situation: today,as i was leaving for work in the morning,i had a tire burst in the middle of a busy road. that scared the hell out of me!
dialogue: today,as i was leaving for work in the morning,i had a tire burst in the middle of a busy road. that scared the hell out of me!
are you fine now?
yeah,i am doing alright now, but with minor injuries.
label: terrified
response: cool is your car damaged a lot?

situation: i was walking through my hallway a few week ago, and my son was hiding under the table and grabbed my ankle. i thought i was got.
dialogue: a few weeks ago, i was walking through my hallway, minding my own business, when all of a sudden a hand reached out from under a table and grabbed my ankle. i was so suprised. i thought i was got. turns out, it was my son.
that is funny, hope he did not give you a heart attack.
i may have let out a scream that will have him question my manhood for the rest of our lives,.
label: surprised
response: i would probably scream also.

situation: i am overly excited today because will be flying outside the country for the first time tomorrow.
dialogue: i am overly excited because will be flying outside the country for the first time tomorrow.".  please enter here.
wow! that sounds amazing. where are you going?
traveling to south africa then to ghana. also my first time visiting africa
label: excited
response: you are going to love it i am sure. safe travels!

situation: i was holding my son over my head, playing with him. a few seconds after doing so, a gush of throw up hit me in the face.
dialogue: one time, i was holding my son over my head, when all of a sudden, he threw up all over my face. i almost cried.
that is horrible, hope he is ok.
yeah, he had just drank a bottle, and i was moving him around like an airplane. in retrospect. i deserved it.
label: disgusted
response: i see, glad he is ok.

situation: i felt caring when i helped an elderly lady carry her bags to her door.  she was struggling to carry some heavy bags and i offered her help.
dialogue: hello
hi, how are you?

i am doing great i just wanted to tell you a short story about a time i helped an elderly lady.  she was struggling to carry her bags from a trip she had took.  i helped her carry them to her door ! pretty good feeling when you help others
label: caring
response: that was kind of you, i am sure they appreciated that!

situation: i had just moved to texas and my boyfriend took me to kemah boardwalk. it made me think of times i spent vacationing back home.
dialogue: i went to the kemah boardwalk with my boyfriend. it made me think of times i went vacationing with my family.
my last vacation went horribly wrongq!
all i thought about was being at home again and being able to relive those moments.
label: sentimental
response: yes i love to reminice

situation: when my dog died, i felt lost. i also felt like i just let him live when i should have put him down due to his health.
dialogue: my dog died a few years ago after i had my son.  it was right around christmas and i had the dog for fourteen years.
i am sorry to hear that. i have never had a dog. what was your experience of the dog?
the dog was there with my throughout my life. he saw me through boyfriends and friends.
label: sad
response: i am really sorry to hear that. what was the dogs name?

situation: i locked my keys in my car about a week ago. it was 95 degrees outside and i was at the store getting groceries.
dialogue: hello
hello how are you and what is your story chat about today?
i locked my keys in my car about a week ago. it was 95 degrees outside and i was at the store getting groceries.
label: embarrassed
response: omg wow. i hope you got it open quick!

situation: i felt a bit terrified when i was hit by a drunk driver last year but i am very grateful to be alive to today
dialogue: hello

hi, a few months ago, my mother found some stray dogs that were starving, so she told us about them. of course, we brought the poor babies to our house, a mother dog and her two puppies. my heart went out to them, as their ribs were showing, but they were still so loving and sweet.
oh no i am so sorry to hear that :/ that is good that you took them in
label: afraid
response: yes, i really felt so much sympathy for them and we all really liked them. we already had several pets, so i was not going to keep them, but i wanted to help them get better and find them a good home. we did for all of them, with the puppies being able to stay together.

situation: i was very happy about a time when i saw an elderly lady being helped by a younger male , its nice to see people still helping others now days.
dialogue: i wanted to let you know recently i saw a younger man helping an old lady who fell to the ground. its nice to see people helping others
that is really nice to see. i bet it made you feel good! so sweet.
yeah it made me feel great
label: impressed
response: nice to still see that behavior in todays world.

situation: i was very happy when my grandmother gave me a scooter
dialogue: so this one time my grandmother gave me a scooter, it was the best gift ever, i was really happy
that is sweet that you remember that, how old were you?
i was around 10 years old i think, it was quite a long time ago for me now haha!
label: grateful
response: i will not make you reveal your age! :p

situation: when my current girlfriend said yes to dating me.
dialogue: i was extremely lucky when my girlfriend said she would date me, she is my world now.
that is wonderful. how long have you guys been dating?
we have been together for close to 5 months now, so not very long haha!
label: joyful
response: time flies by pretty fast. could be together 10 years from now!

situation: i was very happy to get my new job
dialogue: i started a new job about a month ago and it is going really well.
congratualtions. what do you do?
i work in i.t. for the provincial government in canada
label: joyful
response: oh wow. we are practically neighbors.

situation: when my friends deck was finished being built it was very nice.
dialogue: so my friend built a deck and it turned out amazing, i did not know he had it in him.
how big was the deck?
i think its probably about 20 feet by 25 feet? i am bad at guessing that kind of stuff hah
label: impressed
response: wow that is big.

situation: my girlfriend came up behind me without making any noise.
dialogue: my girlfriends really quiet and she tends to scare me a lot.
what is scary about what she is doing? i am not quite understanding what you mean.
well, when shes dealing with her own personal issues she tends to kind of just vanish, i have not talked to her in a few days and it is making me worry.
label: surprised
response: oh wow, i can see why you are worrying. you should really talk to her about all this if she comes around soon.

situation: created a program at work.
dialogue: i have to fill out forms all day so i scripted a program that does half of it for me and it works really well!
that is great. did you create the script?
yeah, had to google a bit of it but it worked out well.
label: proud
response: i love google. it is my favorite search engine.

situation: when my dad had cancer and they gave him the all clear.
dialogue: i was extremely relieved when i found out my dad beat cancer.
that is wonderful news! its such a nasty disease! how long has he been clear?
about 2 years now.
label: hopeful
response: well i hope he has 100 more years to go!

situation: i am doing everything i can to stay true to my girlfriend during a hard time.
dialogue: my girlfriend hasn't talked to me in a few days and i am struggling to keep it together but i am at the moment.
have you tried to call her?
i have, but she is going through a rough time and likes to seclude herself.
label: faithful
response: maybe give her space.

situation: my grandmother gave me a rock.
dialogue: my grandma gave me a stone and said it was my birthstone and i hold it very close to my heart now.
what birthstone is it.
it is amethyst.
label: sentimental
response: what birthstone is it?

situation: i got to a really high level in a video game.
dialogue: i play some competitive video games and i think i am pretty good at one of them.
i love to play madden.
do you play madden often?
label: proud
response: yes, every day.

situation: i have not seen my girlfriend in a few days.
dialogue: i have not been able to talk to my girlfriend in a few days and it is making me quite sad.
where is she?
she is in the same city as me, but she is going through a hard time and has decided to seclude herself so i cannot reach her.
label: lonely
response: just give her space.

situation: i was working with my daughter teaching her some things. i pointed to something and she actually knew what it was when we had never discussed it before.
dialogue: my daughter is very smart. she learns things really quickly.
that is great.
yes, she picks up on things that i did not even think she knew about.
label: impressed
response: did you teach her?

situation: i recently went surfing and surfed waves everyone else was afraid to. i was the man,
dialogue: i cannot believe how big the waves are. hurricane chris amped up my summer.
did you stay and ride it out? i bet it was quite a thing to see!
yes, i have been surfing for ever. only three of us in the water.
label: confident
response: that must be so much fun. i have never surfed but love to be on a boat.

situation: after my 4th child was born, i had friends sign up to bring dinner for us for 2 weeks. i had a c section and was really limited in what i was able to do, so i was very grateful.
dialogue: i usually hate to ask for help, so when my friends all surprised me by taking turns bringing us meals for 2 weeks after my 4th child was born i was blown away. i was so relieved to have help.
wow, 4 children my first is on the way and i am freaking out. you must have great friends.
that is so exciting, congratulations! we moved 17 hours away from family, so having a great group of friends is really important to us.
label: grateful
response: thank you. that is our next step we are moving from nyc to miami after the baby. how can we find friends like yours?

situation: i was proud of the painting i did
dialogue: i went to this thing called a paint night and i ended up making an okay looking painting
that sounds fun, i was never any good at painting
i am not either, but they had an instructor to follow along to!
label: proud
response: that probably helps a good deal!

situation: i was driving home from work and some jerk cut me off. i cannot believe that.
dialogue: that jerk, did'nt even wave when he cut me off.
i wish i had a rubber bumper to ram those people with!
after the apocalypse i will just ran them off the road. to make things worse he was in a horse and buggy.
label: annoyed
response: that is terrible, he could have hurt the horse!

situation: i was super stoked when i saw my first paycheck from my new job!
dialogue: so i got a new job recently, and i got my first paycheck and it was pretty good compared to what i was expecting!
nice, congratulations. how are you liking the new job itself?
it is pretty good so far, i think i am gonna like it for the long haul!
label: excited
response: awesome, i hope the job goes great for you!

situation: we adopted a new kitten after our beloved cat ran away. the day we brought our new cat home, our old cat showed up.
dialogue: when i was a little girl, our cat ran away and was gone so long we did not think he would come home so we adopted another kitten.
that is sad, hopefully the new cat got to live a long and full life with you
well, we had a funny twist. the same day we brought the new kitten home, or old cat showed up. we kind of thought maybe he was hanging out close to home and was mad that we replaced him.
label: surprised
response: haha that is crazy, i hope they became best friends, i love cats.

situation: my mom came to visit in march for a couple of weeks. she helped out a lot around here and then she had to leave and go home miles away.
dialogue: i really liked having my mom here. she helped with the kids but then when she left i missed it.
i can imagine! that extra set of hands, and a person you can *trust*, that is the best!
yes, the kids really missed her when she left. it took us a while to get back to the normal around here.
label: sad
response: does she live far away? it sounds like maybe visits are not too frequent.

situation: waiting for my food at dennys.
dialogue: this one time i spent an entire hour waiting for food at dennys.
an hour? damn for somewhere as meh as denny's that really is not worth it.
its really not, the foods not worth that long of a wait.
label: anticipating
response: i have not been there in so long for that exact reason.

situation: i went to a really nice dinner for my husbands work. right before we went in i used the restroom and did not notice that i tucked my dress into my panty hose and i walked past almost the whole room to walk to my seat.
dialogue: i went to a nice work dinner with my husband. i cannot get over how stupid i made myself look.
oh really? what happened that made you look bad?

i went to the bathroom real fast before we went into the dining room. i tucked my dress into my panty hose and did not even notice. i walked past everyone with my underwear showing. i am sure i will laugh about it. someday.
label: embarrassed
response: oof yea that seems like it might take a few years or 10 before you can laugh at it but at least its over.

situation: i had no issues helping a lady with her computer problem.
dialogue: a lady was having issues with a program on her computer, and i solved it with no problems!
that is awesome! my experience was quite opposite as i sat waiting in the dentist chair for a 2 1/2 hour procedure!
that sounds unpleasant, did you get in afterwards?
label: confident
response: yes! i am actually glad it is over so, how long did it take you to fix the computer problem?

situation: my bank messed up my account and kept charging me over draft charges that were not mine. i had plenty of money in my account.
dialogue: i am so angry they end up charging me 255 in charges that did not belong to me.
yeah, that is pretty annoying to have happen.
i called them and did not hold back.
label: furious
response: good man! that is your money and they just wanna snatch from you.

situation: my friend had encouraged me to apply for teaching jobs. i went on several and did not get hired. she went on one and got hired right away.
dialogue: my friend was telling me about teaching jobs to apply for. i did not get hired, but she got one right off the bat!
it sounds like you are happy for her, which is commendable given you did not get hired. were you very disappointed?
i was kind of envious that she got the job and i did not because it seemed like i was more qualified than she was.
label: jealous
response: that is always tough. it is so hard to tell what other factors come into play in situations like that. are you happy where you are currently at, or still looking?

situation: when my girlfriend was in the hospital.
dialogue: my girlfriend has some mental health issues and sometimes ends up in the hospital, and i go and see her as often as i can.
i am so sorry about that. it sounds like you are doing your best to be supportive.
thanks, i am definitely trying to be as supportive as i can, she is my world.
label: caring
response: she is very lucky to have you. i wish you guys the best!

situation: i am 32 now, so anytime that i go to a place that i did something when i was younger makes me whimsical and causes me to think about the past.
dialogue: i love going to places that i explored and play at as a child. every time i go, i always feel super nostalgic.
i am very nostalgic too, that must be a fun time!
yes, until you realize that it was 20 years since you played there, and you start feeling old
label: nostalgic
response: that is true, but it is part of life, but it is cool to see things again, regain perspective

situation: i have a tendency to be praticular about my stuff, so it was culture shock when my girlfriend moved in with me. she started moving and rearranging my things. i was very apprehensive at first.
dialogue: i hope this does not make me sound like a horrible boyfriend, but when my girlfriend first moved into my house, i felt very apprehensive towards the move at first. i was used to it being one way, and she was changing everything. took some getting used to.
i am sure it did! it is not easy to have to adapt to another person's habits.
i know. it caused some tension the first week or so. i had to take a deep breath, and realize its just things, and it was just me being reluctant to change.
label: apprehensive
response: yes, sometimes we have to learn to let go of the little things so we can appreciate the more important things. it sounds like you have done a great job!

situation: i was looking at old photographs of my son yesterday, and almost started crying. i still remember those days, and started looking at all of his old baby clothes
dialogue: i always hate thinking that my son is getting old. just like a few days ago, i was looking at some of my sons old clothes, and it made me very sentimental. i never want him to get old on me.
i believe you are really sad although it is a fact of life
yes. you get to see them change and grow. it makes it all worth it.
label: sentimental
response: true, and the good thing is that when the kids grow, they provide moral support to parents.

situation: i love surprises, and on my birthday, my girlfriend waited until the last minute to give me something. i honestly thought she had forgot.
dialogue: i love a good surprise like anyone else; however, when my girlfriend waited until 8 pm on my birthday to tell me happy birthday and give me a present, i was caught off guard. i thought she had forgot.
maybe she did and remembered last minute. you should ask her!
she remembered but was trying to draw it out to make me think that she had forgot. i should have known because i made her wait until 10 pm on her birthday.
label: surprised
response: next year i would just forget her birthday all together!

situation: my neighbors 20 year old kid got a new bmw. i am 33 and drive a 1990 crown vic, not by choice. i need a new car in my life.
dialogue: i work two full time jobs and he stays at home all day, not fair!
is he a stay at home father, or does he just not want to work?
he is 20 he just wants to party and sleep.
label: jealous
response: i am sorry to hear that. maybe as he gets older he will get his priorities in order and see how hard you work.

situation: a situation in which friends organize a birthday party for you when you did not expect them to do so. you walk in a dark room, turn on the light and all your friends jump out and say "happy birthday" and present you a cake.
dialogue: so the other day was my 23rd birthday! i had no idea what my friends had planned but i walked into a room, a room which i thought was empty as the lights were all off, and all my friends jumped out and yelled happy birthday! it was such a shock, and felt so nice to have people who cared deeply about me provide me with such an experience!
must of been pretty surprised, also great to have friends like that.
it really was! they even had my favorite kind of cake, chocolate mousse from my favorite bakery!
label: surprised
response: that must of just made everything even better!

situation: i just walked into work and got a raise.
dialogue: i am thrilled. i got a raise!
that is a great news. you surely have done a great job.
best ever. i did not have a clue i was going to get it. i just walked in and boom got a raise.
label: surprised
response: you are very lucky

situation: the other night my boyfriend and i watched the film "within" on netflix and i was pretty scared trying to fall asleep afterwards
dialogue: have you seen the film "within" on netflix? the other night my boyfriend and i watched it and i had trouble sleeping afterwards, it was pretty creepy!
no i have not actually, i recently just canceled my netflix service! i have been thinking about resubscribing though.
why did you cancel your subscription? if you ever re-subscribe i would definetly recommend checking out "within"!
label: terrified
response: i could not find the content that was best suited for me personally to consider it worthy at the time, but if i do i will definitely check it out!

situation: i spilt wed wine on my moms red carpet and blamed it on the cat.
dialogue: i spilt wed wine on my moms red carpet and blamed it on the cat
was the color of red that different to show on the red carpet?
very! it was a dark maroon stain.
label: guilty
response: oh! wow that must of been pretty obvious then.

situation: i can not believe i forgot my anniversary.
dialogue: my wife is angry and i do not know what to say. my anniversary was yesterday and i had no clue!
argh! that is tough! have you been able to come from a place of authentic apology? it can be easy to be defensive in those situations, which of course only makes it worse!
i am still working on it. she has has not given me much of a chance.
label: ashamed
response: what is your approach? does humor ever work.? you know, like wearing a dunce cap while holding a huge bouquet of flowers? or going john cusack and holding a boombox overhead, playing "your" song?

situation: another girl was flirting with my boyfriend at a networking event and i felt rather envious,
dialogue: so the other night my boyfriend and i were out socializing at a networking event and another woman went up to him and touched his arm i coudn't help but feel a little envious even though he pulled away.
you should not be so insecure like that.
its not about insecurity!
label: jealous
response: what is about them? do you think he is better than you?

situation: i have a fun trip to las vegas coming up in the fall that i am very excited for!
dialogue: have you ever been to las vegas?
yes, several times.the place is magical.
i am actually going for the first time in my adult life this fall! i am really excited!
label: anticipating
response: well, you are about to have the fun of your life, but gamble responsible.

situation: the night of my wedding proposal i was not expecting my boyfriend to get down on one knee and ask me to be his wife
dialogue: i was thinking about my boyfriends wedding proposal the other night, it had left me in absolute shock. i did not expect him to get down on one knee and propose.
why. did you started dating recently or something
no we'd been dating a very long time but he was never the traditional kind. never wanted an official ceremony but after meeting me i guess it all changed!
label: surprised
response: the most important thing is what you want.

situation: i just got home from a day on the beach surfing the waves of hurricane chris. i did what others could not!
dialogue: i am one of the best surfers that has ever hit the beach. i ride giants.
really?? are you famous then? what is your name?
yes, you can google me.
label: confident
response: are you still competing on a professional level?

situation: i was just walking out of taco bell. the bottom fell out of my bag and my wonderful taco bell covered the ground.
dialogue: i cannot believe the bottom of the bag ripped and my wonderful taco's covered the ground. i am sure my face was bright red with anger.
not the tacos! seriously, i can understand how frustrating that is. especially when you have the taste for something.then gone!
it is not like i could back in. i waited in line 20 minutes and had been looking forward to them all day. i had to skip lunch due to work being busy. i am still mad.
label: furious
response: even worse. i am so sorry. what did you do instead?

situation: my friend just ran her first full marathon after recovering from a broken leg.
dialogue: have you ever participated in any races, half or full marathons?
i have not! i used to run a lot for soccer practices. have you?
i have not either! my best friend recently recovered from a broken leg and just completed her first full marathon, it was inspirational!
label: impressed
response: that is great for her.

situation: i am not afraid to admit this: i am 32 and afraid of the dark. the other day, my electricity went out due to a storm. it was dark, i could not find my phone or a light, so i screamed for my girlfriend to wake up. am i embarrassed to say that, not at all,
dialogue: i am not afraid to admit this: i am 32 and afraid of the dark. the other day, my electricity went out due to a storm. it was dark, i could not find my phone or a light, so i screamed for my girlfriend to wake up. am i embarrassed to say that, not at all,
hahaha that is funny why are you still afraid of the dark?

i am not scared of the dark. i am just scared of the things in the dark. and the ironic thing is, i do not even believe in the supernatural, so i am scared of the dark to just be scared of it, i think.
label: afraid
response: ooo so you think something else is hiding in the dark and that is why your scared?

situation: my last job interview i really researched the company and what all they do.
dialogue: before i applied at inline i really did some background research on the company and what all they were involved in.
that is probably the best thing to do before you go to work for a place. were you happy with your results?
i was!  it ended up securing me the job because the company itself is small so the ceo and interviewer were really impressed.
label: prepared
response: sometimes it is the extra step someone is willing to do that will make it. good for you!

situation: i felt really alone when my husband went to work out of state for a few weeks.
dialogue: my husband hangs steel and the last time he had to go work in another state i felt really lost and alone for a bit.
i feel the same way when i am away from my cat.  does he have to travel a lot for work?
sometimes he does.  lately there hasn't been any local work so he has had to go out of state and its just too far to come back.
label: lonely
response: maybe one day if you have the time, you can pay him a surprise visit.

situation: as soon as i arrived at the bus stop and the bus slowly stopped in front of me.
dialogue: i made it on time to the bus stop.
that is good. where you running late
i was running late and so did the bus.
label: joyful
response: that sucks. i hate when i am running late i always feel behind

situation: i ate the last piece of pizza and did not know my husband actually wanted it and i am feeling pretty bad.
dialogue: so i kind of ate the last piece of pizza that we had and i did not know tom wanted it. feeling kinda bad.
i do not think you should feel bad, you did not know!
yeah but he just seemed so disappointed when he came home for lunch.
label: guilty
response: i am sure he will be okay. maybe you can make it up to him.

situation: i took my son to his first swimming pool. he loved it so much. i do not really go much because i hate the water, but seeing his joy made me forget all about my hatred for the water.
dialogue: i will start off saying i hate the water! i cannot stand being in it; however, that changed last week when i took my son to his first pool. his joy erased all my hatred for water.
aw. children will make us do things we never thought we would (or could) do!
yes! i start swimming lessons next week. i have went 32 years without knowing how to swim, and that one visit changed all that.
label: joyful
response: that is so exciting! congratulations! you are a fabulous role model for your son.

situation: i heard one of my grandmothers favorite artists playing on the radio on the way home and it made me think of our car rides together.
dialogue: oh today i heard one of nannie's favorite songs on the radio.  it made me really miss our car rides together.
oh that is so sweet. my grandmother is a great person too and i am glad to know her.
she was a lovely lady indeed!  i miss our time together a lot especially when i hear the music she used to listen to.
label: sentimental
response: i think it is great that you have such positive memories of her, that way she will always be there in some form.

situation: i recently went back to the town i grew up in. i miss it!
dialogue: do you go visit some place that makes you miss growing up?
yes, i love to visit the zoo!
i recently went back to michigan and got visit my old town and even the high school i had such great times back then.
label: nostalgic
response: what were some of your favorite things to do back in highschool?

situation: my mother was always there for me when i was sick, annoyed and sad.
dialogue: my mother was always there for me when i was sick, annoyed and sad
that is wonderful!. it is always nice to have at least one good parent.
well my dad too but my mum was so much more, even when i was naughty she was still there.
label: caring
response: my mom was pretty awesome too! i am glad you had a good one as well.

situation: when i was little i got chased by a large dog and now that i am much older the feeling is still the same.
dialogue: when i was little i got chased by a large dog and now that i am much older the feeling is still the same.
that is bad. are you still afraid a lot?
i am, everytime i see a dog, i begin to run the other direction instantly
label: terrified
response: you need to fight your fear

situation: i am an introvert, so being faced with a new situation and new people puts me on edge.
dialogue: i actually have no friends, can you believe that? i am ok with it though.
wow that is very sad!  i am really sorry!
no, it is not sad. i really like to be alone, as i am an introvert. i need my space.
label: anxious
response: well i guess if that is something you enjoy.  i cannot say that i have alot of friends.  mostly my friends are family

situation: i am always more cautious when driving at night, and when it is raining.
dialogue: do you ever find it hard to see at night when it is raining?
yes i do actually, i was almost in an accident because of rain at night once.
that is so scary! i am always on edge in those cases. i hydroplaned really bad last time.
label: apprehensive
response: i am glad you were okay and nothing bad happened.

situation: i was eating at a restaurant.  as i was leaving, one of the employees rushed over to me and gave me my phone i left there.
dialogue: i was eating at a restaurant and as i was leaving, an employee there gave me my phone which i had left behind
oh that was so nice of them! i bet you were relieved!
i was, it saved me a lot of problems
label: grateful
response: i bet, losing your phone causes all kinds of stress!

situation: i written down my notes on a double sided a4 paper now i just have to wait for the exam in the next 5 minutes.
dialogue: i written down my notes on a double sided a4 paper, now i just have to wait for the exam which will begin in the next 5 minutes.
okay that is good to know. hopefully you pass the test and i hope you studied.
oh i did, i have been doing it for weeks!
label: prepared
response: very nice man. let me know your exam results when they are released!

situation: it was that time of the year when work performance evaluations were being had.  a newer employee received a promotion over me.
dialogue: an employee who had not been working as long as me received a promotion
oh no! i will bet that made you feel terrible!
i definitely did not feel appreciated
label: jealous
response: i can see why not! i am so sorry that happened to you.

situation: i left the bathroom with a bit of poo in my pants once. i was in 3rd grade and so ashamed when everyone smelled it.
dialogue: when that happened to me, even the teacher could not stop herself from laughing.
that is hilarious. i bet.
i was so awkward and quiet in school, how about yourself?
label: embarrassed
response: oh my just the opposite

situation: my first baby is on the way. i am going to make sure they have a great life.
dialogue: i cannot wait to december when my first born arrives into the world. i am going to make sure they have a great life.
oh wow! congratulations! that is wonderful.
thanks i am stressed, excited and hopeful for the future. do you have kids?
label: hopeful
response: i do not yet but hope to one day. i think you will be a great parent!

situation: i had an overweight friend run a marathon
dialogue: i was just speaking with my buddy. he is very over wight and somehow finished a marathon last weekend. impressive!
wow yes it is
i could not believe it. just the day before we were crushing cheese steaks.
label: impressed
response: he probably stored that up for his energy for the race

situation: i was impressed with my friends work ethic when she stayed awake for 36 hours to study for a final exam.
dialogue: my friend stayed awake for 36 hours studying for the mcat!
haha oh wow, how was that for them
she did well actually, i was impressed with how well she managed to do despite lack of sleep!
label: impressed
response: that is great, i am glad she did well

situation: i was on my way to work one morning.  a driver near me merged over into my lane and did not signal
dialogue: i was commuting to work and a driver cut me off
i hate it when that happens! were you ok?
i made it out ok, just so irritating
label: furious
response: i always wonder what goes through peoples heads when that happens.

situation: for thanksgiving, i traveled to see my family i hadn't seen in a long time due to work.  it felt great being around them again.
dialogue: i was busy due to work and visited my family for the first time in awhile
that sounds nice! did you have fun
it was great, felt refreshing to be around them
label: joyful
response: i am glad you enjoyed yourself, it is important to make time for family.

situation: when my boss backtracks on what he says
dialogue: i get so annoyed with people who say one thing and do something else. my boss is one of those people. i wish there was just instance that i could be like this is where he annoyed me, but that is not the case. it happens every day.
i am sorry to hear you are having to deal with that
yeah, it can get annoying at times. i just stir clear of him when he is around.
label: annoyed
response: sounds like the best thing to do honestly

situation: i am really eager to get off work tonight to see my boyfriend.
dialogue: i have an 8 hour shift in the office today but i cannot wait to go home to see my boyfriend!
you will survive, and you have something to look forward to
exactly, it is keeping me going since i am not feeling to good today!
label: anticipating
response: i hope your work day goes by fast

situation: when i was 12, i got ran over by a truck.
dialogue: when i was 12, i got ran over by a truck. i was with my older cousin and his car messed up. since he was my hero, i listened to everything he said, so when he told me to get the truck rolling and jump in. i listened. however, my 12 year old legs did not make it and got trapped under the truck
oh wow that is so scary.  i cannot believe he asked someone so young to do that.
well, he was 17 at the time, so in his defense, he just was being a "dumb teenager". my parents never let me go with him again after that though.
label: terrified
response: i really hope you did not have any lasting effects from the injury?

situation: i did not do too well on an assignment but i still felt like i could improve my grade for the final exam
dialogue: i only got a b- on an assignment i worked really hard on recently, but i am working even harder now studying to ace the exam!
wow! i am sorry to hear that. do you think you will get an a this time?
i do actually!
label: hopeful
response: congratulations! studying can be hard, but sometimes it is about technique rather than time spent. are you doing anything different this time?

situation: i was at work and the butt of my pants tore.
dialogue: i was inspecting rooms yesterday when i bent down to look under a bed, i felt the back of my pants tear. the hole was the entire back of my pants.
oh no! i am so sorry! i hate when that happens!
yes, i have a staff of 30 and i think each one saw me at some point in the day. i have khaki's on. i had to tape and staple the hole.
label: embarrassed
response: ugh! that is the worst! too bad you could not run home and change!

situation: a spider dropped down in from of me while driving once. i almost lost it.
dialogue: i had to compose myself and pull over to remove the spider. i am so thankful that i did not freak out and crash the car.
oh that sounds so scary!
it was very scary, i am terrified of spiders. what are you afraid of?
label: afraid
response: i hate snakes! they are like little evil creatures.

situation: my wife has made me go on a diet. i have been cheating.
dialogue: so as i have gotten older over the last 10 years. i gained 30 pounds. my wife has me on a diet but every night when she goes to bed i have a bowl of ice cream.
do not even tlak about diets.i miss the times i was young and could eat all i wanted
yea but those times are behind us. tonight for dinner was a kale salad. it was gross but i have gotten a dish or rocky road with my name on it later. i do feel bad for lying to her but i need it.
label: guilty
response: ugh.so boring.what wrong with being fat.at least they are all happy.

situation: i just completed my bachelors degree!
dialogue: did you ever attend college? i just completed my bachelor's degree and i am feeling really good about my future!
yes, i have an associate's in nursing.
wow that is great you must enjoy helping others!
label: proud
response: yes, it is been a great career.  how exciting for you to be about yours.  congratulations!

situation: we have recently changed over to recycled toilet paper because my wife want's to save the world. it is like sandpaper!
dialogue: have you ever felt sandpaper on your bottom? because that is what the new recycled toilet paper my wife want's us to use feels like.
holy smokes! let me guess, better for the environment?
yes but in the end it is still paper and still going to the same place. i dream of the day i can enjoy angel soft or charmin again.
label: annoyed
response: you poor soul! i am all for saving the planet, but you have to draw the line somewhere. i hope you get some relief!

situation: i had an exam last week that determined my promotion. i knew that i would ace it.
dialogue: i scored a 95 on my promotion exam, i was upset that i missed one question.
but that is an awesome grade!  you should be so proud!
thank you, i am definitely proud! when was your last exam?
label: confident
response: oh, it is been years since i have taken an exam!  perhaps the last one was a para-pro exam to help out in the local schools when my kids were younger but they did not even give me the grade it was a pass/fail type exam (the horror of not knowing the grade though!)

situation: on the way home yesterday i hit 155 in a vw on the autobahn
dialogue: on the way from work i hit 155 in my vw on the autobahn. i was well impressed with the car.
i love the autobahn.
i have been faster in my old audi but this little car is a 4 cylinder and still super fast.
label: impressed
response: yes i use to own an audio.

situation: i just finished my first iron man last weekend. i am so happy!
dialogue: last weekend i did something big. i finished my first 125 mile iron man race. i am still pumped.
i have never done that, good job.
that is it was a bucket list item and the hardest thing i have ever done but now i want to do it again.
label: joyful
response: you should. when is the next one.

situation: i was going threw storage and found a tube of things my grandfather game me
dialogue: last night i was looking at my things i have in a storage locker and found a tub filled with my grandfathers things. the good memories came flooding back.
oh wow that is cool.
yes, he is been gone 10 years but i still think of him daily. it is strange how someone can make such an impact on someone for so long.
label: sentimental
response: that is good you still think of him.

situation: when i started massage therapy, i thought it would be strange, but  i actually just felt a sense of concern for my clients.
dialogue: i went to a school for massage therapy, but i was worried at first that it would be strange to massage people i did not know.
that is cool. was it hard?
some of it was. i had to learn the name, attachment point, and action of every muscle in the body. there are over 800.
label: caring
response: wow that is a lot.

situation: i bothers me a great deal when people show up unannounced.
dialogue: i think i get it from my mom. she would never open the door for uninvited guests.
what do you get from your mom?
being bothered by uninvited guests
label: annoyed
response: i do not like uninvited guests either! so annoying!

situation: my family adopted a puppy and then i had to play soccer. i could not wait for that game to be over
dialogue: my first dog was a dalmatian. we adopted her and then went right to a soccer game before i even had time to play with her.
i love dalmatians.
she was a great dog! that game felt so so long though. i had to watch her sitting with my parents while i played.
label: excited
response: how old was she.

situation: i have a friend who is always complaining about something. when i was going through a hard time she got even worse to make sure she sounded like she had it harder.
dialogue: i have a friend who is always complaining. she always has to make it sound like her life is harder than everyone else's.
well maybe it is but it could also just be she is spoiled.
i did not know her when she was young, so she could be. i think she just likes to be miserable.
label: annoyed
response: does she have like some other issues like mentally?

situation: my favorite shoes wore out. they no longer make them.
dialogue: have you ever put a pair of shoes on your feet that felt so sweet that made your sole happy?
i have a pair of fuzzy slippers that make me feel pretty cozy and happy in.
yea, i had that but recently my shoes wore out and they no longer make them. i am so sad!
label: sad
response: that is the worse, you finally find a brand and fit that perfect and they discontinue making them that is the worst, happens to me all the time.

situation: i was on lunch and my coworker made me laugh. i pee'ed my self.
dialogue: i was on lunch and my coworker made me laugh. i pee'ed my self. i felt like i wanted to die.
wow, did they notice?
yep, to make it worse i am the boss. i am pregnant so i tried to pass it off like the baby was pressing on my bladder.
label: embarrassed
response: they will forget about it soon.

situation: a friend/customer cheated me out of a large sum of money. she works at the corner grocery where i shop often. i became very uneasy when i had to shop there.
dialogue: becasue of a certain person who worked at the corner grocery i became uneasy to shop there.
i am so sorry to hear that. what did they do to make you feel uncomfortable going there?
they were a friend and customer of mine in a small business and cheated me out of a large sum of money.
label: apprehensive
response: that is the worst! you think you can trust people, and then they stab you in the back. i do not blame you for not wanting to see them again.

situation: i just found out my new insurance if going to cover my big dental surgery coming up.
dialogue: i just found out my new insurance is going to cover my big dental surgery coming up. no more bad jibbers!
that is great. that should be good insurance. are you generaly happy with it?
yes, they are covering $4,500 worth of work. i only have to pay $100 total. i cannot wait to have good teeth.
label: joyful
response: that is nice. good luck with the sugery.

situation: i have a solo trip coming up. i am going to colorado to clim mt. elbert solo
dialogue: i have a solo trip coming up. i am going to colorado to climb mt. elbert solo. it is the tallest mountain in the united states.
i love colorado, my favorite state.
yes me two. i used to live in colorado. i have not been up a mountain that big in years, i am getting the belly butterfly's.
label: afraid
response: i wish i could live there.

situation: i was on date last weekend and got bad gas.
dialogue: last weekend i was on a date with a wonderful guy but right after dinner i got bad gas.
did you fart?
it sounded like trumpets were filling the room. he looked like he wanted to puke each and ever time.
label: ashamed
response: did they smell?

situation: we need a new roof and it seems like so many roofers have good and bad reviews. trying to find one we can trust has been hard.
dialogue: we had a hail storm about a month ago. it ruined our roof so we are trying to find a good roofing company to replace it.
did anyone get hurt?
no, thank goodness. just a lot of car and property damage in the area.
label: apprehensive
response: that is good, as long as no one got hurt.

situation: my husband just ran a marathon. he had no training i was blown away by him.
dialogue: my husband just ran a marathon. he had no training i was blown away by him. true inspiration!
no training at all!  wow, that is pretty impressive.  how far is a marathon?
26.2 miles. he walks about 10 miles a day at work so that is some training sorta.
label: impressed
response: that is still pretty impressive.  i bet he was proud of himself also!  does he plan to do it again and will you maybe do it with him?

situation: i was driving by the house my ex-wife and i lived it. for a few seconds it made me nostalgic about the past.
dialogue: i do not like saying this, and this is the first time i have but a few days ago i drove by my ex-wife and mine house, and for a few seconds it made me nostalgic.
wow you are brave.
yes, it was only a fleeting moment but it was there.
label: nostalgic
response: i bet you drove fast.

situation: i am going skydiving this weekend.
dialogue: i am going skydiving this weekend. i am afraid of heights and freaking out a little.
oh my! that sounds exciting for sure! i could not do it, i do not think.
yea, until this morning when i called and put down a deposit i did not think i could either.
label: terrified
response: have you ever done anything else so frightening?

situation: i was pretty unsure of myself when learning to ride a bike at 15
dialogue: can you believe that i learned to ride a bike at age 15?
at least you did it. lance armstrong did not learn until he was 13.
really? i did not know that. is there anything that you would say you were a late bloomer for?
label: apprehensive
response: love, it took me 12 years with the same person to build up the courage to ask her to marry me.

situation: i had a huge exam that was coming up, and i study for weeks for it
dialogue: i had a huge exam that like 25 percent of my grade. i study for 2 weeks for it
oh, i bet that was very stressful and difficult. i hope you did well on it?
yeah because the professor got mad that the book store did not have the little blue books to write in, so he canceled it and said whatever our current grade was to bump it up a letter grade
label: prepared
response: well, at least you did not go down in your grade. but, it was not right to treat the students like that!

situation: as i get older i have fully accepted who i am. i am not here to impress.
dialogue: as i get older i have fully accepted who i am. i am not here to impress. it makes life easier when you think like this.
that is good, how old are you?
33 so not super old or super young. just happy with who i am.
label: content
response: i am 31 so same generation.

situation: got a pizza last night. it gave me food posion.
dialogue: got a pizza last night. it gave me food poison. now i am stilling here sick and angry.
oh gosh, i am sorry. did you let the pizza place know?
yes, i called and they laughed at me. told me it was the new pizza buy and that he must have used old cheese or something.
label: annoyed
response: wow! in that instance, i would prefer them to lie to me than to laugh and be like i knowingly fed you bad food.

situation: i had studied for an exam for severl days. i was very confident i would ace the exam
dialogue: i had studied for an exam for several days, so i was confident when i strolled into class because i knew i would ace it
and did you knock it out of the park?
uh, i made a b on it,  so it was a false sense of confidence,
label: confident
response: perhaps be less cocky next time? either way b's get degree's.

situation: i was very anxious when my son had his tonsils taken out
dialogue: when my son was 5 years old, he had to have his tonsils taken out. i thought it would be nothing, but when they went to take him back, i got so anxious.
was he okay? i have never heard of that going wrong.
yeah, he was fine, but i had read a few horror stories online. i knew i should not, but i did.
label: anxious
response: that is where you went wrong. i am glad he was fine. i would've been scared if it were one of my kids too. surgery is still surgery.

situation: my neighbors are still doing fireworks every night at midnight. i have dogs that are scared of the noise and will not sleep.
dialogue: my neighbors are still doing fireworks every night around midnight. scares my dogs and they cannot sleep through it.
oh, i bet that could be frightening for your dogs. did you try to complain to them?
we do not know them well, but if they do it again tonight we probably will. i understand on the 4th and even a couple of days after, but some people have to get up for work.
label: angry
response: i think they have some leftover fireworks that they do not want to sit on. they should just use them next time.

situation: my dog passed away of bone cancer. she was such a special dog.
dialogue: my dog had bone cancer and we had to put her down. it was a very sad, but necessary decision.
it takes a strong and compassionate person to make that kind of decision.
it was very hard, but she was suffering. our vet was very helpful and we did ask him if he thought it was too soon. he assured us that it was not.
label: devastated
response: she had a happy life. i am sure she understands.

situation: my mother has been visiting for the last week. we have been doing a lot of talking and laughing.
dialogue: my mom is here visiting me and my family. it has been a really fun visit.
sounds nice. how long has it been since you've seen her?
about seven months. too long.
label: content
response: oh wow. that is a long time. do you live far apart?

situation: i wareally in awe when an older fbi agent came to speak to us about his experiences in the field during the 70's.
dialogue: we had a really great guest speaker at work today.
that is awesome! what did they talk about?
he was a retired fbi agent who talked about his experiences in the field in the 1970's.
label: impressed
response: fascinating! what kind of work do you do?

situation: the new season of better call saul will start next month. i cannot wait to see what will happen.
dialogue: i am a bit breaking bad fan and love better call saul. season 4 starts in august.
me too! i also iike staying home all day.
i wonder what will happen this season. i am expecting it to be really nail biting.
label: excited
response: i have more time to watch movies and shows on netflix alot. i stay home with my little one year old during the day.

situation: i came home to find my leftovers had been eaten. i was perturbed to say the least.
dialogue: i came home today and someone had eaten my leftovers. i was so irritated!
i hate when that happens!  i look forward to those all day you know!  did you find out who the culprit was?
yes, it was my partner. he owes me big time
label: annoyed
response: i think that calls for a nice steak dinner out on his dime!

situation: i wanted to have a few things so i manipulated an account to make it appear i had money that i did not have.
dialogue: i got into some serious financial troubles a few years back.
it happens to everyone, are you out of it now?
yeah but what i did was terrible. i was self employed and i manipulated the system so i received money i was not owed/. my husband helped me out of the jam once i came clean about aht i did.
label: content
response: oh well, it was nice to have someone to help you.

situation: fair rides make me nervous.
dialogue: do you like fair rides? i cannot take them myself.
i do not like them at all. i have seen too many videos on the internet where people get injured or they break easily
yes, i remember in 2007 a teen was decapitated at six flags in atlanta.
label: anxious
response: yeah that is terrifying. the smaller country fairs are worse. i bet they have no one really checking up on them except the carney folk.

situation: when i found out that my ex-wife cheated on me
dialogue: two years ago, i discovered that my now ex-wife was cheating on me with someone she worked with. when i first discovered it, i was angry and hurt.
i bet you were, i did that to my husband when i was young. i thought it was the solution to relief from abuse.
i know it was a horrible experience at the time, now i think its the greatest thing to ever happen to me. sleeping in different beds for 3 years is not healthy. it took that to wake me up
label: angry
response: i guess that was what you call a temporary situation. sometimes moving on is required.

situation: i just love the 80's, it reminds me of my childhood.
dialogue: i wish i could go back to the 80's for a little while at times.
do not you wish you knew you were living in the good ol days while your going through them
that is nothing but the truth! what is your favorite era?
label: nostalgic
response: do not you wish you knew you were living in the good ol days while your going through them

situation: i cannot believe i passed my graduation tests. i did not even have to retake any of them.
dialogue: did you graduate high school? it is a lot harder than most people think.
sure i did! it takes determation to succeed
i did not think i woudl have to do that much studying. i figured that came later in college.
label: proud
response: so if not by studying ,what else?

situation: have you ever hit your toe on hit doorway? talk about being furious!
dialogue: i hit my toe on the edge of the doorway and it bent backwards. i was furious and crying at the same time!
that must have hurt a lot.did you go to the hospital?
no, i do not have insurance. just like when i twisted my ankle on the stairs and fell. it took months to heal, but it healed.
label: angry
response: you are very accident prone.you should get an insurance right away.

situation: my 32 year-old son died of a sudden heart attack. i was with him. the day before.
dialogue: sometimes we can get a phone call that shakes us to the core.
that is so true. and sometimes that phone call can be a trip of a life time!
my phone call was my mom telling me my 32 year old had just died of a heart attack while at her house.
label: devastated
response: oh my goodness! once things settle down i will give you the info about our cruise. it will help you relax like it did me!

situation: my husband always knew i wanted to go on a cruise. and for our anniversary we are finally going!
dialogue: i cannot believe my husband planned this all by himself! my mind is still blown by this!
sounds so exciting. what did he plan?
we are going to mexico. i have mixed feelings, but mostly excited!
label: surprised
response: when and how? are you flying or driving? just because or is it your anniversary?

situation: i was looking through some of my sons old toys, and i felt sentimental and could not give them away
dialogue: do not you hate when you have to give stuff away and then cannot? well, that happened to me recently. i was going to give away some of my son's old toys, but started looking at then and realized that i need to keep them for no other reason than that i was being sentimental
that is too funny. you know, i am the exact same way. i get so nostalgic with my old things. can never throw them away!
i know! i am always like i need this notebook that has my 3rd grade handwriting back from the 90s because it will be very useful someday.
label: sentimental
response: yes, someday.. haha. i love looking back at those kinds of things. it brings back so many good memories. such a good feeling

situation: i was looking through some of my old pictures a week or so ago, and saw a picture of my grandmother who passed away a few years ago
dialogue: i was looking through some of my old pictures a week or so ago, and saw a picture of my grandmother who passed away a few years ago
i am sorry to hear that. were you two very close?
yes, we were. i used to spend my summer vacations with her when my parents were out of town, so it allowed me to get really close with her.
label: sad
response: that is sweet, i had the same experience with my own grandma too. god bless y'all!

situation: i was at the gym on monday and a man started having a seizure. i was frozen in fear but luckily someone else tended to him.
dialogue: i was frozen in fear at the gym monday, when a guy started seizing. he got so violent and ran away from paramedics.
wow, that must have been challenging for everyone! was he okay ultimately? was someone able to help him?
they could not capture him, he jumped the fence by the pool and rolled down a hill. i do not know what happened to him.
label: caring
response: that is frightening! hopefully nothing you will have to deal with again!

situation: wow, is always a very bad situation for me
dialogue: yes, i was surprise on how he changed to another talk
what was the initial talk?
i should descript how i could feel when am lonely
label: lonely
response: so how do you feel when lonely?

situation: i slipped on a puddle and landed on my back in the middle of the mall once. all i could do is pretend that i was hurt to avoid embarrassment.
dialogue: i slipped on a puddle in the mall once. i was so embarrassed that i pretended i was hurt badly.
i know the feeling. once i fell in high school from a puddle and laughed it off even though i was hurt,
even animals get embarrassed, i have seen it in my cats.
label: ashamed
response: oh really? i have not seen that in an animal as of yet. that is pretty interesting.

situation: i try my best not to be jealous, but i saw my girlfriend giggling with some other dude.
dialogue: one day my girlfriend told me about a guy that works with her and she mentioned how hilarious he was which then made me think of a meme that i read about how funny guys will make you laugh and then all of a sudden you do not have clothes on. it was only for a split second but it happened

that is a hilarious intro, thank you for that! so were you worried that your girlfriend found someone else humorous? (and you are very insightful + intelligent if you say yes! though being both of those things, you have nothing to worry about)

well, i most def want to be insightful and intelligent, so i will say yes. i know i had nothing to worry about, but it is crazy how in those instances when you least expect it a ridiculous meme shots into your brain and you start playing "along came polly" sceneros in your head.
label: jealous
response: these references are perfect. and your girlfriend must enjoy you very much. mazel tov, you crazy kids!

situation: lately, my two year old boy has been so much into wearing dresses and playing with babie dolls,i do not even want to think of it.
dialogue: lately, my two year old boy has been so much into wearing dresses and playing with babie dolls,i do not even want to think of i
is that good or bad? why the concern?
i think it is bad
label: afraid
response: ok why do you think so?

situation: my son needed to borrow money for transportation last week. i was just thankful to be able to help him.
dialogue: it is such a privilege to be able to help someone in any way you can.
indeed. it makes you feel good when you can help somebody else with their problem
it also makes me feel bad when i am unable to help.
label: grateful
response: i think if everybody in the world offered a hand of help to one another, we would not have much problem

situation: i was hoping that i would do better on a math test.
dialogue: my math teacher told the class i needed to do better on my next test.
well you should try to study more and see what happens
i did, i cannot remember, i either made an a or a b in there.
label: hopeful
response: well maybe you should talk about getting a tutor or somethinf

situation: well, this is not going to make me sound like the manliest individual ever, but i think i need to tell it to someone. a few weeks ago, i was driving home from work. it was late. i was tired. so i was not my usual self.
dialogue: well, this is not going to make me sound like the manliest individual ever, but i think i need to tell it to someone. a few weeks ago, i was driving home from work. it was late. i was tired. so i was not my usual self. i was singing along to some song when all of a sudden i glanced up and saw two eyes looking back at me, and at the time i did not know whos eyes they were so i was scared to death. i slammed on my breaks, in the middle of the road, jumped out, and was ready to run. i mean fight whoever was in my back seat. long story short, i saw my own reflection in the mirror.
that is terrifying. until the end of your story. then i laughed so hard i cried. but that is so relatable. i have been terrified of my own shadow more than once.
it seems to happen to me at least once a week. if i watch a scary movie or show then it happens at least every other day until i forget about it,
label: surprised
response: that is hilarious, but i also feel bad for you. perhaps there is a way to calm yourself down after you watch a scary movie?

situation: wow, is always reduces my standard
dialogue: why no response?
i am supposed to wait for you to start.
is my response not good enough?
label: angry
response: you have not said anything yet other than asking why i hadn't responded. sorry i am a little lost as to what i was supposed to respond to?

situation: i am looking forward to winter.
dialogue: it is really hot here most of the year.
really?  where do you live at?
alabama. it is winter for about 2 weeks.
label: anticipating
response: i feel your pain.  i live in orlando, florida.  so  i am in the same boat.

situation: ok i was in walmart buying a video game when this dud eshows up and immediately questions my selection.  like it is some kind of internet forum!
dialogue: ok i was in walmart buying a video game when this dud eshows up and immediately questions my selection. like it is some kind of internet forum!
that is so annoying.who he thinks he is???
i dunno, but i just said "that is great, bro" and left.  then he follows me to the checkout counter to continue giving me crap about it.
label: annoyed
response: i would be scared of a guy like that.

situation: well, one time i went to watch a movie alone
dialogue: this was several years back. i was single, but i also like watching the notebook type of movie, so i thought it would be okay to go watch the vow alone. wrong! horrible mistake. it was a tear jerker, and i had no one there to see it and be like awe. all those tears wasted for nothing!
aww. sorry to hear that. i have not personally seen the show. what hit you the most?

oh, it was a movie about a woman who lost her memory, and her husband had to get her to fall back in love with him. at the time, i was like i want that; however, now that i am in a relationship, i am like i do not know about this. i wish she would get amnesia as well
label: lonely
response: sounds like a touching but sad story. love without two ways interaction is really hard. i cannot imagine myself going through relationship like this honestly.

situation: i was joyful when my grandparents shared the gospel with me.
dialogue: i was joyful because my grandad shared the gospel with me when i was 11.
you mean nostalgic?
i guess i am nostalgic now.
label: joyful
response: what your grand father did to you was very special.

situation: my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street. it is so gross!
dialogue: can you believe that my neighbors downstairs allow their dog to relieve itself in the street?
that is not very considerate or respectful, plus the dog could get hurt if a vehicle were traveling down the street.
that is what i am afraid of as well! but the dog seems to only want to use it that way. do you like your neighbors?
label: disgusted
response: i live in the country, so i do not have neighbors that live close.

situation: i drank too much soda, so now my teeth look bad.
dialogue: i regret drinking way too much soda. now my teeth look bad.
uhmmnn! cut down on the intake
i quit. probably going to need some fillings.
label: ashamed
response: you need to see a dentist then

situation: i am annoyed at myself currently because i cannot figure out how to install a game on a different disk drive. i am also kind of tired and do not feel like looking online. i might just look tomorrow.
dialogue: have you ever felt really annoyed at yourself?
just all the time.who does not?
yeah right now i do not know how to make a game install on another drive. do you?
label: annoyed
response: it depends on the machine you are working on.

situation: when i was 18 and i got my first tattoo
dialogue: this is a silly story, but it reminds me how confident teenagers can be. when i got my first tattoo, for some reason, it gave me this false sense of confidence. i am not sure why other than at the time i thought my tribal tattoo was something to admire
do you have a tribal tattoo. how does it look like?
i got it when i was 18. i did not take care of it, so now it looks like a shady prison tattoo,
label: confident
response: that was bad. you can try some tattoo removal tool

situation: a co-worker at work needed some money for a drink, but i did not have any cash, so i let them have my debit card to go buy them something
dialogue: a co-worker at work needed some money for a drink, but i did not have any cash, so i let them have my debit card to go buy them something
did you know them well? you must be very trusting.
a co-worker at work needed some money for a drink, but i did not have any cash, so i let them have my debit card to go buy them something
label: trusting
response: i think i would have just said i did not have any cash and let that be the end of it.

situation: i never expected to fail my final exams,that is a major blow for me.
dialogue: i never expected to fail my final exams,that is a major blow for me.
sorry! try harder next time!
yeah, i know,i ought to have taken my studies seriously.
label: disappointed
response: never late you know!

situation: i love it, though most times it could be killing.
dialogue: am surprised there is no response from my friend.
that sucks. are they mad or what?
sucks? i do not know about sucks.
label: surprised
response: it is kinda annoying to me when people do not call you back.

situation: i was in a wreck on the interstate.
dialogue: i was scared when i was in a wreck.
serious? why are you scared when you are in a wreck?
i was on an overpass and did not want to fall off.

response: wow, you really have to be careful dear.

situation: i kind of felt ashamed today when i realized that others might think i am stupid. i can sometime be loud and rowdy for no reason. maybe just to prove a point.
dialogue: have you ever felt really ashamed?
yes i have, it feels really bad when it happens.
yeah same. sometimes i can make a fool of myself by trying to act too smart or something like that.
label: ashamed
response: yea it can be quite embarrassing to look back on.

situation: my younger brother always get the best dates and beautiful girls to date,i hate it.
dialogue: my younger brother always get the best dates and beautiful girls to date,i hate it.
come on, you do not have to be jealous of your brother
i cannot handle that very well. i need to get my groove and swag on. damn it!

situation: it is high time i get my self a girlfriend,i feel so bored up.

are you trying to go out and meet some ladies
yeah, i am so ready to date.i want to meet my person.

response: that is the first step. what you have to do next is be at your best behavior always

situation: i felt depressed today when i realized i was so non tech saavy. i cannot figure out how to download a game. this is just bad.

do you work in the tech industry? you could always take a class.
that is true. there is a lot of stuff online. no i am completing college for a natural sciences degree.
label: sad
response: there is ton's online, and knowing more about computers can really help any profession.

situation: i do not like it when people talk with their mouth full of food.
dialogue: i do not like it when people talk with their mouth full of food
i am sure it is something disgusting. do you have someone do it around you
yeah, i close friend of mine likes doing that. she has to stop.

response: you can just let him know you are not comfortable with it

situation: i saw an article of someone i went to high school with.
dialogue: i saw an article of someone i went to high school with who was working with an ebola patient?
yes the patient is very ill
it was cool cause her dad died of cancer, so now she is helping sick people.

response: oh that is really a bad news i heared

situation: i bought a lottery ticket today and hope to win big
dialogue: hi
what is it that you would like to share with me? i am very interested to hear about it!
i am excited i bought a lottery ticket today and the jackpot is over 20 million
label: hopeful
response: whoa, i hope you win! you never know, it could be your lucky day!

situation: i have never been ready like this for an exam in my entire life.
dialogue: i have never been ready like this for an exam in my entire life.
i know how you feel, i get so scared when exams come up, its so hard sometimes
open book exams can be tricky, i have no option but to pass this exam.

response: yea open book make you think you do not need to study but that is not true at all

situation: i felt good and happy about myself when i graduated college
dialogue: hi there
hi
i just got my bachelors degree in english with a gap of 3.5
label: proud
response: cool, i could not do english.

situation: my boss has about 2000 clients he has gotten over 20 years.
dialogue: i was impressed because my boss has 2000 investment clients. that seems like so much work.
yea that does seem like a lot of work could you ever handle it?
maybe. some of them he got from a guy who retired though.
label: impressed
response: ooo well that explains a lot. well hopefully he will pass some to you

situation: today i felt really happy that i was getting some work done. it is been a very busy past couple weeks. i also have a new job that i am working on.
dialogue: i felt really elated to be getting work done. it is hard sometimes and  i pulled through. the happiness is real too!
which work are you talking about. it is always a good feeling to get things done. there a way your brain reward you with good feeling
it was just some stuff for a new job. do you feel happy to complete stuff?
label: joyful
response: oh yes, i do most times. who does not

situation: i am looking forward to my next vacation
dialogue: i am trying to decide where i should go next on vacation, i love travelling.
i say think of all the places you always wanted to go and then choose a place you never even considered.
that is interesting but i usually look for deals so i can go to more places
label: anticipating
response: yes deals will allow you to travel more for sure.

situation: i felt like things would go good when i bought a lottery ticket
dialogue: today i saw the lottery was for 36 million at the gas station so i decided to buy a ticket.
do you think you can win the lottery
hahaha no i do not at all but i was just really hoping that it would happen on the off chance.
label: hopeful
response: then why do you want to risk your money on such thing. why not buy yourself a nice shoe instead

situation: i am happy with where i am with life right now. work is great, family is good and business is booming.
dialogue: i am happy with where i am with life right now. work is great, family is good and business is booming.
i am very glad to hear that. do you have any children?
i have three beautiful kids and you?
label: content
response: i have no kids, but would love to have some at some point!

situation: i felt hopeful today about my future. i finally started to go run. i have not run in forever.
dialogue: do you feel hopeful ever? i feel hopeful that i am gonna get in shape.
yes i do
what do you feel hopeful about?
label: hopeful
response: i feel hopeful that i am going to recover from a mental dosirder

situation: last month i was very disappointed because my brother did not attend my birthday party
dialogue: i remember inviting my brother but he did not turn up for the party. i felt so lonely and discriminated.
that sounds terrible. why did not he come?
he said he was held up at work and coud not make it
label: disappointed
response: ah i see. i do not really talk to my brother much.

situation: i ate my dinner and am relaxing on the couch in my pyjamas
dialogue: i am relaxed right now ate a nice dinner now i am relaxing on the couch watching tv.
that seems pleasant. i am currently in my chair working!
i am getting ready to go to bed i am in my pyjamas
label: content
response: i need some good rest, myself. sleep is so important!

situation: when i applied to college for the first time and waiting to see if i got accepted
dialogue: hey i just applied for my top college today and i am hoping to get the letter soon to see if i get accepted.
awesome!  that is exciting.  what college are you applying at?
i am applying to my local college its called samford

response: that is awesome!  i wish you the best of luck in your future studies!

situation: i want to see the halo tv series.
dialogue: i want to see the halo tv series when it comes out. spielberg is supposed to direct it.

probably mostly the super heroes in it.

situation: i finally got a job after a year of not working
dialogue: i am happy i did not work in over a year it was hard to get a job but i finally got one, thanks to a friend
congratulations on getting your job we should go celebrate !
oh yes we should let's go have some cake and ice cream.

response: as long as the cake is funfetti i am more than there

situation: i felt surprised when my parents wanted to buy me my dream car
dialogue: my parents want to get me a brand new camaro !
wow, are they going to pay for it?
yea they are they said since i graduated top of my class that they are going to cover it !
label: surprised
response: you have some very nice parents, when i graduated my parents said pay us more rent now.

situation: i went to bed early night before my surgery. i wanted to wake up early the next morning, and be on time.
dialogue: i went to bed early the night before my surgery. i wanted make sure i was not late to the appointment.
that is a really good idea, that sounds like it would be hard to sleep though
yes, surgery is so scary. but i am glad it is over.

response: i am glad it turned out well or i hope so.

situation: the thought of loosing a beloved one scares me.
dialogue: the thought of loosing a beloved one scares me
as it should.  however those things happen to everyone it is a part of life.
as sad as it may sound,that is the reality which we cannot escape.
label: terrified
response: hopefully something better happens when we die and our lives will go on in a better way.

situation: last friday i was invited to a wedding shower. the place amazed me because it looked so elegant and classy. i am still astonished on the elegance of the event
dialogue: the event was all white from dressing to the decorations. i really loved it
i am glad you enjoyed it. was it a wedding?
it was a wedding shower
label: surprised
response: that is wonderful. i am going to a wedding next week!

situation: i felt really mad about a tech problem today. i cannot figure out how to download a game to a certain drive.
dialogue: i felt pretty frustrated at some tech problems i had earlier. i could not find a way to download a game to a different drive.
i understand. i remember when we had to save games to 5 inch floppy disks. they made really strange shuffling sounds and a lot of times did not even read.
those are old from what i understand. this was a while ago?
label: furious
response: yeah, i had my commodore 64 and amiga in the late 80's. still, the games were great when they worked!

situation: i felt caring when i picked up my puppy for the first time
dialogue: me and my kids picked  up our new puppy the other day !
how wonderful. what sort of dog?
it is a west highland terrier and he is so cute !

response: a fluffy white one? how amazing!

situation: my friend arranged a trip to vegas for my birthday
dialogue: i am so excited my friend told me last minute we are going to las vegas for my birthday she arranged everything.
that sounds amazing! what do you think you are gonna do there?
go shopping and eat, i love food and vegas has some amazing food.

response: i have been one time but i was too young to drink or gamble so it was a little boring. that sounds like a great time though, i am happy for you!

situation: i shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me
dialogue: i was disgusted at the way the man was staring at me non-stop

yes, and i ended up getting a different taxi, i lost my money

situation: i was disappointed when my son brought home his first f

that is a tough thing to deal with but hopefully his first f will also be his last.
yea he is a smart kid i just think he has been playing too much fortnite.

situation: i was sad to see one of the cave rescuers died.
dialogue: i was glad to see the boys get out of the cave, but sad that a diver died.
that was so bad. what kill the diver
they said he ran out of oxygen, while uderwater. that was weird since it happened after they located the team.

response: it means he miscalculated the time he was to spend under the water. sorry for him

situation: yesterday i left my luggage behind for a stranger to look for it.
dialogue: yesterday i left my luggage behind for a stranger to look after it
why did u leave your luggage for a stranger
that was so naive on my part, i had to leave shortly to buy a drink from the shop.

situation: i am worried about failing my exam
dialogue: i am very stressed i have to take a major final exam on saturday.
that is intense. i hope you do as well as possible!
thank you me too i have been studying like crazy.

situation: i felt terrified today when i realized how far behind i am on some assignments. i let them creep on me.
dialogue: do you ever feel overwhelmed by assignments or work?
yeah, sometimes i want to just stop going to work. i hate tps reports so much!
like the ones from office space? haha
