response: yeah, bill lumbergh is the worst boss ever. he kept calling me every day when i just wanted to sleep instead of work!

situation: i am trying to type and my cat keeps moving on my lap
dialogue: so i am trying to type fast right now and my cat keeps moving on my lap.
i love cats, just hold it between your arms, it will be okay
yea she finally decided to settle down so i think i can type good now.
label: annoyed
response: thats better, but sorry for the disappointment she had caused

situation: i will be on vacation next month
dialogue: i am excited am goint on vacation next month to paris. i have been waiting for this period and cannot wait to be there
wow that is amazing i went there back in 2000. you are in for a big treat. make sure to get french bread.
yah, french bread is on my list, will definitely do it
label: anticipating
response: also the mcdonald's taste way better there than in the us if your looking for good cheap food.

situation: i just started a new job i want to get promoted.

you need to be patient. getting promoted at your work place takes patience and perseverance
i have a good chance though it is a very small department
label: hopeful
response: your hopes are high. it means you have a good chance of getting it. and i hope you have the requirement too?

situation: i am so happy with all my achievements i have made in life.
dialogue: i am so happy with all my achievements i have made in life.
wow! it looks great that you feel achieved
the most outstanding achievement is when i was able to graduate with my doctoral degree by the age of 30 years.

situation: i did not get approved for my dream car, it was a real let down at the time.
dialogue: my dream car is a hyundai genesis, but i did not get approved for financing unfortunately.
sorry to hear that you did not get approved.
it is ok, a car is another bill for me anyway. i will keep taking lyft.
label: disappointed
response: you are right about that. owning a car can get expensive.

situation: i used to have a couple rabbits.
dialogue: i had a couple rabbits once, interesting pets to take care of.
do you still have them?
no, this was as a kid. the dog essentially killed one. then the other one became more grumpy.
label: caring
response: do you own any other pets now?

situation: i was furious when i got in my first car wreck
dialogue: so i was driving on the interstate and another car ran into the back of me.
wow.  did you get hurt?  sounds scary.
no just the airbags went off and i hit my head and got a few bruises.
label: angry
response: i am always scared about those airbags!  i am so glad you are ok!

situation: i lost my cousin last month. i feel so devastated
dialogue: she gotan accident and by the time she was reached in hospital, the doctors pronounced her dead
oh my goodness, that is horrible. who was she?
she was my cousin
label: sad
response: that is horrible, i hope you are okay and are recovering from that.

situation: i felt really surprised that i was finally getting some work done today. it is been a taxing past week.
dialogue: do you ever feel surprised at your abilities?
no,i do not feel surprise d
you must be very talented then?

situation: i am happy cause i fixed my gum.
dialogue: i am glad cause some antibiotics fixed my swollen gum.
i am glad too. what made it swell up anyway?
maybe not cleaning teeth properly, it was around a wisdom teeth that needs to come out or some work.
label: joyful
response: oh i get that, i had that happen near one of my wisdom teeth too.

situation: i once went into a shoe store and picked out a pair that i like. i walked out without paying, and left my worn out shoes in the box on the isle. i feel bad about it now.
dialogue: i stole a pair of shoes once, i feel so bad about it. i was young and poor and needed shoes for work.
wow, it was because you were young, that is why
back then, i felt like the world owed me something because of my bad childhood.
label: guilty
response: it is really nothing, children behave like that sometimes

situation: i was about to check my result so i had an anxiety to checking it
dialogue: but finally, it happened that i passed
what did you pass?
my university result, when in school

situation: i was stranded in a gas station and this lady helped me out
dialogue: this lady has just popped in when i needed help most. i had forgoten my wallet at home and needed to refil my gas. she offered to help
i am so happy for you. i know how it feel when you are stranded
yes. i was so relieved, thanks to her
label: caring
response: you can collect her contact and make friend with her

situation: i feel extremely terrible i did not invite my best friend to my wedding.
dialogue: i did not understand you
i feel extremely terrible i did not invite my best friend to my wedding
label: guilty
response: that is bad. how could you forget?

situation: i feel like my boss is a cool guy. i think he is actually looking out for my best interest.
dialogue: do you think your friends are looking out for you?
i only have a couple really good friends who are always there for me. the rest of my friends do not really care about me that much.
i feel the same way. maybe it is normal?
label: trusting
response: yeah, we have to watch out for ourselves. at least we will not let us down,.

situation: before i do feel that i will not make it in life, but later i felt expectant of my future
dialogue: i expected something good, that was why things are working well for me now
that is great news to hear. i hope things continue to stay great for you.
of course, it is good not to lose yourself when things are difficult
label: hopeful
response: i agree. i think that difficult times are best navigated with a calm mind.

situation: i am really looking forward to my vacation. i have my fingers crossed that it will not rain the entire time.
dialogue: i cannot wait to enjoy my vacation, pending it does not rain the whole time.
i hope it does not rain. where are you going?
panama city beach, fl. i am really looking forward to the beach and resting in my suite.
label: hopeful
response: that is great. i have been there before. it used to be a spring break hotspot.

situation: my classmates took a video of me sleeping in class
dialogue: we were in class and i had not enough sleep the previous night because i had gone to a party. i slept on my desk and later found on my facebook wall a video of me sleeping while the students laughed at me.
oh no! that is not very nice but i guess you can play it off by just acting cool and laughing it off.
i did but i feel so embarrassed
label: embarrassed
response: it is okay it is pretty funny, and it will be forgotten about so quick anyhow. i know how it feels haha, we all do.

situation: i was surprised my brother joined the army.
dialogue: i was surprised my brother signed up for the army.
oh ,really,that is so brave of him
yeah, it might have just been an rotc thing, but he did some traveling.
label: surprised
response: ok,where did he travel to?

situation: once i overslept and was late picking up my child from school. i felt so horrible about that.
dialogue: back when i worked two jobs and went to school full-time, i overslept and was late to get my child from school.
yikes!  schools get really mad about that, as well as it makes the kid worry.
yes, she was crying and it made me cry. i felt so irresponsible.
label: guilty
response: do not beat yourself up.  it happens all the time.  i am sure you are a loving parent!

situation: i was on my way to work when i witnessed a child hit by a vehicle
dialogue: it was foggy and slippery and the driver could not control the brakes. he suddenly run over a child but she survived the injuries
that is awful. was anyone else hurt?
no, just the child, she was trying to cross the road with her dog
label: devastated
response: were there any signs that the driver might have been impared, as opposed to the breaks malfunctioning?

situation: one time someone knocked down part of our brick mailbox with their car.
dialogue: one time somebody ran into our brick mailbox with their car and knocked a few bricks off.
oh wow, how did you feel about that?
i was not sure how it could have happened given how fast they would have been going.
label: surprised
response: how fast were they going?

situation: i cannot wait for tomorrow,we are going to barbados for vacation as a family.
dialogue: i cannot wait for tomorrow,we are going to barbados for vacation as a family.
oh how nice, how long are you staying?
just for a week.

response: that sounds exciting i hope you have a lot of fun!

situation: before i left the country i paid my bills and rent ahead for 2 months. maybe i should have listed on airbnb instead.
dialogue: i think i should have listed my place on airbnb before leaving the country.
wow, what really happened?
i ended up paying rent and bills ahead 2 months instead.

response: oh really, that was hectic for you i guess

situation: i will be having an exam next week
dialogue: am so anxious about the exam and i feel like i am not ready for it
you need to calm down and focus so that you can pass the exam
i am trying to
label: anxious
response: do you get enough sleep. being sleep deprived can make you lose focus

situation: i was a espectant of receiving gifts for my birthday b

what are you expecting? are you pregnant?
nooo, i am  not  pregnant, was just expecting my birthday gifts

response: oh nice well happy birthday

situation: i am so mad my son came home late last night.

were you up when he got home?
i was right at the door waiting for him,never been that scared.

situation: my girlfriend passed her medical school last year, i was so proud of her

is she a model?
no, she is a medical student, always wanted to be a doctor

situation: when i went for a show in new york, i was expecting to see beyonce
dialogue: but we waited and waited, she did not still show up
who are you talking about? what happened?
went for a music concert in new york and was expecting to see beyonce but she did not show up

situation: i had no friends in high school, misery is being surrounded by an entire class and no one talking to you.

yea i know that feel, outside of a few people i knew nearly know one and avoided lots of people cause no one cared
yes, and now that i have added them on facebook, they still do not interact with me.

situation: i feel very faithful in regards to my work. it gives me purpose in life.

yeah,but very few.
why is that the case?

situation: i have never cheated on my girlfriend even once.

that is great. i am trying to get a girlfriend right now :/
i wish you luck buddy, most of these girls out here are so fake.

situation: my mother gave me a car as a birthday present
dialogue: i was really excited upon seeing the present because the car was so adorable
did you get a car as a gift? that is exciting.
yes, my mom bought for me as agift

response: that is so nice of her! that is really really generous.

situation: i was unhappy when my girlfriend broke up with me

i tried to ask but she refused to say anything. i guess she got a better guy

situation: i have such a big heart, i love my people.

what makes you say that?
i like making people around me happy.

response: do you have  a large network of friends and family?

situation: i feel happy with life right now. i have a nice job and things are going my way.
dialogue: do you feel content with your life right now?
somewhat, i have felt better these past couple months than i usually have
me too. i think exercise helps alot.
label: content
response: yes definitely, makes me feel like i am doing soemthing good and helps me get better looking and healthier

situation: i was expectant of getting a new phone
dialogue: cox my old phone was bad
what was bad about it?
my phone fell off the stairs, so i was expectant of getting a new one
label: hopeful
response: did you get a new phone?

situation: honoring my relationship is extremely important to me.
dialogue: it is really crucial to being an honorable mate in your relationship.
yes, it is important. what happened?
nothing happened on my end, but my mate used to be a horrible cheater.
label: faithful
response: that is bad and difficult to live. sorry to hear that.

situation: there was a time, i fell down in the mall, it felt so devasted that day
dialogue: i was on a high heel, so i slipped, people gathered and was trying to lift me
i am so sorry to hear that, that is a real bummer. were you injured?
oh yes, i broke my ankle. it was really painful
label: embarrassed
response: that is absolutely awful! how long did it take for your ankle to heal?

situation: a you tuber bought me a car,it totally caught me off gurd.
dialogue: a you tuber bought me a car,it totally caught me off guard.
wow, what did you do to deserve the car?
not really, i was picked to be one of their lucky winners.
label: surprised
response: thats intresting, you must be very happy now

situation: my parents travelled and am left alone in the house
dialogue: i felt lonely because i have never been left all by myself before
you should find something interesting to do.
like what
label: lonely
response: go hand out with friends or host a night over sleep,that would be fun.

situation: seriously, is not a good situation to be.
dialogue: why no response please?
who are you waiting for a response from?
worker 2
label: sad
response: i do not understand the context of this conversation.

situation: i was amazed when my dad bought me a new car
dialogue: my dad got me a new car recently
wow that is awesome! what kind of car did you get?
he got me a honda car
label: surprised
response: great to hear, they are really reliable good cars.

situation: i feel down in front of my students during games.
dialogue: i feel down in front of my students during games.
oh really? that is sad, why is that?
i tripped over and fell down,and the students laughed at me.
label: embarrassed
response: oof that sounds quite embarrassing, hopefully it does not keep you down too long

situation: i feel scared of the future because it is so uncertain. i feel like i always have a lot to lose.
dialogue: do you ever feel afraid?
a lot of the time. i am quite an easily frightened person! especially by large animals!
yeah. i am more scared of failing i guess
label: afraid
response: have you always had a fear of falling?

situation: i have just won the lottery!
dialogue: i have just won the lottery!
congratulations. how much did you win?
about 10 billion dollars, i cannot wait to tell everyone and the internet and the world!
label: excited
response: that is a lot of money. can i have some of that?

situation: i was thankful i got to go on mission trips in high school.
dialogue: i was thankful i went on mission trips in high school.
oh that sounds cool, where to?
vermont, denver, baltimore, and prince edward island.
label: grateful
response: sounds like a lot of fun, i kinda wish i got to do those too back in high school.

situation: i was expectant to see my mom after 5years
dialogue: my mom travelled to china and has been there for five years now
you do not miss her?
i have missed her alot, have been calling her to come back home
label: anticipating
response: i would suggest you go to china and visit her.

situation: i did not like it,my team lost during yesterdays match between england  and croatia
dialogue: i did not like it,my team  lost during yesterdays match between england and croatia
i was supporting england too,
so bad, let wait for the finals.
label: sad
response: who do you think will win the cup

situation: my mum told me were travelling out, so i felt happy because i was ready for it
dialogue: sometimes it is good to be ready ahead of time, with that you will not leave any important thing behind
yea but id still manage to leave something behind anyway haha.
for where? i did not, i was fully ready
label: prepared
response: just anywhere like when leaving a friends place or taking stuff on a trip, i somehow manage to forget one small thing occasionally

situation: i abused my sister
dialogue: we were arguing about her taking my car without my knowledge and i ended abusing her. i feel bad
what steps have you taken to remedy the situation and make her feel safe?
i apologized to her but still she wount talk to me
label: guilty
response: i think that is for the best. abuse is never okay.

situation: i was ready to face anyone to a fight
dialogue: i just wanted to face anyone to a fight cox they were just so annoying
i am sorry i am not sure i follow.
my neighbors were really annoying to an extent, so i was ready to face anyone that will be annoying again
label: prepared
response: oh i see, i can imagine that can get really frustrating

situation: my puppy urinated on my outing cloth, i became so angry, that i tried to hit her
dialogue: oh yeah, i kept it to iron it, for me to come out and see her on my beautiful dress
how did that make you feel?
i felt so annoyed and devastated, because i was already late for the date
label: furious
response: oh no,trust me if it were me,she would hear me good!

situation: the thought of having a third child in our family is overwhelming.
dialogue: the thought of having a third child in our family is overwhelming
wow, but to have children in the house is good
every time we add another child it feels great.
label: joyful
response: oh yes..children are blessings, i love them being around me

situation: i will be a masters student soon
dialogue: i am so excited i will be a masters student starting next month
oh wow that is a big accomplishment, congrats.
i cannot wait to start my classes
label: anticipating
response: i feel the same, college is stressful but its a nice environment.

situation: i left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots.
dialogue: i had maggots on my counter about a month ago after leaving trash out for a couple days.
why do not u throw the trash awy?
i should have.
label: disgusted
response: yea,as soon as possible

situation: i brokedown when i got a bad news
dialogue: i really broke down when i heard my mom was sick
i am so sorry. you feel so helpless when someone you love is ill.
yea, i cried and cried. but i believe she will be ok soon
label: devastated
response: oh, i am so glad to hear that! i hope for her speedy recovery!

situation: i sometimes feel sad about things when i should not it might be depression.
dialogue: do you ever feel sad about things in life?
i cry everytime i watch dogs on tv, always makes me sad.
like the animal dog?
label: sad
response: yes, i a, referring to the animal, dog.

situation: i cannot wait to watch the world cup finals.
dialogue: i cannot wait to watch the world cup finals.
which team are you supporting
i am supporting france.
label: excited
response: yeeees. i am alos supporting france. i hope it wins

situation: my friends went for a vacation
dialogue: i feel bad that i could not make to go on vacation with my friends
do not you worry,there is always a next time.
yah, i will go next time
label: jealous
response: try visit barbados,such an amazing place.

situation: i lost someone special long time ago, i felt so gloomy and depressed
dialogue: he died in a motor accident
i am sorry to hear that. that is an awful way to go.
seriously it was heartbreaking because we were best of friends
label: sad
response: hopefully you are able to move on and be happy.

situation: i drove out to the park but my buddy cancelled.
dialogue: i drove all the way to the park, but my friend cancelled on me.
that is so annoying. what came up that he had to cancel?
he was doing something with his parents.
label: disappointed
response: did you manage to reschedule?

situation: i was thankful to get an applause from the crowd
dialogue: i got a serious applause from the crowd yesterday after dancing
that is really cool. what kind of dance do you do?
break dance
label: grateful
response: that is awesome i have always wanted to learn.

situation: i was surprised this night that i am so awake. i really have not slept well lately.
dialogue: do you ever feel surprised?
yeah mostly when i am not expecting something new
i am surprised i am still awake haha.
label: surprised
response: hahaha maybe you slept alot during the day

situation: it can be boring not to have a romantic kind of relationship.
dialogue: it can be boring not to have a romantic kind of relationship.
yes.my partner is very romantic person.
you much be very lucky. i need a companion,a girlfriend.
label: lonely
response: yes. i of course you need a girlfriend and the girlfriend  is very lucky.stay blessed.

situation: i am going to the dance and i won the prize.
dialogue: this experience is very good.thank you so much.
you are so welcomed!
yes.i am very lucky person so thought with you
label: confident
response: ok,sounds great!

situation: it tells that tomorrow will be better
dialogue: am surprised
about what?
am surprised may be my response is not good enough.
label: hopeful
response: you are funny.

situation: my youngest daughter made me happy.
dialogue: my youngest daughter made me happy
wow, you are lucky.
she came tops in her class and last year she read about 80 short story books.
label: proud
response: that is good. am really happy for her.

situation: i love how far france has come to world cup
dialogue: i hope france win the world cup
ok hope the sucessful in prayer.
yah sure
label: proud
response: ok, next

situation: i was very happy to see my brother
dialogue: my brother came back home after staying 2years in japan, was so happy to see him
oh, wow. was he stationed there?
he just went to stay there with my uncle
label: excited
response: what was it like in japan, did you ask?

situation: i missed my flight that i paid heavily for, i was so annoyed
dialogue: i was busy looking for my one pair of shoe, so i missed the flight
did you find your shoe in the end?
i later saw it inside my bag that i have already packed
label: furious
response: oh dear! that is quite a mess! did you have to pay any fees to rebook the flight?

situation: i feel devastated that i might be doing this work incorrectly. i do not know if it will hurt me.
dialogue: do you feel devastated right now?
no. i feel fine, if a little tired. do you?
yeah me too. i kind of do due to lack of sleep.
label: devastated
response: are you based in the us? is it not about 2 am over there?

situation: i feel grateful that i have so much in my life. i have a nice apartment with so many useful items.
dialogue: do you feel grateful for anything in your life?
yea my mother has been a huge support to me over the years, how about you?
i feel that way about my dad. he helps me out a ton on almost everything.
label: grateful
response: yea my dad was really cool but he was also a drunk sadly so he was flip floppy

situation: i was so curious about being alone
dialogue: i was supporting so curious of being alone at home cox i wanted to see a movie
what do you mean exactly?
i was so curious of being alone at home cox i wanted to see a movie
label: anxious
response: oh cool, well that sounds like a good time.

situation: my neighbour is olay
dialogue: my neighbour is playing loud music and i am trying to sleep
i hope you do not have work in the morning. whenever i cannot sleep easily i just give up trying and do something else.
i cant, i really want ti sleep
label: annoyed
response: do you know them we'll enough to ask them to stop?

situation: i went out and came back late, so i lied to my mum, i really felt bad about it
dialogue: i lied because, had it been i told  her first, she would not have agreed
oh about what exactly? are you talking about family or friend or so?
i went out with my friends
label: guilty
response: ah ok, was it fun then?

situation: i feel sad that i am spending so much time this late on the internet. i really could use some sleep for tomorrow.
dialogue: do you ever feel sad about anything?
oh yeah, i have been through quite a few sad things before. what about you?
yeah some. it is a part of life i guess.
label: sad
response: definitely, the sad is needed to balance out the good.

situation: i do not like hospitals
dialogue: i am afraid of hospitals since my cousing was admitted due to injuries in a road accident. i saw alot of blood and sick people and the thought of going there scares me.
i figure we'll all be there at some point once we get old.
i do not want to imagine
label: afraid
response: my parents worked in them, so i am used to them.

situation: my cat died.
dialogue: my cat disappeared, we figure it died.
oooh, sorry about that, what happened
i was the last person to look after it when people were on vacation for about a week. i feel bad cause for a couple of those days i did not crack the garage door.
label: sad
response: sorry, i hope you areokay now

situation: my parents traveled for about a year, i felt all alone, because there was no one to talk to in the house
dialogue: the house was so quiet, and if i talk, it will echo
where you the only one in the house?
oh yes, i would have gone out with my best friend but she went on a holiday
label: lonely
response: wow, that is nice!

situation: doing a race with the wrong shoes.
dialogue: i had an important high school race. and i left my shoes at home.
wow, that is a big mess-up! how did that turn out?
i got my second best time at the distance after borrowing someone else's shoes.
label: apprehensive
response: good thing you found someone who had as big of feet as you do!

situation: i was pretty amazed when my grand father bought me a gold wrist watch
dialogue: i was amazed because i thought he had no money, i was not expecting it
why? what was the unexpected thing that happened?
that he bought me a watch, not just a watch but gold
label: surprised
response: who bought you this golden watch? was it a wizard?

situation: i put together a shelf with odd parts.
dialogue: one time at work i put together a shelf that had nonmatching parts.
oh? is it more of art than purpose in its form?
it is more like there were leftover parts and we made do with what we had.
label: proud
response: oh, i see. a workable shelf then.

situation: i passed my license exam last month, i was so happy because the exam was difficult
dialogue: it was a happy moment that day i checked my result, i was so afraid but later it varnished
hahaha hope you did very well
of course, very excellent result
label: excited
response: that is good..  i did well too

situation: i was expectant of money lately
dialogue: i was very expectant of money last week
so, did you get it?
noo, but hopefully i will get it this week
label: anticipating
response: that is cool. definitely you will

situation: i was late for a meeing.
dialogue: one time i was driving my car at it is maximum speed potential because i was late for a meeting.
wow, and you did not get pulled over?
no, i had not tried to max it out. but at 95 it pretty much shook and would not go faster.
label: terrified
response: must've been some important meeting!

situation: i stole my mum's money when i was 4years old,, i felt bad about it though
dialogue: i was flogged very well that day
i do not know what flogging is.
wow, i mean i was disciplined
label: guilty
response: looking up the definition tells me its punishment by being whipped or beaten, so unless you mean you were beaten metaphorically, you should not be "wowing" me.

situation: i was amazed yesterday
dialogue: i was amazed with the good performance i put up on stage yesterday
well done, what type of performance was it?
dance performance
label: surprised
response: was it a ballet. i enjoy watching dance performances.

situation: i was so tired last saturday, my friend came to my house and helped me with my chores, i was very happy
dialogue: really, she surprised me. i was so happy
what did she surprise you with?
by helping me with my chores, even without me asking
label: grateful
response: amazing! that is really nice

situation: i was ready for lunch
dialogue: i was really hungry and ready to eat
what do u want to eat?
noodles i guess
label: prepared
response: ok,have u prepared it?

situation: my elder sister gave birth to a bouncing baby boy, it was really a happy moment in the family
dialogue: she was told that she will give birth through cs, but she delivered normal
normal is the best way, it helps the mother bond with the child
exactly, and it helps the woman heal fast.
label: joyful
response: we are adamant to have our baby born normal. i have seen first hand the cs mothers and their closeness (lack of) with their kids

situation: it is good to be trustworthy in relationships
dialogue: so many relationships are being spoilt by cheating and  unfaithfulness
you think so?
yeah cox i have been in that situation before
label: faithful
response: well, i have kept quite a few relationships throughout my life. if i actually wanted to look at online profiles, i do it mostly for research or investigative purposes. other than that, i am only interested in online chat.

situation: was really believing to get enough money this weekend
dialogue: i needed money this weekend
why, what do you have planned?
wanted to go see a movie with my girlfriend
label: hopeful
response: sounds like fun!  i hope you find the money to do it.

situation: i went for a job interview.  i had studied so hard and researched the company for weeks beforehand.  in the interview it was great because i could answer all the questions with ease.  i was very proud and felt on top of the world when i left.  half an hour later i got the phonecall that i got the job!
dialogue: i got a job interview for a very prestigious company.  i spent weeks studying and researching them then had my interview this morning.
great! you must be well prepared. are you nervous?

no actually i was feeling very positive as i had done so much research.  during the interview i was able to answer the questions with ease and my courage just grew and grew.  i left feeling on top of the world as it had gone so well!
label: confident
response: yes it sounds like you did everything right.  i hope you hear back from them soon about a job offer.

situation: i was very expectant of money
dialogue: i needed money last week and was very expectant of money
did you get what you needed?
nooo but i got a little
label: anticipating
response: well that is better than nothing at all

situation: i accidently wore two odd shoes to work yesterday.  i had a really early start and i was half asleep getting ready.  i just grabbed two pumps and put them on.  when i got to work one of my male colleagues pointed out my mistake!  one shoes was plain black while the other had a little pink and black bow at the front.  i was mortified though my colleagues thought it was the funniest thing ever.
dialogue: i had the worst day ever yesterday.  i started early and was half asleep getting ready.  i just grabbed to pumps and put them on my feet but when i got to work my male colleague pointed out that i had infact put two odd shoes on!
oh no, i have had a few days like that. did you laugh it off?

not really i was just mortified! one shoe was plain black and the other had a pink bow on it at the front.  i had to walk about all day while the whole office could not stop laughing.  i think by the end of the day though i tried to see the funny side.
label: embarrassed
response: well good on you for toughing it out. your the stronger for it.

situation: i put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt
dialogue: that food was my last hope, i was so hungry that day
what kin of food was it?
pasta food. i felt bad
label: furious
response: i love pasta

situation: i am the best student in my class, no one competes with me
dialogue: i passed all my papers, even my teachers were proud of me
wow that must feel good
very cool, i felt on top of the world
label: proud
response: that is great

situation: i wrote medical school exam up to 3times and failed, but this time i passed it with flying colours,
dialogue: oh yeah, my parents bought me special gift because of my success
how nice
very good one, gold watch
label: joyful
response: wow that is very nice

situation: i felt leftout when i was in a train yesterday
dialogue: i was really lonely sitting alone in the train
that sucks. sometimes it does not matter if you are surrounded by people, you can still feel alone
yeah most especially when you have no friend around
label: lonely
response: the hardest lesson in life is that we are all alone

situation: i was expecting to see beyonce in a concert yesterday
dialogue: went for a music concert yesterday
awesome. what type of music was played there?
hip pop  mostly,  they invited beyonce but she did not show up
label: anticipating
response: oh my god. that is so cool. hope the ticket was not expensive?

situation: he actually came back with a gold medal, i was actually doubting him for a while.
dialogue: he actually came back with a gold medal, i was actually doubting him for a while.
who came back with a gold medal?
my friend, he won the 100 metre sprint carnival.
label: impressed
response: oh, nice. well, if you work upon on something, anything is possible if you work upon it.

situation: it motivates, encourages to you to push on in anything you are doing.
dialogue: yes, because that is how i feel about it.
hello friend! may i ask what it that you feel that way about?
it encourage to be impressed.
label: impressed
response: i do not understand what you are talking about. are you feeling okay today?

situation: you have to be happy in order to live long
dialogue: you need to be happy for you to live longer
of course, like they say happiness is contagious, if you are happy everything around you stays happy and it will be hard to die young
yeah for sure, that is why i always like to be happy
label: excited
response: also your home stays blessed because you become a more better partner

situation: i just saw an ad on television for a music festival.  it brought back memories of my college days and the concert events we went to!
dialogue: my roommate and i used to plan for weeks to prepare for music festivals!
wow that must be lot of preparation
it was, but part of the fun was getting ready!  sometimes the planning can be just as fun as the event!
label: nostalgic
response: where is this event going to be

situation: i have done all my paper work for my exam tomorrow, now i can relax until tomorrow.
dialogue: i have done all my paper work for my exam tomorrow, now i can relax until tomorrow.
that is amazing. it is good to give your head a rest so that you will recall all the items easily when you are at the exam center
thanks, i think i have learnt everything because redid each past exam paper 10 times.
label: prepared
response: i wish you all the best in the exam

situation: my surgery showed i was cancer free.
dialogue: i recently got great news, medically.
that is good, i am not sure if i can ask what happened?
i am glad you did!  i had a tumor removed, and it was not cancerous!
label: grateful
response: oh wow, i am glad that you are okay.

situation: when i saw a snake and did not know if it was poisonous.
dialogue: the other night i went outside to unplug the pool pump and saw a snake. we have poisonous snakes around us so i was a bit worried when i saw it.
omg i would have ran faster than forest gump. what did you do?
i ran inside and got my husband out of bed. he killed it since we have little kids we did not want to take a risk that it was poisonous.
label: apprehensive
response: i am glad no one was hurt!

situation: i lost my dog to bone cancer three years ago.
dialogue: i was on facebook and my memories popped up reminding me that i lost my dog to bone cancer three years ago.
oh no, i am sure that was a hard memory to have brought up for you.
it was, she was a very special dog. one of the old souls with a heart of gold. i still miss her.
label: devastated
response: what was her name? have you read rainbow bridge?

situation: a few years ago, i graduated college and took the test to earn my teacher certification. i passed, and was able to quickly get a job.
dialogue: i am so happy i was able to pass my teacher certification test and become an english teacher.
that is great. teachers are so important.
it is such a fulfilling job. the test was difficult, but i spent a lot of my free time studying for it.
label: proud
response: i wanted to become a teacher before. i was afraid of how hard it would be.

situation: i was in a back room and heard a noise everyone else was in bed so i thought maybe someone was in the house.
dialogue: i was in a back room in our house and everyone else was asleep. i heard a weird crinkling noise and was worried that someone had come in the house.
oh my goodness, did you go to check what the noise was?
i did, it turned out to be my cat playing with a play mat the kids left out.
label: afraid
response: i am glad it was not anything serious! it is scary how quick our mind goes to the worst possible scenarios.

situation: my parents threw a party for my for my 25th birthday. i had absolutely no idea it was happening,
dialogue: when i turned 25 i got my first surprise party thanks to my parents.
that is really cool of them. you were not expecting it at all, hu?
no. i just thought we were going to an early dinner together.
label: surprised
response: parents can be great sometimes. did you have a good time?

situation: i felt this way when i discovered some old childhood toys and memories in my basement.
dialogue: i found some old keepsakes in my parents basement and it made me feel nostalgic
what did you find?
old toys, sports equipment, video games etc
label: sentimental
response: i love old school video games. what were your favorites?

situation: i had a job interview that i did really poorly at. i went over all the questions they asked and fixed my answers. for my next interview, they asked very similar questions, and i did much better and got the job.
dialogue: for my current job, i thought about interview answers that i did poorly on before. i was able to ace this interview and have been there for three years!
congratulations. interviews can be stressful
true. the interview i had before i got this job went so, so badly. i studied some common questions so i was ready the next time.
label: prepared
response: that is smart. and it worked.

situation: last december, i got my puppy, churro. it was one of the best days of my life, and i am so happy i have her.
dialogue: my puppy is turning 2 years old next month. the day i adopted her was one of the best days of my life.
nice. what is his name?
churro. he is a boxer mix.
label: joyful
response: nice. i like dogs.

situation: when i was zip-lining in thailand, a tree close by fell. a large piece of the branch hit the platform we were standing on. it was fine, but we were all eager to get to solid ground after that.
dialogue: i went zip-lining in thailand once. a nearby tree fell and part of it hit the platform we were on.
oh my that sounds so scary! was everyone ok?
we were all fine. a bit shaken up, but nobody got hurt thank goodness.
label: afraid
response: do you think you will ever zip line again?

situation: we went out to eat for my brother in law's birthday but we had to leave before it began because my son got upset by people
dialogue: my son experienced stranger anxiety and did not want to be out in public.
oh no. what do you do for that?
we had to leave the restaurant before everyone could order drinks.
label: disappointed
response: oh. how old is he?

situation: at work today. i was not feeling that great so my coworker had to pick up the slack.
dialogue: today as soon as i got to work i got sick. i have a new coworker that stepped in and helped me out. her works looks good but i am nervous.
well, i hope you are feeling better. what makes you so nervous? are you worried your superiors will look down on you leaving early?
no we are allowed to help each other but i am worried his code will not pass once the program is done.
label: trusting
response: i am sure you can get in tomorrow and see how it looks. you can work together to make sure it works!

situation: i just upgraded the turbo on my car. i wanted more power but i am happy.
dialogue: i just upgraded the turbo on my car. i wanted more power but currently my vw can beat a corvette in a race. so i am happy
that is very cool! how much did it cost?
i did all the work my self but the parts were around 4500 besides the price off the all work i have all ready done to it. i am trying to build a grocery getter that i can take to the race track.
label: content
response: wow, sounds nice! was it hard to do the work?

situation: i just hired four new people to work for me. two all ready quit because the job was just to hard for them.
dialogue: hired 4 more people to join my crew at work last week. 2 all ready quit. i am bummed.
dang, that really stinks. why did they quit so quickly?
the  work was to physically hard for them. but i still had big hopes for them.
label: disappointed
response: perhaps you should screen new employees better? like give them a physical performance test?

situation: i am making plans for the weekend with some friends, they want to do something that costs a lot of money, which i have saved for a few months to do. it is supposed to rain and i cannot afford to do that and something else in the event it rains.
dialogue: we are supposed to do the amusement park, tomorrow but i think it may rain.
i hope it is nice for you. do you have any alternate plans?
we do, but i think my friends want to do the amusement park as well as something else. i do not know if i have money for both.
label: embarrassed
response: well, that is always a problem for me too, but at least you've got another $1.25 now.

situation: i just read an article online recently that said medical marijuana was now ok in the uk, it was so frustrating to read it because it had no valid reason being banned, and the way it got legalized was a child (epileptic) being denied it, and then having seizures every day. its mind blowingly frustrating
dialogue: hello! i recently read an article about medical marijuana now being allowed in the united kingdom, what do you think about it?
i think that is wonderful, it is about time more countries and states are making this medicine an option.

the way it ended up being legalized, imo, was a complete disgrace, they confiscated some childs weed who was epileptic, and as a result predictably he immediately started having seizured without it. like gee, well done on torturing the kid! do you think it was right to confiscate it, even though it technically was not legal at the time?
label: angry
response: no, but as mark twain once said, the law is an ass.

situation: at a track meet i saw one of the half milers way out of the other runner's league.
dialogue: the coolest race i saw was a high school 3200 meter relay.
the coolest race i saw was late at night on the highway out of town.
i am a bad driver, otherwise i might like it.
label: impressed
response: yeah, it can be pretty dangerous, but i was young.

situation: my hamster donatello just died.
dialogue: my hamster donatello just died.
i am sorry to hear that. how long did you have him?
i had him for two years. he was my best friend.
label: sad
response: i bet pets are amazing. they are hard to replace once they are a part of the family

situation: my brother told my girlfriend i cheated on her.
dialogue: i cannot believe my brother snitched on me. he told my girlfriend i cheated on her.
oooh, that is rough. did you make him mad?
no, he just does not understand the meaning of loyalty.
label: disappointed
response: well, i hope you can work things out at least

situation: i did not feel comfortable going there
dialogue: i did not like flying abroad
flying has seemingly become terrible these days. what about your trip was so bad?
it was snowingh really bad and the plane had to land in sc instead of chicago
label: trusting
response: that sounds frustrating and a little scary.  did you eventually make it to your destination?

situation: beating my brother in pokemon cards when we were little was the best.
dialogue: i miss beating my brother in the pokemon card game everyday.
well, have you tried reliving that through the pokemon app that you can interact with?
no, i need the real thing it just does not feel the same.
label: nostalgic
response: yes, i can understand that. sometimes nothing compares. have you guys played recently?

situation: my boyfriend went out of town for a few days leaving me all alone at the apartment. i did not have many friends here.
dialogue: my boyfriend had to go out of town for a few days and i was left alone in the apartment. i did not have many friends here at the time.
i know how that feels. i bet it was boring and lonely.
yeah, it was. i did not have much to do all that weekend and the apartment was quiet.
label: lonely
response: did you get out and do anything?

situation: my son is starting kindergarten in a few weeks. i am wondering how i will handle that as a stay at home mom.
dialogue: my son starts kindergarten next month. i do not know what i will do since i do not work.
that really is a big change for you! are you excited to have some more down time?
i am but also not sure how i feel like him "leaving the nest".
label: anxious
response: yeah, that feeling will change when you see him coming home with a huge smile on his face!

situation: i was very nervous to fly on a plane.
dialogue: i was flying to alaska and it was a nervewracking flight.
was it a long flight? or was there lots of turbulance?
it was about 9 hours. a little bit of turbulance. i just have nothing to do on flights.
label: anxious
response: ah, i cannot imagine being up in the air that long! sounds like it was a boring flight too.

situation: i cannot believe i flunked the test i studied all night for.
dialogue: i studied all night and i still flunked my math test. i cannot believe it!
did you study hard?
yes, it just baffles me. maybe next time i should not even study.
label: surprised
response: no, you should keep studying.

situation: i did not get the job that i wanted. i am upset
dialogue: i really wanted a certain job and i did not get it
that stinks, it is never worth giving up though! what line of work do you prefer?
video work. it is very competitive.
label: disappointed
response: i can definitely believe that. i hope something opens up for you soon!

situation: i took my dog to the dog park last weekend. he was so happy!
dialogue: it was so fun!
what was so fun?
taking my dog to the dog park!
label: content
response: oh yeah! i love taking my dog too, she gets to get all that dang energy out before i bring her back to our little apartment!

situation: my dog passed away.
dialogue: i really miss my dog who passed away.
that sucks, i love dogs.
me too. she is a better place now.
label: devastated
response: yes i am sure she it.

situation: the other day i got in a bad car crash and messed up my leg, but i knew i would walk again.
dialogue: the other day i lost control of my car and got in a huge wreck. my leg broke, but i knew i would walk again.
wow. that is horrific!  i am so glad you are okay. was anyone else hurt?
no, by the grace of god. he protects me at all times.
label: hopeful
response: awesome. i am so glad to hear that. always good to hear the stories were someone gets away!

situation: i was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day...
dialogue: i hate when i make plans and the rain cancels them.
i agree with that! i just had the rain cancel my trip to the beach yesterday! makes me so mad.
yeah, some people like the rain! i do not get how.
label: disappointed
response: i mean i like the rain at certain times. but not when i am trying to do fun stuff outside!

situation: i cannot wait for school to start in the fall.
dialogue: i am planning to return to college for engineering which should be cool.
that is such a brilliant idea, are you excited about it?
yeah, i have more years left.
label: anticipating
response: that is awesome, you will thank yourself later down the road for making yourself do it!

situation: somebody stole a package from my front yard yesterday.
dialogue: i caught somebody stealing a package from my front yard on surveillance.
oh wow! i have heard of that happening to lots of people. did they get arrested?
not yet. people these days just do not care. they steal anything they lay their eyes on!
label: furious
response: yes they do. it has gotten really bad around here with car thefts. it is no wonder are car insurance rates are so high.

situation: i was at the grocery store today using self checkout. a man was checking out beside me and he took my receipt!
dialogue: i just got back from buying a few groceries at the store.
oh really? what'd ya get?
just stuff for dinner. at the checkout, a guy took my receipt!
label: angry
response: why did he do that?

situation: i had a math test last week and i knew i would ace it.
dialogue: i studied really hard for my math test last week, so i knew i would ace it.
math is a tough subject. good for you.
i know, i feel like i can solve math problems that even einstein could not solve.
label: confident
response: being good at math will open lots of opportunities for you. keep at it.

situation: i have been doing extra work to pay for my summer travel. super excited, i have been able to pay for several trips!
dialogue: we have taken many unplanned trips this summer that i did not have money for. but i was able to pick up more work and pay for them.
how exciting that you were able to do that. i hope it was fun.
it has been a fun summer! i am so tired though.
label: joyful
response: it is funny how you need a vacation to recover from vacation.

situation: i was working on a major project for a company and i had everything in order and ready for the presentation
dialogue: i had a major project and felt very ready to present it to everyone at the office
how'd it go
it went well, i think i gained confidence by being so prepared
label: prepared
response: that is great. do you present often?

situation: i was walking home late at night.  i noticed i was being followed by someone and ending up running back.
dialogue: i was walking home late at night and noticed i was being followed
oh no, what happened?
i ended up running back to my place
label: terrified
response: glad you are safe!

situation: i noticed my girlfriend was talking to other guys.  she was spending a lot of time on the phone texting them as well
dialogue: my girlfriend seems to be distant and talking to other guys
have you talked to her about it?
not yet, she is also been texting other guys as well i think
label: jealous
response: that does not sound too good. has she been like this before?

situation: i worked on a team based project with co-workers.  we were able to successfully complete the project and our clients loved it
dialogue: i finished a team based project with some co-workers
was it fun? interesting? engaging?
yeah, it was fun, and we did so well
label: proud
response: good! team based projects can be very hit or miss depending on your team so i am glad it worked out for you

situation: my girlfriend broke up with me.  she did this right before my birthday
dialogue: my girlfriend broke up with me
did she give you a reason?
she fell out of love with me
label: devastated
response: sorry to hear that, i hope you find somebody else in your life.

situation: i accidentally left my wallet behind.  specifically, i left in the bathroom and had to go back
dialogue: i left my wallet behind by accident
sorry to hear that.did you lose money?
i left in the bathroom and was able to get it back
label: embarrassed
response: so, you never actually lost the wallet.

situation: a friend through a birthday party for me.  i had no idea he planned it out
dialogue: a friend threw a birthday party for me
that sounds amazing! how did it go?
it was a lot of fun, i had no idea he was planning it
label: surprised
response: that is amazing, i have only had one brithday party like that in my life.

situation: i found some old toys of mine.  it made me feel very nostalgic
dialogue: i found some old toys of mine
what kind?
some action figures i had when i was younger, i felt pretty nostalgic
label: sentimental
response: i use to have a g.i joe.

situation: a friend of mine was sick.  i went over to his house and gave him medicine and food
dialogue: a friend of mine was sick
what were they sick from?
flu, i went over and gave him some food and medicine
label: caring
response: that was nice of you.

situation: a friend who i hadn't seen in awhile showed up at my doorstep.  we ended up going out for drinks
dialogue: a friend who i hadn't seen in awhile showed up at my door
i will bet you were surprised. were you glad to see them?
i was very happy to see him, we ended up going out for drinks
label: surprised
response: did you reconnect and promise to keep in touch?

situation: i met a girl i hadn't seen in awhile.  we ended up going out on a date
dialogue: i met a girl i hadn't seen in some tme
was she your girlfriend?
no, but we did end up going out on a date
label: nostalgic
response: that is great, did you have fun?

situation: my dog got into the trash and it was gross.
dialogue: i really hated it when my dog got into the trash. it spilled everywhere.
yeah, that is rough. i hate having to clean up mess that was not my fault.
yeah, it was pretty gross. a lot of rotten food.
label: disgusted
response: yeah, that sounds annoying. maybe try to scold the dog so they will not do it again?

situation: my dog passed away and it was really hard.
dialogue: i really miss my dog. we had to put her down.
that sucks. what was his name?
barney. he was such a good boy.
label: devastated
response: barney was the name of my hamster.

situation: i was scared to drive for the first time.
dialogue: i was very anxious to start driving at 16.
i know that feeling. it is nerve racking trying to incorporate everything you learned at the dmv in real time.
it really is. it is like i cannot remember all the rules of the road.
label: apprehensive
response: it is also scary thinking about getting in a car accident the whole time, that would definitely get me nervous.

situation: i was so ready and anxious to see taylor swift in concert.
dialogue: i cannot wait to see taylor swift in concert!
my wife, loves taylor swift.
i actually went to high school with her. i cannot believe she is as famous as she is.
label: excited
response: that is awesome, i went to high school with brett favre! small world.

situation: my coworker came on to me at work last week, but i refused her advances.
dialogue: a female coworker came onto me at work the other day, but i refused her advances because i love my wife.
i am glad you love her, it must be a nice feeling
yes, i just cannot see myself being with another woman.
label: faithful
response: that is a good thing then

situation: i cannot believe i got a dui this weekend, i let myself down.
dialogue: i cannot believe i got arrested for a dui this weekend, i let myself down.
that was not smart.
i know i promised myself i was not going to drink anymore.
label: ashamed
response: why did you then?

situation: i passed all my college engineering classes and think i will do even better next semester.
dialogue: i feel good about my last semester. i think i will do better in my engineering classes this fall.
dang. my old roommate was an engineering student. he always told me how hard it was. what kind of engineering?
i am doing mechanical, it is pretty hard but it is interesting. a career in the field would be awesome!
label: hopeful
response: yeah, i think once you get in the field, you are set. the jobs seem to pay well. good luck with that, you sound like you know what you are doing.

situation: i was late for the bus and missed it.
dialogue: i hate taking the but, today i was late to my stop and got there just as it drove away.
oh, the bus? yeah i bet that was a little embarrassing. sorry to hear that. i take my car for granted. maybe you will get one someday.
i drove my parents' old car for a little, and i definitely took that for granted until it broke down. i am trying to save up, i hope i get one too.
label: angry
response: well, keep working at it. it is a process.

situation: i get to see my dog this weekend!
dialogue: i cannot wait until i see my golden retriever blue this weekend!
where has he been?
i live away from my parents, he lives with them.
label: excited
response: oh i bet you are excited then! he will be happy too!

situation: i saw a colleague stealing money at work last week. i wonder if i should have said something to my boss.
dialogue: i saw a colleague stealing money at work. i wonder if i did the right thing by not telling my boss.
is there a reason why you did not tell your boss?
i just did not want to be labeled as a snitch, but now i am having second thoughts.
label: guilty
response: is there a way you could report it anonymously?

situation: where i live it is forecasted to rain all week.
dialogue: i hate when it rains, especially for several days at a time.
oh i do too! i like a nice sunny day.
how has the weather been where you are.
label: angry
response: it is been really rainy. my power just went out awhile ago.

situation: i remember when we used to see who could do the best tricks with yoyo's when we were little.
dialogue: i remember when we used to compete with yo-yo's to see who could do the best tricks.
my brother used to have a yo-yo! he did a trick called "around the world" and also one called "the cradle." know those?
yes, my favorite was called "walk the dog".
label: nostalgic
response: oh yeah! i remember that! i was not good at doing any of them. i mostly just watched him. good memories.

situation: i cannot belive my brother went on the roller coaster with us. he is usually afraid of heights.
dialogue: last week we were at an amusement park and i cannot believe my little brother got on the roller coaster with us. he is usually afraid of heights.
oh man i would have terrified i hate being up so high. he sounds really brave!
i know, he usually never goes on dangerous rides.
label: surprised
response: did he go on anymore after that?

situation: we all went out to dinner and my son had spaghetti and got it all over him. luckily i brought a change of clothes with us.
dialogue: my son got spaghetti all over himself at dinner at a restaurant one night.
well he is young, so you cannot really fault him.
i did not really care too much. i had remembered to pack him an extra set of clothes though.
label: prepared
response: that is good. you seem like a great parent.

situation: i was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking.
dialogue: i hate when it is storming it makes me so uncomfortable.
does it happen often in your part of the country?
yes especially in the summer time storms are bad and hurricanes are at a high i hide under my covers.
label: afraid
response: wow.  i can only imagine

situation: somebody walked in on me using the toilet yesterday.
dialogue: i was using the toilet at walmart yesterday and somebody walked in on me.
that is nuts.
whats worse is that i was in the wrong restroom. it was the girls restroom. i just wanted to get out of there as fast as i could.
label: embarrassed
response: did she scream?

situation: i was going to sea world for the first time. i had never been there before.
dialogue: i was finally going to get to see dolphins up close.
did you get to? what happened?
i went to sea world for the very first time. we got to feed the dolphins.
label: excited
response: i have never been there! sounds fun, but i do not support sea world and the way they treat their animals.

situation: last week there was a large spider on my wall.
dialogue: last week there was a huge tarantula on my wall. i thought it was going to jump on me.
oh gosh! i would burn the whole house down. i am terrified of spiders and bugs
omg me too! i hit it with a rolled up news paper and a bunch of baby spiders came out. i had a panic attack and stomped on them.
label: afraid
response: i would have a heart attack!

situation: one day i saw a video of a grandparent playing with my grandkids and i realized i was no longer able to do a lot of those things.
dialogue: i will never forget the first time i felt old. i saw a video of grandparents playing with grandchildren and i realized it had been awhile since i did those things.
i know how you feel. life is too short.
yes, i try to remind myself that i still have a lot to offer.
label: sad
response: yes, you do! just keep living everyday like your last.

situation: yesterday my brother did a back flip off the roof and landed in the pool.
dialogue: yesterday we had a pool party. my brother got drunk and did a back flip off the roof and landed in the pool.
wow, i never did understand why people want to get drunk in the first place. i sure hope he was not hurt.
i was not mad at him. i just never knew he was that athletic.
label: impressed
response: it does sound like an amzing feat

situation: my friends went out yesterday, but they did not invite me.
dialogue: i got on social media yesterday and saw that my friends went to a party, but they did not invite me.
ohh that is rough.did you talk to them about it
no, sometimes i feel like they just do not understand me.
label: lonely
response: do they give you any kind of value..or do they just ignore you / put you down 90% of the time?

situation: my cousin had a heart cath and the surgeon sent for me to come to the operating room.
dialogue: awhile back i was taking a relative to get a heart cath. the surgeon sent for me to enter the operating room.
is your relative okay now?
oh yes, thank you for asking. other family members just got a call and told them everything went ok. kind of scary when i was sent for.
label: anxious
response: it must've have been. glad they are okay now.

situation: i watched my little brother graduate last week.
dialogue: i got teary eyed when i watched my little brother get his diploma at graduation.
congratulations to him! you must be proud.
i am, every time he succeeds, i succeed. i love my big headed brother.
label: sentimental
response: he is very lucky to have you.

situation: i was supposed to drive my friend to work.  i overslept and forgot to pick him up
dialogue: i was supposed to drive a friend to work
oh yeah what happened?
i forgot to pick him up as i overslept
label: guilty
response: omg is he upset?

situation: a friend needed help moving.  he did not know of anyone else to turn to so i lent him a hand
dialogue: a friend needed help moving
so did you help him / her
yeah, he did not know of anyone else to turn to for help so i gave him a hand
label: caring
response: that is pretty nice of you

situation: my friend bought the car i always wanted.
dialogue: yesterday my friend bought the ferrari i always wanted. i deserve it more than him.
wow, that is a nice car
yes, i do not know how a clown like him ended up with one before i did.
label: jealous
response: it happens sometimes i guess

situation: i was thinking about my old neighborhood.  specifically, the friends i had there growing up
dialogue: i was thinking about my old neighborhood
memories. what state?
cannot say, but i was mostly just thinking about the friends i had there growing up
label: nostalgic
response: i understand but memories are always nice.

situation: i need to use my car to drive somewhere.  when i walked over, i saw that it had been hit
dialogue: i needed to use my car to drive somewhere, but could not
what happened with your car then?
my car was hit while parked
label: surprised
response: ugh! that stinks! did you found out who did it?

situation: we were recently at a concert and my son had an accident.
dialogue: i was at a journey concert with my son and he had to go to the bathroom while they were switching out performers.
i would love that show
it was a very good show, but the people were so rude. we had to squeeze through a crazy crowd and did not make it to the bathroom in time.
label: embarrassed
response: oh well, it happens

situation: i fell in sick for the past two days. i feel disgusted
dialogue: i am suffering from severe fever for the past two days i do not have any energy
have you been to the doctor?
yes i had. he prescribed medicine for curing
label: sad
response: you will be fine then

situation: my son amazes me.  he currently has enough merit aid to pay for 2/3 of his college tuition!
dialogue: sometimes i am surprised my son is actually my son. he currently has enough merit aid to pay for 2/3 of his college tuition!
well that is quite the accomplishment.
it is certainly much better than i was ever able to do.  i think my scholarship was $500 and i had no merit aide.  he set his academic bar high. i just told him to do his best.
label: proud
response: he sounds like he has a great head on his shoulder. you must have taught him well.

situation: new superintendent has joined my school system.  every superintendent has his/her own expectations, and you never know what type of impression you will make.  today was my first lengthy meeting with him.
dialogue: i now have a new boss, and today was my first day of a leadership meeting with him.  you never know how you will be received.
oh man, that is so nerve-wracking. do you think you guys will be a good fit?

he spent some time laying out his beliefs and his expectations, and i have to say, i agreed with all but one of them.  that is pretty good.  he spent a lot of time watching the rest of us interact with each other, so i think he is trying to feel us out without making judgments yet.
label: anxious
response: then it sounds like at least he has some perspective and ability to know not to overreact. i guess you could say you lucked out, but that may be me speaking too prematurely

situation: my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day and time in which it will create a huge hardship on me. she knew my schedule when she made the plan.
dialogue: my mother will be 85 in a few days. my sister planned a surprise party knowing the day, hour and location would be very difficult for me to attend.
i hope you make it. that is a big birthday.
it is day after tomorrow and i am still not certain i can work it out. sometimes people are very inconsiderate.
label: furious
response: that not good. maybe she will understand if you just cannot make it.

situation: got a call from my cousin. her husband took her and their 4 kids to a county fair. ate about noon and headed home. they decided to stop at a cemetary to look around, lost track of time and now they are locked inside. it is 7pm and everyone is very hungry.
dialogue: my cousin just called with the craziest story. she and her family are locked inside a cemetery.
wow. that would be one of my worst fears. how did they even manage to do that?
they had gone to a fair and decided to stop on their way home and walk around. i guess her husband lost track of time. the worst thing is they have not eaten anything since about noon.
label: angry
response: wow! any way they can get out? did they call someone?

situation: my son is never here anymore.  he is growing up and going out with his own friends.  this is extremely healthy, but i certainly miss him and want him to spend more time here.
dialogue: you hope your teens make the right choices, but sometimes even the right choices feel wrong.  he is choosing to be away with friends and not at home much.  i believe this is healthy, but i can help but want something different.
i know it is hard to start letting go, but it gets easier with time.  do not worry, you are not alone.

that is what my own mother says.  in fact, she said my dad had a harder time than she did when i called and said, "hey, i am staying the night at so and so's, be back tomorrow."  i guess i will survive!  hopefully he will choose to spend time here as he hits his 20s!
label: disappointed
response: yeah, they always seem to come back!  you just have to love them from afar for  a while.

situation: while at a service station i watched the atttendent leave his inside station to go out and pump gas for a lady. she offered him a tip and he declined it.
dialogue: i witness a great sight. i saw a gas station attendant leave his post to pump gas for a lady who has a hard time getting around.
that is really sweet. we do not have gas station attendants here. but that is nice that they are that helpful.
the one i refer to is more like a cashier. he is supposed to stay in a little shack and collect money and turn the pumps on. the lady offered him a tip and he would not take it.
label: impressed
response: ohh, that makes sense. yeah, then that is really nice of them! and really sweet of her to offer a tip. i guess there is good in the world after all.

situation: i just had a lump in my neck.  i had a biopsy and was worried it was cancerous.  thankfully, after it was removed, it was determined to be a benign tumor.
dialogue: i have been fortunate to live a good life but i found a lump in my neck.  most people would get it checked out immediately.  i waited.  i was scared to get the news.
i would absolutely be scared too. good news or bad, i would be a worried wreck beforehand. have you gotten it checked out yet?
i finally went to an ent doctor in may.  they biopsied it, and that was the most nerve-wracking five days i have ever waited.  it was good news, but still had to have removed.
label: terrified
response: i am so glad to hear it was good news, though!

situation: i have tried my best to always do what is best for my family.
dialogue: even when life is tough and seems very unfair i have done my best to care for my family.
that is great of you. life is very unfair but we can go at any minute, so cherish those you love!
it can be difficult. but i learned early on retaliating helps nothing.
label: faithful
response: it does not help us no. but you must take care of yourself too- take some time for yourself when being a caregiver ok!

situation: i am off work in the summertime, and most people would want to stay off work, but i started back today and it felt great!
dialogue: i am off work for a month in the summer, but i today was my first day back, and it felt great to be back on a routine!
coming back to work could be good after a break.
a month is a great break to "get away from the daily grind" but believe me, at the end of week one you think oh, i have all the time in the world, and you are not as productive.
label: joyful
response: i understand

situation: i arrived at church just as everyone was leaving. turns out the power had been off and my clock was wrong.
dialogue: i still cannot believe i did that. my power had been off and i did not even realize it.
that is not good.
i arrived at church just as everyone was leaving. boy did i feel awkward
label: embarrassed
response: did anyone help you?

situation: when i was pregnant, i tried to figure out how i would feel once my son came. i thought about it alot!
dialogue: when i was pregnant, i thought so much about what my son would make me feel!
i wish i could feel that feeling, (unfortunately, i am a man). what did you end up naming your son?
i named him george, men can have feelings of their sons too. hopefully one day you will as well.
label: anticipating
response: i am greatly looking towards starting a family with my wife as well. george is such a nice name.

situation: laying in the hospital after having a mini stroke and the last visitor of the day says good bye is a very sad time.
dialogue: have you ever been hospitalized? it is not much fun. i had a mini stroke and was stuck there for a few days.
i have but not for anything that severe. are you suffering any side effects of the stroke?
i am 99% me  the hardest part of the hospitalization was at the end of the day when my last visitor would go home. i am not good at being alone.
label: lonely
response: yup i know that feeling. and it is always so hard falling asleep in those uncomfortable beds with an iv in your arm.

situation: i have a full time stay at home job where i have my grandma who is in her 80's and my five year old.
dialogue: i have a full time job that does not pay anything.
that really sucks man. are you planning on looking for a new one?
i love my job, it involves my five year old kid and my eighty year old grandma.
label: caring
response: well, as long as you are doing something you enjoy, that is all that really matters.

situation: i have a card table that i put my computer on.  my son keeps putting his foot on it and i have to constantly tell him to take it down.
dialogue: i have a table that is somewhat unsteady, i put my computer on there because i have no where else to put it.
have you figured out what is the problem?
i have not, it seems to do ok except when my son puts his foot on there even though i tell him repeatedly not to do that!
label: annoyed
response: sounds like maybe one of the legs on the table is bent?

situation: my daughter recently said the f word.  i am not sure where she picked it up, so that definitely shocked me!
dialogue: my 2 year old daughter keeps picking up random words lately.
yes? that is so cute, but you have to be carefull not to say bad words in fron of them
i know!  she said the f word!
label: surprised
response: omg, well it is a bad thing but now you can be more polite in front of them, and also when you are not with them!

situation: i keep a lot of random things to scrapbook. for instance i save tickets to concerts.
dialogue: i went to a concert last weekend and saved the tickets.
are you keeping it as a souvenir?
i am, i plan to scrapbook it once i get the pictures back.
label: sentimental
response: nice, i do that sometimes with movie tickets if it is a great movie that i enjoed a lot.

situation: we were camping, and i thought everyone was outside.  i accidentally opened up the bathroom door on my step-daughter.
dialogue: we recently went camping.  everyone definitely gets closer in such close quarters!
i have been camping a few times the proximity to others makes me feel stuffy too. where do you usually go?
we went by a lake.  i accidentally opened the bathroom door with someone in it!
label: embarrassed
response: oh wow! i bet the person inside would've pooped his pants, but there was probably none left!

situation: my grandmother recently passed.  we were close, so it is been hard.
dialogue: this spring has really made me appreciate family.
what happened?? did you guys went camping or something?
my grandmother fell ill, and passed away.
label: sad
response: ho, i am sorry to hear that.

situation: i got a notification that i had a package delivered. i did not see it on my porch and found it sitting in the middle of my driveway!
dialogue: i got a notification on my phone that i had a package delivered and went to look for it
too late i already took it. just kidding, did you find it?
i did, they left it sitting in the middle of the driveway so it could get run over!
label: angry
response: oh, that is bad. was there anything important in it?

situation: my son and wife live out west and i live on the east coast. they called to say they were on their way for a visit.
dialogue: my son and wife are coming for a visit. been a long time since i have seen them
wao that is so cool you must so excited, how long has it been?
about a year. i am on the east coast and they moved out west
label: impressed
response: wao it must be very difficult to be separated from your wife and son, sorry

situation: when we went to a hockey game earlier this year, i put a blanket in my purse. i also had snacks and a tablet for my five year old.
dialogue: i went to a hockey game with my five year old son earlier this year. i had to bring lots of supplies!
oh yeah? do you have to do that every game?
when i have my son with us i do! my husband was shocked when he said he wanted his blanket and i pulled one out of my purse!
label: prepared
response: that is funny. well at least it sounds like you are always prepared.

situation: i have been married for almost ten years. it takes a lot to stay in a marriage that long.
dialogue: i have been married for ten years. since we are not swingers, i am a one man kinda lady.
that is cool. i am not a swinger either.
staying with the same guy day in and day out over a long period of time can be tough.
label: faithful
response: how did you do it?

situation: i had a leak in my roof, that was causing major damage.  no matter what i did to the roof (including replacing), the leak continued.  another person came out to look, and said it was because nobody checked the chimney.  he put a gutter around the stone chimney and i have had no leaks since!
dialogue: after a full year of trying to get a leak fixed, i got help from a neighbor's roofer, who "knew a guy."  he said the guy did not work on roofs, so i was confused!
that makes no sense.

exactly!  the roofer told me that since i replaced my roof and the leak was still there, the problem had to be my fireplace chimney.  he said stone chimneys often develop leaks.  as it turns out, this chimney guy fabricates a type of gutter for chimneys to keep the water from running down the rock.  for $300 he made and installed the "gutter" on site, and i have had no leaks!
label: impressed
response: that seems like a good price.

situation: i am feeling a little bit disappointed right now because the forecast said itll be raining and cloudy today, instead its +30c and sunny with not a single cloud in sight
dialogue: its so hot here. i have had to shower like 3-4 times a day cause you start sweating anyway and it feels icky. hows the temperature at your place?
right now it is freezing in my home i just got out of bed after 30 mins of sitting because it is coold
what? where the hell do you live? what do you mean its freezing? oh my god i am so jealous
label: disappointed
response: haha i live in virginia where right now the temperture outside is muggy 85 degress just regular ac pumping in my home

situation: i was upsetwhen my dog. i kept her on the bed for a whole day. did not want to lety her go
dialogue: oops. i meant i was upset when my dog died.
i am sorry, how long has it been?
happened in febuary.
label: sad
response: that is always a tragedy.

situation: my girlfriend invited me to meet her parents.
dialogue: last week, my girlfriend invited me to meet her parents. the whole time i was on edge because i wanted to make a good impression.
that is nerve wracking for sure.  how did it go?
well we had dinner and the whole time a was stuttering because her father was asking very personal questions, but i think they liked me.
label: apprehensive
response: it probably went well, despite the common jokes most parents want their child to date someone good so try to look for the best in people.

situation: we just finished a camping trip, and spent some great quality time together.  we did some fishing, played board games, and had campfires almost every night.
dialogue: we love going on our annual family camping trip, and just got back from it!
oh nice! how long did you guys stay?
we went for a week, but did have to come back to town once.
label: joyful
response: oh no, what happened?

situation: we recently went camping for a week.  being around my family made me focus on what matters in life.
dialogue: i really love being in the great outdoors with my family!
oh yea? where are you guys? in the mountains? camping?
we went camping, yes.  we are in the midwest, so no mountains, unfortunately.  but we were near a lake.
label: grateful
