response: lakes are awesome. a body of water around here is pretty far. how long are you guys staying?

situation: i did well on a project for a company.  i think i might get a promotion soon based on that work
dialogue: i did well on a project for a company
did you get anything extra, like a bonus or a trip.
i think i might get promoted based on the work
label: hopeful
response: great. what business is it?

situation: i was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk.  i was completely drenched
dialogue: i was on my way home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk
i can tell where this is going.
i got completely drenched, it was terrible
label: angry
response: that has never happened to me. thank god!

situation: i am a stay at home mom. my son just started kindergarten.
dialogue: i am a stay at home mom. school just started.
well does that make you anxious?
it does, this is my only child and he is going to kindergarten.
label: lonely
response: oh, that would be rough. i have been through that too.

situation: a friend who i regularly saw had to leave the state for work.  it is sad i will probably not see him again
dialogue: a close friend of mine has to leave the state for work
are you happy for him?
kind of, it is going to be sad since i will not see him again most likely
label: devastated
response: but if is a great opportunity for him, you should be happy.

situation: a friend was able to fix a problem i was having.  it was something i could not figure out how to do
dialogue: a friend was able to fix a problem i was having
that is very nice of the friend. what sort of problem was it?
computer problem.  it was something i could not figure out on my own
label: impressed
response: bah, those newfangled computers. it is nice to have a tech saavy friend.

situation: i work in a call center that has 4 members on the team and is based on a queue.  once you finish a call you go to the back of the queue.  on a regular basis i will get off of a call and the others will log out of the queue so i am back to the top again.
dialogue: my coworkers sometimes put more work on me than necessary.
why do you think they do that?
they do not want to talk on the phone and can get away with it for a while.
label: annoyed
response: that is not fair and probably very frustrating for you. you need to say something to them.

situation: the first tornado in oklahoma
dialogue: i moved to tornado alley a few years ago. i am not used to large tornadoes so i was pretty scared when it started storming.
oh man, i cannot even imagine. i lived in kansas for a while and we had a storm that did a lot of damage. took out the power all day and stuff. nature can be so devastating sometimes.
we are not too far south of kansas in oklahoma. we have had to spend a few evenings in the storm shelter. i guess stuff can be replaced.
label: terrified
response: jeeeze, yea, it is totally understandable to be afraid. has it been good there otherwise?

situation: dove down to the coast to surf. n waves
dialogue: i cannot believe i spent 2 hours in the car just to arrive to surf and no waves to be seen.
that must be so disappointing. is there something else you can do to have fun?
kiteboard but i left half the gear at home. the surf report said 10 foot waves and it is flat water. not cool bro, not cool
label: disappointed
response: sounds like you really like the water. so what do you do now?

situation: flying out to peru to surf next week.
dialogue: in 6 days i leave for peru
wow! i have never been anywhere near there.
it is a surf trip. they have monster waves. i am nervous.
label: terrified
response: i have been to the ocean a few times but i have never even seen a surfer. we had a small boogie board.

situation: i have a staff of 30 one lady cries daily
dialogue: every single morning one lady on my team comes into my office and cry's
oh no! how come?
you guess is as good as mine. she is crazy. today she was stressed. mind you she is 22 lives at home and has no bills.
label: annoyed
response: oh well maybe she has a lot of problems internally. you never know how someone's home life is like.

situation: found 100 bucks on the street today next to my car.
dialogue: i cannot decide how to spend the $100. i found next to my car this morning.
i would save some and maybe get something you need/want?
do not really need anything but it was a great way to start the day.
label: excited
response: for sure! any extra money is always good!

situation: i went on a date with my ex's best friend while we were dating
dialogue: i cannot i went out with my ex's best friend while we were dating. i was a jerk but it was karma biting her in the butt.
had she done that to you before?
right before that i found out she was seeing other people while i was in iraq.
label: guilty
response: what a shame!

situation: got on the scale today. lost 15 pounds
dialogue: got on the scale this morning. thanks to work stress i lost 15 pounds.
oh man! i wish work stress would make me lose weight. i gain! are you looking for a new job?
yes, that or a new boss. i love my job but my boss is terrible.
label: surprised
response: oh i do not deal with that well. i hope you get a new boss!

situation: the neighbors's kid grandparents just got him a bmw 745i, a hundred thousand dollar car for a sixteen year old.
dialogue: i can see the kid's car from here. he is 16 and has a car work 100k
wow, what brand
bmw 8 series. it is my neighbors kid.
label: jealous
response: that is a nice car

situation: lost 25 pounds now i am a beautiful man
dialogue: do you see a man and that yea he is got it going on?
yeah all the time. i get so jealous
yea well i lost 25 pounds and now i am that guy. happy in my skin.
label: content
response: wow, that is hard to do. congratulations my dude!

situation: heading to colorado next week to climb elbert.
dialogue: last time i climbed elbert i started getting sick from altitude. heading to colorado next week to try to climb it again.
that sounds awesome!  is elbert a fourteener?
yes, it is the tallest in colorado. this will be my 3rd time climbing it. but the first time since i got old and lazy.
label: anxious
response: hahaha.  well, i hope you do not get sick.  take something salty with you, maybe that will help.  have fun!

situation: got and a today on my real estate exam
dialogue: aced my real estate exam today. now i am licensed in two states.
congratulations. i bet you are happy!
yea, time to advance my career now.
label: grateful
response: do you work for a company or on your own?

situation: i was recently waiting to hear back from my old apartment about my security deposit refund. i needed the money for some necessities for my new house, and was not sure if i would get enough back.
dialogue: i was recently waiting to hear from my old apartment about my security deposit refund. i needed the money to pay my new pet deposit, and was not sure if i would get enough money back.
were you able to get it back?
i was, and i ended up getting enough to pay the deposit and then some.
label: anxious
response: that is great! i bet that was a relief.

situation: i watched a man make a small table out of chocolate and it looked real.
dialogue: i was watching a video about a man who made a small table out of chocolate. it looked real and was just amazing.
wow, that should have been amazing
it really was. it also made me want to eat chocolate.
label: impressed
response: me too, i love chocolate

situation: i watched my friend do a really cool backflip!
dialogue: i was so happy to watch my friend do a backflip
i have always been too scared to do a backflip. i always worry i am going to break my neck or something. did it take him a long time to get it right?and did he get hurt?
i think he just took gymnastics classes. he luckily did not get hurt!
label: impressed
response: oh, that makes sense. and i am glad to hear that. i always worry about that sort of thing. you ever think about trying to do it netx?

situation: i went in for a doctor appointment that i had been waiting for, and it did not go well or anywhere near expected.
dialogue: i hope the next doctor's appt. that i have goes well. sometimes they are not the greatest experience.
are you sick?
yeah, i have health problems, it is complicated.
label: disappointed
response: that sucks, i will pray for you.

situation: i knocked on a closed bathroom door and no one responded. but, when i opened the door, someone was using the bathroom.
dialogue: i cannot believe i walked in on someone using the restroom.
oh my, that must've been an embarrassing situation!
it was! i knocked first and no one answered, so i thought it was okay to go in.
label: embarrassed
response: that is ok, you did the right thing. it probably happens to lots of people.

situation: i remember dropping my phone on subway and an old man picked it up and gave it back to me.
dialogue: so remember i told you, that i have lost my phone for a moment on a subway?
yes, what about it?
so i guess i just dropped it, and a very old man, picked it up and gave it back to me
label: trusting
response: that was nice of him.

situation: as i woke up today i found out it was still dark and very early nevertheless, i felt good.
dialogue: i woke up today to a bit of a strange sight.
tell me all about it.
well, it was still dark and too early, but i felt like i had enough sleep.
label: surprised
response: i try to always go for extra sleep.

situation: friends and family threw a party for me. it was unexpected and fun!
dialogue: the party that was thrown for me was for my 30th. i think it made friends and family just as happy as it made me.
wow! 30th is a big milestone birthday! i can imagine that everyone was excited to get to share that with you.
thank you! i was glad to share that moment with them.
label: surprised
response: did you feel old after?

situation: i was unable to access the printer at work, and a coworker showed me a fool proof way to find it.
dialogue: i was frustrated because i could not print a document, and a co worker showed me a keyboard shortcut to find it everytime.
that had to be relief. so now you will not have to deal with that frustration again.
yes indeed, it was frustrating!  i did not have time to mess with it everytime i had to print something.
label: impressed
response: those keyboard shortcuts can be lifesavers.

situation: i have had some difficult times, and feel glad to have friends and family to help me.
dialogue: some things have changed in my life and my close friends have family have helped me through, which i really appreciate.
that is good. everyone is not so fortunate.
for sure, thank you. times can change very unexpectedly.
label: grateful
response: its goof to have support when it does change.

situation: i unexpectedly got a raise in the past, and that was great!
dialogue: one day i randomly got a raise, not something i was expecting!
oh wow. bet it felt amazing. was it a mistake?
thanks! it was not a mistake. just unexpected and pretty neat!
label: surprised
response: sounds like a great day. makes you wish it would happen everyday

situation: one time i knocked some things off a shelf. i could feel my face turning red.
dialogue: i was at the store and accidentally knocked over some items. i could feel my face turning red.
that is so embarrassing! what did you do?
i picked them up and tried to move to another area!
label: embarrassed
response: did anyone say anything?

situation: i was going to fly alone. i felt a bit wary.
dialogue: i was flying alone, even though i had before, this particular time i felt wary.
really? why was that?
i think i felt concerned that the plane would crash or that something else bad might happen.
label: apprehensive
response: do you normally feel like that when you fly?

situation: i felt scared on a plane ride. i was traveling by myself.
dialogue: i was traveling on a plane by myself and i felt kind of scared.
i can understand that, flying is scary.
it is. we ended up going through a thunderstorm.
label: afraid
response: i am glad you did not get hurt.

situation: i am trying to recover a videogame account and the customer support is just so surprisingly stupid, theyre asking me for my game code when that is what i do not have and why i contacted them
dialogue: hello!
hey, do you have anything on your mind?

yeah! i just received an email from guild wars 2 customer support, i lost my game code so i could not recover my account (forgot password), and they sent an email back asking me for the code. its so surprising having to deal with people this stupid, you would think that they would never get hired to begin with
label: surprised
response: i agree, incompetent customer support is one of the worst things when dealing with such problems.

situation: my dog died after 13 years, and it broke my heart.  burying him was one of the hardest things i have ever had to do.  gut wrenching to lose something you love.
dialogue: i recently lost my dog, after 13 years.
oh i am so sorry for your loss.
yeah, it was terrible.  heart wrenching to bury him.
label: sad
response: i bet. you gave him a good long life, that was the best you could do.

situation: when i got my promotion at work to a supervisory role, i was nervous till i got the news.
dialogue: when a spot came open for a supervisor job at my employer, that was a stressful week for me.
i am sorry it was so stressful
they had many qualified candidates and it took a full week for them to make their decision.
label: hopeful
response: just hope for the best

situation: my boyfriend and  his family went to a christmas party one saturday and i had to stay home and work.
dialogue: i had to work the day that my boyfriend and his family went to a christmas party.
ugh that is the worst right. everyone should have holidays off.
it was not even a holiday, just on a saturday during the day because the drive was so long.
label: sad
response: i say skip work next time :p go for it

situation: i started teaching my daughter sign language when she was a baby. she started using it to communicate.
dialogue: when my daughter was a baby she could not talk so i taught her sign language.
i just love that, my son knows asl
that is great! i taught her a few words that were interesting to her so she could tell us what she needed.
label: proud
response: i wish schools would teach kids asl

situation: my sister in law planned a get together during a time that we could not go, but asked to take my daughter instead.
dialogue: my sister in law planned a get together during a time we could not go.
she wants to spend time with you
well no, she knew we could not go out late because of my son's bedtime and scheduled it anyway.
label: annoyed
response: that was nice of her

situation: my mother in law asked to take my daughter to colorado with her, but i was not so sure about it.
dialogue: my mother in law wanted to take my daughter to colorado, but she is only 3.
its a beautiful place
i am sure it is, but she is very young and still looks for me in the morning.
label: apprehensive
response: in that case i agree then

situation: we were going on a trip to new jersey and i made a list of every possible thing we could need.
dialogue: we were going on vacation and i made a list of everything we could possibly need when we were there.
where are you going on vacation?
we went to new jersey, so a long way for us. we had a toddler, so i had to make sure i had everything for her.
label: prepared
response: that is close for me, but it is a fun time!

situation: i was waiting for a subway train, but as it passed me it honked continuously, i din't move a muscle.
dialogue: i seem to be always alert, so that even something loud happens, i remain calm.
i admire that
i just wander, is this normal?
label: prepared
response: no its not

situation: i have been too scared to leave my house.because of panic and anxiety.
dialogue: i have been having bad anxiety for months. i cante seem to get a to stop.
i see, have you tried yoga and meditation?
nope.but have been practicing breathing and muscle relaxation
label: terrified
response: keep a positive mindset and your anxieties will be relieved!

situation: my friends planned a second baby shower for me without me knowing.
dialogue: i was having my second baby and my friends threw me a baby shower without me knowing.
oh my, you must have very surprised!
yes, i was not expecting it at all. they invited us over to hang out.
label: surprised
response: it must have been an enjoyable day. you have nice friends!

situation: it was christmas eve and i could not sleep. i could not wait to see my daughter's face when she saw her toys.
dialogue: i could not sleep on christmas eve. i was ready to see my daughter's face when she woke up in the morning.
i bet she was so excited! did she love her presents?
yeah she did, but i guess i was looking forward to it more than she was.
label: excited
response: that was me last christmas my son was only 9 months old but i bought so many presents and i was so excited to see his reaction

situation: i feel like my employer really counts on me to do my job and i would feel bad ever leaving them for another company.
dialogue: i really like my job. i am worried that i will lose it.
oh no. why are you worried to lose it?
i do not have as much work to do as in the past and no one needs help with anything.
label: faithful
response: oh no. that is a bit scary. i wish the best for you!

situation: i called a pizza delivery today, and the guy that took my order, was so rude..
dialogue: i ordered a pizza today, but it really was not a pleasant experience.
oh no, why not?!
the guy that took my order was rude, but i understand, most people cannot control themselves.
label: angry
response: they really cannot. it is still no excuse though.

situation: once i was waiting for a friend for an hour to go to dinner and she would not answer her phone!
dialogue: i cannot believe my friend would not answer her phone when i waited over an hour for her to pick me up!
oh that sucks.did she explain herself yet
no, she just completely blew me off. i found out she was out on a date instead and did not tell me.
label: angry
response: sounds like you need a new friend or your own car..or both

situation: my neighbor neglects their dog.
dialogue: my neighbor is the worst! he has a dog that he just keeps chained up in the backyard, and he rarely feeds it. last week i saw it and he looks anorexic.
that is terrible.  someone should call animal control on them.
i know, what kind of human being would do that to a poor dog! i am going to call animal control soon.
label: disgusted
response: i hope they do something to help that poor puppy.

situation: when i visited one of my friends home recently , i encountered with their dog its a male rottweiler and it was so furious and tried to attack me and i got struck suddenly and felt lot of fear
dialogue: i was so shocked by the behavior of my friends dog
what happened ?
when i knocked on the door i felt the door was open and i thought as he is in home itself i felt i can go in but suddenly his dog jumped on me
label: terrified
response: did he end up biting you??

situation: last week my dog got really sick.
dialogue: my dog got really sick and was coughing up blood last week. i did not know what to do. i had a panic attack.
oh no, that is terrible!  are both you and your dog alright now?
yes, i took him to the vet and got him the help he needed. the possibility of losing my best friend had me frightened!
label: afraid
response: yes, that would have frightened me too.  i am glad he is alright now.

situation: i am convinced my family's finances will soon turn around.  hard work and never giving up will be the key to it.  i believe it will happen.
dialogue: financially, things will turn around for my family soon!
i hope and wish so. in this tough economic climate many are finding it difficult to cope with financial responsibilities
yes, and we had a layoff of five months.  i believe in a brighter day, though, so i know it will improve.
label: hopeful
response: being optimistic will help you alleviate much of your accumulated stress

situation: i was waiting in a check out lane for quite some time. a new cashier came and she took the people at the back of the line.
dialogue: i was in a check out lane for a while waiting when another cashier comes alone and takes the people in the back of the line.
that is literally the worst, the people should have atleast told you to go ahead  first!
oh i know. people just gladly go, but the cashiers should be taught to take the next person in line.
label: angry
response: its really so rude. ugh i am sorry

situation: hanging out with my dog by a lake near my house
dialogue: i love hanging out with my dog in nature, it makes me feel good.
i love dogs too what breed do you have ?
i have a 4 yr old golden do you have any?
label: content
response: i have a german shepard

situation: my life may be far from ideal, but i am happy with where i am.  i am satisfied with the overall scope of my family, career, and friendships.  i am at peace with it all.
dialogue: where at i am in life, currently, is at peace with everything around me. it is a first for me, and it is simply amazing.
that is awesome.  what did it take for you to get there
a lot of years struggling, and finalizing realizing that the struggle is the normal part of it all.  acceptance and steadfastness led to happiness, i guess.
label: content
response: sounds like you've gotten smarter and more observant over the years

situation: i saw a dead possum in our trash it was pretty gross
dialogue: i once saw a dead possum in my garbage it smelled terrible.
oh how gross! i do not like possums anyways
yeah me neither any wildlife where you live?
label: disgusted
response: just lizards and gators. i live in south florida haha

situation: i have been watching my 12 year old son play fortnite.  his level of skill simply amazes me.  i have a hard time even believing that a human can do things that fast.
dialogue: recently, i have been watching my son play a game called fortnite. it blows my mind how good he is at such a fast game.
i have heard about that game.  i heard there was one guy that makes about $500,000 a month playing it on the streaming service twitch.  maybe your son should give it a try.
i have never heard of twitch.  that is a lot of money, i could retire!
label: impressed
response: twitch is just a place where people stream themselves playing video games.  i guess a lot of people really love watching good players.  go ahead and retire now and get him started!

situation: my friend moved to california last week.
dialogue: my friend got a promotion and moved to california last week. i always thought i would be the first one to get out of this dump.
i am sorry your friend moved away. sounds like me when i moved from indiana to florida. my friend was upset when i left too.
he does not deserve to live in luxury! he gets to chill on the beaches and i am stuck out here in the dessert.
label: jealous
response: that is your friend, you should be happy for them!

situation: i cannot wait to back to uni full time again in the fall
dialogue: i am excited to go to school full time again in the fall!
aw i am happy for you! what do you go to school for?
engineering its tough but i think its really cool.
label: anticipating
response: that is great! good luck to you!

situation: the birth of my first child was an amazing thing.  seeing that little boy being brought into the world left me with such a feeling of happiness and wonder.
dialogue: watching my first child being born changed my life forever.
i bet! i cannot imagine what that must be like to see a bran new life.
it changed my whole outlook on everything.  i have never felt such happiness condensed in such a short period of time/
label: joyful
response: that is awesome i am happy for you! hopefully one day i will get to see that

situation: i am a stay at home mom and my son is always with me. sometimes he uses language like i do, curse words.
dialogue: i stay home with my five year old son. sometimes i hear things come out of his mouth that i know he learned from me.
hopefully the things coming out of his mouth are good things, right?
i wish, he sometimes says curse words.
label: ashamed
response: oh.  i recommend correcting that before it gets out of hand.  good luck!

situation: i have just finished a movie, and i feel very energized.
dialogue: i have been watching movie a few hours ago, and still feel its effects.
what movie were you watching?
i think it was called rampage.
label: excited
response: that is a great movie.

situation: i went hiking with my family and had fun.
dialogue: i had a great time hiking with my family and dog recently! do you like nature?
i do.  it feels great to get out into nature does not it?
yeah i always enjoy hiking in the mountains or just going to the beach.
label: joyful
response: the beach is my most favorite place to go.

situation: about 8 years ago i moved to texas with just my boyfriend. i left all my family behind when i moved.
dialogue: when i moved to texas i did not know anyone but my boyfriend.
that sounds rough, were you able to get accustomed to texas?
yeah, but i had left all my family behind. i did not know anyone here for quite some time.
label: lonely
response: i know what you mean, that happened to me when i left for college a few years ago.

situation: i got the new girl's number at school.
dialogue: we got a new girl in class yesterday and i bet my friends that i could get her number! let's just say lunch was on them.
wow that is really confident on your end. are you going to do anything with the girl
well that is the attitude you have when you look like brad pitt. maybe take her out to the movies and try to get to second base.
label: confident
response: that sounds exciting. just make sure she is okay with it all before!

situation: we were visiting my husband's grandma and she asked about the rain hitting us. i thought she meant on the way to see her, but she did not.
dialogue: we were talking to my husband's grandma and she asked about the rain hitting us. i thought she was talking about the rain we got on the way to see her, but she was not.
what was she referring to then?
she was talking about the rain storms that hit earlier in the week, and asked if we were effected by them.
label: embarrassed
response: i see.  do you get a lot of storms in your location?

situation: we watched "the land before time" in class.
dialogue: yesterday we watched "the land before time" in class. that movie brings back so many memories.
that movie is a classic! i loved it as a kid!
yes, i remember we used to call one of my friends petrie because he looked exactly like him.
label: nostalgic
response: hahah! that is awesome!

situation: i am staying in hotel, and new neighbors just moved in, from what it sounds like already, i am not having a good night's sleep today.
dialogue: my new hotel neighbors are very noisy.
get them reported
i might just do it, thank you.
label: furious
response: you are welcome, if you take your stand they will  behave

situation: my son enters kindergarten soon, i plan to get caught up on my scrapbooking! years behind i am!
dialogue: my son starts kindergarten next week, i am a stay at home mom. i want to get caught up on scrapbooking my pictures of him!
i bet you are both excited and nervous about it! i have two kids of my own and one will be starting in about a year while the other is going to fourth grade.
i had all these plans when i had my son, they did not work out but i am wishing that this does!
label: hopeful
response: i am sure it will! i hope it all works out for you.

situation: i feel so fortunate to just know that there are like minded people around me.
dialogue: i recently discovered that there are plenty of like minded people around where i live.
that is always a good thing. it means you should get on great with your neighbors.
yes, just knowing that i am not alone is such a great feeling.
label: joyful
response: most of my neighbors are good, kind people too, so i know just what you mean.

situation: i felt anxious when i do ,my work in office
dialogue: i felt anxious during my work. the finance related work which gives me satisfaction
why did you feel anxious?
i love my job. i eagerly awaited to achieve and go  as long as i want in my life.
label: anxious
response: hmm. i am a little confused.  why were you anxious?

situation: the other night we went out for ice cream. our son walked up to a cop and told him he wanted to meet the mayor, the cop said he could make it happen!
dialogue: we were eating ice cream last night and my son walked over to a police officer and started talking to him.
well that is sweet. how did the policeman react?
he was so nice, he even volunteered to set up a meeting with the mayor and my son!
label: surprised
response: oh wow! that is awesome! your son sounds like he has a bright future!

situation: my cousin invited me to go white water rafting with him.
dialogue: my took me white water rafting with him last week. when we got to the river i started having second thoughts.
i have done that before. getting over that initial fear is really hard. but it is fun once you do!
i know, but since it was my first time i did not know how to act. my mind started to go blank and i started to sweat profusely.
label: apprehensive
response: i understand completely. it is that initial anxiety. it is a scary thing to do!

situation: i could not wait for my mom to get here from new jersey.
dialogue: i could not wait for my mom to finally get here from new jersey. she would stay about a week and a half.
i bet you are pretty anxious and excited at the same time.
yeah, she would be able to see the kids, and she hardly ever comes to visit.
label: anxious
response: its always nice when grandmas come visit.

situation: my brother landed a 900 on his skateboard like tony hawk.
dialogue: last week, my brother landed a 900 on his skateboard like tony hawk at a skating competition.
oh wow, that sounds like it might be cool but i do not know what that looks like, what is the 900?
it is when you turn a skateboard 900 degrees while spinning in the air. it is very hard to do, so you can imagine the look on my face when i saw my brother do it.
label: impressed
response: yea, how old is your brother?

situation: when we are camping, i take a hammock with me. i love swaying in the hammock and reading a good book!
dialogue: we go camping a lot during the summer. my favorite piece of equipment is my hammock!
i love camping, and understand why a hammock is your favorite. they are so comfortable!
they are, i love to read a good book while hanging out in the hammock!
label: content
response: that sounds amazing, as long as you are not reading scary books about the woods!

situation: i enjoy going to disney world because it makes me feel fond for my childhood.
dialogue: i really enjoy going to disney because it makes me feel very nostalgic for my childhood.
i have actually never gone there. what is it like?
it is pretty awesome! lots to do for adults as well. i tend to go to epcot quite often with my annual pass. we live right down the street.
label: nostalgic
response: that is good to hear. i do plan on taking my kids in the future!

situation: i was pretty shook up last year when hurricane irma came through florida.
dialogue: i was pretty shook up last year when hurricane irma came through florida.
do you live in flordia? i have family down there and was really worried about them.
yes, i live in orlando so i was lucky that it was central, but we were out of power for a few days.
label: terrified
response: that was lucky. losing power is bad, but at least that was it. scary situation.

situation: i really feel good when i feel a friend can keep a secret.
dialogue: i really feel good when my friends keep my secrets. (or at least i think they do!)
what will happen if the secret is told?
not much, i just value my privacy. do you have secrets that you tell your friends?
label: trusting
response: of course, i only tell them the best ones though!

situation: my sister in law got really upset one day when she was over and i tried talking to her about it.
dialogue: my sister in law got upset when she was over and i was trying to talk to her about it.
oh no, was she upset at you or about something else?
about something else and i wanted to talk to her and make her feel better.
label: caring
response: well that is really kind of you to help her like that. she is lucky to have you!

situation: we went to a concert a few weeks ago, people would not move so my son could go to the bathroom.
dialogue: i was at a concert a few weeks ago with my son and he had to go to the bathroom.  there were so many people there, mostly adults, and they refused to move so we could make it to the family bathroom.
ugh, people can be so rude. was he able to go to the bathroom?
he was not, there were just too many people standing around not moving.
label: annoyed
response: that is awful! so what did you end up doing? did he just have to pop a squat?

situation: i am really hopefully that i will land a new promotion at work.
dialogue: i am really hopeful that i will land a new promotion at work.
as long as you work hard and stay dedicated, i am sure it will come!
i hope so! hard work and dedication tend to pay off.
label: hopeful
response: absolutely! and if you trust your boss, i am sure he will do the right thing.

situation: we were driving home from a long trip and it started storming real bad and we could not see and there were so many big trucks around us.
dialogue: as we were driving on the highway we got caught in a big storm.
that is scary.  did you have to pull over?
no we kept driving but the rain was real bad and trucks were swerving.
label: terrified
response: i take it you made it out safe beacuse we are here chatting

situation: my mom told me at christmas that we would be going on a cruise vacation. i could not believe it!
dialogue: my parents told me that we would be going on a cruise vacation at christmas. i could not believe it!
that sounds like an awesome christmas present!  i have actually thought about doing that with my girls now that they are older and not much they really need.  where are you going?
we went on the cruise in february. it was a disney cruise in the bahamas! what a great experience.
label: surprised
response: i have always wanted to go on a disney cruise it is probably my dream vacation. i am so jealous!!

situation: i was so glad when i graduated college.
dialogue: i was so glad when i graduated college
that is such a great accomplishment and such a relief at the same time. what was your major?
communications. it was a little tough but not engineering tough!
label: proud
response: i totally get that. i majored in business but sometimes i wish i majored in engineering. i am kind of glad i did not though. it is hard!

situation: my family is always there for me. when my dog died, they flew out and spent time with me for a quick weekend trip.
dialogue: my family is so supportive. they even flew out when my last dog passed away and spent some time with me to make me feel better.
aww, that is very nice of them. i just had to put mine down a few weeks ago.
i am so sorry to hear that. what kind of breed was your dog?
label: caring
response: border collie. yours?

situation: i was very scared when flying for the first time.
dialogue: i was very scared when flying for the first time
i can imagine! did you end up having a good flight?
i did. luckily no turbulance!
label: afraid
response: that is good! hopefully you had a nice seatmate too!

situation: i recently had a fun day out with my son. but when we got home, his behavior turned horrible! i was not happy.
dialogue: my son starts school soon, we had a fun day out but when we got home he was really bad.
aww, was he scared?
i do not think so, i think he was just over the day and it was too much for him.
label: disappointed
response: i can see that. school is a challenging time for a kid.

situation: i was very ready going into my test.
dialogue: i was very ready going into my test
always good to feel ready for something like that. what subject was it in?
engingeering. it was really tough!
label: prepared
response: man, i remember those days. my engineering exams were killer. did you do well on it?

situation: when we take a trip, i normally save what some may think of as trash.  i will scrapbook it later.
dialogue: anytime we take a trip, i normally save what some people consider trash.
another man's trash is another man's treasure! what things do you save?
just different things that i can scrapbook, mementos from my trip.
label: sentimental
response: i keep a scrapbook myself! i love collecting stamps. got any trips planned this year?

situation: my pants feel down when riding my bike.
dialogue: my pants feel down when riding my bike
i am so sorry that happened to you. how did you handle this situation?
i just pulled them up. it was just embarassing.
label: embarrassed
response: i hope no one saw that, it must've been terrible.

situation: i was scared to go to school
dialogue: i was scared to go to school
how are you going to learn! why are you afraid to go?
just nervous about all the people
label: apprehensive
response: it ain't so bad. i am sure you will make a few new friends and everything will be just fine.

situation: i was scared of going into the caves
dialogue: i was scared of going into the caves
please describe what scared you about the caves.
just the darkness.
label: afraid
response: that seems like a valid reason to be scared of going into the caves!

situation: we live in a vhcol area, sometimes i compare myself to what others have. we do not have as much.
dialogue: we live in a very high cost of living area but do not make a ton of money.
is there anyway you can move to somewhere more affordable?
i am not sure, sometimes i wish i had what the other people around me had.
label: jealous
response: i do too but it is natural to get envious of others sometimes, do not put yourself down over it.

situation: sometimes people ask me to do a lot when i am already doing alot. it is like they do not care that i have stuff to do.
dialogue: sometimes people ask me to do a lot of other stuff when i already have a lot on my plate.
that must be so annoying. i get that sometimes too.
i feel like people do not care that i have stuff to do.
label: annoyed
response: i am sad to hear that, i am sure there is someone who cars.

situation: my son's preschool was so awesome! i could always count on them to watch him extra when i needed it.
dialogue: my son went to the best preschool. when i needed him to stay late, they always had space for him.
that is good to hear that you care for your son so much. i am sure he will be quite an intelligent child going to the best of the best.
i hope so, it really helps to get your village when you have kids.
label: grateful
response: yeah, my village helped with my son's preschool tuition as well. strength in numbers and good neighbors!

situation: i was so grossed out when i saw someone vomit.
dialogue: i was so grossed out when i saw someone vomit
oh yuck! where did that happen?
at fazolis. it was so gross.
label: disgusted
response: during dinner? ack!

situation: i could not believe it when i heard they are making even more star wars movies
dialogue: hello
can you tell me about your recent experience?
i could not believe it when i heard they are making even more new star wars movies
label: surprised
response: yeah, i love star wars. i was sad when han solo died. he was my favorite character!

situation: my husband went to hang out with the guys and i was all alone in the house.
dialogue: my husband went to go hang out with his guy friends leaving me all alone.
that would make me sad, did you let him go?
yeah, i mean i did not want to tell him he could not. i just do not like being by myself.
label: lonely
response: i know how you feel, i am sorry about that, at least he probably came back pretty quickly.

situation: i felt upset when i forgot to ask my friend to dinner.
dialogue: i felt upset when i forgot to ask my friend to dinner.
i am sure they will understand. you can always have another dinner, that is the beauty of life!
that is true. good way to look at things!
label: guilty
response: where did you end up going?

situation: i felt pretty down when i found out that i was losing my job. it was pretty disappointing. tomorrow's my last day.
dialogue: tomorrow's my last day of work. i cannot believe it. i wish i had something lined up.
oh no, have you look at other options?
i have and tried negotiating with my old work. i have an interview next week with another company so i hope that goes well!
label: sad
response: i really hope you get it!

situation: i was so mad when some guy cut me off in traffic!
dialogue: i was so mad when some guy cut me off in traffic!
oh no. did you flip him off?
no, i remained calm, but i was very mad!
label: furious
response: that was probably for the best anyway. people who drive like that are the worst, though.

situation: i could not stand it when my neighbor was using power tools at 8 am on a saturday
dialogue: i could not stand it when my neighbor was using power tools at 8 am on a saturday
wow, that is super annoying! i understand wanting to get things done early, but that is not very respectful to neighbors.
nope, it was very frustrating, he lives next door too
label: annoyed
response: have you talked to him about it?

situation: i am pretty worried about what the future will hold. i hope it is bright!
dialogue: i am pretty worried about what the future will hold. i lose my job tomorrow. trying to keep my head up!
are you getting laid off?
yes, unfortunately. we are having a huge company layoff and being a remote employee did not help my case.
label: anxious
response: im sorry, i hope you are able to find an even better job immediately

situation: i was really scared when hurricane irma came through florida last year. it was a pretty horrible experience.
dialogue: i was really scared when hurricane irma came through florida last year. it was a pretty horrible experience.
do you live in florida?
i do, in orlando. i feel lucky to have had no damage to my home and been in a central location, but the storm was awful and we had no power for 4 days.
label: terrified
response: wow, that sounds terrifying. you are very lucky to have made it out without any property damage though.

situation: i work online and make extra money to pay for fun things for my family.
dialogue: i work online to make extra money for things my family wants.
that is amazing, you must be a good person
it is nice to be able to pay for fun things that our budget does not allow us to normally do.
label: proud
response: how many kids do you have?

situation: i felt bored being by myself all week
dialogue: i felt bored being by myself all week
sometimes i like to not have other people asking things of me. alone can be good.
it was just boring because i had so much work to get done
label: lonely
response: well at least you did not have a lot of people under foot to slow you down. so i hope the sacrifice of being bored was worth it.

situation: my son's school starts next week, they just changed the day that is his first day. my husband had to ask off a different day as well.
dialogue: my son's school starts next week and they just changed the first day of school!
i am so sorry to hear that!
my husband had to ask off for a different day without much notice!
label: annoyed
response: that is the worst. at least you and your husband got something worked out for your son's first day at school!

situation: i was going through my cloud and found pictures of when i was little.
dialogue: i was looking through my cloud and found some pics of when i was little.
a walk down memory lane.
yeah, it makes me miss being at home and around my family.
label: sentimental
response: oh i bet! it is always good to cherish those memories.

situation: i was trying to watch my favorite show on tv and my husband kept talking to me.
dialogue: i was watching my favorite tv show and my husband kept talking to me during it.
oh that can be annoying, did you tell him anything?
i just gave him a look. the thing is he says i do that instead of waiting til commercial, but then he goes and does it to me.
label: annoyed
response: hahah that is kinda funny. maybe he just missed you!

situation: i was glad i went on a mission trip even though i did not help much.
dialogue: i was glad my dad asked me to go on a mission trip with him.
nice! where did you go?
belize. he did doctor stuff. i did not do much. but it was cool to see what they were up to.
label: proud
response: oh, that is really cool! what a great experience, and fun to bond with your dad!

situation: i was upset sitting in traffic yesterday
dialogue: i was upset sitting in traffic yesterday
was it long?
about an hour
label: disappointed
response: that is long, i understand the reason behind you being upset

situation: my friends were coming over for a game night and i hadn't seen them in a while.
dialogue: my friends were finally coming over to visit, it had been a long time since i saw them last.
i know how you feel, it is always good to bond with your buddies when you can
yeah, i really miss seeing them since they moved.
label: excited
response: thank god you will be able to tell them in person about how much you miss them

situation: i have good memories when i see photos of my grandmother
dialogue: i have good memories when i see photos of my grandmother
oh yea, i can relate to the good times, is she still alive?
no unfortunately she isnt
label: sentimental
response: oh no. may her soul rest in peace

situation: last week was my husband and i's 10th wedding anniversary.  10 whole years married, loyal and true to each other and i would not change it for the world.  heres to another 10 more, and many more after that.
dialogue: well last week my husband and i celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary.
congrats! i am sure you will have great memories.
we do.  10 years being loyal and true to each.  i just hope we have many more!
label: faithful
response: i believe you will just continue doing what you've already done.

situation: i have a presentation to give and i think i will do well.
dialogue: i have a presentation tonight, i am nervous but i still think i will ace it.
have you been practicing? do you have note cards?
i do not want to use note cards as i look better without them. i did use them while practicing though.
label: confident
response: i hope you do well. is it for school?

situation: last week i got bit by a spider.
dialogue: a tarantula bit me in my living room the other day and i thought i was going to die.
oh my gosh! was it a wild tarantula or a pet?
it was a wild tarantula. i had my family rush me to the hospital, but i ended up being just fine. it only caused me discomfort for a couple of days.
label: afraid
response: thank goodness! the biggest type of spider we have here if a wolf spider. they do not really bite you unless you irritate them.

situation: my friend from out of town came to visit me.
dialogue: last week, my childhood friend came to visit from out of town. i could not stop smiling when we hung out.
oh awesome! how are they doing?
great. we were just cracking jokes the whole time. it was good to see him.
label: joyful
response: awesome! it is nice to see people who knew you so long ago. no friendships like those!

situation: my brother came out on the news because of a new charity he is starting.
dialogue: yesterday, my brother came out on the news because he was taking about the new charity he started. i am glad i have brother with such a good heart.
wow, that is really great. what charity did he donate to?
no, he is starting his own. i am glad i am able to call him my bro.
label: proud
response: oh, sorry. that is awesome. what does his charity support?

situation: i was outside with my daughter watching her play. i felt very relaxed out there in the sun.
dialogue: my daughter wanted to go outside and play so i sat out there with her.
was the weather nice?
yes it was nice outside. i felt very relaxed out there.
label: content
response: i cannot wait until we get nice weather. its too hot to do anything

situation: some lady cut in front of me in line at the supermarket yesterday.
dialogue: i was in a long line at the supermarket the other day. then some lady just cut right in front of me like nothing.
some people have no concept of being rude.
it mad me sick! do they teach these people about manners?
label: disgusted
response: no, they dont.

situation: i was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
dialogue: i was diagnosed with stage four cancer yesterday. the doctor told me i have less than a month to live.
are you serious? that is extremely terrible news to hear.
yes, i fell to my knees when i heard the news and have not stopped crying since. my life is pretty much over!
label: devastated
response: i really wish i knew what to say, but even watching my mother go thru stage 4 i still do not know what to say! spend a lot of time with your loved ones!

situation: my daughter picked up sign language really well when she was a baby.
dialogue: when my daughter was a baby she picked up sign language really well.
really, is not that unusual?
not really, i was trying to teach her so she could communicate with us and tell us what she wanted.
label: proud
response: i am glad it worked out so well for you all .

situation: i waited the whole day in the doctors office for my blood test results.
dialogue: yesterday, i was at the doctors office all day waiting for my blood tests. i was hoping everything would turn out alright.
i know how stressful that can be. i hope everything turned out alright.
the wait turned out to be worth it because the results showed that everthing was fine.
label: anticipating
response: that is great news!

situation: i was in shopping and came back to the carpark to my car only to find that someone had hit the back of it and must have just driven off! they did quite a bit of cosmetic damage but obviously did not care less as they did not even leave a note for me.
dialogue: i was so annoyed earlier went back to get my car after doing my shopping and someone had hit it and driven off!
that was not nice. i hope they caught them.
no unfortunately not.  there were no cameras in the carpark and no one saw anything.  so i am left with the bill.  i hope karma gets them eventually though.
label: angry
response: that sucks, how much is it?

situation: i applied for a job as manager at the store i was working at. when i interviewed they really liked my answers.
dialogue: i was applying for a manager position at the store i worked at. i felt really sure about the interview.
i can relate. you just have to be yourself.  do you know if you got the job?
yeah they offered me the job. i was very excited.
label: confident
response: that’s great!  how do you like it?

situation: i am really happy about the weather today
dialogue: i am really happy about the weather today
is it sunny where you are ?
yes and warm but not too hot
label: joyful
response: glad for you, it is cloudy and humid here.

situation: my friends girlfriend kissed me at a party.
dialogue: my friends girlfriend kissed me at a party last week. it is been weighing heavy on my mind. should i tell him?
why did you wait a week? tell her to tell him
but, he is been my best friend since childhood. i think i should be the one to tell him. i just feel so bad. that is why i postponed it.
label: guilty
response: i do not know. you should have told hime when it happended. just do it and get uit out of the way so you both can move past it.

situation: i got a letter from my grandmother in the mail today
dialogue: i got a letter from my grandmother in the mail today
that is nice. i always like getting letters.
did you ever have a pen pal when you were a child?
label: joyful
response: no, i never did. it might have been nice.

situation: my friend won the lottery.
dialogue: my friend won 58 million when he hit the jackpot the other day. i do not understand, why cannot good stuff like that happen to me?
58 million. that is unbelievable.
i could not believe he won it because he is so stingy and i am such a kind hearted person. i deserve it more!
label: jealous
response: well, you know how to get it from  him right?

situation: yesterday i went engagement ring shopping.
dialogue: yesterday, i went engagement ring shopping and i picked out the perfect ring for my wife.
ah congratulations on the engagement! how long have you two been together?
thanks buddy. we have been dating for 2 years on and off. i cannot wait to show her the ring. i like it a lot and i think she will too.
label: content
response: no problem. i hope she will love it as well.

situation: i was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
dialogue: i was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
oh no. did you guys talk about it?
we did. he apologized, but i just hate that he forgot me.
label: disappointed
response: no one's perfect. i hope you will not hold a grudge.

situation: i had a major work presentation to give.  i came all set to deliver it and i did well in the end
dialogue: i had a major work presentation to give
how'd it go?
it went well, i felt like i had everything in order
label: prepared
response: being prepared pays off soemtimes.

situation: i had to take a work related placement test.  i think i did extremely well
dialogue: i took a work related placement test for a better position in my company
how did you do on it?
i did well overall, it was easier than i thought
label: confident
response: good, well i hope you get the better position!

situation: sit down to work on my budget. i got this!
dialogue: just started my budget. apparently i am going to be ok.
how strict is the budget?
down the last dollar. i have a baby on the way so we have got to bank money
label: hopeful
response: ah, that makes sense, well i hope it goes well for you!

situation: i was impressed by my nephews performance at his little league baseball game
dialogue: i was impressed by my nephews performance at his little league baseball game
nice. did his team finish first?
they won the game and he played really well
label: impressed
response: at his age, they progress very quickly

situation: i really appreciated all the effort my friends put into my birthday
dialogue: i really appreciated all the effort my friends put into my birthday
that is very nice of them! having caring friends is very important.
yes it is
label: grateful
response: what did they do for you?

situation: i am an over the road trucker. it is a lonely life.
dialogue: i am over the road trucker. man it gets boring in the evenings.
i bet it does, you should find a podcast you like
i listen to most of those as i drive. i was thinking of getting into gaming. i have a tv in the truck and can buy a game system.
label: lonely
response: that is smart, i would recommend a nintendo switch!

situation: i see a lot of work coming up ahead at my job.  it will be a frustrating experience
dialogue: i see a lot of work coming up at my job
how so?
my supervisor warned me earlier in the week about it
label: anticipating
response: i am sorry. any way you can get out of it?

situation: i was scared to fly for the first time
dialogue: i was scared to fly for the first time
why is that?
because i am scared of heights.
label: terrified
response: have you always been scared of heights?

situation: i could not believe it rained this afternoon after such a sunny morning
dialogue: i could not believe it rained this afternoon after such a sunny morning
yuck!  you did not get wet and muddy i hope!
nope it only rained for a few minutes
label: surprised
response: that is good to hear.  no one likes soggy shoes!

situation: i was really proud of my friend for doing a backflip
dialogue: i was really proud of my friend for doing a backflip
backflips are scary. neck injury is serious.
yes, but luckily he completed it without hurting anything.
label: impressed
response: that is good! they do look cool too.

situation: i was scared to fly for the first time
dialogue: i was scared to fly for the first time
i was scared the first and only time i flew also. where were you flying to?
europe. so a long flight!
label: terrified
response: oh wow! i bet that was really exciting. i have never been out of the country.

situation: i feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
dialogue: i feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
you must feel horrible!  get her something extra nice and i am sure she will forgive you!
what should i get her?
label: guilty
response: get her flowers and a gift certificate to a nice massage place!

situation: i was thinking about how i missed my grandma
dialogue: i was thinking about how i missed my grandma
i have the same feeling. i miss her also
she passed last year. she is in a better place.
label: sentimental
response: sorry to hear that

situation: i have a work project that needs to be completed.  i am worried i will not be able to finish it
dialogue: i have a work project coming up that needs to be completed
are you going to have it completed in time?  i hope you are not behind schedule!
i still have much to be done
label: apprehensive
response: ouch!  you better knuckle down and burn the midnight oil!

situation: got a new boss at work. he is 20 and had a phd
dialogue: so i walked into work this morning. i have a new boss. he is 20 and had a phd. i am amazed.
wow! i would be amazed too!
a little worried. while super smart as we get older we gain real world experience in dealing with people that you can not learn in a book. but still at 20 i was struggling with my associates degree.
label: impressed
response: that is so true.  i am 30 and just now having the time to work on my bachelors. but i have a lot of work experience.

situation: ever day my boss is late to work. today i was 1 minute late and got a write up.
dialogue: so ever single day my boss is late to work. 20 minutes or more. today i was 1 minute late, first time in 2 years and i got a wrote up.
wow. that is pretty hypocritical.
yea, i even called and let them know the highway was closed down and i was going to be late. i even text her photo of the traffic accident once i got up to it.
label: annoyed
response: i think she is just trying to cause a problem.

situation: i was hungry and i took some of my co-workers food.  i also did not have much money on me at the time
dialogue: i was hungry and took my co-workers food
did you not have your own food?
i did not have any that day, i was also out of money
label: guilty
response: oh no! that sounds horrible! did the co-worker find out?

situation: picked up a homeless person today on my to work. i took him 35 miles to the train station.
dialogue: this morning i do not know what got into me but on the way to work i picked up a homeless guy.
oh wow. give me the details.
yea, as i pulled over i thought it was someone down on his luck. nope, he was crazy.
label: trusting
response: are you missing an organs?

situation: went on a first date, did not realize i had bbq sauce on my face most of the date.
dialogue: went on a first date last weekend. had some sort of bbq appetizer early in the date. yummy, yea well not really!
not really? how come?
well, after about an hour i got up to pee. as i washed my hands i looked up and my face was covered with sauce. it looked like someone poured it on my face,
label: embarrassed
response: oh wow, the bbq must be delicious.

situation: we really are lucky to live in the united states.
dialogue: do you ever wake up and realize how lucky we are? i travel a lot and i just got back from haiti. i am convinced it is better to be poor in america then rich in haiti.
that is a profound thought. we definitely take america for granted, especially when some people say it is in its "worst state in a long time." we are prisoners of the moment.
those that criticize have not traveled the real world out side resort gates or into the third world. then you see a real state that is in trouble.
label: grateful
response: yeah, i guess you would know for sure, since you've seen it first hand. especially a place like haiti, that is just gets pounded with hurricanes. what brought you to haiti, if you do not mind me asking?

situation: i was down town and had lost my wallet a homeless man offered to pay for my train ticket home.
dialogue: monday i was downtown for work. i was on my way home when a homeless man asked form some money. i went to reach for my wallet and it was gone.
i am sorry to hear that.is there a chance you forgot your wallet home?

no it was stolen. so when i went to reach for it. the homeless man could tell something was wrong. he actually paid for my train ticket home. i end up seeing him again today. took him out to lunch and gave him some money.
label: impressed
response: that story could become a movie script.

situation: i have to work all weekend. i just want to sleep and do nothing.
dialogue: all i want in life this weekend is to sleep and i have to work.
that’s a bummer. drink some coffee
coffee dose even phase me anymore. the lack of sleep is making my soul sad.
label: sad
response: try drinking a lot of water and cutting out soda

situation: this weekend was going to be my 1st weekend off in two months. well not any more i have to work,
dialogue: this weekend was supposed to be my first weekend off in 2 months.
is it not going to happen?
nope, my boss who only works one weekend a month has decided this month she is not going to work any weekends.
label: disappointed
response: that sucks.

situation: i studied very hard for my esl certification, and was sure i would pass the test going in.
dialogue: i recently took my els certification test. i studied really hard, so i am sure i passed it.
what is els?
sorry, esl. it is english as a second language. it just means i am certified to teach students that do not speak fluent english.
label: confident
response: ah, gotcha. a few of my friends teach english to chinese students online and i think they have taken esl courses

situation: when i moved into my house, i had a cockroach issue. i do not like bugs so it was not fun to deal with
dialogue: i just moved into my new house and i am having a cockroach problem.
that really sucks! what do you have to do?
i am just using raid right now, but i will call an exterminator tomorrow. i hate bugs so i am freaking out a little bit.
label: disgusted
response: i do too.  i am so sorry you are going through this

situation: i went to stomp in new york.the way they use normal things to make music is fascinating.
dialogue: when i was in new york, i got to see stomp. it was an amazing show.
wow. i had that dvd.
i used to watch it in music class a lot. i am fascinated by the way they make music with everyday items.
label: impressed
response: i know. i wonder if they still do that show

situation: my dad paid for the rent deposit on my new place, and i was going to pay him back. he only made me pay back half.
dialogue: i love my dad. he only made me pay half of the money i owed him and let me keep the rest for my pet deposit.
some dads are cool like that. my mom is that way sometimes.
i was shocked. i was fully prepared to pay the full thing. he is great.
label: surprised
response: i just went on a trip with my mom and sh paid for almost everything

situation: my bus broke down and i was late for work
dialogue: my bus broke down and i was late for work, again!
are you a busdriver?
no i ride a bus to work. this has happened twice in the past month. i need to get a car
label: annoyed
response: ah, gotcha. i hate it when things happen out of our control. hope you get it figured out

situation: my girlfriend broke up with me and got married to an investment banker. we were of the same age, so at the time i was still job hunting. when i saw them together, i felt really jealous of him and that he had my girl.
dialogue: hey there
hi what you got going on?
uhm. just feeling blue. my gf broke up with me recently and got married to an investment banker
label: jealous
response: that is really sad.  are you alright?

situation: i failed my exams in the last sitting
dialogue: i feel so bad that i failed my last semester exam
i am sorry.  will you be able to pass this semester/
i am doing my best to pass
label: disappointed
response: i am sure it will happen.

situation: next week i will be presenting my project
dialogue: i will be presenting my project to the company and am tensed about it
i am sure you will do well!
yes, i have prepared for two months now
label: anxious
response: i do not think you will need to worry then.

situation: my best friend missed my birth day
dialogue: my best friend had arranged for my birthday party, but she did not attend, i feel so bad
sorry to hear that. why did they not attend?
he was at work
label: angry
response: hopefully your friend can make it up to you and hang out with you some time soon.

situation: my parents went on vacation
dialogue: my parents went on vacation and i am left aloe in the house
ha, hope you are not too scarred about being all by yourself.
i am scared, especially at night
label: lonely
response: watching too many horror movies i bet. just put on some comedy special.

situation: there was a time where i was homeless for about a year, but i always held out hope that things would get better.
dialogue: man i am so glad i was able to climb out of poverty.
that is quite an accomplishment. you must have worked very hard.
i was homeless for about a year.  it felt like every day i would just descened even further.  but i always held out hope that things would get better.
label: hopeful
response: that must have been a very hard time. your persistence led you to this success because you never gave up that hope.

situation: i have saved up enough money to pay off all of my car payments in one fell swoop next month.
dialogue: i am so pleased with myself right now.  i saved up enough money to make all of my car payments at once next month.
that is very good. it takes a disciplined person to save money
heh, well i did not exactly save money that mush.  i just hunkered down and started working harder and asked for more hours.
label: prepared
response: you truely are determined to get that car, what brand is it?

situation: i have an exam next friday
dialogue: i am confident i am going to pass my exam
i hope you pass your exam. did you do good at your exam?
yes, i always read hard
label: confident
response: good luck

situation: i found my old elementary school a while ago.  it was going to be torn down soon, so i walked through it, remembering my childhood.
dialogue: man i had an absolute blast from the past last week.
really? what happened?
i found my old elementary school.  i hear it was going to be torn down next month, so i toured the inside.
label: nostalgic
response: wow, cool! did they let you in? it is so cool you had that opportunity.

situation: i went to a used car lot to check out a potential buy.  i was very non-plussed by what i saw.
dialogue: yeah i went to a used car lot yesterday to check out a car i saw on the internet.  not happy.
ick. i have never heard of anyone having a really good experience with that.
well i realzied that the owner had taken the pictures of the car from a large distance.  up close it was very disappointing.
label: disappointed
response: ah, i see. the classic photo trick. i understand why you would be upset about that. that is definitly why it is so important to go see before you buy

situation: one day my relation is road crossing to them accident.my family is very sad.
dialogue: hi
hi, tell me what is going on with you?
not going.hoe are u?
label: sad
response: oh, i am well thank you.

situation: i was trying to buy something at walmart, and this dude just starts criticizing what i am buying like i asked his opinion!
dialogue: man i am so cheesed off today!
oh really? any reason why?
yeah i was buying something in electronics and this guy shows up out of nowhere and starts criticizing my purchase!
label: annoyed
response: wow really? that is pretty rude and bad in general for an employee to be doing.

situation: man i did not expect to see a bear on the road today.
dialogue: you will never guess what i saw on the road today.
do tell
i saw a bear crossing the road a mile from my job.
label: surprised
response: that is neat! i have only seen ducks and chickens. a deer did bounce over my car once, though

situation: man i was so stoked to get my new paycheck
dialogue: man i was so stoked to check my bank account today
i guess it did not turn out well?
no man it was great.  i finally got my first paycheck after my rasie!
label: excited
response: oh.  sweet!  congrats!  what are you going to do with all that money??

situation: one day for the time i am and my family are going to vecgation. so very enjoy and so very very happy.
dialogue: hi
hello
how are you?
label: joyful
response: am doing well thanks and you?

situation: one day for that time my sister marriage to vey afraid.
dialogue: hi
hi
how are you?
label: afraid
response: fine. but, i think you are suppose to do the prompts, so hope it does not cause you a rejection.

situation: once upen a day my friend is meet to the road very happy and enjoy.
dialogue: hi
what have your experiences been like?
so nice my experience.
label: joyful
response: that is good to hear! hope that it continues that way.

situation: i had to pay with interest
dialogue: i feel angry i have to pay with an interest
oh i hate that. is it a high interest rate?
yes, it is exorbitant just to say
label: furious
response: it is highway robbery. well i can only hope you can pay it quickly to avoid as much of that as possible.

situation: one of my friends sent me a lot of money for my birthday right when i needed it.
dialogue: one of my friends sent me a lot of money for my birthday right when i needed it a lot.
you read
i do read a lot of articles.
label: grateful
response: that is great , sorry for the error and unrelated message previously sent but you do have great friend that are dependable

situation: there was one time in grade school when i went to the bathroom and the fire alarm went off.  i had a hard time buttoning up my pants and had no choice but to walk out with my class holding my pants together.
dialogue: there was one time when i was in grade school and the fire alarm went off when i was in the bathroom.  i had a hard time buttoning my pants up and had to walk out holding them together in front of my classmates.
oh my god, that must have been so embarrasing! was there actually a fire?
nope, it turned out to be a fire drill.  everyone was laughing at me.  it was not one of my prouder moments.
label: embarrassed
response: its okay, at least now you can look back at it as a funny moment.

situation: it is a matter of time until either the wi-fi will go off or the electricity will.
dialogue: i am sitting here and guessing when will the wi-fi stop working.
oh no, i hate having connectivity problems! are you having bad weather?
yep its raining cats and dogs in here.
label: anticipating
response: oh, it has been raining here a lot too. i will keep my fingers crossed that your wi-fi keeps working!

situation: i felt guilty my cell phone was going to die while working for lyft.
dialogue: is anyone here?
yes, i am here
yes, i had fully charged it and after like 6-7 rides it had 3% left.
label: guilty
response: oh no, i bet that was stressful. what did you do?

situation: is it bad to enjoy solitude, because i am enjoying it.
dialogue: recently i have been enjoying being by myself.
i like my alone time too. what do you enjoy doing by yourself?
i just love people watch, if that is considered alone time.
label: lonely
response: oh that is is fun. it is a way to be alone with your thoughts, but still be around others. i love to watch people!

situation: i am really content that i can live this lifestyle.
dialogue: when i wake up and know that i am doing the things that i like, i feel great.
yes i can related to that feeling
i do not think people realize iportance of that in their life.
label: grateful
response: well, a great morning leads to a great day

situation: i watched a horror movie yesterday
dialogue: i watched a horror movie and i feel terrified and anxious all the time
which movie did you watch?
lost
label: terrified
response: that is a very scary movie! how are you coping?

situation: i was very angry when i was fired from my job july 23rd.
dialogue: it was really hurtful
what was hurtful may i ask?
well, they made me leave everything at my desk, walked me downstairs, turn in my badge, and would mail my belonings.
label: angry
response: that sounds like very bad treatment, you should sue them

situation: i think that even when you feel down, its a great opportunity to go deeper into yourself.
dialogue: i feel very strange for not feeling any remorse about anything really.
maybe you have not done anything terribly wrong that anyone would feel remorseful about. do you think that is it?
i think it might just be a stage in life.
label: sad
response: maybe. it is none of my business but sometimes when people feel this way, they could be experiencing depression.

situation: i cannot really recall the last time i felt any kind of a remorse. and this makes me fell bad, or at least strange.
dialogue: is it terribleto always feel ok, and not wait for the bad times
i suppose it is.
than i will go on feeling this way i guess, or do i have another option?
label: ashamed
response: you always have options!

situation: i trusted my boss to look out for my best interests and she did not.
dialogue: she was actually always blind-sinding nice to my face and back-stabbing the other.
sounds like someone who is actually not a friend. how long have you known her?
i have known her less than a year.
label: trusting
response: i used to work with a girl like that. she always talked bad about me but was nice to my face.

situation: i know some things about this life, and have no doubts about it.
dialogue: do you ever feel that now you have finally grasped what life really is.
i cannot say that i really do. it is always a mystery in my mind.
or is the sign of overconfidence, like they say,  there are two types of bikes, those that were in an accident, and those that will be?
label: confident
response: i believe i see it more as that type. no one can truly know.

situation: i just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming.
dialogue: some markets have to be avoided, that is if you valued your sense of smell.
i know what you mean. wednesdays there is this market i like to go to, but lately it just has so much rotten food
yet there is still something about that imperfection, do you agree?
label: disgusted
response: totally. i still love to go have a look around

situation: the only thing that can bring you down is you.
dialogue: do not you think that the only one really capable of bringing you down, is you?
yes, it is partially true. what is the problem?
there are not any, i am just drawing a conclusion from past experience.
label: disappointed
response: i understand.

situation: i cannot take it when people are rude.
dialogue: sometime all it take is one rude person to ruin your day.
that is very true. did something bad happen to you?
nothing major, but i am still learning how to deal with such behavior and always open for an advice.
label: angry
response: generally just try to ignore it as best as you can. i am good about just letting things roll off my back.

situation: once when i went to shopping i mistakenly parked my car at a no parking place which i was not aware
dialogue: when i went for shopping i parked my car at a no parking zone which i am not aware , police approached the car and was about to tow it away
oh no! those can be difficult to spot sometimes.
yes exactly , but i also had my 4 6 month old 11 month old baby with me .
label: grateful
response: wow. that must have been stressful. i have babies, too. did they understand?

situation: ive been feeling really nervous for the past few days and i cannot quite tell why, nothing is specifically going wrong but on the other hand it feels like something is going wrong
dialogue: gosh i have been feeling so nervous for the past 24 hours, its almost like an impending sense of doom, to my knowledge theres nothing about to go wrong or blow up in my face but it feels like something is going badly
i get it. sometimes i feel stressed out for no real reason myself.

i ordered some semi expensive tablet yesterday so maybe its that but like, i cannot think of a logical reason why that would go wrong so i am left wondering why i feel so nervous, its really weird, very hard to relax like this
label: anxious
response: well sometimes companies make mistakes. i doubt it is anything you did.

situation: there are too many thing in life we take for granted.
dialogue: i have been recently thinking about the things we do not appreciate.
i think it is very common that we take things for granted.
is there anything that can change that?
label: grateful
response: i think you can really think about all that you have, and show your thanks that you have these things.

situation: i was feeling pretty much alone when i did not see my boyfriend for two days.
dialogue: yah, was depressing.
what was depressing?
well, just really did a lot of housework and felt we lost contact.
label: lonely
response: oh, that sounds like a bummer. do you think it will change?

situation: i remember there was a tv show on called hero's and it was awesome they had 2 seasons and i watched them religiously every week when new episodes came on and after season 2 they decided to cancel it and i never found out what happened to the characters that i was invested in and it made me so freaking mad
dialogue: have you ever watched this show it was really quite good?
what is the name of the show?
it was called hero's
label: angry
response: no, i ever did.

situation: i am currently waiting for my security deposit from my old apartment. it will help me pay for a washer and dryer for my new place.
dialogue: i am currently waiting to receive my security deposit back from my old apartment.
why hasn't it already been returned?
they said it takes up to 30 days, and it is only been a few weeks.
label: anticipating
response: if you live in america and they fail to return it in a timely manner, i hear you can go to small claims and get 3x the amount awarded to you

situation: i just ordered a really cool tablet yesterday! i cannot wait for it to arrive
dialogue: i ordered a surface pro yesterday! its gonna be so cool to play around with when it arrives
that is cool. i have always been a mac kind of girl, but i would look into a surface is i was in the market for a new computer.

i only ever wanted one cause they can do the same stuff a regular computer can but also touch screen so you can draw on it, i always got discouraged drawing on paper cause id waste so much of it, and then just stop
label: excited
response: i get that. i got a bamboo tablet a few years ago, but i feel like working directly on the screen would be even better.

situation: i felt a feeling of nostalgia when we shared a glass of wine together.
dialogue: it was such a sweet moment.
what was ?
spending time watching tv and sipping wine together.
label: nostalgic
response: oh that does sound nice
