oh, i hope you get some good news. i am sure it would help you getting aid for college.
yes, i think my stats are good. i am hopeful there will be some good news soon.
label: hopeful
response: all you can do is be patient and see what happens. i am sure everything will work out for you.

situation: going to a friend's wedding.
dialogue: my best friend is getting married next weekend. i am in the wedding.
that is awesome. i hope it works out for your friend and their fiancee. are you excited to be there?
super excited! these two have been together forever. it is about time they made it legit!
label: excited
response: well i am sure they appreciate you being a part of their big day. enjoy the after party!

situation: a friend had an art showing
dialogue: i went to a fancy art showing at a gallery last night.
wow, that sounds fun. what type of artwork did you see?
it was watercolors. my neighbor was the artist. i had no idea she did such great work. she also has two toddlers. i have no idea how she manages all of that.
label: impressed
response: gee, she must have her hands full! i hope she does well as an artist!

situation: my wife bench pressed a hundred fifty pounds at the gym.
dialogue: i thought i could lift, but my wife upstaged me by benching 150 lbs at the gym the other day. i can only lift 130 lbs.
did you feel very emasculated by this?
no, it actually turned me on. i did not know she was that strong.
label: impressed
response: yeah, i can see that viewpoint as well. she may end up carrying you to bed next time!

situation: child returned safely from camping trip
dialogue: my son came back from a camping trip last night. i was great to have him safely home again.
i am glad he returned home safe and sound. did he have fun on the camping trip?
he did. i am a worrier, but i need to learn to let go more.
label: grateful
response: my mom was the same way. it is all part of being a parent. i hope to have kids soon too and i worry about stuff concerning them myself!

situation: looking through wedding albums
dialogue: i came across my wedding albums the other day and showed them to my kids.
oh wow, i bet the emotions of that came back to you.
yes, it was so much fun to see the younger version of me and my husband, pre-kids. very sentimental.
label: nostalgic
response: yes, those memories are what make life so special.

situation: i got a car for my birthday.
dialogue: i got a car for my birthday, but i kinda knew i was going to get it beforehand because i kept telling my wife i wanted it.
so, not a surprise, but still nice to get?
yeah, kind of ruined the surprise, but i can always count on my wife to make me feel special.
label: anticipating
response: that is sweet.

situation: i donated $1,000 to the american society for the prevention of cruelty to animals.
dialogue: i donated $1,000 to the american society for the prevention of cruelty to animals. it is for a great cause that is very important to me.
wow, that is very admirable of you.  people who abuse animals are the worst kind of people.
i agree, we should protect and nurture animals, not abuse them.
label: caring
response: i have 2 dogs myself and i could never imagine hurting them.  i cannot believe there are people out there who think that that is ok. its sick.

situation: i miss my childhood and living with my parents
dialogue: i miss my childhood and living with my parents
yeah those were the days. when we had no worries in the world.
yes indeed.  i wish i had my treehouse back that my dad built for me.  i would live in it.
label: sentimental
response: that sounds really cool. i always wanted a treehouse but never had a good tree for it.

situation: i live next to a football field and every football season i hate living here.
dialogue: i live next to a football field and every football season i hate living here
oh yeah, why is that?
because they park in my driveway!
label: annoyed
response: i would have them towed!

situation: my husband treated me to a week at disney, i had no idea!
dialogue: my husband treated me to a week at disney, i had no idea!
that is awesome. which disney park did you go to?
disney world. it is the only one i have ever been to .
label: surprised
response: ooh i live pretty close to it. you have a great husband to give you that treat!

situation: i am pretty happy right now, i do not think i have ever been happier with my life.
dialogue: i am pretty happy right now, i do not think i have ever been happier with my life.
that is good that you found happiness. that is what were all in the pursuit of right?
exactly! i used to struggle but i do not anymore
label: content
response: you are blessed. make sure to spread the positive energy.

situation: my daughter went out of town.
dialogue: my daughter went out of town, but she promised me she would not do anything i would not approve of, and i believe her, so i let her go.
that is great that you can trust her.  how old?
yeah, she is a good kid and hasn't given me any reason to think otherwise. she just turned 18.
label: trusting
response: that is great. be thankful, some people are not so lucky.

situation: i saw something that looked really good in an ad, but when i went to the store to get it, it did not look as good.
dialogue: man i cannot believe i almost bought that thing at walmart!
what did you almost buy?
it was a combination rice-cooker and vegetable steamer.  it looked so good in the ad, but when i got there, it looked cheap and shabby!
label: annoyed
response: it is hard to find good quality at walmart

situation: i am trying to sell my house, i hope i can find a buyer
dialogue: i am trying to sell my house, i hope i can find a buyer
finding a buyer can be tough.  you have a good agent?
i hope i do.  we will see, i know it can take a while.\
label: hopeful
response: does it have a good location?  you know the only rule of real estate, right?  location, location, location.

situation: my job brought in an incompetent manager who made my life miserable. i could not stand him and avoided him at all costs. it aggravated me to come to work every day.
dialogue: i had to leave my last job because this manager they brought in was such an incompetent doofus.
that is never good when you have a bad manager.  what made them so bad?
he was the "marketing manager" but could not market his way out of a paper bag, it was impossible to work with him. plus he thought he knew everything which made it worse.
label: furious
response: know it alls are the worst.  hopefully you are in a better spot now, with a manager who cares.

situation: i am concerned about my father
dialogue: i am concerned about my father
oh no! what is wrong with your dad?
he is old, and he lives alone.  i just worry because he is getting old.  he gets on ok, but i do not know how much longer.
label: afraid
response: aw, i am so sorry to hear that. it is not easy to watch our parents age.

situation: my neighbor asked me to watch over his dog.
dialogue: my neighbor asked me to watch over his dog. i told him he could trust me, but he escaped and ran away.
that must have made you feel terrible. were you able to find the dog?
i feel so bad. i forgot to lock the gate. no, but i put up a lot of posters, so hopefully i find him before my neighbor comes back.
label: guilty
response: i sincerely hope you can find him! but i bet your neighbor will understand it was just a mistake and you did not do it on purpose.

situation: my neighbor would stay up all night playing. he'd be yelling into his headset at 4am when i was trying to sleep, it was infuriating.
dialogue: i used to have this obnoxious neighbor who stayed up all night playing league of legends, he drove me nuts screaming into his headset all hours of the day and night.
does not he understand that people have to go to work in the morning?
his parents paid his bills so no, he did not understand that sadly. i tried talking to him about it but clearly he did not get the picture as he kept doing it.
label: angry
response: you might have to file a noise complaint with the police.

situation: i have a new job offer, but i am not sure if i should take it.
dialogue: i have a new job offer, but i am not sure if i should take it
what is causing you to question whether it is the right thing for you or not?
well, it is retail.  i have done retail and it is not fun.
label: apprehensive
response: yeah, i have done that as well.  it can definitely be a hard job, considering dealing with the public, hours during holiday seasons, etc. but sometimes if the pay is good, it can outweigh some of the negatives.

situation: my cat taught himself how to use a human toilet. i do not know how, but it was pretty cool. i was in awe that he just figured it out without my intervention.
dialogue: so this one time i walked in on my cat using the toilet by himself. he just taught himself to do it, i had no idea how or why but it was pretty cool.
lol that remind me of a movie i saw with robert deniro , that is absolutly bizzare by the way but cool at the same time
i know which movie you are talking about! i think they actually had to train that cat to do it. mine just. learned.
label: impressed
response: wow , i would love to have a cat like yours

situation: i went to a concert by myself.
dialogue: i went to a concert by myself because all my friends were too busy doing other things.
aww that is too bad that no one else could go.  what concert was it?
it was a marilyn manson concert. i was even dancing by myself.
label: lonely
response: haha that must have been a crazy concert!

situation: my friend always seems to get great jobs and then just phones in her work. it is annoying because i got laid off a while ago and it was so hard for me to find another job, but she just hops from job to job with seemingly no effort.
dialogue: this friend of mine is constantly job hopping, i do not even know what she does technically but she seems to get good jobs so easily, whereas when i left my last job i could barely get interviews.
sometimes that depends on the industry. if she works in ones that have high turnover it is not a big of a deal as, say, an administrative job
she is in banking so there are definitely a lot of available jobs. and there seems to be a lot of turnover so you are probably right.
label: jealous
response: well, i am not entirely sure about the banking side but i wonder what she is looking for. perhaps a small vs big bank culture

situation: i am ready to start renovating the rest of my house.
dialogue: i am ready to start renovating the rest of my house.
ooo i love doing that, but not so much the upheaval in the midst of it.  what room are you going to be working on?
i finished my kitchen, so the next room is going to be my family room.  just painting it really.
label: prepared
response: still, a new color can definitely brighten up a space and make it feel all new!

situation: i was singing in the shower.
dialogue: this morning i woke up and i was in such a good mood that i just started singing in the shower.
that is awesome!  i wish i could wake up that way every morning.  did something specific make you feel that way?
i do not know, i think it was because i had a dream about marrying scarlett johansson.
label: joyful
response: ha!  well i have woken up from a dream and been mad at my husband because of something he did in my dream i guess it can go the other way too!

situation: i was going through my storage the other day and came across a bunch of things i wrote in elementary school. it made me miss being that little, when the world still had so much possibility.
dialogue: i went through my closet the other day and found all these old writings and drawings i did when i was in elementary school. it was fun remembering being that little, how different the world was.
i have done that before. i enjoyed it too! i love looking back at old pictures and stuff
did your parents save a lot of your school work like mine did? i am surprised how much my mom kept!
label: sentimental
response: some of it but my grandma did save a lot.  i plan on doing that with my kids

situation: last year for my birthday a coworker brought me a bottle of my favorite beer and some cheese. it sounds silly but it was so perfect for me, she really put some thought into it and i was not expecting it.
dialogue: for my birthday last year, a coworker gave me cheese. it sounds ridiculous but i was touched by her thoughtfulness. i love cheese!
i love cheese too! what kind of cheese was it?
smoked gouda, one of my favorites! i ate it all in a day haha
label: surprised
response: gouda is great! do you like prosciutto too?

situation: my foster cat had really bad teeth, i had to take her to the oral surgeon. they ended up taking out 13 teeth! poor thing had nothing left, i felt so bad for her.
dialogue: my cat had really bad breath so i took her in to the dentist. it turned out almost all of her teeth needed to be pulled, poor thing was in so much pain.
aww poor baby, hopefully shes doing fine now.
she is doing great, thanks! it was a tough recovery for a few days but then you could tell she felt so much better.
label: caring
response: that is great to hear. you have one tough cat.

situation: toys in mcdonald's happy meals.
dialogue: when i was a kid, i remember telling my mom to take me to mcdonald's, just so i could get the toy in my happy meal. i did not even care about the food.
ha, i used to do that too. but i was almost always disappointed by the toy once i actually got it.
right? but when you collected them all there was no greater feeling.
label: nostalgic
response: true! mcdonald's was my first job when i was 14 and i remember being stoked i could now collect all the toys even if i did not play with them!

situation: i had a job interview the other day. i was so nervous but excited at the same time!
dialogue: i am so nervous. i had a job interview the other day and have not heard back yet.
did they tell you when you may hear back from them?
they said within the week, i know it is only been a few days but i am excited about the opportunity!
label: anxious
response: i pray they get in touch with you soon and that is is an affirmative on the job!  i know  how nerve-wracking waiting can be though i hope you get it!

situation: i accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that i was frustrated with her attitude. i wanted to dig myself in a hole.
dialogue: unfortunately, i accidentally sent an email to a coworker essentially complaining about her attitude. i really wanted to dig myself in a hole and never come out.
argh! i so feel for you and have been there. have y'all had the chance to talk about it? (or do you even want to?)
i have kind of avoided her a bit. i am trying to come up with an apology that feels heartfelt. it is a horrible feeling!
label: embarrassed
response: i hear you. maybe humor might help? like "okay, so *this* is awkward..can we talk about that email?" heartfelt apologies go a long way, and even if she does not respond, you will feel better for trying.

situation: i went to a restaurant and the waitress put things on our bill that i did not order.
dialogue: i went to a restaurant and the waitress put things on our bill that i did not order.
are you sure they did not bring the wrong bill?
it had everything we ordered plus a couple things at the bottom we did not order.
label: annoyed
response: i would have complained.

situation: i do not have family to spend thanksgiving with. sometimes i will get together with friends but this is rare. i usually end up alone for the holiday.
dialogue: since most of my family is either dead or lives a few states away, i usually spend thanksgiving alone. it sucks sometimes.
ohh, i feel sorry for you
oh do not feel bad, i live a lovely life and have many friends. it is just that they usually go home to their own families that time of year.
label: lonely
response: ohh, that is bad. you can always skype your family!

situation: i spent the other weekend cleaning my apartment, it felt so good at the end of the day to sit back and watch tv in my nice, clean apartment.
dialogue: i spent the entire other weekend cleaning my apartment. it sucked at the time but it was so nice when i was done to just chill out and watch tv.
yes, i feel you. cleaning sucks, but after all that hard work, the results are amazing!
right? it is so rewarding when you are finished and everything smells good. i love that feeling.
label: content
response: me too! you seem just like me!

situation: my husband and i closed on our first house. i am thrilled for this new adventure!
dialogue: my husband and i closed on our first house last week!
that sounds very exciting! what kind of planning did you put into such an achievement?
it is! lots of blood, sweat and tears and lots of phone calls and signing things, haha. we cannot wait to move in!
label: excited
response: that is so cool! i wish you the very best and hope that the blood sweat and tears turns into happiness, joy and fun times!

situation: my daughter moved to california and a few months later she got in a car accident and was on the other side of the country so there was nothing i could immediately do.
dialogue: my daughter moved to california and a few months later she got in a car accident and was on the other side of the country so there was nothing i could immediately do.
are there any other family members out there that could help her?
no. she asked her friend to call me after it happened but was not able to tell me many details.
label: terrified
response: wow, i hope that she was able to work things out. not the best way to start living somewhere far from home, but i am sure she figured something out.

situation: my most recent job i was approached by the company i used to work for and they were trying to lure me back. i felt really good about it and was able to negotiate a great salary.
dialogue: recently i was contacted by my former company, begging to get me back. i felt really good about the salary negotiation since i knew they needed me.
that is great! i am happy for you!
thanks, i am happy about it. i only have to work a few hours a week, it is pretty amazing.
label: confident
response: yeah, and they are paying you good enough. you are a luckiest person!

situation: i was shocked to learn that i had been called to serve on a jury !
dialogue: i was shocked to learn that i had been called to serve on a jury !
i honestly have never gone to jury duty , but i am sure it was still a pain to put it on your schedule
yes i am not looking forward to it.  i have heard that its just awful.
label: surprised
response: same thing i heard too , really long and boring being there against your will

situation: my dog died this past december and i have had a really hard time getting over it. she was our family pet.
dialogue: my dog died this past december and i have had a really hard time getting over it. she was our family pet.

i am so sorry to hear that. i have been devastated by the loss of pets in the past, so i can understand what you are going through. i am sure she was very loved and had a great life with you and your family.
she really was a wonderful pet. we just got a puppy recently, which is the same breed as the one who passed away. she is bringing some light back into our lives.
label: sad
response: aww that is great! what breed?

situation: i have never felt so terrified the day i was 8 months pregnant and started bleeding. thankfully, baby and i are both okay!
dialogue: the worst day of my life was when i was 8 months pregnant with our first child and i started bleeding like crazy.
oh no! that sounds so scary. was everything ok?
yes, thankfully everything turned out fine. i had to spend 3 weeks in the hospital though!
label: terrified
response: good i am glad to hear that.  that is a long time.  hospitals scare me, i cannot imagine being there for that long

situation: my doggie recently passed away.
dialogue: my doggie recently passed away
i am so sorry to hear that! hopefully he or she was not in too much pain at the end.
no i do not think so, but it was violent.  she was run over by a car.
label: sad
response: oh my gosh that is horrible. i hope they caught the person who hit her!

situation: the other morning i got up and without looking, i stepped in warm cat puke on the floor. i was thoroughly grossed out.
dialogue: the other day i woke up and without looking i stepped in warm cat vomit.
oh man, that is gross! at least it was vomit and not something else.
yeah it was pretty gross but one of my cats is pretty pukey, i should have known better and watched where i was walking.
label: disgusted
response: how many cats do have?

situation: my dog died last year.
dialogue: my dog died last year.
aw, i am so sorry. how long did you have your dog for?
about 5 years. he was a rescue.
label: sad
response: they say dogs are mans best friend.

situation: the worst phone call i ever got in my life was when my dad was put in hospice. we were told he only had a few days left.
dialogue: the worst phone call i ever got in my life was when i was told my dad only had a few weeks left to live.
oh no. that is terrible. i lost my dad five years ago, i know how terrible that feels.
i am sorry to hear that. i am going on just over two years. never thought it would happen to us.
label: devastated
response: neither did we. he seemed so healthy, and then within weeks he was so sick he could not even talk. i miss him every day,

situation: the other day i got a gift card in my email i was not expecting from someone i had done some freelance work for. it caught me off guard but i was super happy!
dialogue: the other day i checked my email and a former client i did some freelance work had emailed me a gift card out of the blue! i was happy.
surprise gifts are always fun.
very! i decided since it was surprise money i would waste it on something fun.
label: surprised
response: that sounds like a well deserved plan.

situation: i remember my first time going to a theme park and riding a roller coaster.  i would been planning on the way not to ride on any but being there quickly changed my mind.
dialogue: i remember the first i went to a theme park.  i had been planning on the way there not to go on any roller coasters, but just being there changed my mind quickly.
oh man, i can relate, that feeling of anxiety before you get there really turns around when you get caught up in the moment
exactly.  i just saw how much fun it looked and i thought to myself i should just live a little.  it is not often you get to have experiences like that.
label: excited
response: life is full of experiences like that, they seem scary from the outside, but once you relax you get swept away

situation: i lost $100 cash somewhere.  i have looked everywhere and i cannot find it
dialogue: i lost $100 cash somewhere. i have looked everywhere and i cannot find it
that sounds prettty bad!
yes, i have retraced my steps and i cannot find it.  hopefully i will find it when i need it the most.
label: disappointed
response: i cannot imagine if something like that happens to me. i would be trying very hard to find it.

situation: i really hate when people let their kids run wild in public. i do believe kids should be kids but there is a time and place for it.
dialogue: i really hate when people let their kids run wild in public. i do believe kids should be kids but there is a time and place for it.
i agree completely it is an embarrassment to the parents you would think.
the worst is when they are screaming at them rather than just speaking to them calmly.
label: annoyed
response: the frustration they go through well at least we do not have to take the kids or parents home.

situation: i was so down when i found out that the sale for tissue was all gone.
dialogue: i wanted to go and get the tissue that was on sale was so bummed it was sold out.
what store were you at?
i was going to walgreen's and they was out and the sale began today.
label: disappointed
response: could you get a rain check? that is a bummer?

situation: my coworker went out and bought a birthday cake for me
dialogue: it was my birthday and felt like no one really cared
aw man, i am sorry to hear that. is there anything i can do to make you feel better?
thanks! my coworker went out on lunch break and bought my favorite ice cream cake!
label: grateful
response: ice cream cake is my favorite! i am glad you are feeling better haha. you have a really nice co-worker.

situation: i completely ate the last cupcake even though i know my husband will want one when he gets home. i feel terrible but it was so good.
dialogue: i completely ate the last cupcake even though i know my husband will want one when he gets home. should i go get some more?

oh, i know how that goes. my husband loves sweets, but if it is just sitting there and no one is eating it it will get eaten right then. getting another would depend on how much he likes sweets and needs them.
right! it is almost like, you knew this was going to happen. i feel terrible but it was so good. i will get him some more tomorrow!
label: guilty
response: that is probably what i would do also. it will not kill him to wait another day.

situation: the other day i was at the store and the woman ahead of me acted like an alien who had never seen a self checkout machine. i was not in a hurry or anything but it was obnoxious that she was holding everyone up.
dialogue: i was at the store the other day and the lady ahead of me had no idea how to use self checkout, i wish she would have used the regular line instead of holding everyone up.
oh i hate when that happens. we go to self checkout to avoid things like slow lines.
exactly! i was not in a hurry or anything but it felt so inconsiderate.
label: annoyed
response: hopefully the person learned what they had to do so they do not hold the line up in the future.

situation: when i was in high school there was a girl i had liked for a long time that ended up dating my best friend.
dialogue: when i was in high school there was a girl i had liked for a long time that ended up dating my best friend.
oh man, that must have hurt. did she know you had feelings for her?
yes. but at the time she was unavailable. then when she was not spoken for my "friend" asked her out.
label: jealous
response: sounds like your friend broke bro code, that was kind of scummy.

situation: i had mentioned to my friend that my computer was pretty much dead.  later i found he had sent me money to help me buy a new one.
dialogue: i had mentioned to my friend one day that my computer was pretty much on its way out.  some time later i found that he had sent me the money to buy a new one.
wow! what a nice friend. i wish my friends did that
yea i was really thankful and appreciative for it.  he is like a brother to me.
label: surprised
response: that is great. it is nice to have people so close to you. it really helps in bad times

situation: i was so ecstatic to see my daughter graduate from vpk.
dialogue: i cried so hard seeing my baby girl walk across the stage at her vpk graduation.
that must of been a proud moment for you as a father.  she is all grown up and out in the real world now
yes this is a new milestone and now she get's to see what real school is all about with all age groups.
label: proud
response: that is awesome, she will have a great time and learn a lot i am sure!

situation: i entered a raffle at a local fair and actually won $1000.
dialogue: i entered a raffle at a local fair and actually won $1000.
wow! what are you gonna do with the winnings?
oh they are long gone,lol. bills to pay and all.
label: surprised
response: bills do take up a lot, do not they.

situation: one time i moved into this new apartment, it was a converted loft in an old warehouse. on my first night, my soap dispenser in the kitchen malfunctioned and started squirting soap everywhere, the sound spooked me so bad!
dialogue: one time i moved into a new apartment, it was this big loft in a converted warehouse. i had this automatic soap dispenser that went nuts on me and made this really scary sound, i thought the place was haunted!
oh my gosh! that is funny.  was that the only thing that made you think it was haunted?
haha yeah it was pretty funny once i realized what the spooky sound coming from the kitchen was.
label: afraid
response: how did you discover exactly what it was?

situation: i was so worried about getting on the roller coaster at the fair but i could not let my family know it so i got on anyways.
dialogue: i have a fear for roller coaster but i let my siblings talk me into getting on one last night.
roller coasters are scary for me. how was it for you?
fun but scary i could not wait for it to end had my eyes closed most of the ride.
label: anxious
response: i am the same way haha. but how was it fun if you have your eyes closed the whole time?!

situation: a years ago i had to put my cat down. actually she was my mom's cat i inherited when my mom died. i would known the cat for her entire life, and for half of mine.
dialogue: i had to put my cat down a few years ago, she was old and in kidney failure.
i am so sorry to hear that. i am sure she was very happy while she was alive with you guys.
she had a good life. she was actually my mom's cat, she came to live with me when my mom died.
label: sad
response: you went through a lot of losses.

situation: i fell in the grocery store i felt my face turning red in front of all those people i was so ashamed.
dialogue: someone buggy was in the way at publix and i tripped and fell in the aisle.
that sounds painful, i hope you were okay after your fall.
i was ok just the look on m face let you know i was ashamed i turned red instantly.
label: embarrassed
response: yeah i bet that was really embarrassing, but i am glad you are okay.

situation: i applied for a job one time where i was one of 4 people being considered for it and had to wait a week to find out if i got it.
dialogue: i applied for a job one time where i was one of 4 people being considered for it and had to wait a week to find out if i got it.
oh boy!  that is always a nail biter waiting to hear back and it seems like they love to take the full amount of time before they let you know. did you get it?!
i did get it! if i was a praying kind of guy i would have done so every day. i was o nervous.
label: hopeful
response: amazing! congratulation! prayer is always a good thing to do! that is so incredible.  are you enjoying the job?

situation: i remember when i was younger waiting christmas day to unwrap presents.  there were a lot of things i wanted that year.
dialogue: i remember being younger and waiting on christmas day to unwrap presents.  there were a lot of things i wanted that year.
i remember those times. did you get what you wanted?
well i was really looking forward to the super nintendo.  it had just come out that year and everyone my age wanted one.
label: excited
response: the super nintendo is a classic. what is your favorite game?

situation: the other day i was riding my bike and totally wiped out when i was turning the corner. admittedly, i had a couple beers before i decided to go for a ride. i felt like an absolute dork.
dialogue: i fell off my bike the other day in front of a bunch of people. it was kind of humiliating.

oh no! i am so sorry!  i would feel the same way but you just have to think.who cares what others think!  if they cannot have compassion for an accident then something is wrong with them.  did you get hurt?
you are right, the other people probably hardly noticed. and no, thankfully i was ok! unless you count the bruise on my ego.
label: ashamed
response: i bet they did not.  i like to look at experiences as part of our journey and teaches us to have compassion for others in similar situations.  so glad you are alright! hope you own a helmet!

situation: one year we had a scary hurricane warning, but thankfully with plenty of time to get ready for it. so i got batteries, beer, non-perishable foods. i was totally ready!
dialogue: this one year right after i moved to the east coast we had this scary hurricane warning. i went ahead and stocked up on all the basics; batteries, canned goods, beer. i was set!
how'd the hurricane go?
would not you know it totally missed my city. i was a little let down to be honest, though glad we were safe.
label: prepared
response: thank goodness. hurricanes are no joke.

situation: i was going on a trip and could not take my dog so i had to board him and i was so worried about it.
dialogue: i was going on a trip and could not take my dog so i had to board him and i was so worried about it.
was he okay?
he was fine. i just did not know how he was going to handle it, he is a very nervous dog.
label: apprehensive
response: well maybe if you do it a little more then he will be fine with it. i would be afraid just because he is afraid.

situation: i have to stay on a set schedule so i have always arrange lunch for the week every sunday night for the week.
dialogue: i usually food prep for the week it is so much easier.
that is a great idea
yes it works out great saves me money and keeps my scheduled arranged and on track.
label: prepared
response: saving money is important

situation: my daughter graduated high school as a straight a student last year.
dialogue: my daughter graduated high school as a straight a student last year
that is amazing! you must be so proud.
oh i am. it is nice to know that i raised a child with a good head on her shoulders.
label: proud
response: she is also a hard worker.

situation: yesterday i did my monthly pilgrimage to the grocery store. my lyft driver helped unload my groceries (there were so many!) and offered to help carry them upstairs to my apartment.
dialogue: yesterday my lyft driver offered to carry my groceries up to my apartment. i thought that was super nice, there were a lot of bags.
that was very sweet they do not have to actually do that.
it was sweet. and i told him not to worry about it, i did not want to hold him up.
label: impressed
response: good to know there is still kind people in the world.

situation: i received flowers at work just because i was so astonished when the deliver guy brought them to my desk.
dialogue: i got some pink roses at work last week i was so happy.
that is awesome! who were they from?
my husband but i did not expect it i was so surprised they was a just because gift.
label: surprised
response: that was really sweet of him, maybe he just wanted you to know you are loved.

situation: i am going on a 17 hour road trip with my husband and 4 kids.
dialogue: i am about to leave on a 17 hour car trip with my husband, our four kids, and 2 dogs. i think i have everything ready to go though
you can never be too prepared! i am sure you have got everything.
i hope so. i even portioned out each meal for our dogs in little plastic bags to make sure we have enough.
label: prepared
response: that was very smart thinking on your part. have fun on your trip!

situation: i sent an email i should not have sent, and for about a week i obsessed over it. thankfully nothing came of it and all that worrying was for nothing.
dialogue: i sent an email i should not have sent. i would been drinking and totally should have saved it rather than sending it when i did.
we all do things we regret when drinking
true. the funny thing was i obsessed over it for days, worrying i made a mistake. and absolutely nothing happened! i worried for nothing.
label: anxious
response: that is usually how it goes

situation: i moved cross-country several years back. i was a bit scared to do it because i did not know many people but i am glad i took the risk.
dialogue: a few years ago i decided to move cross-country. it was kind of terrifying taking a huge leap like that with no job and hardly knowing anyone here.
you definitely took a leap of faith there. how'd it go?
it definitely has had its ups and downs but overall i am really glad i did it. i do not think i will be doing it again any time soon that is for sure.
label: apprehensive
response: hahaha i definitely admire your courage to have done that.

situation: i am going back to school this month and i always drop classes but i am positive to stay on track this time around to get my degree.
dialogue: i am going back to school i am going to stick to my goal and do not stop until i get my degree.
i wish you luck
thanks i am super excited i know i will have a great outcome i have goals to meet.
label: hopeful
response: i am sure you will meet them

situation: i did not have anyone to spend my birthday with last year. i was bummed my boyfriend did not want to hang out, it was not too fun.
dialogue: i spent my birthday last year alone. i expected my boyfriend to make plans but nope.
that is disappointing. what happened? did he just not do anything?
yeah, he acted like it was just a normal day, it was so weird. maybe i am getting too old to make a big deal out of birthdays anyway.
label: lonely
response: i would have been disappointed, too.

situation: i made plans to have a family cookout but it started storming i was so irritated.
dialogue: i get so annoyed when it rains i had plans for a family cookout but it started thundering and lightening such a bummer.
oh no that is a total bummer. it is especially common in the summer months.
yes it is the worse especially in florida it is sunny one day and pouring down raining the next.
label: annoyed
response: oh right, i spent some time in florida when i was younger and i remember it being so unpredictable. just gotta keep an umbrella all the time.

situation: my friend had a book published
dialogue: i went to a book release party yesterday.
cool. was it interesting?
yes. it was a good friend of mine. she got a novel published! she also has four small kids. i am not sure how she does it all.
label: impressed
response: good for her! moms get a lot done

situation: a good friend is moving away
dialogue: my best friend is moving across the country next week.
are you happy or sad?
sad. i will miss her terribly
label: sad
response: i bet. i she moving school or a job?

situation: i received a award at work for over exceeding and helping others i was very appreciative for being recognized for y hard work.
dialogue: my job recognized me for my hard work i was thankful and surprised i just love my job.
oh cool that is great! what were you doing that they recognised?
for over exceeding and helping all staff when in need, i am always just helpful but was happy to get noticed for my hard work.
label: grateful
response: awesome. what is your job?

situation: i randomly won a gift voucher for completing a survey
dialogue: i got a random email this morning with a $120 gift voucher
wow was it a scam or was it legit?
i was really sure it was a scam but it turned out it was a prize for a survey i had submitted a few weeks ago!
label: excited
response: that is so good congratulations you are lucky what are you going to use it for?

situation: falling up the stairs
dialogue: there was an "incident" at the gym today.
oh no, what happened?
i finished a fabulous workout, then promptly fell up the stairs on my way to the locker room. in front of everyone. i was mortified.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no! but that happens (it has happened to me several times). at least you had the great workout!

situation: getting a new job after being unemployed for a long while
dialogue: after four long, broke months of looking, i finally got offered a job today!
that is great. are you excited?
yes, and incredibly happy. i was getting really worried about the bills.
label: joyful
response: is it your dream job? then you should really be happy.

situation: won a gift voucher from a survey i completed online
dialogue: i had an email telling me i had a $120 gift voucher this morning
was it real?
haha that was my first thought too. it actually was!
label: surprised
response: that is awesome. what are you going to buy?

situation: the other day i was riding my bike on the sidewalk and accidentally knocked over a clothes display outside of a store. i did not go back to pick it up and felt bad all day.
dialogue: i knocked over a clothing display on the sidewalk outside of a boutique the other day when i was riding my bike. i should have gone back to pick it up but kept going.
i have done the same thing before. i am sure you were not a bother
i hope not. now that you mention it i am sure it happens all the time.
label: guilty
response: yeah and they really should be better about how they place their racks

situation: i remember i was waiting for a video game to come out. when it finally did and i got it, it was not as good as i thought it would be.
dialogue: i was waiting for a while for a video game to come out.  when it finally did it was not as great as i thought it was going to be.
that has happend to me too.
i got my hopes up too much. i should wait for reviews to come out before i rush out and buy next time.
label: disappointed
response: you can always sell them if you buy discs. cannot do anything with a download though

situation: the other day i put u2's achtung baby on spotify. that album reminds me of being young.
dialogue: the other day i was listening to spotify and put u2's achtung baby on. it reminds me of pre middle school days.
i used to love that band
yeah they were great back in the day. i cannot comment on their new stuff, i have not listened to any of it in years.
label: nostalgic
response: i have not either

situation: waiting for cable repairman who is late
dialogue: so the cable repair guy was supposed to show up between 8:30 and 12:30 on friday. guess when he showed up.
probably at 4 or 5!
you got it. 5:00. why does this still happen? i wasted the whole day waiting.
label: annoyed
response: no idea! i have not had cable in so long! i would hate that and they always over charge! do not they have a rule that theres no service fee if they are late?

situation: won a $120 gift certificate
dialogue: i got a random email telling me i had won a gift card
was it real because i get those every day
haha yeah it actually turned out to be real! it was for $120
label: excited
response: i could do so much with $120.  i am jealous

situation: having enough toilet paper in the house
dialogue: we had a near-disaster at our house today.
oh no! what happened?
my older son called from the bathroom that we were out of toilet paper. it seemed.um.urgent.fortunately, we had an emergency stash in the laundry room.
label: prepared
response: ah, crisis averted! that could have been a lot worse

situation: having a nice meal
dialogue: we went to our favorite italian restaurant for dinner tonight.
was it good? i hate when your favorite place disappoints.
it was good! it always is. i had my "usual" pasta and just enough wine to feel relaxed, but not loopy. it was a good way to end a sunday.
label: content
response: that is great. sundays are supposed to be breezy

situation: i needed a pen and a stranger gave me a nice silver one
dialogue: i did not have a pen while returning a rental car to an unattended location
hm, that sounds interesting. i am not really familiar with this kind of situation, since i have never had to rent a car. what exactly happened, or what did that mean?
yeah i was travelling in the us and they just had a drop box where you put the keys and a form in. luckily i asked a stranger who was passing by and they gave me a really nice pen to keep
label: grateful
response: oh, so it was no big deal? at least you cared enough to stop someone and ask them about it. no harm, no foul.

situation: recently i was in talks with my former company about coming back to work for them. the money and hours would be great, so i anticipated it would work out.
dialogue: i recently got an email from my old company hinting that they wanted me back. it was kind of exciting, i really wanted it to work out.
i bet that was a nice feeling
it definitely was. the money is great and i get to set my own hours!
label: hopeful
response: that sounds perfect

situation: going to the dentist
dialogue: i have a dentist appointment first thing tomorrow morning.
the dentist makes me a bit nervous
it makes me very nervous. i hate it. i will probably barely sleep tonight because of it.
label: anxious
response: well at least think about the fact that it is a good thing to go to the dentist!

situation: someone his my car in a parking lot
dialogue: i got back from vacation last week and found a huge dent in my car.
that is awful, did the person who hit it leave a note or a call back number?
no. they just hit it and left the airport parking lot. i am pretty incensed.
label: furious
response: you should ask the airport people if they have any security footage of the parking lot, maybe they can track down the car.

situation: someone cooks a fancy meal
dialogue: i went to the fanciest dinner party the other night. it was  eight amazing courses of food!
what kind of food was there?
really intricate things souffles and such. i was very impressed.
label: impressed
response: it is nice that you enjoyed it.

situation: seeing a mouse
dialogue: i saw a mouse run across my kitchen last night. i woke everyone up with my screaming.
oh man.  that would of startled me too.  what did you do after?
stood on the couch and screamed some more! i do not do rodents. i am having my son handle it. i think he is putting out traps tonight.
label: terrified
response: well i can understand your nervousness.  i probably would be on guard as well

situation: my cat that i had since she was a kitten passed away. she was only four years old. i was completely crushed.
dialogue: my kitty that i had since she was a kitten passed away. she was only four years old.
oh that is tough.  it is hard when our pets pass away.
it really is. she was the first pet that was really mine. she brought a lot of happiness to my life!
label: devastated
response: it is like losing a family member is not it.  well, just think of all the good times and be thankful.

situation: i had a test today and i am pretty sure i aced it. i studied all night for it!
dialogue: i had a test the other day and i am pretty sure i aced it. i studied for like a week!
that is great! i never really studied much so i could have done better on my tests
same here. i never had to study for high school but when i hit college, it was a wakeup call.
label: confident
response: oh yes. but, i found that getting involved in clubs along with a major i liked actually allowed me to spend less time studying and more time learning for fun. it is a subtle, but important diffeence

situation: all of my friends went on vacation last week and i could not go because of work. i was green with envy when i saw all the pictures.
dialogue: so all my friends went on vacation last week
judging by the, i am assuming you did not get to join them?
yeah, we were supposed to go but i could not get off work. i got to see all the pictures on facebook though, ha! so envious.
label: jealous
response: i would be envious too.  perhaps next time you can go somewhere and return the feeling :d

situation: i found a pizza joint in town that does a buffet.  needless to say i left satisfied.
dialogue: man i am stuffed.  i found a new pizza joint in town.
that is nice. do you like a lot pizza?
yeah i definitely like a lot of pizza.  this place had a all you can eat buffet.  i ate my fill of pizza!
label: content
response: you are lucky.

situation: i could not get any sleep last night.  something was scratching on my window.
dialogue: man i could not get any sleep last night.
were you worried about something? what was keeping you up?
there was something scratching on my window.  i was pretty nervous.
label: anxious
response: hopefully you had a lock on them, you can never be too safe.

situation: my boyfriend gifted me an ipad one year for our anniversary. i did not expect something so lavish at all.
dialogue: one year for our anniversary, an ipad showed up at my office. my boyfriend had ordered it and timed it so arrived on our exact anniversary. i did not expect it at all!
dang really! sounds like you have a boyfriend that likes to shower you with presents.
he is generous yeah but i would not call it "showering." he is just good about knowing what i need!
label: surprised
response: that means that he is always listening and paying attention to you!

situation: i used to take cold showers in the morning it made me feel good.
dialogue: i used to enjoy cold showers in the morining.
i have never tried a cold shower? what is it like?
it is very cold and refreshing, wakes you up instantly.
label: joyful
response: i bet it does wake you up right away. i guess i should try that sometime if i oversleep. !

situation: my neighbor keeps letting her dog poo and pee all over our parking lot and i am not sure how to get her to stop. it is really irritating.
dialogue: my neighbor refuses to clean up after her dog and it is infuriating.
wow that is very rude of her
it really is. i am not sure what to do though besides reporting her to the hoa. any suggestion?
label: angry
response: no i have never dealt with a rude person like that that lives near me

situation: sitting on a bench in a park used to be enough for me.
dialogue: what else do we need, just a sunny bench and some chips.
i totally agree. that actually sounds really good rihgt now.
so lets go, i will meet you outside in an hour.
label: content
response: sounds fun. i will be ready. hope were going to the beach that is closest to us!

situation: i really cannot wait for tomorrow.
dialogue: i am looking forward for tomorrow.
i will be expecting to see you there.
yes, tomorrow as well as today are such a nice places.
label: excited
response: having positive attitude always succeed. keep it up.

situation: i saw a girl with a craziest hair style yesterday
dialogue: i was walking around town yesterday and saw a girl with crazy hairstyle.
interesting.  what was the first thought that popped into your head when you witnessed this?
it was.dandelion.
label: impressed
response: is that a reference to the color of the hair, the shape or something else?

situation: i remember applying for my job in the government.  i felt pretty good about it!
dialogue: man i felt good when i applied for my job!
how did it go? that is an anxiety-inducing but hopeful situation!
no i was very assured in my interview.  i got the job, probably because of my attitude.
label: confident
response: congratulations! enjoy the new gig! good things happen to good people.

situation: i pulled out my high school yearbooks the other day, it really does not feel like 20 years have passed. it made me kind of miss those days, although i am glad i am not a teenager any more!
dialogue: i flipped through my high school yearbooks the other day for the first time in a long time. i cannot believe how much time has passed.
time does fly really fast. i just turned 30 and it feels like i was just a teenager yesterday!
enjoy it, your 30s go by really fast. i am clinging desperately to the last few years of mine myself.
label: nostalgic
response: i am sure it will. at least it gets us to enjoy life more and focus on the moment.

situation: i have met a girl whom i have not seen for ages in a big town once, by a complete accident.
dialogue: it is very strange when you meet somebody you know, in the middle of a megalopolis.
yeah, it is like a small world.
exactly, how does it even work?
label: surprised
response: i think it is merely a coincidence.

situation: in the past the smallest things would make shed tears.
dialogue: small thing in life used to make me shed tears.
indeed they can. is there any specific moment that you would like to talk about?
yes, things like great classical music for example.
label: sentimental
response: oh, i see. i thought that some other bad things happening in your personal life are making you cry

situation: watching all the stuff that is going on in the world, i still believe in a bright future.
dialogue: we have to stay positive through all the things that happen in the world.
i completely agree. we must have positive thoughts at all times.
yes, that is a good start.
label: faithful
response: our thoughts are were everything starts. mindset is so important.

situation: someone my husband used to work with got a promotion and a big raise.
dialogue: someone my husband used to work with got a promotion and a really big raise.
that is awesome!  what do they do?
they work in the oil field. my husband left the company they both worked for and i cannot help but think if he still worked their he would have gotten a raise too.
label: jealous
response: that would be nice, but it is never good to dwell on things like that instead of looking toward the future.

situation: last week, i got pulled over for speeding. i was in a hurry to get to work.
dialogue: last week driving to work, i got pulled over for speeding.
that sucks. how fast were you driving?
only a couple miles over. it is always a terrible thing to see those lights in your mirror.
label: afraid
response: i hate getting pulled over too. especailly for something silly like being a couple of miles an hour over the speed limit

situation: i have not drank beer in almost a year.
dialogue: i have not drank beer in almost a year, but yesterday i relapsed. i feel like such a loser.
oh man, i am so sorry to hear that. you are not a loser though! just take one day at a time. if you relapsed yesterday just move on and do your best not to drink today and tomorrow
i just cannot believe i gave in to the pressure. oh well, yeah your right. i will start by taking baby steps.
label: ashamed
response: do not be so hard on yourself. we are all humans, we make mistakes.

situation: my neighbor next door is remodeling his house. i would not mind but he starts at 5:30 in the morning.
dialogue: my neighbor is remodeling his house, which i hate, because they start at 5:30 in the morning.
that is probably so annoying
i have a 3 year old, so he wakes up at 5:30 because of all the hammering going on.
label: annoyed
response: that really sucks. how long will it be going on?

situation: my wife told me she is pregnant.
dialogue: my wife told me she is pregnant the other day. i was baffled by the news because the doctor told us she only had a ten percent chance of having a baby.
wow.  that is either really lucky or unlucky, depending on what you want.  are you wanting kids?
yeah, it just came at an unexpected time. i really want a little boy.
label: surprised
response: well, then congratulations!  i wish you the best of luck, and enjoy this time!

situation: i went to see a movie last night. a couple two rows in front of me would not stop talking. it was incredibly annoying.
dialogue: i went to see a movie last night. i was not really able to enjoy it though.
why not?
there was this couple sitting two rows in front of me. they just would not shut up.
label: annoyed
response: oh man! that is why i watch movies at home. it is just more comfortable.

situation: i saw a psychiatrist.
dialogue: i saw a psychiatrist for the first time yesterday. it was alright, but i have to admit i was a bit skeptical at first.
i have considered it myself but feel the same as you. will you go back again?
i might. it just makes me a little uneasy having to share personal information with a total stranger.
label: apprehensive
response: right, i feel you but maybe it will be good to get it all out!

situation: my mom called about a year ago to let me know she had cancer
dialogue: my mom called me about a year ago and told me she had cancer.
is she doing okay now?
yes, she had a really difficult 6 months and then things started improving.
label: devastated
response: great, i am very glad to hear she is getting better!

situation: i was well prepared for my interview
dialogue: i was very pleased to get this job
what is the job?
i got the job has an software analysis and that was aim
label: prepared
response: well congrats then, i am sure that is not easy

situation: i was trying to finish a work project but the server went down!
dialogue: i was so angry, i threw a bottle of water!
what caused that to happen?
a server went down and i did not get paid for my work
label: annoyed
response: oh gosh, hopefully it does not happen next time

situation: i felt nostalgic looking through old photos today
dialogue: i felt nostalgic looking through old photos today
what were the photos of?
just old family photos
label: sentimental
response: it is good to have those and look at once in awhile

situation: my wife and i recently got divorced. it is strange her and the kids not being around the house.
dialogue: a couple months ago, my wife and i got divorced.
i am sorry to hear that, what happened?
we just grew apart i guess. house seems so empty with her and the kids gone.
label: lonely
response: did you try therapy at all or counseling?

situation: i am losing my home
dialogue: we cannot afford to live in our home anymore
why is that?
we are poor, and bills are adding up
label: devastated
response: i am sorry to hear that, i hope things improve for you a ton!

situation: i am moving, but i have done all my research!
dialogue: boy, it is been a lot of owrk
sometimes we believe is the things that happen to us . they are many
what sort of things?
label: prepared
response: i interpret the difficulties

situation: last year, my father passed away. he was my best friend.
dialogue: last year, my father passed away.
oh goodness, i am so sorry to hear that. was it sudden?
yeah, he developed a stage 4 glioma in his brain that could not be removed.
label: lonely
response: that is awful and very sorry you had to go through that. i work at a cancer hospital so i cannot imagine going through that with a loved one.

situation: i feel nostalgic going through old boxes in my basement
dialogue: i feel nostalgic going through old boxes in my basement
what kind of stuff is in there?
just old sports uniforms and toys and stuff like that
label: sentimental
response: oh okay, i love going through my old stuff too, it is really fun

situation: i have plans so go to the beach with my wife for a week next month.
dialogue: i have plans so go to the beach with my wife for a week next month
that sounds so fun!
i cannot wait! we have been looking forward to going back since our honeymoon.
label: excited
response: i hope you both have tons of fun!

situation: i am happy to be alive!
dialogue: i am so glad my health is good
that is great! i am glad to hear that. we often take our health for granted.
we do, and do not do enough to take care of it
label: joyful
response: i am one of those people. eat junk food even though i know it is not good for me

situation: i made a mistake at work. it was something simple that i overlooked, and it embarrassed me in front of my coworkers.
dialogue: oh man. i cannot believe i made that mistake at work today.
uh oh what happened
i was giving a presentation on the project that i am working on, and i overlooked something simple. one of my coworkers called me out on it. how embarrassing.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no, well mistakes do happen, it will be behind you in a few days

situation: i feel a sense of the "good ole days" when i see something old
dialogue: i love to see old stuff from when i was a kid
oh yeah? what kind of old stuff?
old metal lunch boxes like charlies angels speed buggy ect
label: nostalgic
response: i always liked those old lunch boxes myself. do you have a favorite?

situation: i am super excited to move
dialogue: it is time to move!
oh, ok!  where are you moving to?
another house, it is closer to school
label: excited
response: that is good!  that will make your life much easier!  congratulations!

situation: i am about to ask someone that i like out on a date. i am pretty confident that she will say yes.
dialogue: so there is a girl that i have been talking to lately. i am thinking about asking her out.
that is exciting. do you have a plan for a date for when she says yes?
yeah, i already have it all planned out. we get along really well, so i am sure she is going to say yes.
label: confident
response: what all is on the agenda for the date?

situation: i finally finished writing the book that i have been working on. i am proud of my work and cannot wait to get it published.
dialogue: i have finally finished writing the book that i have been working on for the last few months.
great. are you going to get it published?
definitely! i am pretty happy with this one, cannot wait to get it published.
label: proud
response: what is the book about?

situation: i just pulled a container out of the fridge that has been in there for months. when i opened it, i was disgusted at what i found.
dialogue: oh man. i was cleaning out my fridge, and found something unpleasant.
oh no that is the worst! did you clean it up?
well i threw it out. it was some unidentifiable stuff in a plastic container. it had been in there for months, i think.
label: disgusted
response: you shoudl write the date on stuff to prevent that from happening again

situation: my daughter fell and hurt herself
dialogue: my little one got injured
oh no! what happened?
she fell off a kitchen stool
label: caring
response: ouch. i hope she is okay.

situation: i finally have all of my housework done for the day. now i can just sit back and relax.
dialogue: whew. i had a lot of housework to get done, but it is finally finished.
thats good, its always a good feeling after
yeah, i am pretty happy. now i can just sit back and relax.
label: content
response: thats the way to do it

situation: i was delighted with how well my nephew did at his little league game
dialogue: i was delighted with how well my nephew did at his little league game
did his team win?
yes
label: proud
response: that is great news! i bet you are so proud.

situation: my bra is driving me nuts
dialogue: my clothing is making me crazy
oh no!  why are they driving you crazy?
they are totally itchy
label: annoyed
response: that is no good!  i guess it is time for you to go shopping!

situation: i admired the way my nieghbors helped each other out after a storm
dialogue: i admired the way my nieghbors helped each other out after a storm
storms are the worst and destroy so much.
they are horrible, luckily this one was not deadly or too destructive
label: impressed
response: my family went through a big storm a few years ago.

situation: i have received news that my brother has died. i am beyond devastated.
dialogue: i got a terrible phone call yesterday.
what happened on the phone call?
i found out that my brother died.
label: devastated
response: i am so sorry about that.

situation: my cat keeps attacking my foot. it was funny at first, now it is just annoying.
dialogue: ugh, my cat keeps attacking my foot.
has it made any scratch marks?
nah, he just keeps running up, grabbing and biting, then running away. it was cute and funny at first, now it is just irritating.
label: annoyed
response: have you tried disciplining him in anyway

situation: it is frustrating waiting on hold to speak to a human
dialogue: it is frustrating waiting on hold to speak to a human
yea, i hate calling att or verizon they take forever to get on the phone.
it is so annoying!
label: annoyed
response: i think as we get smarter, it will get better.

situation: recently on my birthday, i did not expect to receive any gifts from my fiance since he is been pretty broke. he ended up getting me a bouquet of flowers and taking me out to dinner, which i was not expecting at all.
dialogue: i did not expect to get anything for my birthday from my fiance since he is been broke, but he gave me a bouquet of flowers and took me out to eat still!
wow!  sounds like a keeper right there!  that must have been a nice surprise for you!
it really was! he had to scrimp and save, but it was worth it for both of us in the end
label: surprised
response: it is always nice when someone gets their priorities right!

situation: my dog got hit by a car. unfortunately he did not make it.
dialogue: so. my dog got hit by a car last night.
oh no!  that is horrible!  is he ok?
no, unfortunately he did not make it.
label: sad
response: that is really sad!  i hope it was quick and painless.  i hate seeing anything suffer!

situation: i let my son borrow the keys to my car. most people would be worried, but i trust him.
dialogue: my son asked to borrow the keys to my car this morning.
did you let him borrow it?
yeah. i know most people would be worried about doing something like that, but. i trust him not to do anything stupid.
label: trusting
response: that is good to hear. i assume everything went ok?

situation: my daughter asked to borrow my car. i am not sure it is a good idea.
dialogue: my daughter asked to borrow my car to go out tonight.
did you say yes?
i have not given an answer yet. i am just not sure if it is a wise idea or not.
label: apprehensive
response: where does she plan to go?

situation: i miss the days when i did not have financial worries
dialogue: boy, it was nice when i was not so poor
money problems are never fun. trust me, i know.
i am sorry to hear that it'd be nice if work paid better
label: sentimental
response: yeah, definitely. have you tried asking for a raise?

situation: i was sad when i had to put my dog down last month.
dialogue: i was sad when i had to put my dog down last month
oh no, i am so so sorry. i have always had at least one pet throughout my life, and they are truly part of the family.
they are very much family. i cannot believe we get so attached.
label: sad
response: yes, they are honestly more dear to me than my friends. i hope you are doing okay i am sure your dog was very loved and had a wonderful life, so try to take comfort in that.

situation: i was promoted to district manager at my work, due to work ethic and increasing sales.
dialogue: i was recently promoted at my job. i did not expect it to happen, but i got it through hard work so i am pretty excited about it!
that is great! doing what?
thank you! i am now a district manager for a local chain of businesses. it is not my favorite thing to do, but the raise is great!
label: proud
response: i bet that is nice and probably has good benefits!

situation: i packed for a long road trip, and had everything i would need to hopefully avoid excessive stops.
dialogue: i recently went on a long road trip. i was not too worried, though, because i packed everything i needed to make it as stress-free as possible. '
i can never go on long trips.
why not? they used to bother me, but i am finding that as i get older, they are not so bad.
label: prepared
response: i can no longer afford them, long trips cost the most.

situation: i kept laughing at myself for falling down
dialogue: i kept laughing at myself for falling down
oh no!. are you ok? must not have been a bad one if you were laughing?
not bad but it was funny because i slipped on a banana peel!
label: embarrassed
response: how ironic. i kind of wish i were there to see it.

situation: got a new kilt and i look amazing in it.
dialogue: i compete in the highland games around the country. i just got a new kilt and i look amazing.
i am bad at every game.
it is a little different. it is based in picking up and throwing objects like logs, hammers that weight 70 pounds and stones that weight 70 pounds. being scottish it keeps me feeling at home.
label: confident
response: i still could not do that, i am very weak human person.

situation: i just hired a new office manager to take some stress off of me. i am worried but i want to trust her.
dialogue: i have been very stressed out at work. i had it in my budget so i hired a new office manager. i am having issues trusting her.
do what i did, quit the job and live at home with mom.
i wish. my mom kicked me out at 14 and i have only seen her a handful of times since over the last 20 years.
label: trusting
response: i still thing living with a relative is the cheapest way to go.

situation: i still have another 75k on my student loans to go before i can afford grad school.
dialogue: i just pulled up my student loan bill. i have been out of school 10 years and still owe 75k.
that is awful! luckily i paid all mine off, but i know many people still struggle with it
it started off at 150k so i have paid a lot but it is still crazy. make me think i would have been better off to just go work construction or something instead of college.
label: sad
response: yea.the education costs are atrocious and, honestly, not even worth it on my opinion. it is just the piece of paper. the material you learn from them can be learned online for free or nearly so

situation: my boss kept giving me more work to do without increasing my pay. he told me he could not afford to, when i knew for a fact he could.
dialogue: my boss is piling on the work but keeping my pay the same. he claims he cannot afford to pay me more, but i know that is not true.
typical of most companies.  ask employees to do more and pay less.
yep, it is so frustrating. i am ready to shake up the system but i feel limited in what i can do, besides quit.
label: furious
response: what kind of job do you have?

situation: my pants fell down in public
dialogue: i am so shocked, my pants fell down in public
i am sorry, did anyone see?
i am hoping not, but it is possible
label: embarrassed
response: i hope you would wear a belt next time.

situation: i have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
dialogue: my best friend has the best job ever. she is paid to travel the world full time and write blogs on different locations.
that sounds like a blast.  compared to my job.
yes, i know. ever day i drive an hour to the same place that is slowly killing me inside and she is jetting off to explore.
label: jealous
response: i am sorry.  i like my job but its certainly not like hers!

situation: just did my budget. it is going to be a rough two weeks. maybe i will loose some weight.
dialogue: just finished my budget for the week. woowa, i am in trouble it is going to be a rice and beans week.
lol.  be careful. that is a ton of carbs.
it is better then the alternative. one good meal then water and ketchup soup the rest of the week.
label: disappointed
response: eww

situation: for my birthday, my family and fiance went out of their way to make sure i got everything i wanted and had a great day. i am very thankful for them.
dialogue: i just had my birthday, and my family and fiance did everything they could to make it special. i do not have much, but i am thankful to have them at least.
happy birthday!
thank you! i hope your birthday, whenever it is, is awesome as well!
label: grateful
response: what all did they do for you?

situation: i was proud when my dog learned to sit.
dialogue: i was proud when my dog learned to sit.
how long did it take for you to teach you dog that?
a few days. he was so happy!
label: proud
response: i thought i would take longer, like months!

situation: this week my work offered to let me work an extra day. i thought great overtime. nope they plan to send me home every other day to even it out.
dialogue: this week my work offered to let me work an extra day. i thought great overtime. nope they plan to send me home every other day to even it out
oh no. maybe you can get some things done around the house.
yea like working on my resume and netflix.
label: disappointed
response: lol, that sounds like a plan. working two jobs is hard.

situation: i am pleased with my dinner
dialogue: i am so happy i ate good food
yummy. what did you eat?  i am hungry.
i had chicken, asparagus, and a portobello mushroom
label: content
response: that sounds so good.  like i love that stuff.

situation: i am grateful that my family is healthy
dialogue: i"m so happy that no one in my family is sick
i am glad no one in your family is sick.
thank you! i hope no one in yours is either
label: grateful
response: thank goodness my family is healthy too.

situation: i went for a job interview. i got the job offer but they offered me less money then i all ready make.
dialogue: went for a job interview. i got the job offer but they offered me less money then i all ready make for more work.
but do they give raises more frequently and do they have better benefits. it may be worth it still,
not for the first few years. the title would be a move up in status but the pay is about a 20% downgrade. i cannot take that loss.
label: disappointed
response: benefits are worth a lot more than you think sometimes

situation: i cannot wait to go to dinner tomorrow
dialogue: i am so excited to go out to dinner tomorrow!
is there a special reason?
no, we just will not be home so we have to eat out
label: anticipating
response: going anywhere good?

situation: i am been loosing weight january. i am down 50 pounds. i have 10 more to go but i am happy.
dialogue: i am been loosing weight january. i am down 50 pounds. i have 10 more to go but i am happy.
that is great. how have you done it?
i have always walked a lot at work. i average 10 miles a day so kept doing that but i cut out all processed food and drinks.
label: content
response: that is a lot of walking. i can hardly walk 1 mile.

situation: my wife went on a trip for a week to see her family but i had to work so i had to stay home alone.
dialogue: my wife went on a trip for a week to see her family but i had to work so i had to stay home alone.
i have never been on a trip before.
i wish i could have went on this one but i could not. it ended up bein a long week by myself.
label: lonely
response: i have long weeks every single day.

situation: i have applied for several new jobs, and i am hoping at least one of them ends up working out for me.
dialogue: my current job is not working out, so i have applied to several others.
i would just quit and live off the government.
haha, i would if i could! sounds a like much more laidback way to live.
label: hopeful
response: everyone can! just gotta try.

situation: i found a new stray dog eating out the dumpster last thursday. today i officially adopted her.
dialogue: i found a new stray dog eating out the dumpster last thursday. today i officially adopted her.
how sweet and thoughtful of you
i already love her. this is the second stray i have found eating out the same dumpster. they are now sisters.
label: caring
response: you seem to be a very compassionate person, very kindhearted.

situation: about 6 years ago i was diagnosed with cancer.
dialogue: about 6 years ago i was diagnosed with cancer.
ohh, i so sorry.
thank you, it was a very scary situation to be in.
label: afraid
response: hope you are doing better. i will pray for you.

situation: i should be eating healthier and working out, but instead i have been doing the opposite.
dialogue: i have been trying to eat healthier and work out more, but so far i have only been somewhat successful.
forget that! eat pizza and enjoy life.
oh i definitely do both of those things as much as i can. pizza = perfection
label: guilty
response: i agree, i eat what i want when i want all the time.

situation: i am scared to move
dialogue: i am so scared to move to a new home
you have to have fun!
how can i do that?
label: afraid
response: get drunk and go out!

situation: just got home from the grocery store. forgot my wallet at home. got to check out and had to apologize to the cashier and leave with out anything.
dialogue: just got home from the grocery store. forgot my wallet at home. got to check out and had to apologize to the cashier and leave with out anything.
i never go to the store anymore, i wish i did.
why not? dollar store has something for everyone.
label: annoyed
response: not for me, i shop online mostly these days.

situation: a few months ago i started a new job, and i was extremely nervous about it.
dialogue: i am about to start a new job, and i am really nervous about it.
just go for it! never look back!
okay, i will take your advice! wish me luck!
label: apprehensive
response: best of luck my friend, you can do anything.

situation: i get so mad when i watch shows about animal shelters and see how many people abuse animals.
dialogue: i get so mad when i watch shows about animal shelters and see how many people abuse animals.
i own an animal shelter here in my home town.
it must be so hard to deal with emotionally at times. just watching a show makes me want to lash out.
label: disgusted
response: i try to pass that onto my top doctors to take care of the dogs.

situation: my daughter aced the gre
dialogue: my daughter killed the gre!
that is great! i hope she goes to a good graduate school.
thank you! me too
label: impressed
response: i am very happy for you!

situation: i am devastated by my mother's death
dialogue: i am devastated by my mother's death
i am so sorry to hear that she has passed.  how long has she been gone?
21 years, but i miss her every single day
label: devastated
response: i know how you feel.

situation: a friend of mine bought a lottery ticket right after i bought one. mine was a loser, his was a $15,000 winning scratch off.
dialogue: i have no luck when it comes to lottery tickets, i constantly buy losers.
i have that same problem!
a friend of mine bought one right after i did one day, mine was a loser, his was a $15,000 winner.
label: jealous
response: holy goodness!! i would be a bit jealous

situation: a friend of mine was in a car accident.  unfortunately, he did not make it
dialogue: a friend of mine was in a car accident
is your friend ok? what kind of car was it?
he was driving a compact and a truck hit him.  he did not make it unfortunately
label: sad
response: that is horrible news, i am so sorry for your loss.

situation: a co-worker mentioned that we were going to have a lot of work coming up.  i hope it is not too bad
dialogue: a co-worker told me we were going to have a lot of work coming up
is that good or bad?  sometimes extra work can be a blessing, unless you are salaried, then it is just more work.
bad if anything, i just hope it is not overwhelming
label: apprehensive
response: i hope so too.  what kind of work is it?

situation: my father recently passed suddenly, i was devastated.
dialogue: my father recently passed suddenly, i was devastated
oh, i am sorry for your loss
thank you. i am having trouble getting over it.
label: sad
response: do not feel bad now. what is done is done

situation: there was a bad crash this morning and i got so irritated it had me late for work.
dialogue: there was a 2 car accident this morning a driver going the wrong way it had traffic backed up.
oh no! was anyone hurt?
yes one driver was in critical condition and car ran into the side of the express way it was unfortunate but i was over a hour late for work.
label: annoyed
response: that is so sad. i hope they recover okay. hopefully you were not in trouble for being late either.

situation: i am excited to see my son and his fiance!
dialogue: i am excited to see my son and his fiance!
that is awesome, are they coming to visit you?
yes! in october. i have not seen him in a few months.
label: anticipating
response: awesome! i am not a father yet, but i can only imagine your kids growing up and leaving to live their own lives.

situation: i did not ask my husband if i could buy something, now he is mad and i feel bad.
dialogue: i did not ask my husband if i could buy something, now he is mad and i feel bad.
aw, i am sorry, did you just forget or you were thinking about other things?
i did not think he would mind.  but it was expensive, so maybe i should have asked.
label: ashamed
response: yeah, had a similar scuffle with my wife, but being married sometimes you just have to forgive and forget.
