label: caring
response: guilt can be a terrible thing to live with.

situation: my friend and coworker hasn't been showing up to work.  i try sticking up for him but its getting hard with him coming in once or twice a week.
dialogue: my friend and coworker hasn't been coming into work.  people are starting to talk but its hard to stick up for him when he only comes in once or twice a week.
is he sick or just being lazy?
a little bit of both.  he has bad anxiety but he also has told me he just does not like going into work.
label: disappointed
response: i hope he can get the help he needs and maybe a job he enjoys more.

situation: one time during kindergarten, i really needed to go to the restroom. the teacher did not let me so i soiled myself
dialogue: one time during kindergarten, i peed myself because the teacher did not let me go to the restroom
oh, well that is awful on a little person! i never liked it when a teacher did that when a child needed to go to the bathroom!
thanks! luckily i am potty trained now!
label: ashamed
response: lol, well, that is good to know. so am i!

situation: i was impressed today at a patients sugar. as a non compliant diabetic her sugars were actually good today.
dialogue: one of my well knows patients that has horrible diabetes came in today for a follow up.
is your patient improving an following good medical advice?

yes. after 3 years of working with her she finally started to take her medication as prescribed as well as watch her carb and sugar intake. i checked her blood sugar today and to my suprise it was normal!
label: impressed
response: that would be a surprise.  a lot of people are not dedicated enough to change their condition, especially those with diabetes.

situation: the first time my girlfriend slept over i farted on her leg while we were sleeping.  she knew it happened but did not say anything.  she does not know i know.
dialogue: the first time my girlfriend slept over i farted on her leg in the middle of the night.  she knew it happened but did not say anything.  she also does not know that i know.
thats. uh. strange?
it was embarrassing but i think that she stayed with me is after is a good sign!
label: embarrassed
response: i think so, you are two peas in a pod.

situation: i am trying to get some work done and my dog just wants to play!  i love him to death but he needs to be independent at times too!
dialogue: i am trying to get some work done and my dog just wants to play!  i love him to death but he needs to learn to be independent at times too!
pets are great, but they can be a bit needy for attention at times. it is great, but not when you are busy and trying to get things done.
that is very true.  after our first conversation i might have to take a break and play with him a bit.  i might have to log off and go on a sort walk to tire him out.
label: annoyed
response: a walk will definitely help. he will probably be ready for a nap when you get back, then you can get some work done.

situation: one time when i was letting my cat outside, it ran out into the streets and got ran over.
dialogue: one time when i was letting my cat outside, it ran out into the streets and got ran over
oh my god! that is terrible!
then i woke up, it was all a dream.
label: sad
response: oh that is so great!

situation: my son just won first place at his championship swim meet
dialogue: my son just won first place at his championship swim meet!
that is amazing!  congratulations!  swimming can be tough
thank you! he takes to it like a fish in water. haha!
label: proud
response: lol i bet you use that line all the time!  i love it

situation: one time when using the public restroom, i had toilet paper handing from my shoe
dialogue: one time when using the public restroom, i had toilet paper hanging from my shoe when i went outside
oh man! i hope no one noticed.
unfortunately i kept getting looks! it is alright though!
label: embarrassed
response: i am glad that it all worked out!

situation: i am doing work instead of playing with my dog.  i am paying a little attention to him but i have a goal i want to get to before i pay more attention to him.
dialogue: i have a goal i want to get on here tonight but my dog really wants to play.  i feel bad that i am not playing with him but would really like to hit my goal before i do.
oh, i bet you are really torn.
i am, i would think i will be done pretty soon and then take him for a nice long walk.
label: guilty
response: i am sure he will love that. i bet you will see the joy just shining in his eyes.

situation: my girlfriend broke up with me recently.  things just did not seem to work out
dialogue: my girlfriend broke up with me recently
that is one of the hardest parts of life. what happened??
we drifted apart it seems
label: sad
response: that is hard! relationships are hard work.

situation: a friend of mine drove me to work when my car broke down.  i would have been in trouble otherwise
dialogue: a friend of mine drove me to work when my car broke down
that is great of them, did you do anything to pay them back?
i took him out to dinner later on, he is a good friend
label: grateful
response: that is nice of you, glad you have supportive friends!

situation: i saw a mouse run across my kitchen.  i hope i can catch him at some point
dialogue: i saw a mouse run across my kitchen floor
aw poor mouse. i have had a few before.we actually rescued a few from our cat :/
i hope i can catch it at some point
label: disgusted
response: they have live traps to catch and release that are only a couple bucks. mice really are sweet natured.

situation: a co-worker of mine was late with work materials.  i hope i can get the project done in time
dialogue: a co-worker of mine was late with work materials
what happened to them?
i eventually got them, but it almost cost me this project i have been working on
label: annoyed
response: good, sorry you were inconvenienced, hope things get more consistent!

situation: i was watching my girlfriends son for the day and wanted to think of a fun activity we could do together.  i decided we would cook and got everything before he came over.
dialogue: i was watching my girlfriends son the other weekend and was trying to think of an activity we could do together.  i decided on cooking and got everything before he came over.
that sounds like fun. for some reason kids really enjoy cooking.
yeah, he seemed to have a good time.  we made cheese too which was a first for both of us.  it turned out pretty good too which was nice.
label: prepared
response: that sounds like fun. i want to try to make mozzerella

situation: i am nervous for my college test.
dialogue: i am nervous for my college test
did you study for it at least?
i did but it is a law school exam. you just never know.
label: anxious
response: that is true, well best of luck to you friend!

situation: i was walking around my office and someone spilled coffee on me.  it was a new dress shirt as well
dialogue: i was walking around my office and someone spilled coffee on me
that is bad. what did you do after that?
i went to the bathroom to clean up, it was a new shirt as well
label: annoyed
response: did he say sorry?

situation: when i came home, a tv show i set to record was all ready.  it felt good not to waste time
dialogue: when i came home, a tv show i had set to record was all ready to go
what show was it?
black mirror
label: content
response: is that the one with bryce dallas howard?

situation: i keep remember my old college days.
dialogue: i keep remembering my old college days
oh? what about them?
just how fun and carefree they were.
label: nostalgic
response: that is true. any memory in particular?

situation: it is hotter in the summer in massachusetts than i thought it would be.
dialogue: i am spending my first summer in massachusetts. it is a lot hotter than i expected it to be.
is it really? how hot is it there?
the hottest it got was 99 degrees. it has been in the mid 80s mostly, but i was expecting cooler weather in new england.
label: surprised
response: that is hot, but it is a bit hotter where i live here

situation: i was all alone when my family left for the weekend.
dialogue: i was all alone when my family left for the weekend.
did you feel lonely, or were you happy to have some time to yourelf?
a bit sad. more bored than anything.
label: lonely
response: that is tough when you are not used to being alone.  what did you end up doing?

situation: i am looking forward to meeting up with some friends during the weekend.  should be a lot of fun
dialogue: i am looking forward to meeting with some friends on the weekend
oh that is cool!  what do you all have planned?
probably go hiking and visit some local towns
label: anticipating
response: well that sounds like a fun little trip.

situation: i finally got my dog all worn out for the night.  now he is just hanging out and i do not have any more work to do for the night.
dialogue: after a long day i finally got my dog settled down and i do not have any work.  it feels nice to just sit for a little bit.
thats nice to be able to relax
have you had a good day?  hopefully you do not have a busy weekend and can relax a little bit.
label: content
response: everyday is a good day!

situation: i feel ready for the coming work week.  i have all my materials set
dialogue: i feel ready for the coming work week
really? you must really like you job then
yeah, i think i have all my work materials set
label: prepared
response: good for you! i hope you  have good week!

situation: today i had an interview for an online teaching position and i nailed it! i am pretty sure i am going to get the job but i am a little nervous.
dialogue: i had an online interview today for a teaching position and i nailed it!
awesome! i am happy for you!
thanks! regardless i am a bit nervous. there are a lot of things to remember and i do not want to look like a fool on the job.
label: confident
response: i am sure you will do fine! good luck!

situation: my girlfriend's cat has cancer and we cannot afford the operation.
dialogue: i found out recently that my girlfriend's cat has cancer and we cannot afford the operation to remove it.
oh i am so sorry. best thing to do is be there for her.
thank you for your sympathies. have you ever dealt with losing a pet?
label: sad
response: i have and it really hard. it just takes time but a good support system makes it way better.

situation: my girlfriend was having a horrible day at work, so i sent her some pizza to cheer her up and it worked like a charm.
dialogue: my girlfriend was having a bad day at work a few days ago.
how did she handle it
well, i sent her some pizza and it was so unexpected it turned her whole day around!
label: caring
response: well that was nice of you

situation: i studied for 2 hours for an online interview. i felt confident and ready to ace it!
dialogue: i spent two hours studying material for an interview.
did it help?
definitely. i aced it, and now i am officially in a trial period!
label: prepared
response: congrats! i hope it works out

situation: my dad was picking on my younger sister. i defended her, and was kicked out of my house.
dialogue: a while back, i intervened when i saw my dad was picking on my younger sister.
that was good of you.  he did not hurt her did he?
no, but he was just being mean. so mean he decided to kick me out of the house.
label: furious
response: oh no! where did you end up going?

situation: walking home alone from school one day, three young adults jumped in front of me and yelled in my twelve-year old face. i cried the rest of the way back.
dialogue: walking home alone from school one day, three young adults jumped in front of me and yelled in my face.
why did they do that?
for no good reason; there are evil people in this world. i was so scared i cried on the way back home.
label: terrified
response: that is terrible. those days, a lot of people do stupid things.

situation: i was so excited my son started school for the first time and did not cry.
dialogue: i was not sure how he would do since he did not go to prek.
children usually do really well, they are versatile.
i have heard that, but now i truly believe that!
label: proud
response: i hope he continues to do well.

situation: my oldest is leaving for college next week i am scared for her to go into the real world but i am positive she will be ok in the end.
dialogue: my daughter is officially all grown up she is leaving and going off to college next week.
are you excited or will it be lonely?
in between i am very positive that she will be ok but just the thought of your first born going into the real world away from you is scary a little but i know she will be just fine.
label: confident
response: yeah that is scary. i am sure she will do great things though!

situation: i am kind of glad the summer is coming to a end my kids was gone all summer i missed them and i was very isolated when they was away.
dialogue: my kids was away all summer i missed them like crazy when they was gone.
i bet it was really quiet and lonely. did you find some time for yourself though?
a little to quite and i was very lonely i am glad it is over i started isolating my self to much when they was away.
label: lonely
response: i do not think i would like that quiet either.

situation: i slacked off at the end of college semester and flunked the class i am so much better then that i feel so regretful about not giving my all.
dialogue: i know i have high potential so the fact i failed my college course had me down.
well that is not good. i am sorry to hear that. do you think maybe you were just too nervous during the test?
the test and the whole semester i just did not give it my all like i should have and now i feel really crappy and regretful i need to redo course and give it my all.
label: ashamed
response: never be too confident! you've got to give life your all at every step.

situation: i do not know what makes me more upset a rude employee or the manager i had my food order messed up and wendy's gave me so much attitude super rude.
dialogue: some restaurants just have the worst workers they are so rude and mean to us the customers.
i agree. i do not know why they work in the service industry if they do not like to be nice
exactly what is even worse is the managers who are just as rude, i get so upset i had this happen to me at wendy's staff was so unprofessional.
label: angry
response: fast food employees are the worst sometimes.. it is like we bother them

situation: i am so thrilled i will be closing on my first house next month for me and my family.
dialogue: i will officially be a first time home owner next month.
how exciting!  i bet you are thinking already about  how you want to decorate it and fix up the lawn, etc.
i am this is all i ever wanted for my family and it is about to come i am so thrilled with joy cannot wait.
label: excited
response: i can imagine!  it is certainly an exciting time.  i bet you are just over the moon happy!

situation: i was happy when my mother gave me the gift
dialogue: do you have any experience about it
any experience with what?
anything that made you happy
label: surprised
response: yes some things

situation: i packed a sandwich before i went to work
dialogue: i packed a sandwich before i went to work
are you trying to save money by not eating out at work?
yup, and i am too lazy to drive out to a restaurant!
label: prepared
response: well, it can save you a bunch of money!  plus you gain the time that you would normally spend going out somewhere and you can use that time to have more of a break.

situation: one time i saw poop smeared all over the public restroom
dialogue: one time i saw poop smeared all over the public restroom
oh my! i bet you was so disgusted that you ran out of there.
yup the smell was disgusting!
label: disgusted
response: yikes! why in the world would somebody do that?

situation: one time i looked at the mirror and thought i saw a monster
dialogue: one time i looked at the mirror and thought i saw a monster
whoa! that is really scary! i have felt weird sensations like that before.
yeah. unfortunately, it was a monster! i am just ugly!
label: surprised
response: no! i am sure you are not as monster-ish as you think!

situation: my mom spent a lot of money to buy me a computer
dialogue: my mom spent a lot of money to buy me a computer
aw that is nnice of her
yup! she worked hard for like 3 weeks to save up for it! i love her!
label: grateful
response: moms are the best

situation: one time while i was camping, there was a giant rattle snake trying to attack us
dialogue: one time while i was camping, there was a giant rattle snake trying to attack us
did you kill the snake?
nope! i packed up and went straight home!
label: terrified
response: that is too bad, will you ever camp again?

situation: last year i had a meeting where i had to heavily rely on a co-worker.
dialogue: i had business meeting about a year ago where i had to rely a lot on my co-worker.
did they do a good job?
surprisingly they he did, i guess sometimes we i need to trust people.
label: trusting
response: did you take them out for drinks after the meeting?

situation: i had a lunch at a hotel yesterday, i ordered dumplings, they actually turned out to be alright.
dialogue: i had dumplings at a hotel yesterday, and for a hotel restaurant food they were actually good.
sounds awesome
yes, it was a tasty lunch.
label: surprised
response: i would have loved to do the same

situation: the other day i got into an argument with my 19 year old son.  i became so angry with his behavior that i called him names and said things i did not mean.  i still feel badly about it.
dialogue: i got into an argument the other day with my 18 year old son.  i still feel badly about it
did you resolve things?
yes eventually, but i am sorry to admit that i said things i should have never said to him out of anger.
label: ashamed
response: i hope you can get over that pain.

situation: one time i bought a scratch lottery ticket and won $20!
dialogue: one time i bought a scratch lottery ticket and won $20!
that is awesome! it would be amazing to win a million one day. one can dream.
yup, i am going to buy another one just because of you! i hope i win!
label: joyful
response: that is great. i hope you do! maybe this time you can get $40. but gamble only in moderation!

situation: i was upset when my family kept leaving me on vacation
dialogue: i was upset when my family kept leaving me on vacation
that is really upsetting!
it was. i just wanted some quality family time.
label: annoyed
response: well forget them! if they do not care about you you do not need to care about them

situation: every time i see my cousin it reminds me of our childhood.
dialogue: my cousin and i used to beat eachother with sticks.
for fun?
yeah. we called it the box game and walked around inside of a refrigerator box for protection.
label: nostalgic
response: well that sounds pretty fun!

situation: i was very well prepared for my law exam.
dialogue: i was very well prepared for my law exam.
were you satisfied with the results?
i was! 95%
label: confident
response: excellent!

situation: thanksgiving was a huge embarrassment for me.
dialogue: i enthusiastically told my family about everything wrong with my life at that point.
how did it go
not good. i was very drunk though
label: ashamed
response: oh well maybe next time

situation: i was surprised by how easy it was to quit smoking!
dialogue: quitting smoking was so much easier than i expected it to be!
how many days has it been?
2 years
label: surprised
response: wow that is great!

situation: i was grossed out when i saw someone vomit outside a bar.
dialogue: i was grossed out when i saw someone vomit outside a bar.
drunk people can get pretty disgusting in general.
for sure. it was not a pretty sight.
label: disgusted
response: some people cannot hold their liquor.

situation: i am consistently grateful for being able to live an easy life.
dialogue: life is a lot better when you can eat solid food. never get your jaw wired shut it sucks.
i can imagine. what happend that you got your jaw wired?
i got punched while drunk without a mouth guard years ago still think about it !
label: grateful
response: man that sounds aweful.

situation: i am very content with life.
dialogue: life is good right now for me too
nice.  always feels good to be at the top knowing nothing cannot touch you
right just staying active, do not need much money, minimal drama. easy
label: content
response: absolutely

situation: i used to feel lonely a lot as a teenager
dialogue: i used to feel lonely a lot as a teenager. that was dumb of me
i feel like everyone goes through that phase.  i know i did too
i have noticed that it is easier to be happy while not around someone all the time.
label: lonely
response: would you say you are more of an introvert?

situation: i cannot wait until the summer is finished.
dialogue: august is way too hot.
especially in the south
right. i live as north as you are gonna get in the us and it still sucks.
label: anticipating
response: oh wow, that does sound horrible

situation: i believed in myself that i would pass the ged test.
dialogue: ged test was super easy. i was confident that i would pass it
did you find out the results?
yeah i crushed
label: confident
response: dang that is awesome!

situation: i decided to go back to school for a career change after working at my job for 12 years. i did not know if i was making a good decision.
dialogue: two years ago i decided to go back to school after working at my job for 12 years. at the time i was very nervous about my decision.
oh wow and you could not keep your job? what were you going to school for?
i still work there, but just part time now. i am studying computer science.
label: apprehensive
response: oh wonderful! one of the best fields to be in right now

situation: i arranged a nice surprise dinner for my grandparent 50th anniversary last weekend.
dialogue: my grandparents have been married for 50 years i hope to be like that one day.
that is awesome. i never even get a second date a husband may not be in the cards
lol you just have not came across the right person yet. it is incredible i arranged and had them a surprise dinner party it turned out very nice.
label: prepared
response: that is sweet. i bet they enjoyed it

situation: i get so irritated when drivers drive slow in the fast lane this be the reason behind wrecks and traffic it is especially horrible here in florida.
dialogue: here in florida the traffic and wrecks is bad and always happening.
i hate bad traffic, did you get in an accident?
due to a reckless driver running the red light, but most wrecks i have witnessed come from careless drivers or drivers driving slow in the fast lane and get tail ended i get so irritated i swear.
label: annoyed
response: that is the worst, i hate when people are careless.

situation: i made plans with a coworker and she never showed up to dinner i was so angry.
dialogue: i get so angry when people stand me up it is so rude.
i know what you mean
my coworker did this recent we was suppose to have lunch she did not call or anything.
label: annoyed
response: that sucks. have you talked to her?

situation: we have a team building at woek in a few weeks our office is full of problems but i am going to predict this team building turns out good.
dialogue: professional settings is suppose to get along and be great but not my place of work staff fight like cats and dogs there.
that is awful.  i agree.  a professional setting is supposed to be . well, professional.  what steps are being taken to correct that?
we have a team building coming up and let's hope this works which i predict it will be some type of good outcome.
label: anticipating
response: i agree.  i hope it will be.  team building, communication, and professionalism will all help a company.  i think this is why so many companies fail.

situation: i packed for a long road trip, and had everything i would need to hopefully avoid excessive stops.
dialogue: i just drove 12 hours back from my parents' house. it was not so bad though, because i actually packed everything i needed for once. i was able to minimize the amount of stops i took and cut two hours off of the total time it took!
wow, you do really live far from your parents. do you go to college or work?
i work. we moved far from where they grew up when i was young, and they ended up moving back for retirement.
label: prepared
response: i see. well, it seems as people get older they want to go back to places which reminds them of past. nostalgia probably helps them cope with passing life

situation: i was upset when i found out that my favorite coworker was transferring to another department.
dialogue: i was pretty bummed to find out that my favorite coworker is transferring to a different department.
i can see how that would be a downer.  will you still get to see them?
once in a while, here and there.
label: sad
response: at least they are not gone completely, but i can understand how that would affect your day to day work life.

situation: i am getting very frustrated with how often my bank calls me. i prequalified for a mortgage on the website last week and they've called me 3 times a day ever since.
dialogue: i prequalified for a mortgage last week online. the bank i applied with has called me 3 times a day ever since. i am getting pretty frustrated.
i would be really annoyed myself, why so many frequent calls ?
i am not sure. this is my first time shopping for a mortgage, so i am not sure if it is normal or not.
label: annoyed
response: i know ever since i purchased a new car, i know for a fact i did not read the fine print but insurance companys call me almost every day multiple times a day , its really annoying

situation: i watched wimbledon on tv over the summer for the first time. those tennis players are so good!
dialogue: i watched wimbledon for the first time last summer. those tennis players are so good!
i know right! my parents love tennis, so i grw up watching it.
i had played a little bit growing up, but never watched it professionally.
label: impressed
response: were you ever any good at it?

situation: i remember when i was about 7 years old and my mom married my stepdad whom i loved dearly.  he was like a real dad to me.  he built me a wooden playhouse in the back yard.
dialogue: it was so life-like and i have such fond memories of playing in there.  my stepdad worked for pillsbury and brought home dough and i would pretend i was baking.
good for you to have such memorable experience to have and remember of. can you bake now for real?
yes somewhat, although with all that practice in childhood i should be much better.   i miss my stepdad so much.   i have nothing but fond memories of him.
label: nostalgic
response: are you still in contact with him?

situation: i am in the middle of shopping for a house. one of the houses i really like was just taken off the market.
dialogue: i looked at a house i really liked last week, but just found out it was taken off the market.
oh that sucks. i hate when that happens.
yeah, it will be okay though. there is always something else that will come available.
label: disappointed
response: i bet the next house you look at will be amazing and even better than that one.

situation: i packed for a long road trip, and had everything i would need to hopefully avoid excessive stops.
dialogue: i had to drive 12 hours straight last week. for once it was not terrible, because i packed everything i needed. took two hours fewer than it normally does!
that sounds exhausting! were you driving for work or just taking a vacation?
vacation. went to go visit my parents.
label: prepared
response: i am sure the drives worth it since you get to spend time with the family.

situation: i did not know that my boyfriend was coming home from his trip early, so i was shocked when i came home from work and he was home.
dialogue: i came home from work, expecting an empty apartment. my boyfriend was home from his trip a day early!
was he alone?
yes, i was very excited to see him.
label: surprised
response: cool. did you do something special?

situation: i was so excited when i got a promotion.
dialogue: i got a promotion at work! i am so excited!
congrats
thank you!
label: joyful
response: do you get a raise?

situation: my bank will not stop calling me about a mortgage.
dialogue: my bank has called me three times a day for the past week, and i am tired of it.
probably they noticed some irregular or even fraudulent activities associated with your account
no, i prequalified for a mortgage, and they've been wanting me to speak to a loan specialist ever since.
label: annoyed
response: are you interested in mortgage for now?

situation: my roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time
dialogue: my roommate leaves her leftovers in the fridge for a disgusting amount of time.
oh that is really gross! have you talked to her about it?
no, i do not feel like it is my place to tell her what to do.
label: disgusted
response: if you share the fridge, i would let her know if it causes an odor or might affect the other food.

situation: my boyfriend came home early from a trip unexpectedly.
dialogue: i came home expecting an empty apartment, but my boyfriend had come home a day early from his trip!
cool. did he have gifts?
no, but i am not big on gifts.
label: surprised
response: oh. i am

situation: i felt sad when i saw a beggar in the street
dialogue: do you feel anything like that
like what? bad or miserable?
sad, when you see beggar in the street
label: guilty
response: yes indeed. seeing people less fortunate than me makes go to pieces

situation: next month my wife and i will go on our first vacation together. i can hardly wait for our flight.
dialogue: next month my wife and i are going on our first vacation, i can hardly wait.
wow. enjoy your own time.
i will, it is going to be great to get away together.
label: anticipating
response: yeah, you are right. hope you've memorable vacation.

situation: my ex boyfriend of 4 years decided to start seeing someone else which made me so mad and hurt.  he dropped me like i was nothing after 4 whole years of hell with him.
dialogue: my ex boyfriend and i started having trouble getting along and we were under a lot of stress over money.   after awhile of this he started putting a password on his cell phone so i could not get in to see his messages.  that was the first sign!
wao,thats really not cool
no, not cool at all.  we ended up breaking up for a bit and he did not waste any time before seeing this girl.   i wasted four years of my life for that to happen.
label: furious
response: he does not deserve you,so wipe your tears

situation: when my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman i did not know what to do with myself.  i was so used to doing everything with him all the time and it was really hard for me.
dialogue: i found myself suddenly by myself and it seemed as if all the people i had become friends with were no longer wanting to still be friends.  i mostly met all of them through him when we got together, and when he left me he told them not to speak to me anymore and they listened.
that is sad. but i am sure they stil want to be firends with you too

i do not think they do.  he was an abusive guy and he did not want me to have them as friends and he would make up lies about me .  i do not think it was so much the lies he made up because they knew they were not true.  i think they were just loyal to him.
label: lonely
response: posibly. sounds like you are better off without him though

situation: so bitter when i discovered my woman went to church putting on black gown when i ask her to wear white.
dialogue: i love it when the buildbuilding is comingfrom me
that is awesome, i wish i could build my own house.
is the conversation over? you are welcome then.
label: angry
response: well thank you as well.

situation: i had to take my beloved dog to the humane society when i had to move back in with my mother after my terrible breakup with my ex.   she said i absolutely could not have her at her house.
dialogue: her name was lily and she was a pit bull, my favorite breed.   i loved her so much.  we did everything together.  she would go wherever i did.
did she die recently?

no she had to go to the humane society when my ex boyfriend and i broke up.   i had no choice, and he did it just to hurt me.  lily would go swimming with me, ride on our boat etc.  when she was just a pup she would sit on my lap as i rode the four wheeler.
label: sentimental
response: oh wow! that is so sad, i know animals can be like kids to use. i am so sorry

situation: my son had court last week.  he is 18 and got a possession of marijuana charge and driving while suspended.  it was so nerve wracking to see him go in front of the judge and not knowing what they will do him.
dialogue: he was originally suspended at 17 when he again got got with a little bit of weed.  they have a law here in missouri called 21 and under law.  automatically get suspended for a year if ur a minor in possession.
that can ruin a persons life.
i know it can which is why i was so worried at court.  the judge looked at him and said son you need to hire you a lawyer.  i  throw people in jail for things like this.
label: anticipating
response: that is such a mess.

situation: the last time i felt this way was when i got recognized at work at our weekly meeting. i was called by name in front of everyone for a job well done that i have done.
dialogue: the best thing happened at work today!
tell me more, sounds exciting!
well we have these weekly meetings about our goals and today i was recognized by name in front of everyone for a job well done.
label: proud
response: good on you! you finally got recognition for your hard work

situation: i was excited to go to a concert tonight but could not get myself to go by myself at the last minute and so i bailed. i will probably regret it.
dialogue: ugh! tonight was such a bummer.
oh no what happened?
i was going to go to a concert but could not get myself to go by myself at the last minute. i feel like i am going to regret not going.
label: anxious
response: what concert was it?

situation: i went through two floods in missouri only a couple years apart from eachother.    during the first one we lost our whole house.   all that was left was the foundation.
dialogue: the aftermath was awful.  trash and debris was everywhere and we were homeless.  we lived out in the country and it took some time before red cross came out to do their report and get help to us.
that sounds terrible. i hope you are okay now.
i am doing better now but it was really hard times.  we had moved everything up higher as we never expected our whole house to go.  unfortunately we had all our belongings in the house as well.
label: devastated
response: well all the matters is that no one was hurt. you can buy property again but not lives.

situation: i purchased a new phone online last week. when it got here, the box was empty. when i contacted the company, they initially refused to refund my money, and i got pretty angry.
dialogue: i ordered a new phone last week, and when the box got here it was empty.
that is so messed up!
yeah, i was pretty upset, especially when they initially refuse to refund my money.
label: furious
response: i would be so angry.

situation: my dog, who had been with me for 13 years, died a few years ago.  it was so difficult to wrap him in a blanket, and bury him.  i was heartbroken.
dialogue: a few years back i had to bury my dog, who had died at the age of 13.
oh wow, what kind of dog was it? i am so sorry that must've been super hard
he was a lab.  it broke my heart, to be honest.
label: sad
response: i can imagine. i have not had an animal die yet but my cat is 13 and i am dreading the day

situation: i recently enrolled in college at the local community college.  i am so glad i am accomplishing something i have wanted to do for so long.
dialogue: i thought i would never get the chance or opportunity to better my life as well as my childrens.  i cannot wait till i get that degree
that is wonderful that you are pursuing a degree. what is it in?
i am getting a counseling degree to help abused women.  i feel i would make a good counselor since i  have been in a few abusive relationships myself.
label: proud
response: that is great that you have been able to overcome and do this to help others. you can really make a difference!

situation: i saw a trailer recently for the new spyro remastered game. it really brought me back to my childhood. i remember so much about that original game playing with an old friend.
dialogue: i saw a video game trailer recently that really brought me back!
yeah? which game was it for?
the new spyro remastered game coming out. seeing it really reminded me of how i used to play the original all day with an old friend of mine.
label: nostalgic
response: nice. the original spyro is a classic.

situation: i had a flat on the way to work this morning.  when i went to change the tire, the handle to my jack was missing. i had to use a screwdriver to work the jack, and it sucked.
dialogue: i had a flat on the way to work this morning, and the jack handle was missing from my car.
oh no. what did you do?
i used a screwdriver to work the jack. it sucked,.
label: annoyed
response: lol, well done for attempting it. did you make it to work on time?

situation: a friend of mine got all of my friends together to throw a party for me on my birthday. i never expected it as i typically do not do much for my birthday.
dialogue: i just celebrated my birthday and it was so much better than usual.
that is great. what made it so special this year?
i usually do not do much to celebrate but this year a friend of mine got all my other friends together to throw a party for me without me knowing. it was a great time.
label: surprised
response: sounds like fun! i am glad you had a happy birthday.

situation: i found out two weeks ago that i am going to be a father.  it came as quite the shock, because we have been unable to conceive for the last 3 years.  i am stoked.
dialogue: my wife and i have tried to have a baby for over three years, and had given up hope.  two weeks ago, we found out she was pregnant.
i am so happy for you! congrats!
thank you!  we were both pretty shocked by the news,.
label: surprised
response: i wish you nothing but the best!

situation: in 2011 i put my beautiful daughter emerson up for adoption.  this was the hardest decision i have ever had to make.
dialogue: i was in an extremely dangerous abusive relationship at the time and i knew he was intending to put her in the middle of it all.   he intended to use her for leverage over me .
it sounds like you are talking about two different people there instead of just one person.  i am a little confused.
oh my i am getting ahead of myself.  i was referring to when i had to put my daughter emerson up for adoption in 2011.
label: sentimental
response: ouch that sucks. i am sorry to hear that.

situation: i was trying to contact my friend so we could set a time for our plans today but he never got back to me. i was looking forward to catching up.
dialogue: ugh! my friend is definitely getting on my nerves today.
why what happened? are y'all on a trip?
we made plans to catch up but never set a time. i tried to contact him to figure out what time and he never got back to me. i was looking forward to catching up.
label: annoyed
response: oh wow, so he basically ghosted you? i would be mad too

situation: wow, a day i was trapped by court group and the gave me a knife to stab someone i do not kn.
dialogue: yes, i pray not to be found or trapped like they trapped me to stab unknown man.
that sounds very bizarre.
serious, that has being my worse situation so far
label: afraid
response: i hope you are okay.

situation: i came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into. i was very upset and frusterated
dialogue: my car window was broken when i walked up to my car this morning!
that is so messed up!
yeah it is!  i am going to have to spend money i did not have.  i am so upset right now.
label: angry
response: i hope this does not happen again.

situation: i was playing a board game with some friends and i ended up spilling my drink all over the table by accident.
dialogue: i really felt like a fool last night.
oh my, what did you do, may i ask?
i was playing a board game with a few friends and i ended up spilling my entire drink all over the table.
label: embarrassed
response: that does not sound good. it must have been so embarrassing!

situation: i had to explain how something works at my job in front of a bunch of people. i am not a fan of talking in front of a crowd.
dialogue: work was not a good experience today.
oh no, what happened?
i had to explain how a bunch of things work in front of a lot of people. i am not a fan of talking in front of a crowd.
label: anxious
response: i hate public speaking too!

situation: after moving to dallas from a small town i felt i would like it, but after a few weeks of not knowing anyone i got home sick.
dialogue: when i moved to dallas i felt i would have the time of my life after living in a small town, but after a couple of weeks i got homesick.
dallas is a really fast city.
yeah it is. i do not know anybody and my classmates all have jobs. so i get to be at home by myself alot
label: lonely
response: i am sorry, things will get better.

situation: my friend that has been out of the country for a year is coming back and we get to hangout again. i am really looking forward to it.
dialogue: i am really excited about this weekend!
what are your plans?
a friend of mine has been out of the country for a year and he has finally come back. we are going to catch up.
label: excited
response: that is aweosme! is he going to be staying with you?

situation: i let my sister drive my car to run to the store knowing she did not have her license. she got stopped and got a ticket!
dialogue: so my sister drove my car to run an errand and got a ticket! she does not have her license
that is terrible. what happened then?
well not much. its just i feel bad because i told her i would take her but got so busy. maybe i am the one that should have got the ticket. not her
label: guilty
response: i understand. my mistaske always happened.

situation: i was having financial troubles and my family helped me out. it is nice to have people that care about you and will help out.
dialogue: financial troubles are sometimes the worst! ugh.
those are so stressful. just take it step by step and you can get on track.
you really have to. luckily, my family was able to help me out and get me back on my feet. it is definitely nice to have people who are willing to help.
label: grateful
response: that makes all the difference. i am glad you were able to get out of that position.

situation: my brother and sister are having a baby and today is the gender reveal. our family cannot wait to see what the gender is.
dialogue: so my brother will be the first out of 4 kids of my parents to have a baby and today is going to be the gender revealing party.
you must be really excited for it! do you think its going to be girl or boy?
we all want a boy so we are all cannot wait to find out what it is. everyone is so impatient about it, but today is the day.
label: anxious
response: well, it will great either way as long as the baby is healthy!

situation: i just paid all my bills and do not have any huge plans for the weekend. it is sometimes nice to just be able to chill and relax.
dialogue: i am looking forward to how chill this weekend will be.
do you plan do something this weekend?
quite the opposite, really. i just paid all my bills and have not really any plans. sometimes it is nice to just not have that stress and relax.
label: content
response: yes. it is sometime nice to just rest at home.

situation: i have never been to a haunted house, but this year i will be attending. i am very worried about it.
dialogue: so this year will be the first time i been to a haunted house.  i am get scared easilty so  i am kinda worried. i promised my friend i would go with her.
that sounds like fun do you know who haunts it?
i do not know, but i feel i should not go, but again i promised my friend i would go. i do not know wha to do now.
label: apprehensive
response: well, if you promised i would try to go. i am sure it will be fine.

situation: i have been on several dates with this girl and i feel  i am going to ask her to be my gf.  i am sure she will say yes.
dialogue: me and this girl have been dating for awhile now,so i think  i am going to ask her to be my girlfriend.
nice! you must be pretty confident she will say yes.
yes i agree. i feel that way about it. you know me too well.
label: confident
response: i hope it goes well for you and brings happiness to you both.

situation: my sister's cat got sick and had to be put down last week. feels bad. i would known the cat for 14 years and was always her favourite person
dialogue: my sister's cat got sick and had to be put down last week. feels bad.
that sounds terrible. but hopefully it is not suffering any more.
she had stomach cancer, so she was in a lot of pain. definitely the right thing to do
label: sad
response: i agree, just remember her for all the good memories.

situation: i studied all week for this upcoming exam. i am feeling pretty good about how i am going to do on it.
dialogue: i have a huge exam coming up tomorrow.
have you been studying? that is intimidating but i bet you will do great! what is the subject?
it is for a pc architecture class. i am feeling really good about it though since i studied really hard all week!
label: prepared
response: what an interesting course! i hope you do really well. exams can be so scary- they can cause such anxiety.

situation: there were maggots all over my buildings garbage bin this morning. i got one on my arm as i passed by. so gross.
dialogue: there are maggots all over my building's garbage bin this morning. i got one on my arm when i walked by
that is very bad. did you complaint to the landlord?
they do not care. they live upstairs and are very dirty people. i am moving as soon as i get a job!
label: disgusted
response: i understand. the best thing is to move.

situation: i was driving in the rain and my car hydroplaned! i closed my eyes and thank god i was the only car on the freeway!
dialogue: coming home driving in the rain my car hydroplaned on the freeway!
that is awful! i am always scared that is going to happen to me when it is raining
i agree and thank god i was the only car on the freeway , otherwise it would be a different story!
label: terrified
response: you got lucky for sure!  i cannot imagine how scary that would be

situation: i was shocked that the parade had many people attend considering the rain pouring down.
dialogue: i am amazed on how many people came to the parade considering the rain!
really, where was this parade at? i am in missouri and it was absolutely pouring on friday
i am here down south and it has been pouring as well, but that did not stop people from coming!  i am shocked.
label: surprised
response: i usually do not let a little rain stop me unless it is ridiculous!

situation: everytime i see the animal rescue commercials i get so emotional and want to cry.
dialogue: i just saw a commercial about the rescue animals. everytime i see it it makes me so sad.
oh no. feeling empathy towards them just shows you are normal. there is a lot of people in your boat
yea. it reminds me of my old dog that was a rescue. so many memories. i want to go get one actually.
label: sentimental
response: whats preventing you?

situation: i love mystery boxes in games. unfortunately i usually do not get anything good out of them and feel bad for a second. but i love the excitement of opening them.
dialogue: i love mystery boxes in games! unfortunately i usually do not get anything good.
that sounds fun!  what are they exactly?
almost any game that has an online component! like right now i play the secret world and it has mystery boxes.
label: disappointed
response: it sounds like you really enjoy it!  good for you!

situation: i have not seen my mother in 2 years since i been busy with school and work.  i am overjoyed about it.
dialogue: so i will be going to see my mom after 2 years of not seeing her since starting school! i cannot wait
how exciting! she must be thrilled too
yes she is. we are all so excited to finally hang out! we have so much planned
label: excited
response: i hope you guys have the best time!

situation: i worked so hard for the lead role in the play. i kinda got some type of frusteration from the person taht got it since they did not work hard like me
dialogue: so the role i worked so hard for went to a person who could care less about the play!
that unfortunate.  are you feeling a little jealous?
i guess you can say that! what a day!
label: jealous
response: i hate it when stuff like that happens.

situation: once, i went camping with my family. we saw many animals and a beautiful creek. it was a happy time.
dialogue: once, i went camping with my family. we saw many animals and a beautiful creek. it was a happy time.
that sounds so great. being in nature makes you feel so good.
it does! i really hope we get to go camping again this fall.
label: excited
response: you should just make a plan and do it. it sounds like it is worthwhile.

situation: we order chinese food last night. the order was completely wrong!
dialogue: we order chinese food last. the order was completely wrong but the lady seemed very helpful when we called.
that sucks, sorry to hear that. did you get a refund?
we did not get a refund but they were able to fix the order. i was really craving chinese!
label: hopeful
response: hopefully they get your order correct the next time you order there!

situation: i ate a lot of my kid's halloween candy. i told her the candy was old and i had to throw it away.
dialogue: i ate a lot of my kid's halloween candy. i told her the candy was old and i had to throw it away.
did it taste good?
it was really good! she had a lot of candy. i was hoping she would not notice some missing!
label: guilty
response: did it taste good?

situation: recently my office colleagues had arranged for a surprise birthday party
dialogue: two weeks back i celebrated my birthday and do you know what my office colleagues planed for me
were you suprised that they did this for you?
yes and i am quiet happy that they also brought my wife who stays in london for party to surprise me
label: impressed
response: wow! how happy you must be. i be that day brought you lost of excitement.

situation: my mom called me last week to let me know our childhood dog passed away
dialogue: so my childhood dog died last week. my mother called me with the news.
oh so sad , what happened to it
he died of old age. he could barely walk so they put him down. yeah pretty bad news. it made my day blue
label: sad
response: it must must a very much hard time for you and your family

situation: we went camping in the mountain. we did not know it was bear season. there were a lot of hunters and hunting dogs in the area. they were chasing the bears into one area.
dialogue: we went camping in the mountain. we did not know it was bear season. there were a lot of hunters and hunting dogs in the area. they were chasing the bears into one area
i would be so scared. i think i might have to leave. did the bears bother anyone?
luckily, the hunters kept them around a mile from camp. it was still very hard to sleep! we heard dogs barking at the bears all night!
label: afraid
response: were you in a tent or a camper? i hope you kept your food locked up tightly.

situation: we have a doberman for over 8 years. he passed away last spring. it was a hard time for our family.
dialogue: we had a doberman for over 8 years. he passed away last spring. it was a hard time for our family.
oh, i am so sorry to hear that. i know pets can be like one of the family.
they are like having another child! i hope to have another doberman one day. they are really good dogs.
label: devastated
response: you should adopt a rescue dog. that would be great for the family.

situation: last week i visited a restaurant  and i found a insect in the burger which i ordered
dialogue: last week i visited a restaurant and found a insect in the burger which i ordered
that is disgusting. what did you do about it?
i immediately raised an alarm about the issue and complained to store manager
label: disgusted
response: did you get a refund at least? i would never visit that restaurant ever again if i were you!

situation: we have homeschooled our daughter for the past 3 years. this year, she has decided to return to public school.
dialogue: we have homeschooled our daughter for the past 3 years. this year, she has decided to return to public school.
that is interesting! most kids love being home-schooled but i guess she missed socializing and interacting with her peers.
she did miss having a lot of friends. i hope she does well. she starts in 10 days!
label: anxious
response: not too much longer! i hope she adjusts well and enjoys herself. public school can still provide an enriching experience when it comes to social skills and education.

situation: after 3 years of college, this year will be my last semester until  i am done! i cannot wait!
dialogue: this will be my last semester in college! i cannot wait to finish.
wow good job! so close
thanks!. i get so happy everytime i think about it!
label: excited
response: that is a great accomplishment

situation: being in dallas with no friends is boring. i need to get out more.
dialogue: since i moved to dallas i have not met any friends. i go to work and school and just come home.
maybe you should job a club or a social gatherings group
i agree. it gets boring at home alone with no one.
label: lonely
response: i agree. you need to socialize a little bit to get out of your lonely slump

situation: my sister lives in utah. we had planned for her to come visit but her work would not allow her to take the time off.
dialogue: my sister lives in utah. we had planned for her to come visit but her work would not allow her to take the time off.
aw that is annoying. work always gets in the way of things. did you ever try to go to her?
i have not yet. i would like to eventually. i am hoping to see her soon
label: disappointed
response: i am sure it will work out! not this time unfortunatly, but it will in the end

situation: i gave my brother my car this weekend hoping he would take care of it. he has been doing good so far so i felt i could do this for him.
dialogue: so i was out of town this weekend and lent my brother my car. i was hesitant at first, but i felt he would do good with it and take care of it.
did he take care of it for you?
he did. i feel i can let him use it more often after this.
label: trusting
response: that is great that he was able to show you he is responsible. i bet you are proud.

situation: my husband works very hard so that i can be a stay at home mom. it has allowed me the freedom to homeschool our daughter.
dialogue: my husband works very hard so that i can be a stay at home mom. it has allowed me the freedom to homeschool our daughter.
that is awesome, what does your hubster do?
he owns an auto repair shop. he works from sun up to sun down!
label: grateful
response: wow, i admire his dedication! and you will not ever have to worry about your vehicle breaking!

situation: after working at my job for 1 years my review is coming up.  i am hoping it goes well since i work hrad.
dialogue: so my 1 year review at work is coming up and i feel its going to be good since i wokred so hard.
hard work pays off in the long-run. if your work is truly authentic in its nature, it is definitely going to be recognized and appreciated
i agree. i think my raise will be good as well as the promotion i asked for.
label: anticipating
response: be careful while negotiating your pay raise. some managers may find it too intrusive and that may leave bad impression on them

situation: my child sneaked in my room to get the xbox controller while i was sleeping. the night before, i had grounded her.
dialogue: my child sneaked in my room to get the xbox controller while i was sleeping. the night before, i had grounded her.
oh no, do you think she was trying to get back at you for grounding her?
i think she thought she could play a few minutes of minecraft and then return the controller before i woke up! i caught her getting into the drawer where i hid it.
label: furious
response: i definitely remember trying something like that when i was a kid.  i think sometimes kids think they are sneakier than they actually are.

situation: i was appalled at the way my friend approached me last night.
dialogue: my friend came to my house drunk and threw up everywhere.
whow!  that sounds really disgusting!  what did you do?
yes it was! i could not do nothing. she was in a raging fit. ijust made she she went to sleep ok.
label: disgusted
response: man, you are a good friend!  i would have been beyond angry!

situation: my best friends mother got diagnosed with cancer last month. i feel bad about it.
dialogue: my friends mother got diagnosed with cancer last month and its been hard on her.
so sorry to hear that. it is truly horrifying and i wish and hope for nobody to be hit with this calamity
yeah. shes my best friend, so i am planning to go with her this weekend to see her mom. my heart breaks for her.
label: sentimental
response: indeed. friends should be together in times of need. that is what friends are for

situation: i  done a presentation at work and as i got up to speak i farted.
dialogue: last week i did a presentation at work and as i stood up i blew some gas!
oh no! did anyone notice? it is normal though, we all do that sometimes
yes it was loud. i can feel my face turn red and the room getting quiet!
label: embarrassed
response: oh man. it happened to me before, i know how embarrassing it is.

situation: my little brother did so good on his finals. i was shocked considering he did not study.
dialogue: so my little brother barely passed his finals to become a cop! i could not beleive it.
that is great that he passed though!  are you happy about it?
i am very happy, but all he do through school was party and never study.  i am shocked.
label: impressed
response: well at least he passed that is great!

situation: we went to the library where they had an animal expert stop by for the kids. my daughter was able to answer most of his questions that other kids could not.
dialogue: we went to the library where they had an animal expert stop by for the kids. my daughter was able to answer most of his questions that other kids could not. it made me smile.
that is pretty neat actually. i wish i had kids to bring to stuff like that.
you should check your local library. the ones in my area have tons of things, like a lego club, for the local kids.
label: proud
response: i will do that, i had no idea.

situation: my dad died of cancer in 2012.
dialogue: my dad died of cancer in 2012. that was really hard for me emotionally.
i am really sorry to hear that.
thank you. i was prepared, but it was still difficult.
label: devastated
response: i cannot even imagine to be honest.

situation: i have a promotion coming up in the next few weeks. i am hopeful that i will get a raise
dialogue: i have a performance review and potential promotion coming up in the next few weeks.
that is awesome! i hope you will get a promotion. what do you do for work?
i work as an accountant for a carpet cleaning company. there is a chance that i could be made a manager!
label: hopeful
response: you will be a great manager! good luck with everythig

situation: i just hired a new hotel inspector, he has very little experience but wants to learn. scares me.
dialogue: i just hired a new hotel inspector, he has very little experience but wants to learn. scares me.
you took a risk huh? i hope he will be a great worker! that is good you gave him a chance
yes, i need more staff member and he was very nice. but if he does a bad job i get fired.
label: trusting
response: i hope it will not happen!

situation: in high school, i fell down the stairs in front of my crush. i was really embarrassed.
dialogue: in high school, i fell down the stairs in front of my crush. my face turned red and i ran away!
oh no! did he say anything about it?
he laughed at me. looking back, i am sure it was funny but in the moment, i could have died!
label: embarrassed
response: i know what you mean. i have done stuff like that too you do feel a bit silly, do not you!

situation: last night i won a gift card at trivia night at the pub. going shopping today.
dialogue: last night i won a gift card at trivia night at the pub. going shopping today.
awesome! what are you planning on buying?
i have got a baby due in december so something for the baby or my wife. i never bother getting my self anything.
label: joyful
response: maybe you can figure out a way to get all three of you guys something!

situation: found out my wife was dating someone else a year before we got married while we were dating. it is not a good day today.
dialogue: i found out my wife was dating someone else a year before we got married, we were together for 7 years at that point. today i am stressed!
oh no that is crazy!
yea, we have a baby due in december so i am trying to not jump to any decisions to quickly.
label: furious
response: well i am sorry you are going through this and i hope you can figure it all out.

situation: i woke up one morning to make a sandwich. the sandwich meat made me sick! i knew something was wrong so i took a pregnancy test. we now have a 10 year old surprise!
dialogue: i woke up one morning to make a sandwich. the smell of the sandwich meat made me sick! i felt something was wrong and drove to the nearest store. i purchased a pregnancy test.
i hate those things, i try to not eat those at all.
i usually love eating sandwiches which is why i knew something just was not right! i was experiencing morning sickness!
label: surprised
response: i eat steak and shrimp.

situation: one day i was talking to a friend. they kept talking about how smart they were compared to other people. it was really annoying.
dialogue: i have a friend that will not stop talking about himself. he always wants to talk about his latest investments, the books he has read, and how much he knows about the places that he visits!
i really dislike snooty people who are constantly rubbing their amazing life in your face.
i do too. it makes me not want to be around those types of people.
label: annoyed
response: i would not be friends with someone like that. i mean what can you benefit from that friendship?

situation: i cannot hardly wait to go concert tonight!
dialogue: i am a big taylor swift friend!
i love taylor swift! she is talented and beautiful!
yes i need to arrive at her concert tonight at  8!
label: excited
response: how exciting for you! have fun!

situation: i am worried about take my finals this week.
dialogue: i know i studied well, but i cannot stop worrying about it.
you have a test coming up?
yes on friday. it is the final.
label: anxious
response: well i hope you do well! good luck.

situation: i had such a great time at my daughters 7th birthday party.
dialogue: she had a lot  of friends that came.
that is interesting. what was she doing?
she had her birthday at chuck e cheese.
label: joyful
response: that is awesome! i did not know that place was still in business.

situation: i coupon at groceries stores on a regular basis. it is really frustrating when the cashier does not understand coupons. sometimes i feel like the companies should train their employees better when it comes to coupons.
dialogue: i love to coupon but sometimes i feel like the cashiers are not trained properly. they will look at the coupon for every detail and do not understand the language in the fine print.
yeah i bet it is frustrating. the store gets reimbursed for the coupons so they should not nitpick.
i agree. it is not like the money will come out of their paycheck if something is wrong!
label: annoyed
response: i hope they get better training so you do not have to argue with them about it

situation: i am so upset they man that hit my car was not ticketed!
dialogue: the cop said he was too old!
too old for what? what a strange thing to say.
too old to give him a ticket for reckless driving!
label: angry
response: that does not make much sense. maybe i am missing the context.

situation: i played poker against a friend who was not really good. i won and took over $100 from him. i felt bad about it the next day.
dialogue: i played a game of poker with a friend who had no idea what he was doing. i won about $100 from him that night.
oh no, he should not have gambled.
you are probably right! i felt bad when i was spending the money. i hope he did not really need it.
label: guilty
response: i would've too, but sometimes people need to learn a lesson.

situation: i am not sure i am brave enough to walk alone at night anymore.
dialogue: recently there have been a few break ins.
oh no! did you property get broken into? or your neighbor's property?
no, my neighbor did but that is close enough for me!
label: afraid
response: for real! are you taking any precautions?

situation: one time i saw a stray dog walking around a restaurant looking for food
dialogue: one time i saw a stray dog walking around a restaurant looking for food
inside the restaurant ? what kind of place was this ?
it was outside a fried chicken chain restaurant
label: sad
response: okay, that makes more sense then to me.

situation: we did a lot of planning for the bad weather.
dialogue: we made sure to board up for the hurricane coming.
where are you located ?
we are in miami, florida 1 mile from the beach. .
label: prepared
response: i was not even aware there was a hurricane.

situation: i woke up this morning with car damage that happened while i was sleeping.
dialogue: the cop said i will probably never find out who did it.
who did what?
i will not find out who the person was that hit my car while i was sleeping.
label: furious
response: oh i am so sorry to hear that. people are so inconsiderate!

situation: i am not sure i may see about chaning my son's teacher.
dialogue: my sons teacher is not very nice to the young kindergartners.
oh no! why not?!
not, sure, but she is not very nice at all.
label: apprehensive
response: i would make a complaint to the principal if i were you!

situation: i am so upset she hit my car and left before the police came!
dialogue: i may never know who she was.
never know who was?
the women that hit my car and left before the police came.
label: angry
response: wow that is aweful!

situation: there is an abandoned school an hour drive from my house. it is said to be haunted. a group of friends and i decided it would be fun to go check it out. once we arrived, i was so scared that i could not even get out of the car!
dialogue: near my house, there is an abandoned school that is said to be haunted. when i was a teenager, a group of friends and i decided to go check it out.
oh wow, what happened?

when we pulled up, it was very spooky. i did not even want to get out of the car! a few of my friends tried to get in but it was boarded up. i looked in the window and there was still writing on the chalkboards!
label: afraid
response: that would give me the creeps! has anyone seen anything there?

situation: i was always nervous to cut my hair short. i finally convinced myself to do it. afterwards, i felt great about myself! it looked great and i felt like a whole new person.
dialogue: my hair has always been long and i had been scared to have a short hair cut. last december, i finally took the plunge and cut off all of my hair.
good for you! there is nothing wrong or uncool about short hair.
that is what i have discovered! i get a lot of compliments on it and i feel really good about myself when i go out!
label: confident
response: great! i am glad that it worked out well for you!

situation: when i went back to my home town and drove to the towns annual fair, it hasn't changed much so it felt like i went back to my childhood.
dialogue: i recently drove back to my hometown and went to the towns fair, it felt so nice reliving my childhood.
that is awesome, i went to visit my parents and my hometown last month, it is a great feeling.  how was the fair?
it was great, it did not change much but it still has that 'soul' to it. just felt great looking at it honestly.
label: nostalgic
response: brings back all the memories you had as a kid.  i miss going to the state fair, was always fun.

situation: when i was very young, i was dating a guy for several months. he broke up with me and started seeing another girl in our class. i could not stand to see them together.
dialogue: when i was in high school, i dated a guy for almost a year. a few weeks before summer, he broke up with me and started seeing another girl.
you must have been sad and angry.
i was. i would get really mad when i saw them at lunch or after school together. i was my first experience with heart break.
label: jealous
response: yes first heart brake is so hard, i feel for you, something similar happened to me with my first boyfriend.

situation: i did not really think i would win tickets from the radio.
dialogue: this was my first time winning a contest on the raido!
that is awesome! congratulations!
thanks! i will get to go free to the taylor swift concert tonight!
label: surprised
response: no way! that is actually a super awesome prize! have fun

situation: i needed lunch money for school because i had bought extra things during lunch. i was not supposed to do that. i stole money out of my dad's wallet to cover my negative account balance at school.
dialogue: i bought extra items during school lunch in high school. i have a negative balance on my account.
ouch, hopefully its not by much. i remember when i was in high school i had a similar situation. they are usually pretty lenient on it.
i had to take money out of my dad's wallet to cover it. i would have got in so much trouble with my parents for buying candy! it was not much but i still felt bad.
label: guilty
response: i am sure your dad would not mind haha, its usually pretty cheap anything i remember they cost like $1.

situation: end of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room. housing department fined me and the other two roommates 100$ each for his laziness.
dialogue: i had a roommate in my dorm who did not clean up his dorm room at the end of the semester and the school fined me and the other two roommates $100. i was furious at that guy.
did you try to get the money from him? he sounds like a pretty bad person.
yeah we tried but he cut all communication, he did not respond to his phone number or anything. i hope he got fined a larger amount so it teaches him a lesson on laziness.
label: furious
response: i do too! people like that make me never want to have a roommate!

situation: i went to cuba to visit some family members and met up with some friends to go to a bar. it was like 3 am when we were walking back home and there were these guys hiding in the shadows looking at us. we ended up running very fast but they never followed thankfully.
dialogue: so i recently traveled to cuba to see some friends and we went to a bar until 3 am, and as we were walking back there were these 3 guys hiding in the shadows. we got so scared we started running but thankfully they did not follow.
oh wow. that is pretty scary. i would be horrified.
yeah it was quite an experience, my friends said those are usually drunk people who stay up the whole night talking with people. but they looked like they wanted to do more than talk!
label: afraid
response: well, at least they did not follow you. how is cuba? my parents are from there but i have never been.

situation: we had purchased and raised several chickens. one evening, i forgot to put them back in their coop. something killed all of them.
dialogue: i raised 6 chickens since they were babies. i was trying to let them free range but i forgot to put them back in their coop for the night. a predator was able to get to them.
oh no! that is sad, did he get them all?
yes, it did! i think it was a dog that always gets out of our neighbor's yard.
label: sad
response: aw, that is too bad, hopefully next time they will be safe in the coop!

situation: i was looking through some old clothes and found 40$ in the pockets, made my day!
dialogue: i was looking through old clothes that i was giving away and found $40 in one of the back pockets. made me very happy
wow, so what are you going to do with it?
oh i just put it into a little piggy bank i have, trying to get to $220 to cop some yeezys that are coming out in october. hope i get a pair!
label: surprised
response: nice, i hope that works out for you.. good luck

situation: i saw this youtube video of a guy eating a jellyfish and it was one of the most surreal things i have ever seen.
dialogue: i was watching youtube and saw this guy eat a jellyfish straight out of the ocean. looked like the most disgusting thing someone could eat.
that is gross, i cannot even imagine what that would taste like!
he said it had the texture of hard rubber and tasted of pure algae and just dead stuff. he even ate another one that he pan-fried and it was all green and moldy.
label: disgusted
response: that is so gross, i would take a hard pass on eating that. i like seafood but that is too much.

situation: one of my friends did jumped from the roof of his house to his pool and managed to actually make it into the pool. it was a good 10+ feet of distance
dialogue: one of my friends jumped from the roof of his house to the pool and somehow made it, it was like 10+ feet of distance, really amazing stuff.
omg, thankfully he was not hurt.
yeah i was really nervous that he was gonna get hurt since he likes to do stupid dares. it was quite the experience.
label: impressed
response: did yall happen to get it on video?

situation: i cannot wait to go to my brother's wedding.
dialogue: my older brother is getting married friday.
congrats!, i am sure you must be very happy!
i am very happy for him! i thought it was never going to happen!
label: excited
response: haha brotherly love, i hope him and the lucky gal have a wonderful life together!

situation: the happiest moment in my life was the day that we had our daughter. even though it was a painful experience, words cannot express how much happiness she has brought over the years.
dialogue: having a kid can be one of the most happy moments in a person's life. i cannot express how much happiness my daughter has brought to us since she was born.
thats amazing i cannot wait to have my own one day
it can be hard but it is one of the best experiences that i have had in life.
label: joyful
response: i bet so!

situation: im nervous for the new week to begin
dialogue: im nervous for the new week to begin
is there something that is making you nervous about the upcoming week?
very busy and lots of traveling
label: anxious
response: that can be stressful. i am sure that every thing with go smoothly for you! just remember that the weekend is only 5 days away!

situation: i spent ten minutes looking for my car keys while my friends were waiting for me and they were in my pocket the whole time.
dialogue: i spent 10 minutes looking for my car keys while my friends waited outside and they were in my pockets the whole time. my friends made sure i never forgot that moment haha
we all do stuff like that. at least you did not lock them inside your car. done that before!
oh thankfully i have never had to go through that yet. that one would really suck!
label: embarrassed
response: yeah nothing like calling the locksmith and admitting you are not very bright. haha.

situation: i feel so bad i lied to my friend.
dialogue: i told her i had to work because i did not want to go see a movie tonight.
did you not want to go out, or did you just not like the movie?
i was tired and wanted to get in bed early,
label: guilty
response: just be careful with that. if you feel tired due to stress, it may be the stress talking and not you.

situation: i had my finals last week, and i studied like crazy for it. felt so nice walking into that room and feeling calm.
dialogue: had my finals last week, studied really hard for them. felt so nice walking into that room so confident and calm
great, when will you know your scores?
thankfully i knew them right at the spot, i got a 98!
label: prepared
response: wow, that is fantastic.

situation: i am not sure how to tell my husband how it makes me feel when he is flirting with other women.
dialogue: he doesn;t seem to see the issue.
who does not?
my husband does not see flirting with girls a problem.
label: jealous
response: what a jerk! that is definitely a problem!

situation: i barely passed my finals
dialogue: i studied all week for my math finals and only scraped a 68 on it.
that is a real bummer. do you at least pass the class?
yeah, passed with a 75, not what i wanted but at least i passed
label: disappointed
response: well at least you do not have to take it again. could have been worse.

situation: i dropped my groceries in the parking lot
dialogue: i dropped my groceries in the parking lot
oh no, how awful for you! i hope people helped you to pick them up (and did not help themselves!).
i grabbed the cans that rolled away,
label: embarrassed
response: glad you find humor in it! i dropped a bottle of water once, which rolled under the car. i was livid!

situation: one of my roommates left without cleaning his room and the school charged me and the other two roommates 100$
dialogue: one of my roommates left without cleaning his room and the school charged me and my roommates 100$ each
that is extremely frustrating! what were they expecting you to do? it is not your fault your roommate left it trashed.

yeah that is what we told them but they showed us the paper saying that its one of the rules. we were so furious at that guy, worst thing is he never responded to our calls or texts. really immature and selfish of him.
label: angry
response: well, i guess the good news is that he no longer lives with you. but that blows, how hard is it to clean up after yourself before you leave?

situation: i went to a restaurant that had call ahead seating. i called ahead and was put on the wait list. we arrived 10 minutes later as directed. however, we still have to wait over 45 minutes for our table.
dialogue: a restaurant that i wanted to eat at had "call ahead seating" where you can call and get placed on a waiting list. i called ahead and was told we would have a table in 10 minutes. when we arrived 10 minutes later, our table was not ready!
that is so annoying. they should not call it that if they cannot guarantee 10 minutes.
that is what i told the hostess. there was no point in calling ahead if we still have to wait 45 minutes for a table.
label: annoyed
response: hopefully the food was at least worth the wait. i would have been annoyed as well.

situation: we had a puppy going through the chewing stage. i came home from the grocery store to find that he had taken the couch cushions off of the couch and chewed through the center!
