dialogue: we had a new puppy. he loved to chew on everything. i went to the grocery store and when i got back home, the puppy had pulled the cushions off of the couch. he had chewed through the bottom!
oh god! i have not had a puppy in a long time, but you forget all the things in your house that are not puppy-proof. they find ways to make messes in the most creative ways.
they do! i am really glad that that stage did not last too long in him. i just hated having to buy an entire new living room suite! puppies are expensive.
label: furious
response: yeah, that is a real headache. i would want to say they are worth it, but on that day i would not be so sure, haha.

situation: i accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone did not want to turn on anymore.
dialogue: i accidentally dropped my phone at the screen started to glitch out and did not want to turn on anymore. i was scared because it was a brand new phone. thankfully after a while of it just sitting there it turned back on normally.
that is a huge blessing, i do not know about you but my life is pretty much keyed into my phone.
same here, they are so incredibly important in this day and age.
label: afraid
response: it is almost a shame how much we depend on them, but i know i would be lost without mine.

situation: i am bothered by my neighbors loud power tools next door
dialogue: i am bothered by my neighbors loud power tools next door
do they run them all day long or at night?
during the morning and day on the weekends!
label: annoyed
response: is there any kind of noise ordinance in your area?  i know in ours unless they are still running them at 11pm, there is nothing the police will/can do about it unfortunately but i can imagine how annoying it is.

situation: my friends invited me camping, but i was scared to go; it was in the woods and i was afraid i might get a tick bite, seeing as ticks are on the rise.
dialogue: my best friends invited me to a camping trip but i was a little anxious about the whole thing.
i do not blame  you because i hate camping.
really? i was just really scared of getting bitten by a tick. i ended up enjoying the trip in the end!
label: apprehensive
response: oh i hate ticks and all the bugs.

situation: i was blown away by how great my friends were this weekend
dialogue: i was blown away by how great my friends were this weekend
what happened?
they were very supportive and kind , helping me with some moving things
label: impressed
response: you are lucky to have such great friends!

situation: i sliced my hand open trying to rip a beer can in two; i was at a park with some friends and i was scared i would pass out from blood loss.
dialogue: a few weeks ago i was drinking with some friends at a park and i sliced my hand open while trying to rip a beer can in two.
oh that sucks, i hope it has healed since then
it has! the cut was so deep and i was bleeding so much i was scared of passing out from blood loss.
label: terrified
response: ouch, that sounds awful

situation: i was shocked how nice the weather was this morning
dialogue: i was shocked how nice the weather was this morning
how come? have you had awful weather lately?
not really but it was just especially nice this morning
label: surprised
response: oh i see. beautiful weather is an excellent start to the day!

situation: i packed up all my things and moved out of state.
dialogue: i decided to move to be with my boyfriend.
oh? big decision. i hope you feel good about it!
i did, but i had to leave all my family behind
label: sad
response: aw, but they will always be there for you when you visit. you have to do what you want to in life, after all

situation: im mad at my neighbor today
dialogue: im mad at my neighbor today
oh that sucks! what did your neighbor do to get you angry?
he was using powertools loud in the morning
label: angry
response: how inconsiderate. people should have more common sense than your neighbor.

situation: last christmas, i had saved up quite a bit of money to buy all my family and girlfriend nice gifts. it made me feel warm and happy.
dialogue: last christmas, i saved up a lot of money and was able to buy my family and girlfriend really nice gifts.
thats awesome, i always loved giving gifts more than receiving them
me too! the act of giving makes me feel so warm and happy.
label: joyful
response: me too!

situation: the teacher i had for calculus 2 was so awful, i had to learn the course all on my own. i was able to pass the course and i felt so good about myself.
dialogue: the teacher i had for calculus 2 last semester was so terrible at his job, i had to learn it all on my own.
i hate when i get teachers that are clueless. makes you wonder how they got the job.
same here. surprisingly, i was able to pass the course and i felt so good about myself!
label: proud
response: well done. you should feel proud for teaching yourself.

situation: i felt happy this morning because it was sunny and warm
dialogue: i felt happy this morning because it was sunny and warm
that is always a great start to a day.
absolutely, i was overjoyed
label: joyful
response: how are you celebrating it?

situation: i have an exam coming up and i have studied all week for it. i am feeling really good about going into it.
dialogue: i have a big exam coming up tomorrow.
oh wow. what is the exam on?
it is on pc architecture. i am feeling pretty good about it though. i studied really hard all week.
label: confident
response: that is really great. i am sure you will do well on the test.

situation: on my way back from a funeral, my friends and i almost got into a deadly car crash. the driver was falling asleep on the road and drove on the wrong lane directly towards us.
dialogue: on my way back from a funeral, my friends and i almost got into a deadly car crash.
oh no, what happened?
i think the other driver was falling asleep on the road. out of nowhere, he moved onto the wrong lane directly towards us.
label: terrified
response: well that is really lucky you were able to avoid that. hopefully he did not hurt anyone else.

situation: i was so happy that i finally got to leave retail and get a better job.
dialogue: i was so happy that after many years in retail i found a better job.
congratulations! retail really does suck.
yeah it does. it really made me dislike people a lot.
label: excited
response: understandably. my girlfriend is a student and works in retail part-time. she says the same thing.

situation: when i listened to a particular album recently it brought me back to when i was in high school. it reminded me of who showed me the album.
dialogue: do you ever hear an album and it brings you back to when you first listened to it?
oh, all the time. what album is that for you?
i just listened to a billy talent album again the other day and it brought me back to high school and reminded me of the person who showed me them.
label: nostalgic
response: i really love that album! we will have to listen to it together sometime.

situation: my older sister stole my younger brother's ipod touch to pawn. i was so furious, especially because he is the sweetest most innocent kid.
dialogue: a while back, my older sister stole my younger brother's ipod touch to sell.
that sucks. did she make a lot of money off of it?
no idea. all i know is that i was furious, especially seeing as my brother is the sweetest most innocent kid ever.
label: angry
response: i would've been very angry too. i hope the money went towards something useful.

situation: i was planning on going to a concert last night but i did not go because i ended up not wanting to go by myself. i feel like i am going to regret not going.
dialogue: last night was quite a bummer.
i am sorry to hear that. why was it a bummer?
i was planning on going to a concert but ended up not going at the last minute because i did not want to go by myself. i feel like i am going to regret not going.
label: anxious
response: that really stinks. i bet you felt really lonely and filled my regret.

situation: today is my first day off in a long time. i am playing some zelda on the switch, and i am feeling pretty happy!
dialogue: after working for a week straight and running a lot of errands, today is my first day off in a while.
that must feel very refreshing. would you say you feel content?
it is, i am super happy. currently playing some zelda on the switch, it could not get any better than this!
label: content
response: nice! i want to get that game next week. looks really cool.

situation: my older brother always makes promises he cannot keep. recently, he said he was going to bring me out to sushi for my birthday, but he always postpones it.
dialogue: my older brother always makes promises he cannot keep.
that is disappointing. i wonder why he is like that.
i do not know why. recently we were supposed to go out for sushi lunch together, but he keeps postponing it. i will ask him for a definitive day.
label: disappointed
response: i hope he does not let you down.

situation: my brother graduated from college the other day. i was so happy for him. he put in so much work.
dialogue: i am so happy for my brother!
something good happen to him recently?
he just graduated from college. he put in so much work.
label: impressed
response: that is amazing! tell him congratulations from a friendly stranger.

situation: my little brother failed his french class and had to spend three weeks in summer school. it hurt my heart seeing him have to go to school while all his friends were having fun.
dialogue: my little brother failed his french class and had to spend three weeks in summer school.
oh no, that is not good! he is not the only one that is not great at french. most of my family spoke french as a second language when i was growing up and i still never picked it up!
french is a really hard language, i have trouble too so it really hurt my heart seeing him go to school while all his friends and siblings were having fun without him.
label: sad
response: hopefully he will get to enjoy his next summer.

situation: my boyfriend and a couple friends went over to his mom's house to check on things. his brothers got into a fist fight while we were there and my boyfriend jumped in the middle.
dialogue: my boyfriend's brothers got into a fist fight one night and he jumped in the middle.
that sucks. did anyone get hurt?
some things got broke and there were some bruises, but it was really scary to watch that.
label: terrified
response: i bet. i would've hid under the table.

situation: i am blessed to have a great family
dialogue: i am blessed to have a great family
that is nice. why do you say that?
they are just the best and always very helpful
label: proud
response: that is great to hear. i wish i had a helpful family.

situation: my sister in law is always thinking of herself and not taking anyone else's schedules into account.
dialogue: whenever my sister in law plans things, she only does it around her schedule.
that is really selfish. have you talked to her about it?
yeah, but she says she tries her best and thinks she is doing what is best for everyone. however, we are the only ones with kids on a schedule.
label: annoyed
response: well, at least that is the case. people can only do so much.

situation: i could not find anyone that wanted to hangout this weekend. i had to spend the weekend by myself.
dialogue: this weekend was kind of a drag.
oh yeah? why is that?
i could not find anyone that wanted to hangout so i had to spend the whole weekend by myself.
label: lonely
response: well sometimes that is not a bad thing really. you did not enjoy it at all?

situation: i have been thinking a lot about the vacations i have had when i was younger with my family. i miss those times a lot.
dialogue: the vacations i used to take when i was younger with my family have been on mind lately.
are the good memories at least?
oh yeah, but it really makes me miss those times.
label: nostalgic
response: at least you have those memories. you should go on a vacation soon!

situation: this new trailer for spyro remastered really has me thinking about the times i used to play the original. the old friend i played it with i do not keep in touch with anymore.
dialogue: i am looking forward to this new game.
which one?
the new spyro remastered. it really makes feel think back to when i used to play the original with an old friend of mine.
label: nostalgic
response: i have actually have not played that series. when does it come out?

situation: i felt bad because i told my sister in law i would help her with her books. after this last one i told her i had too much going on and could not do it no more.
dialogue: i told my sister in law that i would help her with her books. after this last one, i felt bad because i told her i could not anymore.
that is rough. why cannot you help her?
i just have too much going on now with two kids, and working from home.
label: guilty
response: yeah, i am in the same boat. it is a hard knock life out there.

situation: i saw some person eat like 30 hamburgers in mcdonalds
dialogue: i saw some person eat like 30 hamburgers in mcdonalds
how long did it take them?
i think he was making a youtube video so he was eating very fast, so like 10 minutes
label: impressed
response: he must of been sick after.

situation: one time i bought emergency supplies before a hurricane
dialogue: one time i bought emergency supplies before a hurricane
that was probably a good plan to buy them ahead of time
yup, people started charging like $5 per bottle of water
label: prepared
response: wow, that is insane.  i feel like that is illegal

situation: my son was caught cheating on a test. i really thought we raised him better than to do such things.
dialogue: i just got some frustrating news the other day.
what was the news?
my son got caught cheating on a test. i really thought we raised him better than to do such things but here we are.
label: disappointed
response: are you going to ground him?

situation: my sister in law and her fiance are taking all these trips abroad and we are struggling just to get our bills paid.
dialogue: my sister in law and her fiance are always taking trips abroad and we hardly ever go anywhere.
why do not you join them?
we definitely do not have money for that, plus there are four of us.
label: jealous
response: why do not you get another job?

situation: i got news that my grandfather passed away. nobody saw it coming.
dialogue: ugh. i got some awful news the other day.
that is too bad. what happened? is everyone ok?
i got news that my grandfather passed away. he was old but no one saw it coming.
label: sad
response: oh i am so sorry to hear that. i hoep your family is strong enough to support you through this.

situation: there was a time that i came home and my lights were on in the house and my door was unlocked and it had me really scared, i had my cell phone ready to dial 911 but noone was in my home and i never did figure it out
dialogue: hi there was a time that i was scared out of my mind i came home and my front door was unlocked and the lights were on in the house
holy cow.  was anything missing?
no and that was the weird thing nothing was taken
label: afraid
response: had they gone through anything?

situation: my son recently had a birthday, and we had quite a few people over to celebrate.  he told everyone thank you without being asked to.
dialogue: we recently celebrated my son's birthday, and had a big party.
oh yeah that must have been a good time
it was! he got a lot of cool toys, and ate a bunch of ice cream.
label: proud
response: those are the best times when they still like to play with toy's mine lost interest years ago and i miss it

situation: next month my wife and i are taking our first vacation together. we have been saving a long time for this.
dialogue: next month my wife and i will take our first vacation since we got married.
that is awesome i will never forget the first time me and my wife went on vacation, where do you have planned to go?
we are going to hawaii for a whole week. we have saved a long time to be able to afford this, i can barely wait till next month.
label: excited
response: that sounds like you guys will spend a lovely time over there good luck

situation: when i saw my mom after a long time i feel something
dialogue: do you feel when you see your mom after a long time
i miss her. you have not seen your mom in a long time?
why! what is the reason
label: sentimental
response: i am sorry, but i cannot understand what you are saying.

situation: last year, heavy rainfall caused my basement to flood. i lost all of my childhood photos as well as many irreplaceable things from my past.
dialogue: last year, during the spring, extremely heavy rainfall caused our basement to become flooded.
oh man! i have been there, i hope you did not have anything special down there??
i lost all of my childhood photos and many of my childhood toys and things i had saved, my bible from my late grandmother being one of the items.
label: devastated
response: oh lord, i am so sorry! i have been there, that is hard!

situation: last week, my coworkers all got together and had a party for me for my 20th anniversary at work. i had no idea they were doing this.
dialogue: last week, my coworkers all got together and threw me at party for my 20th anniversary at work.
taht sounds like fun, i wish i had coworkers that nice ahahah. did you enjoy the party?
yes, it was great. i had no idea it was even happening, they are so sneaky.
label: surprised
response: ahahaah seems to be they really like you working threre

situation: my dog is really sick. i do not know if he is going to make it.
dialogue: i took my dog to the vet yesterday. it turns out that he is really sick.
aww, i am sorry.  is he going to be ok?
it is not looking too good. i really hope he pulls through.
label: sad
response: i do too.  that is one of the saddest things.  i hope you will be ok too.

situation: i recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week. it is still not here!
dialogue: i was working on a project in this past week, could not find it locally, so ended up ordering it online.
wow nice
not really, it still hasn't shown up!  i am pretty annoyed!
label: disappointed
response: ooops sorry to hear that

situation: i saw a deer get hit by a car yesterday.
dialogue: i saw a deer get hit by a car yesterday.
oh that sucks. did someone move it out of the way?
it was not dead, it was injured and moved to the brush on the side of the road. it was upsetting.
label: sad
response: yea you never like to see stuff like that.

situation: i found a 10 dollar bill in my mailbox this morning! i have no idea who put it there, but it was a nice thing to find.
dialogue: i opened up my mailbox this morning and there was a 10 dollar bill just sitting there inside!
did you try to find its owner?
i asked my neighbors about it, no one knew anything about it. i guess it was left there intentionally.
label: surprised
response: well that was nice of someone

situation: a co-worker i work with on a project has been late.  it is been very irritating trying to get things done
dialogue: a co-worker i have been working on a project with has been late
that is annoying, are you going to talk to them about it?
i plan on doing that, it is pretty disruptive
label: annoyed
response: i hope it all works out in the end.

situation: i just finished a major project at work.  i am praying my supervisor likes what i have done for the client
dialogue: i just finished a major project at work for a client
awesome! can you say what kind of project it is?
not at the moment, but i am praying my supervisor and client likes it
label: hopeful
response: i hope so too! projects can be stressful!

situation: my cat hasn't been feeling well this past week, i think there might be something really wrong.
dialogue: i have an appointment for tomorrow. i am hoping the same thing.
what is the appointment for?
my cat hasn't been feeling well this past week, i think there might be something really wrong.
label: afraid
response: let's hope not! my prayers are with her.

situation: my cat hasn't been feeling well this past week, i think there might be something really wrong.
dialogue: thank you. i hope it is something that he will get over soon.
you are welcome. it is always nerve wrecking when family is sick like that.
label: afraid
response: i think there might be something wrong with the platform at the moment.

situation: i took my kid's phone away as punishment for getting on the phone late at night. she found the phone and was watching youtube. she needs to start preparing to get up early for school.
dialogue: my child needs to start going to bed early to prep for school. last night, i caught her sneaking her phone and watching tv at 12am.
oh man, sounds like most kids. she is gonna hate it at first, but getting to bed early will help with her future.
i have tried to explain that to her. it is like it goes in one ear and out the other. it bugs me.
label: annoyed
response: well yea, they are young right now and cannot see the consequences yet.

situation: last week a group of coworkers won $100,000 on the lottery. they play the same numbers every week as a group.
dialogue: a group of coworkers who play the same lottery numbers every week won $100,000 on the pick 6 last week.
that is so lucky, they must be so happy they bought that ticket
they had asked me if i wanted to go in with them, and i said no. i regret that now, i could have really used a share of that money.
label: jealous
response: i know that is such a bomber you must have been so angry hahaha

situation: i am sure i did very well on my test.
dialogue: i studied really had so i am sure i will pass my test!
what kind of test is it
it was my science final for college.
label: confident
response: oh i hope you do well then

situation: i was pretty envious when my best friend went on a 14 day cruise to europe.
dialogue: my friend went on a 14 day cruise to europe. i wish that could have been me!
wow i did not even know they had cruises that go on for that long
right? talk about ultimate relaxation!
label: jealous
response: yea i wonder how much something like that costs . i guess if you have to ask you cannot afford it as they say

situation: my son is supposed to be sending me some money. i have been waiting for several days now.
dialogue: my son is supposed to be sending me some money.
that is really nice of him, how much time will you have to wait?
hopefully not too much longer. i have been waiting for a few days now.
label: anticipating
response: well i hope everything goes well at the bank and with the transaction

situation: i am scared of another hurricane coming through florida. i had a bad experience last year.
dialogue: i am scared of another hurricane coming through florida. i had a bad experience last year.
that is horrible, natural disaster are the worst because you cannot do anything against them
no, all you can do is try to prepare. do you live anywhere where there is threat of natural disasters?
label: afraid
response: not really, the worst thing that can happen where i live is a thunderstorm

situation: when my son was born, it seemed like my life was complete. i have everything now that i could ever want.
dialogue: when my son was born it felt like i had everything i needed in life.
i bet that was a wonderful day
it really was, my life finally felt complete.
label: content
response: i am very happy for you

situation: i got passed over for a promotion at my job last week, even though i had more experience than the other people that applied.
dialogue: i got passed over for a promotion at work last week, even thought i had more experience than the other applicants.
that is not good, have you expressed your feelings to your boss?
i did, and it looks like i may be looking for a new job soon as they want to take the company in a new direction.
label: disappointed
response: well i hope everything goes well for you, you will sure find something fitting for you do not worry

situation: i started my first office job after college and did not know what to expect.
dialogue: i remember when i started my first office job out of college. i was nervous because i did not know what to expect.
it is a whole new world when that happens, i can totally understand. how'd you cope with it?
i just tried to keep an open mind and go with the flow. it was hard to get used to sitting at a desk for 8 hours a day, but i soon got used to it.
label: apprehensive
response: it is always best to just open your mind to anything that could happen. it is the best way to learn.

situation: i found some mold growing out in the garage.  it took awhile to clean off
dialogue: i found some mold growing out in the garage
oh no, that is bad.   have you had someone come out and check the hose?
i ended up cleaning it myself, i think i got most of it out
label: disgusted
response: may be worth letting your insruance comapny know. usually they have clauses that you have to tell them as soon as you see it otherwise they will not cover any of it.

situation: the day we finally found our rotty pup and got to go get him.  that was one of the most joyful days in my life and i just could not wait.
dialogue: i was thinking about when we finally got to go pick up rodimus after all that waiting!  i have never been so excited in my life.
what is that?
it is our rotty pup! sorry haha
label: excited
response: oh that explains it!

situation: yesterday, at the grocery store i saw a lady spanking her child. the child only asked for a candy bar and was not being out of the norm for children.
dialogue: i saw a child ask for a candy bar that the grocery store yesterday. the mother spanked the child in front over every one in the line!
wow when the child just asked?!
yes! it was awful! luckily the man behind her spoke up. i could tell she was embarrassed but i was furious at her!
label: angry
response: i am only afraid that the mom is going to let out that embarassment on her child once they get home.

situation: one time i saw someone's dog pooping in my lawn and they did not pick it up!
dialogue: one time i saw someone's dog pooping in my lawn and they did not pick it up!
omg that is so gross!
yes, i wanted to throw it back at them!
label: angry
response: that would be a memorable lesson to learn. the best lessons are learned that hard way, after all.

situation: i used a public restroom. afterwards i walked around the store. i had been walking around with toilet paper stuck to my shoe the entire time!
dialogue: i used the bathroom at walmart the other day. i walked around the store for about 30 minutes before i realized i had toilet paper stuck to my shoe!
oh god. that is kinda gross.
i felt gross hahaha i kicked it off of my shoe and stuffed it under a rack. i hope know one saw.
label: embarrassed
response: rest in peace whoever touches that rack.

situation: my son just started a new school.  the communication with them has been terrible!
dialogue: my son just started a new school.  the communication with them has been terrible!
oh dear. how do they let the parents know what is going on?
i sometimes find out but it seems so disorganized!
label: annoyed
response: that sounds really frustrating. i am sorry that is happening!

situation: we went with our friends to a local lagoon. there are huge cliffs to jump off of. they dared me to jump off of the highest one.
dialogue: we went to the lagoon a few weeks ago. my friends dared me to jump off of the highest cliff into the water.
oh wow.  terrifying.  all i think of is johnny erricson tada, who broke her neck in that situation. did you do it?
that was what i was worried about! i ended up not jumping off of the highest one. i was too scared. i did jump off of the smallest one. that was really fun!
label: terrified
response: you did the right thing!  oh fun!  i am glad you were safe and had a blast!

situation: i have a test coming up in a few days. i know that i will ace it.
dialogue: i have a test coming up in one of my classes this week.
do you feel ready for it?
oh yeah, i am definitely ready. i know i am going to pass.
label: confident
response: awesome, hope it goes as planned!

dialogue: i had about 6 or 7 hummingbirds in my yard the other day feeding.
oh how exciting! did you take any pictures?
no. my camera is not good enough to get good pictures, they are so small.
label: surprised
response: awww..that is a bit disappointing, but really cool that you got to see them!

situation: i was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than i did and it was sold already.
dialogue: i was trying to buy a piece of property that came up on the market, but someone put in a bid before i got a chance and it has already sold.
the market can be competitive if the price is right. they will sell immediatley.
it is a piece of property that my grandfather owned and i pretty much grew up on, i would have really liked to have owned it.
label: disappointed
response: that would have been awesome if you got it.

situation: i had a presentation at work. i worked really hard on it and went over it several times the night before.
dialogue: i worked for weeks on a presentation for work. i practiced over and over. i felt relaxed the morning of.
that is good! that probably means you worked on it until it became something you are proud of.
you are right! i was really proud of it! i am glad i worked so hard on it. it lessened the anxiety that i usually have!
label: prepared
response: maybe i could learn from that. i get really nervous when i have to do any public speaking, so maybe if i just prepared for it better it would help.

situation: i trusted my friends to pay me back the cash that they owed me
dialogue: i was under the impression that my friends would pay me back.
what did they do to you?
they owed me money but never paid me back. i suppose it is not a huge deal though.
label: trusting
response: it happens sometimes. you may ask them directly to pay back.

situation: i worked really hard with my daughter last year to learn her multiplication facts. i gave her a quiz last week and  she failed.
dialogue: i worked with daughter for months with learning her multiplication tables. we have practiced and practiced and she still does not know them all!
i totally get that.  i am in the same place with my daughter.  i home school and she is learning them too. give it time and she will get it soon.  its so much to memorize at once!
we homeschool too! i hope she can get them soon! it will make this year's math so much easier!
label: disappointed
response: that is awesome!  she will!  the best thing about homeschooling is that they can learn more at their own pace.  i am not looking forward to division! ha ha

situation: i am going on a hiking trip soon.  i just finished buying supplies
dialogue: i am going on a hiking trip soon
do you hike very often?
here and there when i have time
label: prepared
response: i have never been hiking, really! i would like to go some day.

situation: i scrapbook and am years behind.  i am a stay at home mom, my son just started all day school, so i plan to scrapbook.
dialogue: i scrapbook pictures of my son and i am a few years behind!
oh, such fun!  do you have all the stamp it up scrapbooking things i hear so much about? i bet it can be hard to keep it updated! they grow so fast!
my son just started school all day, so i plan to start scrapbooking.  i do not use stamp it up though.
label: excited
response: perfect!  now you will be caught up in no time.  i know you will be so gratified to finish and be able to look at all of them when he is much older.

situation: earlier this week, my cat sam passed away. he was 17 years old. it is been odd not having him asleep at my feet while i work.
dialogue: this past weekend, my cat sam passed away, he was 17 years old.
so sorry to hear of sam's passing.
yeah,it is been really strange the past few days without him asleep on my feet while i work.
label: sad
response: may your many memories of sam help you to sustain at this difficult time.

situation: i am content with life.
dialogue: i have nothing to complain about. life is good.
that is awesome.  i am with you on that.  tough times might pop up now and then but life really is great.  i do not like to take it for granted.
no point in being a pessimist.
label: content
response: exactly! you will go far with that attitude!

situation: i baked a cake for my boyfriend's birthday and it turned out to be so delicious! he was so excited.
dialogue: i baked a cake for my boyfriend's birthday and it turned out to be so delicious! he was so excited.
mmm, now you are making me hungry for cake. what kind of cake was it?
black forest cake! it happens to be both our favorite kind of cake. i made it from scratch. what is your favorite cake?
label: proud
response: personally i am a huge fan of red velvet, but black forest is amazing too!

situation: i felt so bad when i had to board my dog while i was on vacation.
dialogue: i felt so bad when i had to board my dog while i was on vacation. it made me feel like a bad dog mom!
aww, i know that can be hard, but you cannot be too hard on yourself.  sometimes you do not have a choice.
i know. she was so excited when we came home though which made us feel a bit better.
label: guilty
response: absence makes the heart grow fonder.

situation: i am proud of myself.
dialogue: i am happy with the person that i grew up to be.
what are some of your best traits?
i am healthy!
label: proud
response: do you exercise often?

situation: i was super happy when i got to bring my new puppy home.  we had been looking for the perfect breeder for a rotty for a long time and saving up money.
dialogue: so we finally found the perfect rotty breeder and we got to pick up our puppy this week!
oh boy that is great news! i hope you did not drop a pretty penny on it! haha, and even if you did, dogs are worth it.
no he was the runt so we got him on the cheap side!  he is soo sweet!  i am so happy
label: joyful
response: hey runts are the best! they need love too. either way, i am glad you were paired up with the perfect companion.

situation: i love going to disney world. it makes me remember all the wonderful memories i made there as a child.
dialogue: i love going to disney world. it makes me remember all the wonderful memories i made there as a child.
i have never been, but it looks like so much fun.
it is a great place for both kids and adults! i do not have any kids yet, but cannot wait to bring mine when i have them someday.
label: nostalgic
response: it would be so much fun to go there as a family.

situation: sometimes when i am out in public, my son throws a tantrum.  every now and then he uses curse words and he is only 5!
dialogue: sometimes when i am out in public, my son throws a tantrum.
oh yeah i am right there with you, i just do not even go out anymore if i can help it! how old is yours? mines 2 1/2
mine is 5.  every now and then, he says a curse word, uses it properly too!
label: embarrassed
response: they are too smart for their own good

situation: i was getting ready to make a sandwich, when i discovered that the bread that i was going to use has mold on it. gross!
dialogue: i was just about to make a sandwich to eat, when i discovered something really gross.
what did you see? please do not tell me there was a bug in your bread
no, there were not any bugs. but there was mold.
label: disgusted
response: ewwww, so nasty! i almost ate a molded avocado today. good thing i noticed before scooping it

situation: our marketing manager at work recently added a ton of new tasks to my workload that were not part of my job when i was brought on. i am a little irritated, like she is passing her work off on me.
dialogue: the head of marketing at my job recently dumped a bunch of new tasks on me and my coworker. i feel like she is just lazy and making us do her job.
or maybe she just knows you are a great worker and very responsible? i hope you will get a raise after completing those tasks
ha, that is a really nice way of looking at it but nah i am pretty sure it is mostly laziness.
label: annoyed
response: did you try talking to her about it? just be straight forward and tell you how you feel

situation: i was pulling into the gas station and this kid felt the need to not only almost hit me but also call me extremely awful names.
dialogue: i cannot believe this!  some kid at the gas station nearly hit me and then had the nerve to call me awful names!
did you call the police?
no!  i got so flustered and kind of paniked.
label: furious
response: its horrible to have to got through things like thaty

situation: i nailed the review for this year and was able to get an okay raise!  i also am up for promotion if the company gets bigger!
dialogue: guess what!  i nailed my review for this year and got a raise!
that is great! i am so happy for you!
thank you! i worked so hard and i am so freaking excited!  i am also up for a promotion if we keep growing!
label: proud
response: ooh, will you be managing anyone?

situation: i dropped my dang coffee on the group and not only that but it splashed me as well.
dialogue: i freaking dropped my coffee on the ground this morning
i hear you! i drop things all the time. was it one you just bought?
yes.  and to make it even worse i soaked myself!
label: angry
response: ugh! were you away from home?

situation: my stepdaughter graduated from college and got a great job in san francisco.
dialogue: my stepdaughter graduated from college in may and got a job in san francisco making 3 times more than i have ever made.
oh wow, she is doing great. i know it probably feels a bit bad that she is making so much more than you, but hopefully you can find  away to be proud of her.
i am definitely proud! it does not feel bad at all. i am so happy about how much drive she has to succeed.
label: proud
response: oh well that is great! some people would get a little jealous. i am glad you are proud of her, i am sure she worked very hard for her success!

situation: i finally got all of my work done for the day. now i can go home and just relax for the rest of the evening.
dialogue: whew. i finally got all of my work done for the day.
that is a good feeling!
it really is! now i can go home and just relax for the rest of the evening.
label: content
response: nice! no kids at home?

situation: i have a dentist appointment tomorrow and it is starting to make me a bit nervous.  i have to get a filling replaced.
dialogue: i am so nervous.  i have to go to the dentist tomorrow to get a filling replaced.
are you afraid of the dentist?
i am!  i had a bad experience with one when i was younger.
label: anxious
response: i am sorry to hear that, i am pretty terrified of the dentist myself. ask for gas! good luck, i am sure everything will be just fine.

situation: i recently spoke at a conference. it was a little nerve-wracking but i was really excited and felt great as i knew that i knew my speech front to back without needing to practice too much.
dialogue: i spoke at a conference recently. i was a little scared going into it but felt great as i knew i knew my speech.
oh nice! that is super brave of you.
i am actually one of those fortunate people who does not have a fear of public speaking.
label: confident
response: that is a great skill to have!

situation: i was cleaning out the attic when i found a box full of old photos albums. it was a lot of fun looking at pictures of the past.
dialogue: i was cleaning out my attic and found a box full of old photo albums. i spent the next few hours looking at old photos and having a great time.
that must have been a nice feeling.
it really was. i miss a lot of the people in the photos, made me really smile to see their faces again.
label: nostalgic
response: i love that nostalgic feeling.

situation: my dog keeps attempting to chew up my shoes no matter where i put them!  it is like he is hunting them.
dialogue: i am so irritated.  my dog keeps trying to eat up my shoes no matter where i put them!
haha, sounds like my pupper, is she still young?
yeah she is only about six months.  despite all her chew toys its still my shoes she craves.
label: annoyed
response: right!? it is weird, you buy them all the toys in the world, but they still go after your stuff.

situation: my husband works long hours. i hate being by myself specially at night.
dialogue: my husband works late at night and sometimes i am stuck by myself.
why he is working late?
he owns his own business working on cars. if something goes wrong, he is forced to stay to fix the issue.
label: lonely
response: i understand. could you plan to do something when he is late (going out with friends)?

situation: my cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car! he does not even have a job
dialogue: my aunt just signed for my cousin to get an fj cruiser! that is my dream car! he does not even have a job.
aww man that sucks for you
it does! maybe he will at least let me drive it!
label: jealous
response: hopefully! it is your dream car after all

situation: i am looking forward to visiting a friend over the weekend.  we'll have lots of fun together
dialogue: i am looking forward to visiting a friend over the weekend
that should be fun. any big planes?
nothing too big, probably just wander around town
label: excited
response: that will be nice to catch up.

situation: my upstairs neighbor moved out recently and left all her trash and furniture in our parking lot next to the garbage cans. no one has a place to park! i am so mad.
dialogue: i am so irritated at my neighbor. she moved out recently and left all her garbage and old furniture in our parking lot by the garbage.
that is not very considerate of her. was she a bad neighbor while she lived there too? some people!
not at all, that is what is so weird! she was really polite, quiet, and neat.
label: angry
response: i wonder what could have changed? either way, i would be pretty pissed off.

situation: there were a bunch of layoffs at my job. i was so happy to see that i was one of the few people that got to keep their job.
dialogue: last week the plant i work at was hit with massive layoffs.
oh no! that is terrible!
i was fortunate enough to be one of the very few who got to keep their job, i am happy but very sad for the others.
label: grateful
response: i understand. layoffs are hard. my brother in law has been through a lot of those at factories!

situation: two years ago my wife and i got divorced. it is been very strange in this big house all by myself.
dialogue: two years ago my wife and i got divorced. it has been very odd in this big house all by myself.
how do you feel these days?
it has gotten a little better with time, but still a pretty sore spot for me.
label: lonely
response: it must be difficult, do you think she will come back ever?

situation: i got laid off a few months back and was really worried about paying my bills. it was consuming me. but i ended up getting a new job the week my unemployment ran out!
dialogue: i lost my job earlier this year. i was really worried about how to pay my bills and finding a new job.
ouch! that is rather painful. what are you doing now?
well that is the cool thing. the week my unemployment ran out i got a job offer. at my former company, no less. so everything worked out!
label: anxious
response: wow! that is like a paid vacation!

situation: a friend of mine bought a scratch off ticket at the gas station and won $2000. i buy them all the time and only win a couple bucks here and there.
dialogue: last week a friend of mine won $2000 on a scratch off ticket. i buy those things all the time and never win squat.
wow, that is incredible. what is their secret?
right place, right time i guess. some people are just lucky.
label: jealous
response: congrats to your friend. i hope they share!

situation: when my niece got send home from school sick i was a bit worried and nervous
dialogue: my niece got sent home from school yesterday with that stomach bug that is going around
that is unfortunate, hope you do not get it as well!
i know!  i have been pretty worried about her.  she is such a tiny thing.
label: caring
response: i am sure she will be fine with some rest and a little bit of time.

situation: i lost my phone. i thought it was gone forever but then i got a message on facebook "from myself," the person who found it was trying to get it back to me!
dialogue: my phone went missing. imagine my surprise when i got a facebook message "from myself," it was the person who found it saying "i have your phone."
wow. that is kind of creepy actually. were you able to get it back?
i was! the guy was really nice and refused the cash i tried to give him as a reward.
label: surprised
response: you are very lucky he was nice and did not steal any of your data.

situation: i recently had new neighbors move in. i asked if i could see how they decorated their condo just out of curiosity and wow, i could not believe what a great job they did in there.
dialogue: i just got some new neighbors. i am kinda nosy so i asked if i could take a look at how they decorated, just out of curiosity.
did you bring them a pan of ludefisk first? what did they say?

nah, although i did consider brownies. they were happy to meet me so it was all good. but man i could not believe how nice their place looked compared to mine! i am a little jealous of their interior decorating skills.
label: impressed
response: next time they let you in, just steal all your favorite pieces of decor and replace them with brownies.

situation: i caught my daughter singing the spice girls when she was little. she thought it was a brand new song!
dialogue: my kid was signing the spice girls a few years ago. she thought she had discovered a new band! she asked if i had ever heard of them before.
yeah, they are cute like that. how old is she ?
she almost 11 now. she loves to listen to all of the bands from when i was younger. it is really cute.
label: nostalgic
response: i have a 10 year old like that.

situation: my daughter practiced her gymnastics skills every day all summer. she made this team after all of her hard work.
dialogue: my daughter practiced her gymnastics every day all summer. we just found out that she made the team!
that is amazing. watching your children succeed is so rewarding
it is! i cannot wait to see what is in store for her future! maybe a scholarship!
label: impressed
response: that is awesome. i hope she has very much success in her gymnastic endevours.

situation: my grandma threw out my high school yearbooks. i am not overly nostalgic about high school or anything but it made me kind of mad, they cannot be replaced.
dialogue: my grandma threw away my high school yearbooks.
that is awful! i hope that she did not mean too!
i do not think she realized what they were. i was pretty irritated as they cannot be replaced but what can you do?
label: annoyed
response: yeah, it really sounds like she did not mean to. sometimes you can find copies online if you look.

situation: our dog passed away after 8 years of having in the family.
dialogue: we have had our dog for over 8 years. he past away this spring.
i am so so sorry!  we lost our chihuahua in february, so i completely understand that feeling.  was he sick prior to passing away or was it sudden?
it was sudden. he was completely fine when we went to bed. no issues at all. its been hard for our daughter
label: devastated
response: i think it might actually be harder to watch our kids go through that kind of loss than to actually go through it ourselves.  our pup was our daughter's dog and she was sick prior to passing, so we knew it was coming.  still does not really help though.  we ended up adopting a pup from the shelter that had lost her human mom it was meant to me my daughter lost her pup and this pup had lost her mom.  it is helped, something to think about at least.

situation: i bought my daughter her first cell phone. i think it takes a lot of responsibility
dialogue: i bought my daughter her first cell phone. it is a lot of responsibility for her. i hope she is ready for it.
i am sure she will be smart with it
i hope so. she has done well with tablets so i am hoping she will do the same with a phone
label: trusting
response: you can always show her the ways

situation: i accidentally knocked a little kid over when i was coming out of the grocery store the other day. i should not feel bad as it was a total accident but i do.
dialogue: i accidentally knocked over a little kid coming out of the store the other day.
were they okay?
yeah thankfully he was totally fine. but i felt so bad.
label: ashamed
response: at least you are not getting sued

situation: i am going skydiving this weekend.
dialogue: i am going skydiving this weekend. my stomach all ready hurts with fear.
do not worry you will be fine.  it is safe.
this is my 3rd time and i am still scared
label: terrified
response: i am surprised you have not started to relax a little yet.

situation: we moved into a very old house that was built 200 years ago. every creek and crack is spooky.
dialogue: we moved into a 200 year old house. there are creeks and cracks that creep me out!
i can only imagine. at least its nice in the day time though?
sometimes. i try to avoid that attic during any time of the day! there is also a weird door about knee-height. when you open it up, it is just big enough to fit a storage tub.
label: afraid
response: i am not sure i would do well in that house

situation: after my mom died i found all our old cassette tapes in her storage unit. it was nice to be able to revisit the music we used to listen to on road trips when i was younger.
dialogue: after my mom passed away i found all our old cassette tapes in her storage, listening to those was pretty cool.
bet that brought back good memories.
definitely, brought me right back to the road trips we took when i was younger.
label: sentimental
response: where did you guys usually go?

situation: i have spent all day getting my kit ready for the next competition this weekend. i am exhausted.
dialogue: i have spent all day getting my kit ready for the next competition this weekend. i am exhausted.
whats the competition on ?
highland games. i throw the caber and heavy hammer.
label: prepared
response: nice hope you win , ill be looking into this further

situation: i am so angry at my self. i was in my performance review today and i passed wind in front of my boss. omg
dialogue: i am so angry at my self. i was in my performance review today and i passed wind in front of my boss. omg
i wonder how that was noted on your report.
i got a raise so not that bad but it was still off putting. i have heard her rip one in the past so i guess no judgement.
label: angry
response: sounds like a wacky place to work.

situation: i got a raise today. i have pushed my self hard this last year and i deserve it.
dialogue: i got a raise today. i have pushed my self hard this last year and i deserve it.
that is awesome. congratulations.  i am sure you earned every penny.
thanks it is been a rough year. my hours were cut but i was expected to keep up the same work load. thanks again!
label: proud
response: good things happen to people who put in the effort. it sounds well deserved.

situation: for the last three nights i have been hearing really creepy sounds just outside of my bedroom window. i am not sure what it is but it is scaring me.
dialogue: for the last few nights i have heard weird sounds outside my bedroom window.
oh no! do you think it is a wild animal?
i do not think so, it does not sound like any animal i recognize. it is really creepy.
label: afraid
response: i hope it is not a crazy person or worse, an alien waiting to abduct you!

situation: i told my daughter she was not allowed to watch youtube. i caught her watching videos on her tablet
dialogue: i told my daughter she was not allowed to watch youtube because it is hard to monitor. i caught her sneaking and watching videos last night!
its so hard to monitor that stuff now
it is! there is also a ton of weird stuff on there that is labeled for kids.
label: angry
response: yeah, that is a scary thing to think about too

situation: my dog does not seem to ever tell me when he needs to go outside! i walk him for about 30 minutes and he still uses the bathroom in the house.
dialogue: i walk my dog for 30 minutes at a time but no matter what, he always ends up using the bathroom inside! i wish he would left me know if he needs to go out.
on no!  that is no good!  is he still a puppy?
no! he is about 2 years old now. sometimes i think he does it out a spite when he is not getting enough attention!
label: annoyed
response: hopefully he is not doing it out of spite!  maybe you should hire a dog trainer to see if they can correct his behavior.

situation: my neighbor stole a package from me. i know he did it because it was an outdoor planter i ordered that appeared on his porch a few days after my package went missing!
dialogue: my neighbor stole a package from me.
no way? do you have proof? that is terrible.
so check this out, i ordered a planter for my porch. that is how i know he did it, the exact planter i ordered and never got appeared on his porch a few days after my package went missing!
label: furious
response: wow. that is horrible. i would get a camera and try to film them in the act and go to the police. i would be so angry.

situation: i moved to northern alaska last year and do not know anyone.
dialogue: i moved to northern alaska last year and do not know anyone.
you have not met all three people in the city yet?
haha. i live about 1 hour south of barrow the most northern place in the usa and about 12 hours north of any actual city.
label: lonely
response: ah well it sounds like i hit the nail on the head

situation: my coworker was able to find a new job within like a week. meanwhile i was stuck at the same horrible company and could not find a single thing.
dialogue: my coworker was able to find a new job after only looking for like a week.
what kind of job was it
sales, so i am not really envious about that part as i am not into sales but i was still upset that he found a job so easily and i could not. we both wanted out of that company so bad.
label: jealous
response: sales do sound hard to do

situation: my cat got sick the other day, i felt so bad for him. i had to syringe feed him to make sure he kept eating until he felt better.
dialogue: my cat got sick the other day, he was really pathetic. i felt so bad for him.
is he going to be okay
yes, thankfully! the vet gave him some fluids and i made sure he got some food in him. he is doing much better today.
label: caring
response: i am glad then, i hate to see pets in pain

situation: my friend recently graduated college! she is a single mom working full-time, i am so proud of her.
dialogue: my friend is a single mom who works full time. she just graduated college!
that is quite an accomplishment.  someone like that is really inspiring.
right? i am so proud of her. her accomplishment really made me think about just how lazy i am in my own life haha
label: impressed
response: hahahaha, it is hard to compare yourself with that, but it really let's you know what is possible if you really want something.

situation: i think i may have gotten my coworker in trouble. i accidentally told our boss that they were at the waterpark last week when they called in sick.
dialogue: i think i got my coworker in trouble.
why? were they not working?
he called in sick, but spent the day at the waterpark with his kids. i did not realize he'd called in sick, i thought he was just out. so, i accidentally told my boss where he was.
label: guilty
response: he should have been honest from the start. it is on him not you.

situation: saturday i am climbing mt. elbert the highest mountain in the lower 48. the nerves has started to set in.
dialogue: saturday i am climbing mt. elbert the highest mountain in the lower 48. the nerves has started to set in.
that is so cool! do you do a lot of climbing?
not so much any more that i moved to the east coast. i do more surfing now but i was able to get off work so i fly into colorado thursday.
label: anticipating
response: wow, so a proper adventure then. have fun and stay safe!

situation: drove past the area my middle school was in today. it was gone. i hated it when i was in school but now that is it gone i am sad.
dialogue: drove past the area my middle school was in today. it was gone. i hated it when i was in school but now that is it gone i am sad
yea funny how that happens
it was not even that long ago i went to that school. it is been less then 10 years. they did not even build anything. it is a park now.
label: sentimental
response: well at least its being put to good use

situation: i am going to job interview thursday. i am currently employed but i am ready to move on.
dialogue: i am going to job interview thursday. i am currently employed but i am ready to move on.
hey congrats!  is it in the same field?
yes, i am currently in middle management this would be the next step up. i am excited and nervous
label: anxious
response: heyyy! that is awesome!  i wish you luck! will it come with a sweet raise too?

situation: my cousin passed the cpa exam. i am really in awe of her dedication, it was not easy.
dialogue: my cousin passed the cpa exam!
congratulation. what is he planning to do next?
she is already working at a big 4 firm so she is just going to stick with that for a few years. i am proud of her, it was not easy!
label: impressed
response: good. i hope it will help her in career growth.

situation: i just got a new manager at work. she is really young but seems to be full of good ideals.
dialogue: i just got a new manager at work. she is really young but seems to be full of good ideals.
that is cool!  maybe you will get along great!
i plan to steer clear. i am going to relocate in january so i just need to lay low. i hope she does a great job.
label: hopeful
response: lol why do you have to steer clear?

situation: the other weekend i really wanted to go out but realized i have sort of drifted away from the few close friends i have. i really need to get into a sport or something and meet people.
dialogue: the other weekend i really wanted to go out, but i realized i do not have any good friends left.
that is a bad realization to come to.  where did they all go?
well i used to hang out with a lot of my coworkers but i left that job. and just kind of drifted away from everyone else. i definitely need to find a new sport or something and make new friends.
label: lonely
response: yeah, that is tough.  once you get to a certain age you have to work pretty hard to meet people.  maybe you could join a softball league, that is what i did.

situation: the other day i was short on cash to pay my phone bill. as i was walking, i found a $20 bill on the ground that put me over what i needed!
dialogue: the other day i was short on cash i needed to pay my phone bill.
it can be hard these days, money is tight
so true. i lucked out though and found a $20 bill on the ground! i hope the person who lost it did not need it really bad because it definitely helped me out.
label: grateful
response: i bet that was a nice surprise

situation: i lost my credit card this past weekend in walmart someone turned it though i was so stun but happy.
dialogue: i lost my credit card this weekend and then in the worst place walmart.
did you get it all straightened out?
yes i was very stun someone did a good deed and turned it in with my wallet and all the money in it i was very grateful.
label: surprised
response: wow that is awesome, too rare in these times, count your lucky stars!

situation: my daughter started elementary school today i was nervous she would be scared but she loved it and i am so glad how much she is a big girl.
dialogue: my oldest daughter started elementary school today i was so glad she had a great first day.
oh wonderful!  i am glad it went so well!  did she already know some friends there or was it a new school for her?
a new school that is why i was kind of nervous and scared but she loved it.
label: proud
response: oh boy, i bet you were nervous.  i would've been too!  sounds like she is got a great and fun year ahead of her!

situation: my neighbor keeps letting her dog use the bathroom off the balcony. it smells awful and looks so trashy, i am so grossed out.
dialogue: my neighbor keeps letting her dog use the bathroom on her balcony.
that is just gross!  have you spoken to her about it?
it is revolting. i reported her to the hoa but she keeps doing it. i am going to say something if i catch her out there letting her dog out.
label: disgusted
response: i hope the hoa does something about that that is just disgusting!

situation: i made fish tacos the other day and did absolutely nothing but watch netflix and relax on the couch. it was so nice and chill.
dialogue: the other day i made fish tacos and did nothing else all day but relax on the couch.
bet that was a nice calming down.
very. it was nice and chill and low pressure, just how i like it.
label: content
response: did you get up to anything else fun?

situation: i did a walk-a-thon  last week was so happy i finished it before the walk i was un-assured i would finish but i did.
dialogue: i did a walk a thon last week for back to school drive and needy kids it was s long walk but i finished it i felt so happy.
that sounds awesome, i bet you feel proud! its nice to do things for kids who are in need.
i did before the walk i was un-assured i would finish but i did so i was overly proud and it was a great cause that raised lots of money.
label: confident
response: of course! do not let fear of not finishing stop you from doing anything!

situation: went out to eat the other day with my boyfriend. i actually witnessed our waiter pick his nose, wipe it on his shirt, and then carry out someone's drinks from the bar. it was gross.
dialogue: went out to eat with my boyfriend the other day. saw our waiter pick his nose and wipe it on his shirt.
oh gross, i would lose my appetite
it really was gross. i was so grossed out i asked to get moved to the bar so we could get a different server.
label: disgusted
response: yeah, i would probably just leave the restaurant altogether

situation: there was a snake in my yard i was so frighten i ran back in the house.
dialogue: i am so scared of snakes there was one in my back yard a few weeks ago.
oh my goodness, that is no fun.  was it poisonous?
when i looked it up on line it was one of the garden snakes but i am still frightened by them all even the harmless ones.
label: terrified
response: they can still bite, so it is better safe than sorry.  my father-in-law just got bitten by a black snake recently-not poisonous-but still painful.

situation: i am adhd when it comes to cleaning so when my family leaves the house a mess i get so furious.
dialogue: i am a neat freak and my house has to stay clean and in place always such a pet peeve of mines.
do you have ocd?
very bad and when my family has the house out of place i become so furious i just like things clean and in order.
label: angry
response: i just love when the house is clean, makes you feel good.

situation: my supervisor took all the credit for a new client i brought in. he did not even recognize that i was involved at all, much less that i did all the work.
dialogue: my supervisor totally stole all the credit for a client i brought in.
that is a bad supervisor. did you call him/her out on it?
i totally did. and let the ceo know about his behavior.
label: furious
response: i hope he got in trouble!

situation: i start school next week to finish my degree i was scared because it is been 6 years i been out of college but my support system is great i am so thankful for them.
dialogue: i start back college next week i cannot wait to finish getting my degree for me and my family.
oh most are dreading going back to school. what is your major?
i am going for nursing and i have dreaded going back for 6 years now but my support system pushed me to follow my dream i am thankful to have them.
label: grateful
response: nursing can be difficult, but if you have determination and a good support system, i am sure you will do great!

situation: i applied for a position at work, and did not get it. then i found out someone less qualified got it.
dialogue: i recently applied for a promotion at work.
how'd it go?
i did not get it.
label: jealous
response: i am so sorry to hear that. i hope another opportunity comes up.

situation: i am getting a new bike soon! i am really looking forward to it.
dialogue: i am shopping for a new bicycle! cannot wait to pick one out.
that sounds like fun!  are you big into biking?
i have been recently, yes. i am using an old beat up hand-me-down mountain bike so getting the right bike for me is going to be so much fun.
label: excited
response: mountain biking is great.  is is really theraputic.  i hope you enjoy your new bike

situation: i live in florida and right now the crime rate is so high it is heart broken the past weekend a 7 year old lost her life from a stray bullet broke my heart.
dialogue: the crime rate in my city is so high right now it breaks my heart and things need to change.
that is horrible. what can people do to change things?
first thing get the young crowd out the streets and take the weapons away a 7 year old passed this weekend because of this it is so heart breaking.
label: sad
response: yes! the weapons thing is so important.

situation: recently found out that one of my best friends from back home died in a car accident. i do not even know what to say to her parents, i have not been able to call them with condolences.
dialogue: found out recently that one of my best friends from back home died in an accident.
oh my gosh! that is horrible! i am so sorry to hear that.
thank you. i do not even have it in me to call her parents and offer my condolences yet, it is just too shocking.
label: devastated
response: i understand that. just give it some time and call when you are ready.

situation: i started a new job and everyone there was so kind they made we feel very welcomed.
dialogue: i started my new job last week and already i feel part of the team.
that is great. getting good coworkers is so hit or miss sometimes.
it is and that is why i was nervous but the staff was so kind and open.
label: caring
response: that sounds like a wonderful place. i am kinda jealous hahaha.

situation: one time someone kicked my dog!
dialogue: one time someone kicked my dog!
that is awful! what did you do?
nothing! my dog was just walking passed him!
label: angry
response: no. i mean did you yell at the person or anything after they did it?

situation: i got laid off from a job i used to really, really love. it worked out though, toward the end i found myself really hating the work and the company. but it still hurt.
dialogue: i got laid off from a job that i really used to love.
woah that is really bad! is it due to cost cutting? they let you off.
sort of, the company was being run into the ground by poor management. it hurt at first but then i realized just how much i would started to hate the work and the company.
label: devastated
response: it happens! i hope you will find a better job with a better company!

situation: i am so upset i lost my phone while doing errands today.
dialogue: i cannot believe i lost my phone today while running errands.
oh no, that is the worst.
sad part is i have no idea which store that is why i am so upset.
label: sad
response: i hope you can get it back somehow!

situation: i ended up on one of those "top 40 under 40" lists for people in my profession. that was a really cool accomplishment that made me feel good.
dialogue: i ended up on one of those "top 40 under 40" lists for people in my profession. felt pretty good.
that is an amazing accomplishment.  what field are you in?
finance, basically, but it was a little broader than that. i wish my mom were still around, she would have been so happy.
label: proud
response: i am sure you know that she is so proud of you!  that is really incredible!  congratulations!

situation: i was shocked my husband brought me flowers today.
dialogue: i was shocked my husband bought me flowers today out of the blue.
that is so romantic.  they were not for any occasion?
nope not at all, that is why i was so shocked!
label: surprised
response: were they your favorites?

situation: i am completely grossed out this bread was molded that i just got from the store today.
dialogue: i was so grossed out about the molded bread i bought today.
oh yuck. did you get a chance to return it to the store?
i tried to, but they had a no refund policy.
label: disgusted
response: that is crazy! i would leave it on the counter at the store. hopefully you are not out much money.

situation: i was so happy to see my kids face when i finally brung a puppy home.
dialogue: seeing my kids face when i finally brought a puppy home was priceless!
wow that must have been amazing!
it really was, and i got it on video too.
label: joyful
response: they are going to remember that forever

situation: while my car was parked outside my house, someone put a huge dent in it during the night. no insurance card, no nothing, just drove off.
dialogue: while my car was parked on the street in front of my house last week, someone ran into it and left a huge dent.
dang, that sucks. did you ever catch the culprit?
no, they did not leave a insurance card or anything, just drove off. some people are so worthless.
label: angry
response: yeah, that guy sounds like a jerk. did your insurance cover the dent?

situation: last month my dog skippy died. he was 18 years old.
dialogue: last month my dog skippy passed away. he was 18 years old.
oh wow! my dog jr died of old age too.
man it is hard. he has been like my best friend since i was a teenager.
label: sad
response: oh, did something happen to him?

situation: i am so upset my dog died today.
dialogue: my dog died of old age today.
i am sorry to hear that. mine died of old age as well last month.
i am sorry that happened too. i never thought i would be this upset over a dog.
label: sad
response: me neither, but in the end, i really did not think about him as a dog, he was just my buddy. i hope fond memories of him get you through this.

situation: i waited three weeks for something i ordered online to get here. when it finally got here, the box was terribly damaged and the item was broken. i was so let down.
dialogue: i waited the longest three weeks of my life to get something i ordered online.
that can be so aggravating. did the company make it up to you for being so late?
it got worse. when it finally arrived, the box was all busted up and my item was broken. so yeah, safe to say they had a lot to make up for.
label: disappointed
response: at least they made up for it. if they had not i would not use them again.

situation: my husabd has been getting on my nerves worrying about his football team losing.
dialogue: my husband has been getting on my nerves worrying about his football team losing.
i know the feeling. what team is he rooting for?
he is crazy about the falcons.
label: annoyed
response: i do not even know what team that is, haha. football is lost on me.

situation: i am almost sure i fixed my broken computer today.
dialogue: i am also sure i fixed my computer today.
oh that is good, last time my computer broke was a day before i left the country
that would be a nightmare! all i had to do was replace the fan.
label: confident
response: i took it to the apple store and it actually got fixed in 5 mins, just needed a hardware reset

situation: i am so sad my husband was deployed this week.
dialogue: my husband was just sent to iraq and i already miss him so much.
oh my goodness, is he with the armed forces?
yes the army, he will be there for 2 years.
label: lonely
response: i cannot imagine how hard that is on the family and the soldier.  while i cannot bring him home quicker, i do want to say thank you to you,  him and your family for your sacrifice.

situation: i am still in shock after my house caught on fire.
dialogue: i am in shock ever since my house caught on fire while i was at work.
that is horrible, did anyone get hurt?
no, thank goodness no one was home, but their is nothing left of our house.
label: devastated
response: hopefully you had insurance and somewhere to stay.

situation: one time i heard a large knock on my door while i was sleeping
dialogue: one time i heard a large knock on my door while i was sleeping
that is scary.  what was it?
it was a couple of drug addicts trying to come in!
label: afraid
response: gosh it is worse than i thought it would be.  what did you do?

situation: i  have very low mark
dialogue: i have very low mark
sorry to hear that. what happened on the test?
exam mark is low in school
label: guilty
response: hopefully next time you will get a better score and study more!

situation: my brother graduated with honors
dialogue: am so happy for my brother, he graduated with honors
he must be very smart
yah, he had done his best
label: impressed
response: it paid off. wish i was smart like that

situation: my parents are on vacation
dialogue: i am alone in the house my parents travelled, i feel lonely and afraid
oh no. how old are you?
am 22 years of age
label: terrified
response: is there anyone you could go and visit and maybe stay the night?

situation: my friend dint come to watch a movie with me
dialogue: i feel lonely my friend did not make to join me i watching a movie
i am sorry to hear that.
yah, i decided to sleep
label: lonely
response: i hope things are better next time.

situation: today is my anniversary! my husband brought me chocolates and is taking me to a concert this evening.
dialogue: today is my anniversary! my husband planned an amazing day! he bought me my favorite chocolates and is taking me to a concert tonight! i had no idea about the concert!
that is great to hear that some really care and put effort in to their relationships!
he usually does not do this much! i guess after years of hinting, he is finally picking up on them! haha
label: surprised
response: lol! oh geez- so many take years to get it ugh! but at least he finally has! i hope he is very romantic too!

situation: i had my front door open and a cat (not mine) ran in my house.
dialogue: i had my front door open and a cat (not mine) ran in my house.
not yours? that is so weird, usually they  are on their way out not in!
i know! we were all surprised. my god was going nuts and my cat hid under the couch while we chased the stray around trying to get it out.
label: surprised
response: did you eventually get it out? i would have been flipping bonkers!

situation: this past spring some real bad storms went through our area. we spent over 5 hours in the basement due to tornadoes all around us.
dialogue: this has been the worst year ever for tornadoes in our area. this past spring we spent 5 hours in our basement due to all the tornadoes in our area.
that sounds terrifying!  i am glad you have a basement though, it can be so dangerous if you have no underground place to shelter in!
yes, a lot of people do not have basements, and that would be really bad. it is hard to explain to a three year old why you are in such a dark, scary place, especially when the power is all out.
label: terrified
response: oh your right, i have an almost 3 year old and i would not know how to explain it as well! that is so hard sometimes because you do not know what to say!

situation: i was walking in the grocery store and found what i need on the top shelf. i climbed the bottom shelf to reach and i knocked a lot of the product down.
dialogue: i was in the grocery store. i found what i needed on the top shelf. i climbed onto the bottom shelf but ended up knocking everything down!
oh my goodness, are you alright? i bet you created a mess!
yeah! the only thing that was hurt was my pride! i have never tried to check out so quickly!
label: embarrassed
response: i hope you can laugh a little about it now!

situation: my husband bought me concert tickets for our anniversary. this is the last tour that the band is doing.
dialogue: my favorite band is doing their last tour. my husband bought me tickets to see their concert! he surprised me with them today!
that sounds like a great gift. that is going to be a great time.
it is! i am really excited for it! it is tonight, so it was also a big surprise!
label: grateful
response: wow. i am sure you will remember this for a long time. you are going to have to think of a great surprise for him now.

situation: last month, my dog duke passed away. i got him when he was only a puppy 17 years ago. i still almost call him when i go to bed at night.
dialogue: last month, my dog duke passed away. i got him when he was just a puppy 17 years ago.

i am sorry to hear about that. it sounds like, to me, that he lived a long life with you though, and that you were able to spend a lot of time with him. i am worried for my girlfriend and what she will do when that happens to her and her dog
yeah, we did everything together. i still have to stop myself from calling him when i go to bed at night. it is amazing how close we can get to our pets.
label: sad
response: that is crazy, and a little heart-breaking too. i am envious of the bond and routine it sounds like you guys had. i have yet to develop a bond like that with a pet. i hope i do at some point

situation: i was driving around my old neighborhood and notice the house that i grew up in had burned down. i hated seeing somewhere i spent so much time as a child gone.
dialogue: i was driving around my old neighborhood and seen that the house i grew up in had burned down.
that is so sad.did you have a lot of good memories in that house?
i spent birth till i was 17 living there, so literally all of my child hood memories.
label: sad
response: i am so sorry at least you have your memories to look back on.

situation: my wife got a flat tire on her way home from work and a man was kind enough to stop and help her change the tire.
dialogue: my wife got a flat tire on her way home from work and a man was kind enough to stop and help her change the tire.
that was really nice of him. i know that she had to be relieved.
as was i. i was about 50 miles away at the time and she was on the side of the highway.
label: grateful
response: someone was watching over her.

situation: just over 2 years ago, my wife and i got divorced. it was so strange being in our big house all alone, and her and the kids not being there.
dialogue: just over 2 years ago, my wife and i got divorced. it was so strange being in our big house all alone without her and the kids.
how long had you been married ?
just short of 9 years. she met someone online in wow of all places and just up and moved in with him.
label: lonely
response: hmm. that is a bit of a strange story.

situation: a while ago i was walking to college and j-crossed the street, to my shock i got a ticket.
dialogue: back when i was in college, i crossed a street in wrong place and got a ticket.
i hate to hear that. i hate tickets. there are so many other things i would rather spend my money on.
exactly, especially when you get one for just walking.
label: surprised
response: yeah, that is such a silly thing to get a ticket for.

situation: this week my wife and i are going to buy our first brand new car. we have been saving and working on our credit so we could get a good interest rate.
