dialogue: my wife and i are going to buy are very first brand new car this week.
cool, what are you getting?
a chevy cruze. we have been working hard to get our credit score up to get a really good interest rate.
label: excited
response: that is a nice car, you are going to enjoy it.

situation: i recently took my kids camping.  i made a checklist to verify that we would not forget any of the things we needed.  i followed that list, and we arrived with everything we needed to have a great time.
dialogue: i took my three children camping recently, and we had a great time.
neat! we took our daughter and her cousin camping about 2 weeks ago! did ya'll build a fire?
of course!  i have found that the key to a great camping experience is to have a checklist of what to bring, and follow it.
label: prepared
response: that is defiantly a priority! i hope you brought everything that you need. forgetting something can be a pain

situation: my daughter finally mastered 1-6 times table!
dialogue: my daughter finally master the 1-6 times. we worked very hard on it this summer!
the 1-6 times as in multiplication?  teaching children is so rewarding.
yes in multiplication! i am glad she is finally grasped them. now we just need to work on 6-12 hahaha
label: proud
response: i bet she was super excited to get it all down.

situation: my daughter starts public school for the first time in 3 years. i think she is going to do well
dialogue: my daughter starts public school for the first time in 3 years! i think she is going to do great but she is a little bit nervous.
what grade is she in?
she is in 5th grade.
label: hopeful
response: what kind of school was she at before?

situation: i love spending time with my family we just got back from vacation and i am feeling so happy after the great trip we had.
dialogue: me and my family just came back from vacation we had a great time.
where did you go ?
we went to disney world in orlando,fl to see my kids have a great time made me happy cannot wait for our next vacation.
label: joyful
response: we went there a few years back. had a great time.

situation: i got a call back from the job interview i went to the other day. unfortunately, they did not hire me.
dialogue: well, i finally got a call back from that job i interviewed for the other day.
awesome news!  what was the response?
well, they decided not to hire me. this stinks.
label: disappointed
response: oh.  not so good news then  i am sorry.  i am sure you will find something!

situation: my wife had a birthday party for me that i did not know about. i was totally taken aback when all my friends showed up.
dialogue: my wife held a surprise birthday party for me. it was totally unexpected and i was shocked when i came home and so many people were there.
that is awesome, i bet you were overjoyed with it!
i could not believe that no one let the cat out of the bag. it must have been hard to plan.
label: surprised
response: you never know if someone is going to slip and spoil it for you, that is true!

situation: last week during the night, someone came into my yard and stole my push mower. i had it chained to a steel pole, but they use bolt cutters to cut the chain.
dialogue: last week during the night someone came into my yard and stole my push mower.
oh no!  do you have any way of finding out who did it?
no, i called the police but it is almost impossible to track. i had to chained to a steel post, but they cut the chain with bolt cutters i guess. i sure hate thieves.
label: angry
response: yeah, thieves are terrible.  i mean, who would steal a mower?

situation: i went to a restaurant and when they brought my food out it had hair in it i was so sicken and upset.
dialogue: my food had hair in it at a restaurant worst experience ever.
what did you do?
i called the manager over and they offered to redo the food and pay for it but i was so sicken and upset i said no thank you it ruined my whole appetite.
label: disgusted
response: yea i can see that, it happens but it sucks

situation: me and my husband watched the new scary movie it and i was kind of frightened.
dialogue: i am not one to like scary movies that much only with my husband since he loves them so much.
well atleast you watch them with him! i do not like them either.
we watched the new movie it i was a little frightened and creep out especially because i am afraid of clowns.
label: afraid
response: oh no, no thank you! ahhh i cannot even.

situation: my wife is out of the country on a business trip. now it is way too quiet around here, it is driving me crazy.
dialogue: my wife is going away on a business trip soon. she will be gone for a couple of weeks.
that'll be tough.  do you have anything you can do to keep busy?
well, i might do some work on the house. but it is going to be awfully quiet around here.
label: lonely
response: i bet.  it is sometimes surprising how much your life revolves around the other person being in the house.

situation: my neighbor keeps playing his music loudly late at night when i am trying to sleep. i think i need to have a word with him.
dialogue: ugh, my neighbor keeps playing his music really loud at night when i am trying to sleep.
spray water over there
ha, that is not a bad idea. i do need to have a word with him about it though at least.
label: annoyed
response: thats good, you should

situation: someone keeps stealing my lunch from the fridge at work. they'd better hope that i do not find out who they are!
dialogue: someone at work keeps stealing my lunch from the fridge! so infuriating!
could you get with your hr department to see if they can assist?
i might give that a try. but whoever did it had probably better hope that i do not find out who they are!
label: angry
response: what would you do to them?

situation: i do not like the dark. i am worried about something bad happening.
dialogue: i do not like the dark.
yea, i used to hate it too.
i get so worried about something happening to me.
label: afraid
response: like a paranormal type fear or a human with intent to harm type fear?

situation: i was stuck on a specific part of a video game for several weeks. my friend tried it and beat it on the first try!
dialogue: i have been stuck for several weeks on a part in this video game i have been playing.
is it really hard? or you just have not have that much time to paly
it is pretty tough. but it does not matter now. i let a friend of mine have a try, and he got through it right away! it was pretty impressive to see.
label: impressed
response: yeah some people are just naturaly good at video games

situation: my fiance was able to successfully rewire one of the outlets in the house.  i have never seen anyone do that before and i did not know he had these skills!
dialogue: so the fiance managed to rewire one of the wall outlets yesterday!
that is pretty impressive, does he have any training or just all self taught?
a little bit of both!  i did not know he had these skills but it was really neat to watch!
label: impressed
response: well it is certainly nice to have someone around with handy knowledge like that!

situation: my neighbor's dog keeps barking all day. i have talked to him several times about it, but he seems to not care.
dialogue: ugh, my neighbor's dog just keeps barking all day long. it is driving me insane.
that is frustrating!  we have a couple down the street that raises hunting dogs.  so annoying all day!
it really is. and i have talked to him a few times about it, but he does not seem to care at all.
label: annoyed
response: i am sure he thinks it is his world, the rules do not apply to him.  sorry you have to deal with that people can be so rude

situation: my brother is getting out of jail next week. i am afraid that he knows that i am the one that turned him in..
dialogue: my brother is getting out of jail next week.
well you must be happy about it.
not really. i am the one that turned him in. and i am scared that he might know about that.
label: afraid
response: oh! that is bad then.  be careful.

situation: i have a dr appointment tomorrow to make sure my cancer is still in remission.
dialogue: i have a dr appointment tomorrow to make sure my cancer is still in remission.
i hope you hear good news.
i think i will. it is been 7 years since my last treatment. i still get nervous when i have my checkups though.
label: anxious
response: i understand. i guess you will always feel that way.

situation: my brother is supposed to be paying me back for the food i bought for him last week. i have been waiting for a while.
dialogue: my brother is supposed to be paying me back for the food i bought for him last week.
it was nice of you to buy him food, but i am thinking he did not pay you back.
nope, i have been waiting for a few days, and i could really use that money now.
label: anticipating
response: i am sorry. i know it sucks to need money and be counting on it, and then you do not get it. i hope he pays you back soon.

situation: i stepped out of my door this morning and right into an unpleasant surprise that my neighbor's dog left. it was so gross.
dialogue: i stepped out of my front door this morning. and right into an unpleasant surprise that my neighbor's dog left for me.
ugh! i use to have the same problem with my neighbors dog who would poop in my driveway! at least it was my tires and not my feet that got the unpleasant surprise.
yeah. the smell was so bad. it took forever to get that off of my shoe.
label: disgusted
response: does this happen often? i would let my neighbor know about it.

situation: i got a call from a friend that i have not heard from in years. i was so happy to hear from her!
dialogue: i got a phone call from a friend that i have not heard from in a really long time.
that is great! you must have been so surprised and pleased to hear from them.
i was! it was so great hearing from her again.
label: joyful
response: i bet you had tons of catching up to do!

situation: i have a meeting with my boss in a couple of hours. i have no idea what it is about, so i am kind of nervous.
dialogue: i have a meeting with my boss in a few hours.
the way you wrote that makes it seem like you are anticipating something bad. do you mind if i ask what you are expecting to happen?
see, that is the thing. i have no idea what to expect. that is why i am so nervous about it.
label: anxious
response: interesting.. well then at least that leaves the possibility for something good instead. if you are not sure what it could be, then at least it is not some obvious mistake or negligence on your part. i hope for the best for you

situation: my mother is getting very old, and is not in great health. i do not know if she has much longer to live.
dialogue: my mother is getting very old. and she really is not in great health these days.
that is unfortunate, my own mother was ill for several years, she is getting older as well. do you get to see her often?
yeah, i try to go see her at least twice a week. i am not sure how much longer she will be with us.
label: sad
response: just spend what time you can with her, i would like to say something really profound but aging parents is a situation that just sucks. sorry you are having to deal with it.

situation: when i was out of work my car broke down and since it was my only car a friend of mine actually gave me his old car to replace it. it was such a nice gesture.
dialogue: when i was out of work my car broke down and since it was my only car a friend of mine actually gave me his old car to replace it. it was such a nice gesture.
that was great of him!
it was. i insisted that i pay him after i got a job but he would not take the money.
label: grateful
response: he sounds very nice!

situation: i finished a major work assignment in a short amount of time.  my supervisor was pleased with the results
dialogue: i finished a major work assignment in a short amount of time
oh really what was the assignment
it was a presentation that had to be quickly put together.  my supervisor seemed pleased
label: proud
response: it is always great to get back positive feedback!

situation: i remember when the ps4 first launched.  it was the first game console i ever ordered online and i was really looking forward to having it delivered.
dialogue: i remember when the ps4 was first launching.  it was the first game console i ever ordered onilne and i was really looking forward to having it delivered.
what was it like when it showed up on your door?
i was watching the front door like a hawk, and constantly checking for online tracking updates.  i kept worrying that someone would steal it of my porch if i did not get it right away.
label: anticipating
response: that is hilarious, you finally got it though uhuh?

situation: a friend was supposed to meet me for lunch.  he ended up not showing
dialogue: a friend was supposed to meet me for lunch, but did not show
i am sure they had a good excuse.
he said he was busy with work, so i suppose so
label: disappointed
response: oh i see. hopefully its just that one time where he could not get to his phone to let you know.

situation: i accidentally left my phone at a restaurant.  i was able to get it back before it got stolen or lost
dialogue: i accidentally left my phone at a restaurant
oh crap! how long untill you realized?
a few minutes after leaving, i was able to get it back
label: embarrassed
response: that is so good, man i have done that a time of two.

situation: i am sure i will pass my law exam.
dialogue: i am sure i will pass my law exam.
i am sure you will as well. confidence is great!
thank you. i am almost done with school!
label: confident
response: congratulations. you have done great!

situation: a friend got a new car.  it was one i had been looking at buying myself
dialogue: a friend got a new car
that is really cool. what kind of car?
bmw, it was a model i had been looking to get myself
label: jealous
response: that  sounds like a really awesome car!

situation: i keep the ticket stub of my first concert in my wallet.  it reminds me of good times with my friends.
dialogue: i carry around the ticket stub from the first concert i attended in my wallet.  it brings back good memories i had spending time with my friends.
aww, that is really sweet and sentimental. i like that. can you still read the words on it?
the edges are a little frayed but i can still make out everything on it.  i keep it in a zippered compartment to preserve it.  maybe i will frame it someday.
label: sentimental
response: i was going to say, yeah, that is the kind of thing i would love to preserve in a frame or something for my office. how cool!

situation: i needed to fill out a form but did not have a pen. i was in a car garage returning a rental car.
dialogue: hey, the other day i did not have a pen while trying to fill out some paperwork
that stinks. what did you do?
yeah! well i was in a parking garage so i went walking to try and find someone to borrow a pen from
label: grateful
response: and did you find one?

situation: i had ear surgery recently. i was hopeful that i would get my hearing back
dialogue: hi! i had ear surgery a few months ago
did it went well?
yeah it went really well actually, the result was better than i had hoped for in fact!
label: hopeful
response: that is great. what was the issue with your ear?

situation: i moved over the weekend.  the truck took us about 5 hours to load.  when we unloaded it took a little under an hour.
dialogue: i moved over the weekend.  although it took about 5 hours to load the truck, when we unloaded the next day it took a little under an hour.
you made quick work out of that
yeah, i was really happy that the unloading took as little time as it did.
label: impressed
response: i wish i could unload that fast

situation: i was scared of the spider in my bathroom.
dialogue: i was scared of the spider in my bathroom.
oh goodness. that has happened to me before. i could not sleep
it was a brown recluse. i had no clue that i had poisonous spiders at my house.
label: afraid
response: how in the world did it get in your house? were you able to kill it?

situation: my girlfriend moved in this past weekend.  i am really happy to start this next chapter of my life.
dialogue: my girlfriend moved in this past weekend.  i am really excited to start this next chapter in my life.
oooooooooo nice!
yeah, i am excited.  first girlfriend that i have lived with but she is pretty awesome so i am glad it finally happened.
label: excited
response: well you two have fun tonight.  i will not tell your parents about all this.

situation: i left my old job to better myself and i have my old supervisor to thank for that and for influencing me to branch out.
dialogue: i got a new job and it is so great and i have my old supervisor to thank she is the best.
why you need to thank her? is she the one that helped you to find the new job?
she was a great influence and gave me words of encouragement to branch out and go for more then our company job.
label: impressed
response: she is very nice person. that is great.

situation: i am nervous about my 5 year old starting kindergarten.
dialogue: i am nervous about my son starting school this year.
oh. will he be starting elementary school?
yes, he will be starting kindergarten this year.
label: anxious
response: aw he is at that precious age where you have to let his hand go, hu?

situation: we had to put our dog to sleep. i am so upset.
dialogue: my dog had cancer and the vet advised us to put our dog to sleep today.
damn why'd you have to tell me that.gawd that is freakin sad, jeezus
i am soo upset, and worse i have to tell the kids when they get home.
label: sad
response: i wish you and your fam peace happiness love and good health.

situation: i am so mad my neighbor killed my dog on purpose.
dialogue: i am so mad my neighbor killed my dog because she was mad at me.
what? do you have evidence supporting this
i sure do i have it on video and made a report with the police already.
label: furious
response: good hope that bitch goes to hell..sorry i love animals and my mom's dog died the same way

situation: my neighbors are really getting on my nerves.
dialogue: i am so annoyed my neighbor's trash always ends up in my yard.
that is a big deal.  what are you going to do?
i have tried everything, but they keep doing it even after paying huge fines.
label: annoyed
response: i would throw trash in their yard.

situation: my husband has been deployed for over a year and i miss him a lot.
dialogue: my husband has been on his second tour in iraq. seems like i will not see him in forever.
he sounds like a real hero though. i hope he comes home safe soon
thank you, the kids and i miss him terribly.
label: lonely
response: i can only imagine. at least you have each other

situation: my house burned down today. i am still in shock.
dialogue: i lost everything in the fire today.
are you and your family okay?
we are thank heavens, but we lost everything.
label: devastated
response: i am sorry, you can replace it though

situation: i remember one time i did not bring any cash to pay for a metro ride, and some girl just paid for me not asking anything in return.
dialogue: i once left all cash and did not have any to pay for a metro ride, some random girl paid for me without saying a word.
wow!  how kind is that!  their really are kind people left in this world.  how did you respond?
yes, and i am thankful for those kind of people.
label: grateful
response: *there* oops.  did you ever find out her name?  or find out a way to thank her?

situation: i was on my way to work last week and i did not notice i was so low on gas. i ended up running out of gas, and a nice man stopped and gave me enough gas to get to the station. i was so happy he stopped to help me.
dialogue: last week on the way to work, i did not notice my wife had ran my car so low on gas and i ended up running out of gas on the freeway.
on no! did you have to walk, or did you call for service?
a nice man stopped, help me push my car to the shoulder and even had a can of gas he let me use in his trunk. talk about a nice guy.
label: grateful
response: wow, you got lucky! did you give him a tip?

situation: i feel so bad, i cheated on my test today and got caught.
dialogue: i got caught cheating on my test. i feel so horrible.
why did you feel you had to cheat? i am sure you could have passed if you had studied.
i just wanted to make sure i passed. but now i have a big 0.
label: ashamed
response: well, do not let this one situation define you. use it as a learning experience and move on, and do you best not to repeat it.

situation: i accidental peed in my pants today.
dialogue: i had an accident today and i never want to show my face again at work.
that is so sad! what on earth happened?
i accidentally peed my pants when i was laughing.
label: embarrassed
response: now that is quite embarrassing! what did your co-workers say?

situation: i could not be more happy my daughter made straight a's all year.
dialogue: my daughter made straight a's all year. i am so happy.
that is wonderful!  she must be so proud of herself and i know you are proud of her.  its great that she likes learning so much.
yes i agree. i let her choose our vacation this summer. she cried because she was so happy.
label: proud
response: awww, what a great idea!  that is so cute! where are you guys going?

situation: i love  looking after my elderly parents.
dialogue: i could never send my parents to a nursing home. i look after them now.
you are such a good person to do that!
thank you! they say they feel like they are the kids and it makes them feel young again.
label: caring
response: it is crazy how the tables turn!

situation: i do not think i can walk into the local grocery store again.
dialogue: i think i will never walk into the local grocery store again.
why do you say that
it was raining today, and when i walked into the store i slipped and fell right on my face.
label: embarrassed
response: oh no, were you okay

situation: i cannot show my face in the bank ever again.
dialogue: i cannot show my face in the bank ever again!
oh my goodness, what happened? did they find out you owe money to the local crime families? those bank employees need to mind their own business, am i right!?
how did you guess? you are exactly right. now they are talking about alerting the police!
label: embarrassed
response: that is absolutely unacceptable. snitches get stitches, that is what i say. tell me where they are at and i will roll up on 'em and tell 'em what for. just say the word. i have got your back.

situation: my mom is staying with me and i need someone to stay with her a few hours. she chooses someone i do not know. i hope it all turns out ok.
dialogue: i need someone to stay with my elderly mother for a few hours in my home.
have you asked your friends for family?
no one is available. she asked someone that i do not know and they are coming. i am a little uneasy.
label: trusting
response: i would def feel that way.its hard when you do not know the person or can trust them

situation: my husband just signed with the nfl. i had no idea he was that good.
dialogue: my husband just told me the best news ever!
oh yeah? and what news might that be?
my husband just signed with the nfl. i never knew he was that good!
label: impressed
response: nice! did he sign up to be a waterboy?

situation: i am so angry my husband cheated on me.
dialogue: so, i just found our my husband is cheating on me.
oh my goodness, that is terrible!
i am soo mad. i cannot believe he did this after being married for 15 years.
label: furious
response: what do you plan on doing?

situation: i do not think i could ever go outside when it is dark ever again.
dialogue: i do not think i will go outside in the dark ever again.
uh oh. did something happen?
yes, i was robbed at gun point while walking home from work.
label: afraid
response: that must be traumatizing. most people would not want to go out alone after that. it is understandable.

situation: i am waiting to see if i got this job at walmart, i really need it.
dialogue: i have been pacing waiting to hear back from walmart after my interview.
do you think you will get the job?
not sure, but i really need this job to support my kids.
label: hopeful
response: i hope you end up getting it!

situation: i like to watch music and guitar covers on youtube.  there is a lot of talented people out there.
dialogue: i like to watch all the music and guitar covers on youtube.  there is a lot of talented folks out there nowadays.
oh definitely, youtube is a great platform for these talented people
yeah, it never ceases to amaze me the kinds of things you can see on youtube.  endless content to discover.
label: impressed
response: yeah, my favorite is watching short comedy videos of my favorite drag queens

situation: i cannot stop thinking about getting back my results from the cancer doctor.
dialogue: i am still waiting to hear the results from the doctor.
do you think there something wrong
they think i may have brain cancer. i cannot seem to even sit still waiting for that phone call.
label: anxious
response: oh no that is terrible  i am sorry to hear that

situation: i cannot hardly wait to see if i really did win the lottery.
dialogue: i am waiting to find out if i really won the lottery.
me too! i bought about a thousand dollars worth of tickets last night!
wow. i spent $500.00 myself. i hope it pays off!
label: anxious
response: you and i both! no matter who wins, let's promise to split the pot.

situation: tomorrow can not come fast enough. i am going on my first cruise.
dialogue: i will be going on a once in a life time trip tomorrow.
oh nice, where are you going?
i will be going on my first cruise.
label: excited
response: wow, i have never been on a cruise before. i think it sounds like a lot of fun

situation: my mom helped us so our house does not go into foreclosure i could never thank her enough.
dialogue: i can never thank my mom enough.
why? what did she do?
she helped us pay off our house so it did not go into foreclosure.
label: grateful
response: she is a special woman.

situation: i caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl.
dialogue: i am not sure how to address to my husband about how i feel about him getting a phone number from another girl.
i would be downright furious. start by smacking him across the face randomly at dinner. that should be a good segway into the conversation.
that is how i feel. i do not think he understands how it makes me feel inside.
label: jealous
response: oh, he certainly will when he feels the hot, guilty tears running down his face from that strong, independent, jealous filled slap!

situation: i am so upset i lost everything in a flood yeaterday.
dialogue: i am still in shock at the damage yesterdays flood caused.
was any of your stuff damaged?
yes, our whole house was swept out to sea.
label: devastated
response: oh wow! i am sorry to hear that. maybe you can go find it and sail it to go kill moby dick to make up for the damages.

situation: i know i got this job at kroger, i am just waiting on the conformation.
dialogue: i know i got this job, just waiting for the conformation.
exciting! are you moving to a new company?
no, this is the first job i have ever had just out of high school.
label: confident
response: oh fun! i am so excited for you. try to learn as much as possible from this job and ask for career development opportunities!

situation: i just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth.
dialogue: i never thought i would see something this gross ever!
oh geez! what on earth was it!
i saw a guy pick a piece of chewed gum off the sidewalk and put it in his mouth.
label: disgusted
response: that is friggin revolting!! i would have lost my lunch right then and there!

situation: i was turned down for the promotion i applied for today.
dialogue: today, was the worst day ever!
no way. what happened? if honestly, almost all my days are like this. so, worst has become normal for me
that is so sad. i was turned down for my promotion at work to someone with less experience than me.
label: disappointed
response: do not get it personally. good performance will always catch other's attention. just continue doing your work

situation: i would have to say i am pretty happy with my life right now.
dialogue: i am pretty happy with my life right now.
that is awesome! always good to be content with life.
it took a long time. but i always tell people to plan for the future!
label: content
response: it is good to be prepared for anything because you never know what could happen.

situation: i never thought i would feel such love having kids.
dialogue: i never knew i would feel this much love having kids.
definately! i have one daughter and twins on the way. i foresee love overload. how many do you have?
congrats. i love every bit of motherhood. i have 3 kids. they are 7,5, and 2
label: caring
response: thanks, motherhood truly is amazing

situation: i felt that type of emotion during my work
dialogue: do you felt sad or emotioned during your work
not really, do you?
some time i felt disgusted with my work
label: disappointed
response: oh i am so sorry to hear that, i hope it picks up for you, maybe listen to a little music to lift your spirits

situation: i feel so bad stealing diapers from the store today.
dialogue: i did not think i would feel this bad for stealing diapers.
oof, sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do i guess
i felt so bad i brought them back. i am happy i was not arrested. but it was only half a pack i brought back.
label: guilty
response: well you tried to make things right, you are still a good person

situation: i feel i am strong at my work
dialogue: do you feel that you are satisfied with your work
i can say that i am satisfied with where i am what i do and what its done for me. are you?
great! i am very happy with work, i am loving it
label: confident
response: im glad to hear that!

situation: i am so lucky i packed extra clothes!
dialogue: i would be in bad shape if i did not pack extra clothes.
what are you packing extra clothes for? did you go somewhere did something happen?
we went on vacation. and we all ended up with the stomach virus so you can guess from there
label: prepared
response: what are you packing extra clothes for? did you go somewhere did something happen?

situation: my husband just shocked me with tickets to a taylor swift concert.
dialogue: i am still shocked my husband bought tickets to the concert.
what concert is it? are you excited to go?
super excited to see taylor swift! he knew i was a fan.
label: surprised
response: oh my god, i am so jealous, she is not coming to my city this time. you are gonna have a great time

situation: i am sure i will be able to handle having twins.
dialogue: i just found out i was having twins. i already have 3 kids.
wow, that will be a busy house
yes, i agree. i was super worried, but decided to think more positive and i know i will be able to handle it.
label: hopeful
response: that is a great attitude, i hope you and your family stay happy and healthy

situation: i feel so bad for lying to my husband.
dialogue: i feel so bad lying to my husband.
what did you lie about, are you going to tell him?
i might as well since i feel so bad. i pretended to be sick because i did not want to spend 3 days at my in law's house this holiday weekend.
label: ashamed
response: hahaha if anything that is excusable, noone like inlaws!

situation: this year has seen more tornadoes in my area that almost any year in history. we have spent many evenings in the basement waiting till storms have went past.
dialogue: there have been more tornadoes in my area this year so far than any year in recent memory. we have spent a lot of time in the basement.
how scary! i am terrified thinking a tornado could pass by here
it is so much worse when the power is out and all we have is a few candles and flashlights.
label: afraid
response: well i hope nothing crazy happens and you guys stay safe!

situation: my husband threw me an unexpected party for my birthday!
dialogue: my husband threw me an unexpected party for my birthday!
wow, that is very nice of him! was there a lot of people there?
yes almost my entire family! the only one that was not there was my son. he could not come because he had to work.
label: surprised
response: that is too bad. i hope you had a blast!

situation: there is suppose to be a huge storm coming. i went to the store and got supplies so i am ready.
dialogue: there is suppose to be a huge storm coming. i went to the store and got supplies so i am ready.
that is a good idea! it is always smart to be on the safe side.
we usually do not have horrible storms so i never do it, but i have heard this one is going to be a bad one.  i just want to be ready
label: prepared
response: i have done that as well where nothing ends up happening but i bought all this stuff. you never know what could happen though.

situation: i am looking forward to going on vacation in october! i need a vacation
dialogue: i am looking forward to going on vacation in october! i need a vacation
where are you going on vacation?
my husband and i are going to the smokeys.  i have been but he hasn't.
label: excited
response: that should be fun, what do you plan to do there?

situation: i was walking through walmart and noticed people staring.  i went to the bathroom and to check my clothing and i had a huge brown stain on my rear! i sat in chocolate, i was moritified.
dialogue: i was walking through walmart and noticed people staring. i went to the bathroom and to check my clothing and i had a huge brown stain on my rear! i sat in chocolate, i was moritified
that must of been horrible.
i cannot stop thinking about it.  i keep replaying the scene in my head, it was so bad.
label: embarrassed
response: i am sure people forgot already.

situation: i am suppose to start a new job tomorrow.  i am not sure i am going to like it.
dialogue: i am suppose to start a new job tomorrow. i am not sure i am going to like it
what job is it?
i will be working at a daycare. i love kids, but i am not sure i will like working with so many at once.
label: apprehensive
response: only one way to find out.

situation: my son is getting ready to go into the military! i am so pleased with him.
dialogue: my son is getting ready to go into the military! i am so pleased with him
what branch of the military then?
the marines. he has always wanted to join.  i am glad he is finally getting to.
label: proud
response: the marines is by far my favorite so good for him!

situation: my electricity is out again! i pay a lot for the service, and i can never count on it. it goes out when the wind blows!
dialogue: my electricity is out again! i pay a lot for the service, and i can never count on it. it goes out when the wind blows!
oh no that is horrible. have you complained to the electric company?
yes but i always get the same answer, we are working to improve the infrastructure. blah blah. i am seriously considering solar.
label: angry
response: i would too at this point. it might be more reliable.

situation: i think i am going to have to serve on a jury and i am terrified.
dialogue: i think i am going to have to serve on a jury and i am terrified
that will be no fun.
no.  i hope it is not a murder trial or something heartbreaking.
label: afraid
response: do not you have to be selected first?

situation: i cannot believe i lost at bingo! i spent 40 dollars and did not win a penny
dialogue: i cannot believe i lost at bingo! i spent 40 dollars and did not win a penny
that sucks! i hate losing money as well.
yes, i swear there were 5 people sitting all around me that won several games.  it is just not fair.
label: annoyed
response: that is how i always feel at those things as well!

situation: i was walking around sf zoo the other day and realized that animals are such genuine creature and i like them like humans,
dialogue: have you ever been to the zoo just to realize that animals can be just as good as humans?
i do enjoy the zoo and the animals. i think they could be just as good.
yes, i am happy somebody shares this with me.
label: trusting
response: i think it is a good outlook.

situation: about a year ago i almost adopted a child, but now i am glad i did not, it is too much responsibility.
dialogue: i almost adopted a child once, but now i am glad i did not do it, sometimes we should stay rational.
hopefully one day you might decide to choose otherwise or have a child of your own.
i do not know if this is something i will ever be ready for.
label: caring
response: it is a tough choice to make, and not everyone has to raise a child.

situation: i mistaken a guard once for a tour guide, and when he stooped me abruptly i was ready to fight him.
dialogue: have you ever mistaken a situation for something it is not and was ready for anything?
i can say that i have mistaken something for what it isnt. but not sure about the ready for anything
it is just that the other day i mistaken a guard for a tour guide and almost got in a fight.
label: prepared
response: almost? so the situation resolved itself?

situation: i have an interview with a local ad agency tomorrow.  i hope i get it!
dialogue: i have an interview with a local ad agency tomorrow. i hope i get it!
what kind of interview?
an interview for a job.
label: hopeful
response: really? that is cool

situation: i was so surprised on my birthday
dialogue: yesterday my family surprised me on my birthday
how exactly?
well i came back from work kind of sad because i thought nobody remembered my birthday and as soon as i went inside they screamed happy birthday , not gonna lie i got really happy.
label: surprised
response: i bet you needed help to take all the presents back home.

situation: the other day i wandered into a strange neighborhood, i could not wait to get away from there.
dialogue: i got into a wrong part of town the other day, i was glad to get out from there.
oh my god, how did you get out of there?
i realized i could walk very fast if i want to.
label: anxious
response: that sounds great.

situation: i always felt very strong in unfamiliar situations.
dialogue: in the past and even today i always felt strong in unfamiliar situations.
that is a great asset to have emotionally i think.
i agree, although i do not really know if you can train yourself to be like that.
label: confident
response: yeah it might just be something you are born with.

situation: i used to have an old tape player and playing music on it was always very reminiscent of good times.
dialogue: i have old cassette player and music on it is much better than what i hear on a radio today.
i agree. music used to have soul and good lyrics back in the day.
yes, today it is just all about money and getting physical.
label: nostalgic
response: hopefully music nowadays can take a note from the good old days and change their tune.

situation: i went to this place yesterday and it felt very nice
dialogue: yesterday i went to the town where i grew up
how did that go? did it bring back a lot of memories?
it did, so much nostalgia!
label: nostalgic
response: im glad to hear that. sounds like a great trip

situation: i went out today and was astonished by how beautiful and sunny it is, even though it was supposed to rain.
dialogue: so it was supposed to rain, but when i got out it was beautifully sunny.

almost sounds like the erratic weather that we have here in georgia.  i do not mind the rain as long as i am inside.  the sun is beautiful but sometimes it can be brutal when it starts to heat up.  do you prefer sunny days?
sun is what makes me alive, so definitely yes.
label: surprised
response: i have to be very careful in the sun.  my allergies and the sun do not mix too well.  i can tolerate the rain much better.  i love the sound of water.

situation: when i see very old people i feel very fortunate that i am still young.
dialogue: when i walk past old people i feel fortunate that i am still young.
i can agree with that. i do feel the effects of age creeping up on me though
yes, but this part is inevitable, for now let us enjoy our young years.
label: grateful
response: def. make the best of them

situation: there are times when i feel like getting a girlfriend, but than i remember how nice it is to be by myself.
dialogue: when i feel an urge to get a girlfriend, i simply remember how nice it is to be independent.
it is good to explore your own interests and what makes you grow on your own.
yes, i still think that there are good and bad sides in both of these cases.
label: lonely
response: hopefully one day you will be willing to explore a relationship in a serious way.

situation: anytime i see people just throwing garbage on the street i feel anger.
dialogue: i get angry when people do not use trash cans.
i once volunteered to pick up trash on the side of the road. it is amazing how much people litter
good for you, instead of tickets this should be a punishment for everyone.
label: furious
response: i wish. people might have more respect if they were forced to clean up other people's trash as well.

situation: every day when i wake up i feel fortunate to have another day to enjoy.
dialogue: when i wake up, the first thing i do is thank life for having another day to enjoy.
are you in a dangerous place?
no i am not, but in away we all are in a very dangerous place, are not we?
label: grateful
response: i suppose so. it is great that you value life so much!

situation: i spilled coffee on my friend's laptop
dialogue: i was with my friend yesterday and by accident i spilled coffee on her laptop
oh no. did it get ruined?
i got so embarrassed but thankfully it did not get ruined
label: embarrassed
response: close call. i once spilt tea over my laptop and the keys were all sticky for a while

situation: my grandmother died last week
dialogue: my grandmother passed away last week.
really? so sorry for the lose
i am really sad because she used to help me with everything
label: sentimental
response: was she sick?

situation: i entered this contest and wrote a story and put a lot of effort into it and i did not win.
dialogue: i entered a contest and i did not win.
that is a bummer. it is never fun to not win.
no it is not. i felt like i put a lot of effort into it too.
label: disappointed
response: hopefully you will have better luck next time!

situation: my internet connection is horrible sometimes
dialogue: we changed our internet provider last week and the connection is horrible.
that is not good, we ended up lucky with who we have
i wish we did too. but it is okay
label: annoyed
response: maybe you can find another one or go back to your previous company. have you double checked with the company to make sure everything is ok?

situation: i was one of the three finalist for a job promotion at my job. i felt very positive about my chances as i had more than double the experience of the other two candidates.
dialogue: i was one of three finalists for a job promotion where i work. i have more than double the other candidates experience, so i feel really good about my odds.
that is wonderful! i hope you will get that promotion! what do you do?
i am a electrical engineer with more than 15 years experience. i have a really good feeling that i am going to get this job.
label: confident
response: good luck! whenever you get that promotion we should go celebrate

situation: winter is almost here
dialogue: i cannot wait for summer to finish , i love winter so much
i agree, plus i love making snowmen!
snowmen are my favourite!
label: joyful
response: i always get sad though when they melt

situation: i was walking on the job site last week and talking to a coworker when i stepped into a hole that i did not see. i ended up falling and spilling my coffee all over me.
dialogue: last week i was walking and talking to one of my coworkers and i stepped into a hole i did not see on the job site. i ended up falling and spilling hot coffee all over myself in front of our client.
ouch! did they try to help you back up?
yeah, my coworker did, but the damage had already been done. pretty big shot to the ego to look like such a fool in front of your client.
label: embarrassed
response: of course! well, at least you also looked human. we all make mistakes.

situation: this year we have had a record number of tornadoes in our area. it really freaks my son out when we have to go into the basement while it storms outside.
dialogue: we have had a record number of tornadoes in my area so far this year. my son really hates going into the basement while it is storming outside.
that sounds really scary!  is your son afraid or is he use to it?
he is only three, so it is pretty scary for him each time. i hate to see him that way.
label: afraid
response: i would hate that as well. i hope he learns to cope with it.

situation: i was getting ready to fly to dallas for a meeting with a client when i heard there were bad storms on the flight path.  i ended up renting  a car because i hate flying so much.
dialogue: i had a client meeting in dallas, and as i was driving to the airport i heard there was going to be a lot of storms we'd be flying through. i ended up renting a car because i hate flying so much in just calm weather.
that is a lot of extra money to spen, but it is completely understandable it you are that nervous about it.  have you ever looked into calming medications, or meditation to help your nerves?
i have, but they only cut down the anxiety instead of making it go away completely. something about hurdling towards earth at a rapid pace in a large metal box alarms me.
label: apprehensive
response: i completely understand that.  my mother in law used to have really bad anxiety about flying, but she did hypnosis and it really helped.

situation: due to heavy rainfall last month, my hometown was almost completely flooded. most of the houses in the small town are no condemned and the whole area has been declared a disaster area.
dialogue: last month, this area got pounded with rainfall. my entire home town was flooded and declared a disaster area.
wow. that is intense. did your home get any damage?
no, i move away from there some years ago, but i hate seeing the place i grew up basically destroyed now.
label: sad
response: yeah. i feel for you. it hurts to lose things like that.

situation: my birthday is in 2 weeks and my wife got me a gift early yesterday and gave it to me. she bought got me a brand new laptop and gave it to me early.
dialogue: my birthday is not for another two weeks, but my wife gave me my gift early yesterday. she bought me a brand new laptop because mine was getting old and slow.
that is awesome.  happy birthday!  what kind is it?
it is a dell with a i7 and 8 gigs of ram, even has a nvidia graphics card. she pretty much know what i wanted.
label: surprised
response: is that a gaming computer?

situation: last month we had record rainfall in our area. the river down from my house flooded so bad, it flooded my home and destroyed everything. it sucks having to start from scratch again.
dialogue: last month our area received record amounts of rainfall. the river that is down from my house backed up so bad it flooded my entire house destroying practically everything.
sorry to hear about that. are the damages covered by an insurance?
yes, we had insurance that is going to cover it, but it still sucks start from ground zero. plus, insurance cannot really replace some things.
label: devastated
response: i understand. it is always difficult to start from ground zero. good luck.

situation: my ex took me to six flags and wanted me to ride a really high roller coaster. i hate heights so i really was not sure about it.
dialogue: my ex took me to six flags and wanted me to ride on a very high roller coaster.
interesting.did you do it
yeah, but only because he was getting mad at me. i hate heights and i was very unsure about it.
label: apprehensive
response: lol why would he get mad..but did you have fun in the end

situation: my husband is lucky i did not heat on him when i know he cheated on me.
dialogue: my husband is so lucky i cheat on him like he did.
why do you cheat on him?
i could have. but i did not. he cheated on me actually.
label: faithful
response: oh i see, why are you still with him then?

situation: i really wanted my package to come in the mail today, so i stayed at the window to see if it would arrive.
dialogue: damn, i really wanted my ebay package to arrive today, but it did not.
i know how you feel. are you also spoiled by amazone prime?
indeed, i thought everything came this early.
label: hopeful
response: haha, i know. especially when i purchase firearms related things like ammunition. it has to ship ground.  1 week for shipping?!?!   rage.

situation: i got really mad at my dog the other day. there is a rabbit living under my shed, and when he saw it eating our grass, he chased it out of our yard.
dialogue: i got so mad at my dog the other day.
what did your dog do?
he saw the rabbit that lives under my shed eating some grass in my yard, and decided to scare it and chase it away.
label: angry
response: oh no, well at least he did not hurt the rabbit.

situation: i am upset that i crashed my new car yesterday.
dialogue: i am so upset about what happened yesterday.
what happened to you?
i accidentally can off the road avoiding a deer and totaled my new car.
label: sad
response: that sucks sorry to hear. are you okay?

situation: i went to my first concert this weekend i was actually very moved at how good the live singers did.
dialogue: i went to my first concert this weekend i seen beyonce herself it was so awesome.
oh nice! i bet you will remember that for a long time
yes and i will it was great and her voice and the singers really moved me because even in person it was lovely.
label: impressed
response: i have never been to a concert. i should go see one like you!

situation: over this past weekend, i found out a friend of mine from school had passed away. even as i get older it is still shocking to see people i went to school with passing.
dialogue: this past weekend i found out a friend of mine i went to school with passed away. he had a heart attack while he slept.
that is terrible! how does that make you feel?
it makes me feel old. i mean i am not that old, but to see people my age passing away really makes me think about my own mortality.
label: sad
response: that is the reality of life, unfortunately! that is what you have to enjoy life now.

situation: i am upset that i have to tell my young daughter her hamster died today.
dialogue: i am upset i have to tell my daughter her pet died.
that is terrible. how long have you had this pet?
she had it for 2 years. but i feel i must be honest with her.
label: sad
response: honesty is vey important. i hope she will not feel too bad.

situation: i cannot believe my husband is taking me on a vacation he planned all by himself.
dialogue: i cannot believe my husband planned a trip all by him.
where are you going?
i am still shocked he planned a cruise for 7 days.
label: surprised
response: that is going to be so fun!

situation: i start my diet next week and i am no where near arranged to keep on schedule with my workouts or meal preps.
dialogue: i start my diet monday and let's just say i am not ready to start.
i am never ready. which diet are you trying
the keto diet and i have started looking up meal preps and workouts but as of non i am so not arranged to start this up i need more time.
label: prepared
response: i think my favorite and easiest would have to be atkins but still alot of prep to get started

situation: i love my little fur babies they are my family and so warmhearted i do not look at them as dogs those are my babies.
dialogue: my dogs are my life more like my family i love them.
my kitties are my family too. animals are the best.
yes they are you cannot be lonely with them they are just so warmhearted and loving always.
label: caring
response: exactly! i am glad you have them

situation: i cannot believe i never knew how well my husband can drawl.
dialogue: i cannot believe my husband hid a talent her had from me for 15 years.
that sounds interesting. what was it? and how did you find out? and why did he hide it! if you do not mind me asking, of course.
i happen to come across all his drawings. he is as good as most professional artists!
label: impressed
response: oh i see. well that is a pretty positive talent then, huh? maybe you should encourage him to keep doing it. maybe he misses it. you could get him a present for his birthday or christmas that was related to drawing tools/pencils and all that.

situation: i use to dance when i was younger and i am going to start back to just have a hobby for myself a little me time i am positive it will go great.
dialogue: i am starting back dancing ballet next month it is been a while since i last danced.
how is that working out for you
a little rusty but i know when i get in the class and hit the floor with my shoes i am more then positive it will be great.
label: confident
response: practice makes perfect

situation: i am so annoyed i was billed twice by accident. but it keeps happening.
dialogue: i hate i keep receiving double bills every month from comcast.
omg i would be upset too. how many times have you called them to fix it?
every month they shut off my service because i did not pay the second bill. then i have to go all over this month after month of them fixing their errors.
label: annoyed
response: sounds like a nightmare! total.

situation: every time i see my wedding picture around the house i think back to that day.
dialogue: when i see my wedding picture around the house i always think back to that day.
does it make you feel happy about your life since then?
yeah, just makes me think back to those times and how it was so different from now.
label: sentimental
response: well at least you will always have your memories as time goes on.

situation: my favorite football team lost their preseason game i talked so much smack before the game for them to loose i feel so ashamed.
dialogue: my favorite football team lost their preseason game and i talked so much smack to everyone saying they was going to win.
that is why i do not watch sports we always make fun of our uncle because he talks a lot of smack and die hard redskins fan
i love the jaguars i was ashamed i talk a lot of smack to everyone i guess me and your uncle need to stay quite next time.
label: embarrassed
response: lol no! you should not! that is the best part! talking smack to each other

situation: there was a bad accident this morning by my daughter's school because a careless driver was not going the speed limit in the school zone i was so mad because a child could have been hurt.
dialogue: i dislike a careless driver and this morning i was furious with one by my daughters elementary school.
oh i know how you feel! i wish there was some kind of hotline where you could report a license plate to law enforcement so they would get in trouble for being stupid with kids around
i wish to and the school zone light was flashing but they was driving past the 15 mph minimum a child could have got hurt.
label: angry
response: that is awful! people should be arrested for that

situation: i lost $100 yesterday i am so unhappy still what a big lost cannot believe i did that.
dialogue: i lost some money yesterday in the parking lot i am still so unhappy about that.
oh no!  devastating! i am so sorry.
i know it is i lost $100 and was actually on the way to pay my car insurance with that cannot believe i was careless.
label: sad
response: that makes me feel ill so i am sure you were sick. i hope somehow you make it up!

situation: i was trying to find my son's back to school supplies myself over ordering them from school.  they wanted specific brands and i had a hard time finding them.
dialogue: i decided to buy my son's supplies for kindergarten, they wanted very specific brands/counts.
that could turn out expensive. did they need a particular brand for a particular reason?
i am not sure, it was just on the list.  i had a really hard time finding them.
label: annoyed
response: that is annoying, maybe they should provide links for you next time?

situation: i just got out of a job interview for a customer assistant role.
dialogue: i just got out of a job interview for a customer assistant role.
how did it go?
i think it went well, apart from a few mistakes, hopefully i got the job.
label: anticipating
response: that is great.  interviews are very intimidating.

situation: i recently had to babysit my cousins, but they made a mess everywhere in the house.
dialogue: i recently had to babysit my cousins, it was a disaster.
oh no, what happened?
they made a mess everywhere in the house. really was not a good way to earn money.
label: caring
response: there has o be an easier way.  i have always avoided babysitting because i just do not like other peoples kids that much.

situation: yesterday was my birthday, and my girlfriend had a surprise planned for me. it was a birthday party with my best friends, and she got me some really cool gifts!
dialogue: yesterday was my birthday and i knew my girlfriend had a surprise planned for me, but no idea what it would be.
so i am guessing she gave you a good surprise?
an awesome one! all my best friends were there and i got some pretty sweet gifts!
label: excited
response: she is must be a keeper then.

situation: i won two tickets to go to a music festival last summer. i was able to see some of my favorite punk rock bands with my older bro and a few of his friends, it was radical!
dialogue: against all odds, i won two tickets to go to a music festival last summer.
that is awesome.  i have never won anything in my life.  what festival was it?
that is a shame! it was a festival called pooza fest. many punk-rock and acoustic shows!
label: excited
response: congratulations!  did you have a good time?

situation: i won a pair of tickets to go to rockfest this summer. unfortunately, none of my friends could go and so i ended up staying home instead.
dialogue: i won a pair of tickets to go to rockfest this summer.
wow that is awesome.  how did you win them? i never win anything cool.
i won them by sharing and liking a facebook page! unfortunately, none of my friends could go and so i ended up staying home instead.
label: devastated
response: aww that stinks, i hope you were at least able to sell them and make some money

situation: my coworker constantly calls in. the past 2 days he had called in and we made a friendly bet that he would not be in the next day.  he actually ended up coming in today.
dialogue: my coworker constantly calls in.  the last couple weeks he had only come in on fridays.  we made a friendly bet last night if he would come in today and i was pretty shocked when he actually was here on a wednesday.
that is crazy! how is he still employed?

he went on disability.  he actually was my old roommate so i know he just does not like working but at the same time has anxiety issues so he can go that route to not get fired.  it definitely does not look good for him though.
label: surprised
response: that makes people look bad. i have severe anxiety and still go to work. i get that things are hard but.. its bad to never come in.

situation: i told my best friends about an incident in where i self-harmed recently. i was scared to share, but i am glad i did; they were understanding and supportive.
dialogue: i told my best friends about an incident in where i self-harmed recently.
i am glad that you spoke out and shared your feelings. its not healthy to self harm and pent up your feelings.
agreed. i was anxious and scared to share, but i am glad i did; they were really supportive and it is helped me a lot.
label: trusting
response: that is what best friends are for, after all. i hope things have gotten better for you.

situation: my dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor. i do not know how to get him to stop and it is frustrating as all heck.
dialogue: my dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing it all onto the floor!
gesh, that is frustrating. i had a dog that used to do that too. had to get a trash can with a lid.
that is a good idea, i just have not found a nice looking one yet. it is really frustrating but i think i will just get whatever i can at this point.
label: angry
response: we even had to put something heavy on top of the lid to keep it from getting in it. hopefully that will work for now until you figure something out.

situation: an eagle landed on my flag pole in my front yard last week!
dialogue: an eagle landed on my flag pole in my front yard last week!
that is awe inspiring, very patriotic.  did you get pictures?
i did. not the best pictures because i was using my phone but still, it was really surprising.
label: surprised
response: i am sure, that is not something you see every day, or would even expect to see ever.  i am glad you got it documented.

situation: i have been putting off my exam studying by being productive in nearly all other areas of my life. as upset as i am in myself for procrastinating, i am pretty proud of what i have been accomplishing.
dialogue: i have been putting off my exam studying by being productive in other areas of my life.
well, that is great. but you probably should study as well. school is very important.
yeah. i am pretty upset in myself for procrastinating, but also proud of what i have been accomplishing. i am so conflicted in my emotions.
label: disappointed
response: yeah, that does sound like a conflicting situation. well at least you are doing something positive.

situation: i was helping my girlfriend pack up her sons toys and he had a lite-brite.  i loved playing with a lite-brite when i was younger.
dialogue: i was helping my girlfriend pack up her sons toys and he had a lite-brite.  i used to have a lite-brite and loved playing with it when i was younger.  it brought back some good memories.
i bought a lite brite from goodwill about a year ago. it was one of the remakes from recent years but we had fun with it.
his is a new version too.those toys that were older were sooo much better but at least kids today can have an idea of how awesome they were back then!
label: nostalgic
response: nope, they only know how to touch screens.

situation: my girlfriend just moved in. i feel really confident that this is the right move for the next steps for us.
dialogue: my girlfriend moved in last weekend.  i really feel like this is the right move for the next steps for us and our relationship.
that is great! how long have you two been together?
almost a year.  we are a little bit older though so i do not feel like its a rush into a relationship sort of thing.
label: confident
response: you learn a lot about someone when you move in with them, so if you feel comfortable in your relationship i think that is actually rather prudent.

situation: a friend of mine hadn't taken out her garbage in weeks. there were so many fruit flies around it, i felt sick to my stomach.
dialogue: a friend of mine hadn't taken out her garbage in weeks.
oh i will bet that did not smell pleasant.
you got that right. also there were so many fruit flies around it, i felt sick to my stomach.
label: disgusted
response: oh gross.  i hope she will not do that again.

situation: my girlfriend moved in this weekend.  i was really happy that she moved in but also super happy that the move is finally over.
dialogue: i really hate moving. my girlfriend just moved in last weekend.  i am really happy she moved in but  i am also super happy that the move is finally over.
moving is the worst.  all those boxes.  ugh. i hope i do not have to do it for awhile
haha, the boxes are still being unpacked and probably will be for the next couple weeks.  i am hoping we do not have to again for a while!
label: joyful
response: i hope its good that she moved in with you.  things must be serious

situation: i was lucky enough to get an opportunity to volunteer for one of my favorite companies at a convention. i was so scared of doing something wrong or looking like a fool but eventually i gained confidence and did well.
dialogue: i was lucky enough to get an opportunity to volunteer for one of my favorite companies at a convention.
that sounds pretty amazing, what convention was it?
otakuthon 2018. it was so amazing, i ended up doing really great!
label: afraid
response: i am so happy for you, it sounds like it was a wonderful opportunity!

situation: looking at old pictures
dialogue: i was looking at my old photo album today, it brought back a lot of memories
that is always so much fun. which ones made you feel the most nostalgic?
the one where i was eating ice cream, oh god i miss eating ice cream
label: nostalgic
response: i know how you feel. i feel guilty about indulging in ice cream the older i get.

situation: i told my family i wanted nothing a few christmas' ago. they ended up getting a an xbox one, and i had no idea how much fun i would have until i received it!
dialogue: "i told my family i wanted nothing a few christmas' ago, even if i knew they'd get me something anyways.
oh yea? and what did they get you?
i got an xbox one, and i had no idea how much fun i would have until i received it.
label: surprised
response: oh nice.  those are fun.  i love playing video games

situation: i went for a run last month and the most unexpected thing happened to me. i saw a deer on the sidewalk, in my small suburban neighborhood
dialogue: i went for a run last month and the most unexpected thing happened to me.
oh yes? what happened?
i was running on a road with a sidewalk, i turned the corner and saw a deer staring at me. cannot believe i found one in my small suburban neighborhood.
label: surprised
response: oh, that must have been so precious! we had deer around where i used to live they are gorgeous creatures.

situation: my little brother was stuck gaming on a horrendously slow computer for years. recently, i re-built my previous gaming computer and gave it to him so he could finally play games and truly enjoy them. i felt so happy seeing his face light up when he experienced it!
dialogue: my little brother was stuck gaming on a horrendously slow computer for years.
that is not much fun. did he get a new one recently?
kind of. i built myself a new pc, and gave him my previous one. i re-built it for him and made sure everything would work perfectly!
label: content
response: wow, you are smart and kind! i would not know where to start re. building a computer. well done!

situation: my older sister stole money from me. i knew it was her, but had no proof and my parents did nothing about it.
dialogue: my older sister stole money from me.
do you know it was her for sure? that is horrible that you cannot trust your own sister.
yeah, no one else in the household would ever do something like that. the worst thing is, my parents did nothing about it.
label: furious
response: that is horrible. it sucks that you have to keep such a close eye on your things in front of family. i would be so mad.

situation: dream i had
dialogue: today i woke from an amazing dream which i had, it brought back a lot of amazing memories, memories which i wish i could go back to.
i hear you! that sounds almost worse then a nightmare as it sounds like it is stuff you miss!
yeah, but at the same time, it motivated me for the day which was nice
label: nostalgic
response: that is great! what kind of stuff was in the dreams?

situation: a client on a job site last week was very impressed at the way we installed his new system for him. i could not help by keep smiling since it was my design.
dialogue: last week as we were finishing up on a job site, the client was over joyed at the way we had done the installation. i could not help but keep smiling since it was my design.
that has got to be one of the best feelings. i love being complimented.
yes, it is great to see something you designed be put into a working model.
label: proud
response: you should be proud of yourself. keep pushing it and work and it will all pay off.

situation: what i saw online today
dialogue: i was just like the usual, working on my website, and then i saw a disgusting advert which was about society
do not put too much weight into those advertisements. sometimes they are just there to get a rise out of you.
yeah, but i wish it was not like this
label: disgusted
response: i know that feeling. sometimes they can really get under your skin.

situation: my girlfriend moved in this past weekend.  we have a ton of boxes to unpack but i am hopeful we will get it done in the next couple weeks
dialogue: my girlfriend moved in over the weekend.  we have a ton of boxes to unpack but i am thinking it should be something that can be done in the next couple weeks.
that is nice to hear. hopefully it makes you two happy. i would just unpack the necessities first and move from there.
i think that is the plan.  after those were just slowly going to go from room to room until everything is done.  not a huge rush and were both super happy.well i am.  i am assuming she is too!
label: hopeful
response: sounds like a plan! make sure to hydrate properly because unpacking is cumbersome work!

situation: sudden realisation of life
dialogue: today i woke up, and i realised that i am more than content with my life, it made me happy and peaceful
that would be a great feeling.  did something happen to make you feel more content?
yes, i just realised i have everything i ever wanted in my life
label: content
response: that is so awesome! congrats! i am hoping to get there soon.  i have a lot to be thankful for but i know i need to work on just a little bit before i am fully content.

situation: i am going to chicago in a couple weeks.  i have not been in a while so i am really looking forward to it.
dialogue: i am going to chicago in a couple weeks.  i have not been there for about 15 years so i am really looking forward to it.
oh nice! i know that feeling, is it home? what made you think about going there?

it is not home but i went there for family trips when i was younger. my girlfriends friend is having a baby shower and lives there so i am tagging along and were going to make a long weekend out of it!
label: excited
response: nice! hope you enjoy your weekend and make sure to make the most out of it!

situation: today i saw one of my old friend
dialogue: i really do not like randomly pumping into old friends, it get's me nervous, and i saw one of my old friend's today and  i was surprised, to say the least
yeah it can be akward some times specially if you do not know what to talk about
yeah, so i tried to look for a way out before i admit defeat, but then i realised there was no way out and so i talked to them in the end
label: surprised
response: yeah a little chat to an old friend cannot hurt did you enjoy the conversation?

situation: a co-worker of mine was fired at our work.  he seemed to be doing a good job though in terms of performance
dialogue: a co-worker of mine was fired at work
do you think they deserved it?
no, their performance seemed to be good
label: surprised
response: well as they say, "better them than you"

situation: proud of my wife
dialogue: today my wife worked super hard for our future and made an amazing progress
that is wonderful it is good to hear you guys are doing good progress
thank you, in a few months everything will work out perfectly
label: impressed
response: that is good hard work and determination will always pay off

situation: thinking about my life
dialogue: today i was walking outside and then suddenly had a moment where i realised how amazing my life is
thats a really good feeling is not it? anything in particular?
just how i have everything i ever wanted, and that made me feel very grateful
label: grateful
response: that is awesome.   i am glad youre happy.  keep the positive energy flowing

situation: getting accused of a crime at work you did not do
dialogue: i got accused of something at work today.
i am guessing it was not your fault? do you know whos it was?
i was not even at work the day it happened, yet they still insist it was me.
label: furious
response: that sounds like sabotage to me. is there any way to prove you were not there? i would be furious.

situation: no one came to visit my house today and i was very lonely
dialogue: i watched out the window for visitors to my house today, it was saddening.
did they not ever come?
no one came to visit.
label: lonely
response: man that is a bummer.  i would visit you but that would be weird.

situation: proud of my wife and me
dialogue: today my wife and i decorated our house and made amazing designs on our bedroom walls, i am so proud of us
that is awesome.  what kind of designs are there?
a rabbit near her and a owl near my side of the bed and random marks everywhere else
label: proud
response: that is very very cool.  i would love something like that in mine

situation: its a good day
dialogue: work was fun, my manager told everyone about the amazing work i put in
its always nice getting praise and compliments.  i hope everyone was proud of you
they are, and i am very proud of myself
label: joyful
response: that is great.  i hope you get a raise too

situation: my dog got bit by something and had a huge front lip. i felt so bad for him, i was doing anything i could to make sure he felt better.
dialogue: my dog was bit by something and had a huge front lip and looked really sad.  i felt terrible for him and was doing anything i could to help.
like what?
i took him to the vet who checked it over and determined he was bit.  they suggested benedryl and rest for a couple days until it went down.
label: caring
response: wow that is really compassionate of you

situation: the future is looking bright
dialogue: i was looking though the window today and the beautiful sight outside the window gave me a positive outlook on life and made me realise to work harder for my future
are you feeling much more motivated now? what do you want to achieve?
i am feeling motivated, i want to be financially free and continue to learn and develop myself even more
label: hopeful
response: that is such fantastic goals to aim for in life! i wish you all the best.

situation: surprise birthday party in which i got cake thrown at my face
dialogue: it was my birthday today, so my family organised a party that i did not know about.
happy birthday.  that was so nice of them.  i bet you were surprised.  was there cake?
oh yeah, the surprise was the cake being thrown in my face!
label: surprised
response: haha that sounds quite messy, but i hope that it atleast tasted good

situation: finance
dialogue: money is such a weird thing, still do not agree with this ideology but it is the way things have been inherited since the start, i just wish it was not so controlling, i am worried about my future income
i agree, you need money for everything these days and it controls us.
yeah i will continue to work hard on my finance and make sure it does not control me
label: afraid
response: me too, i try not to worry about money so much. there is more to life than that.

situation: my work
dialogue: my work is going well and i am happy with the outcome with everything and i am feeling hopeful
i hope your work continues on the path you want and expect.
thank you and i hope you do so too, let's work hard!
label: hopeful
response: hard work is supposed to payoff, right?

situation: not sleeping enough
dialogue: i am feeling very guilty recently as i am putting a lot of stress on my body and not sleeping enough, it is making me feel very bad
i know how that feels and it can make you sick very fast. do whatever you can to try and get enough sleep.
i know i should, but it is been very rough recently with work and all
label: guilty
response: if you get sick you will not be able to work at all so please take care of yourself.

situation: trusting my guts
dialogue: i will not listen to anyone anymore, what i know now is that i trust my guts! that always works out well for me
what happened?
as usual i decided to listen to my father, he told me to come back to my home city and said he has a job there, so i could quit mine, but when i went there he lied, and now i do not have a job
label: trusting
response: wow, that is cruel.

situation: the mountain ahead
dialogue: i anticipate my future, if i continue to work always and chase after my dreams i will climb that mountain
yeah that is a pretty good mindset to go by.
thank you, i hope it goes well for you too
label: anticipating
response: just keep it up and you will go far.

situation: my abilities
dialogue: i believe in my abilities more now, i am surprised but today i managed to write amazing 3 line code to do the base 64 decode process
that is great! i am also learning to write code.
oh really? what language on?
label: surprised
response: html/css/java. i am excited about a career change.

situation: i was nervous for my mom's surprise party
dialogue: i was nervous for my mom's surprise party
why is that?
not sure if everyone who rsvp'd would show up. people are so flaky these days.
label: anxious
response: oh god yes i know what you mean, any ideas what you wanna do ?

situation: going into a dark alleyway to get home from school
dialogue: i decided to go a new route home from school today, but it did not turn out as planned.
uhoh, did you get lost?
no, it just took me somewhere dodgy.
label: apprehensive
response: oh that is scary.  i hope you were ok.  make sure your doors are locked

situation: i was able to get my car fixed.  i am praying it will last longer from now on
dialogue: i was able to get my car fixed
what was wrong with it
engine issues, i am praying it will last a bit longer now
label: hopeful
response: good luck! we just had our mini cooper blow its engine yesterday . $12.5k to replace

situation: music i listened to today
dialogue: today i listened to one of my old time favourite music and it moved my emotions and made me joyful
well music does have a really cathartic effect on people.
yup, it is also a digital drug
label: joyful
response: he can have a great impact on your brain and feeling that is for sure

situation: my friend stole my laptop as a prank and gave it back by the end of the day
dialogue: oh god today! my friend stole my laptop as a prank and gave it back to me late at night
wow!  that is a horrible prank!  i would be crying!  what did you do when your friend gave it back?
i punched him, i was so mad and furious
label: angry
response: i would have been really mad as well!  hopefully he learned not to pull that kind of prank on you again!

situation: feeling full of emotons
dialogue: today is a weird day, i am just feeling so emotional
i am sorry to hear that. do you mind if i ask what happened today to make it so weird?
it is not a bad feeling so do not be sorry, it happens every now and then, just makes me realise how grateful i am to be alive
label: caring
response: oh, i see. i think i kind of understand. it at least sounds like you are a really self-aware person, and appreciative of the small things, and that you have decent perspective on things. the emotions might be difficult to deal with, but at least there are some positives there for you to take stock of

situation: crashed my car today into a lamppost
dialogue: i almost died today coming home from work.
thats crazy. and scary.  what happened?
crashed the car, totalled it too.
label: angry
response: im so sorry.  i hope youre ok

situation: my boss told me if i worked hard id get a raise
