dialogue: my mother got a big cake and left it in the fridge for us to eat later, i selfishly took it all upstairs and closed my door and ate all of it while watching anime
oh wow, the whole cake? has she found out yet? was she mad?
she hasn't yet, we are suppose to have it later tonight, but how disappointed she will be when she comes back from work and sees that the cake has been entirely devoured by me.
label: guilty
response: if you can and have time, i would try to get a quick replacement and explain to her. maybe she will understand.

situation: yesterday when i finished the math formula
dialogue: i created this math formula yesterday for uniquely identifying words! and i am so happy with myself
oh cool.  how does it work?
it seperates the ascii values of each character and adds them up to give a number, then it divides  them by their length and then it does something else which i will keep a secret :p
label: joyful
response: oh that is easy peasy.  sometimes i only have to wipe once when i go number 2.

situation: i never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
dialogue: i never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did!
oh man, i would be so jealous. when will it be your turn?
i am envying them. i do not know , i am working very hard as well.
label: jealous
response: i think your boss should give you more recognition in that case!

situation: i care for my family and always want the best for them
dialogue: i care a lot about my family and always want them to be happy
that is good!  you are awesome!  family is what is important
family should always come first.
label: caring
response: i agree!

situation: i am ready for my new semester
dialogue: i am very ready for my first semester in university!
ready for all those ice breakers? those amazing crazy party? what are you hoping to do this year?
i am really hoping i can make some good friends, and just learn about everything i do not know a lot about you know?
label: prepared
response: yeah defiantly, my best advice to you is to learn and focus on your studying and always expand in knowledge that is the one thing we seniors always wish we had done

situation: i was very angry when i learned about what happened
dialogue: i was very angry when i learned about what happened
what? what happend? why are you angry?
i am angry because my mom and my sister had a fight and they are not talking together. that made me very mad.
label: furious
response: really? was it about something very stupid?

situation: i play guitar as a hobby but i hardly ever play in front of other guitarists.  i only feel comfortable doing it if i know those around me cannot play as well or at all.
dialogue: i play guitar as a hobby but rarely play in front of other guitarists.  i only feel comfortable doing it if the people around me play worse or not at all.
i think that is a kind of natural reaction, especially if it is just a hobby. i would have a fear of being judged.
exactly!  i always feel there is less chance of embarrassment if you are the best in the room.
label: confident
response: definitely. i feel the same speaking foreign languages. it is more of a self-conscious thing.

situation: i am look forward to next week!
dialogue: i am looking forward to next week, i am going on a holiday with my fiance!
that does sound like fun! where do you guys plan on going?
well, we are going to turkey! i have heard some good things about that country i am very excited
label: anticipating
response: that sounds like a good time. not the usual country you see people vacation to

situation: i have hope for the future
dialogue: i have a lot of hope for the future. i am going to get married soon, and everything is going to be amazing!
that is awesome! it is so good that you have such a positive outlook on everything.
is not it? i do not see negative things in life, i try to always look at the bright side.
label: hopeful
response: i think you have the perfect outlook. i hope i can strive to maintain something like that as well.

situation: i am sad because my brother failed me
dialogue: i am sad because my brother failed me.
what did he do yolo?
he could not keep his promise with me. he said he was going to get me pepsi max but he did not and that made me sad.
label: disappointed
response: this is absolutely the worst! he is no man in my eyes!

situation: my brother is sick and he puked in front of me
dialogue: my brother was sick and he puked in front of me, it smelled horrible
oh, yuck! that is gross. did you get sick too?
i did not, but no one was home and i had to clean that up
label: disgusted
response: that is rough! my husband always did with the kids when he was home.

situation: i am moving out of this country soon and i am worried about my university
dialogue: i am moving out of this country soon and i am worried about my university, because i will have a lot of exams to do and not gonna lie i am stressed out.
do not be! i know this is overused but trust me, it is not as hard as everyone else makes it to be, if you focus and aim for your goals, you will get it! i know you can do it!
that was very needed , thank you so much, i was really stressed because of it.
label: anxious
response: do not be, i am sure your fiance will always be right next to you and help you out

situation: i am scared of the global warming.
dialogue: global warming is terrifying me. and i am scared people are not even realising it.
it really is, what can we do to help?
i do not know maybe starting by stop using all those cars ? i do not know i wish we could do something.
label: terrified
response: that'd be a good idea, we could all start biking.

situation: i just delivered the best project at work
dialogue: i just delivered the best project at work!
what was the project?1
the project that i worked on was to deliver a marketing speech for healthy eating
label: confident
response: you must be an expert on nutrition then!

situation: for the future
dialogue: i am so hopeful for the future!
what are you looking forward too?
i am going to see my fiance who lives in adifferent country
label: hopeful
response: which country? that sounds fun, are you guys doing anything fun there?

situation: the security guards
dialogue: i am travelling soon, but i am bringing with myself a lithium ion battery for phone replacement to the airport security, i am anticipating the security there so i may talk to the person at the desk to confirm i can take such an item
yeah. it would be best to check the website for a list of approved items
the website says yes! but my friends say they do not know if that is accurate so i think i need to double check once i am there
label: anticipating
response: yes. hopefully all will go well

situation: i am very happy, my best friend is getting married today
dialogue: i am very happy, my best friend is getting married today
are you his best man?
well , i consider him my brother, i do not know if he thinks the same, we grew up together.
label: joyful
response: i hope he does, being the best man is an honour and you are ready for it.

situation: impressed at my work
dialogue: at work i ended up writing code that is able to detect words that are similar and detect their meaning and cluster them into groups of n clusters
sounds quite interesting to code
it sure is! i used genetic algorithm as well as k-means and neural netwroking
label: impressed
response: oh dang i never really dabbled that deep when i did my small share of programming

situation: my feelings might hurt me in the future
dialogue: i am nervous and scared of my feelings, i feel like in the future they will hurt me
what happened?
nothing so far, but it is what migh thappen in the future
label: afraid
response: i hope all goes well so you are as happy as possible.

situation: i saw one of my old friends today
dialogue: i saw one of my old friends today
that is good! i hope you had a good time?
well it brought back a lot of memories, and it felt nice to see her after all those years.
label: nostalgic
response: yes, it is great when you run into an old friend you have not saw for a long time.

situation: for the life i have been given
dialogue: so greatful to be given this wonderful life
what are you planning on doing with it?
build a life with my fiance and grow together and gain more and more knowledge
label: grateful
response: that sounds so admirable, i would love to see you grow to an amazing person.

situation: hungry and nothing to eat and no one here
dialogue: in my room, alone and i am starving
why do not you go get yourself some food? or just order some?
i have, but the wait is so real you know?
label: lonely
response: oh god i get you! waiting for your food to arrive is real torture.

situation: i saw cat the other day, i got so scared
dialogue: i saw a cat the other day it showed up out of nowhere i got really scared.
wow, spooky, what did you do next?
i just walked past it.
label: afraid
response: that must have startled you

situation: i am starving and nothing to eat
dialogue: . starving once again, this feeling sucks, it gets me all depressed, nothing to eat and the delivery is 1 hour late
you having money problems?
yeah! but i still ordered but the food delivery is not here yet
label: sad
response: i do not think i have ever had a delivery guy be that late. i would be mad.

situation: at my cat for pooping
dialogue: my cat really got on my nerves today! she pooped in the kitchen floor and that was the first thing i saw when i woke up
oh, that stinks.literally! i have pets too so i know how you feel. my cat will eat too much sometimes and throw up!
it is the worst right?. really made me so so so mad
label: angry
response: it is, i wished they could just use the toilet like we do!

situation: i am so proud of my fiancee
dialogue: i am so proud of my fiancee, she is been working extra hard.
thats good! nothing wrong with hard work and dedication
and seeing her reaching her goals and growing so much makes me so happy.
label: impressed
response: that does have to feel really good

situation: i am very lucky that i live out in the country where the quality of life is so much better than living in the high stress cities.
dialogue: i am very lucky that i live out in the country where the quality of life is so much better than living in the high stress cities
yes, where do you live?
i live in colorado with the mountains and fresh air with so many wonderful outdoor activities available.
label: grateful
response: i love colorado. i visit all the time.

situation: sometime i feel very happy that i am a us resident. when i travel to other countries everyone is so amazed that i am from the us. they treat you very differently because they think that the us is so great, rich and free.
dialogue: sometimes i feel very happy that i am a us resident. when i travel to other countries everyone is so amazed that i am from the us. they treat you very differently because they think that the us is so great, rich and free.
yeah, we have a lot to be thankful for.  we take for granted many of the perks of being a us resident!
that is for sure! i just wish other countries were the same. there are so many people suffering all over the world.
label: proud
response: i agree. there is a lot of suffering.  i am glad people like you and i recognize that.

situation: i am very happy that my popsicle business is finally thriving! i have worked so hard on it for many years.
dialogue: i am very happy that my popsicle business is finally thriving! i have worked so hard on it for many years.
that is great. where are you selling your popsicle?
from my house and from a few local stores. i am not ready to make it any bigger than that.
label: excited
response: i understand. good luck.

situation: i was so happy to come home the other day and everything was clean and dinner was already one the table. what did i do to deserve that?
dialogue: i was so happy to come home the other day and everything was clean and dinner was already on the table. what did i do to deserve that?
you were probably just being you.
no, i think somebody wants something. i am just waiting to hear it,.
label: surprised
response: haha! that is usually the case. : )

situation: i lived in new york city for a couple years and it is definitely a place where one can feel quite alone if you do not have family or friends.
dialogue: i lived in new york city for a couple of years and it is definitely a place where one can feel quite alone if you do not have family or friends.
i understand. is your family living far from new york?
yes, a plane ride away. but there was also a lot of cool things to see. i think it was a good experience but it would be better with friends and family.
label: lonely
response: it is always cool to have family and friends close by.

situation: when i am in nature i feel good that this world is exactly as it should be. everything is moving a long to gods desires.
dialogue: when i am in nature i feel good that this world is exactly as it should be. everything is moving along to gods plans.
that is a great mindset to have!  you must feel very happy and content!
yes, when i am in nature. but when i come to the big cities i feel like it is the devils playgrounds
label: faithful
response: why do cities make you feel that way?

situation: i feel so bad that i forgot again to fill the gas tank up in the car again after i used it all. my friend is going to kill me!
dialogue: feel so bad, i forgot again to fill the gas tank up in the car after i used it all. my friend is going to kill me!
oh no. and no one really likes pumping gas.
i just seem to forget until i get home. oh well i will just have to give her some money again instead. oh she is going to be angry.
label: ashamed
response: you could grab it when shes done with it and fill it up real quick for her!

situation: just got back from grocery shopping, the cashier gave me back $10 more change than i supposed to get
dialogue: just got back from grocery shopping, the cashier gave me back $10 more change than i supposed to get
did you give it back or just walk away?
i did not find out untill i got home, the store is kind of far and i think i am going to keep it, but it is eating on my conscious because of that
label: guilty
response: yeah, that is a hard one to deal with.  maybe you should give it back so you will not feel bad about yourself.

situation: i feel a little weird about looking at this house for sale. it looks haunted and i think something bad happened there, but not use
dialogue: i feel a little weird about looking at this house for sale. it looks haunted and i think something bad happened there, but not sure.
i would ask the realtor on some background and even google the address to see if any abuse headlines come from that place.
that is a good idea. it is such good deal and i think it would not need much money to fix it up. but a ghost in the house is definitely a deal breaker!
label: apprehensive
response: kinda makes you think even more since its such a good deal that people are just like get rid of it deff look into it!

situation: when bad things happen i get too emotional. i think more than other do. sometimes i think i am crazy.
dialogue: when bad things happen i get too emotional. i think more than other do. sometimes i think i am crazy.
i am sorry to hear that.sometime you just have stop and take a deep breathe so you do not get overwhelmed.
yeah, i know. but in the moment it is hard. i guess i am just a very emotional person. maybe i need theraoy,.
label: sentimental
response: therapy is a good thing. its is nothing to be ashamed of.

situation: i have faith that i will get pregnant soon. why is it so hard? is not that what a women's body is built to do?
dialogue: i have faith that i will get pregnant soon. why is it so hard? is not that what a women's body is built to do?
maybe it is not your body, but also your partners! something to check into to see which end its coming from, but none the less it will happen!
yeah, more people are having these issues these days. i think it may be true that someone may be poisoning us through the water and food or something! it is a scary world!
label: trusting
response: it is hard to trust anything, even the oatmeal recently was put on the news that its high in cancer causing pest spray.

situation: i found a lost baby duck. the mother was no where to be found. i brought it home and took care of it until it was big enough to be let loose again.
dialogue: i found a lost baby duck. the mother was no where to be found. i brought it home and took care of it until it was big enough to be let loose again.
that is kind of you, did everything go well when you put it back into the wild?
the duck flew away and was never to be found again. hopefully he was reunited somehow with his family. i just hope so.
label: caring
response: sounds like it went well!

situation: i feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people. some people are just cruel and are only out for themselves.
dialogue: i feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people. some people are just cruel and are only out for themselves.
yes, i hate those kind of people. they have nothing to do expect lying about other people.
yeah, it is very hurtful. but what can one do? get back at them? it just seems like you would go to their level. i guess it is better to just swallow it and move on.
label: angry
response: i just ignore them. at some point, they stop but they understand that it is not working.

situation: this past week my 3 year old son had strep throat. it is finally clearing up now, but i had to miss so much work to stay home with him.
dialogue: this past week my 3 year old son caught strep throat. i ended up having to miss the entire week at work to stay home with him.
i am sorry to hear that. i hope he is feeling better.
he is, i hated missing work, but that the sort of thing a person has to do for their children.
label: caring
response: it is. taking care of sick child is hard. missing work is also hard. the things we have to do for our children.

situation: my high heel broke in the cement the other morning and i had to wear them all day at work. not a good day!
dialogue: my high heel broke in the cement the other morning and i had to wear them all day at work. not a good day!
sounds like something on a movie! what a work day right, my god. bring extras next time?
yeah, from now on i will have an extra pair in my desk. everyone was teasing me all day. it was so annoying!
label: embarrassed
response: i bet they were atleast you can laugh about it now.

situation: my father continuously gambles all his earnings away even though he has two minors to support. when i found out, i was too angry to look at him.
dialogue: my father continuously gambles all his earnings away even though he has two minors to support.
that is very sad, has he considered getting help for his addiction?
nope, he does not care and denies it is an issue. when i found out, i was too angry to look at him.
label: furious
response: i can certainly understand your feelings, i hope he can somehow fix his habits.

situation: my friends and i started playing halo online recently. it brought back so many great memories from the times we played on the xbox 360.
dialogue: my friends and i started playing halo online recently.
has it been a lot of fun?
incredibly so. it brought back so many great memories from the times we played on the xbox 360.
label: nostalgic
response: oh yeah i remember those old halo days too during my childhood, such a great game.

situation: i feel happy to just stay in and watch a movie at home on a saturday night. i have no desire to go out and party like most people i know do.
dialogue: i feel happy to just stay in and watch a movie at home on a saturday night. i have no desire to go out and party like most people i know do.
i understand that feeling. it would not make sense for us all to want to do the same things, especially if you've partied before already.
yeah, been there done that. i do not miss those hangovers on sunday morning. totally not worth it anymore.
label: content
response: that is cool that you know what you want from life right now and that you do not feel obligated to do things just because of norms.

situation: last month, i finally received the promotion at work that i had been working towards. it seemed like i had finally got to the end of a very long road.
dialogue: last month,finally, after years of working towards it, i was finally promoted into senior management at my job.
oh that is great! does it come with a nice raise?
yes it did, and much better benefits. seems like i finally got to the end of a very long road.
label: content
response: do you kind of feel like there is no where else to go?

situation: after working for years at a job i did not like, and struggling in school, i found a new job that coincides with my major. for the first time in a long time, the future is not looking so dark.
dialogue: after working for years at a job i did not like, and struggling in school, i found a new job that coincides with my major.
i am so happy for you! all of your hard work paid off!
thanks! for the first time in a long time, the future is not looking so dark.
label: hopeful
response: that is great accomplishment! i wish you well on your new path in life!

situation: last week, i went to sit in my desk chair at work with a full cup of coffee and completely missed my chair and landed in the floor. my boss and a couple coworkers were right there as i hit the floor and spilled coffee all over my shirt.
dialogue: last week at work, i went to sit down at my desk chair and completely missed it and fell straight into the floor.
oh my.i hope you did not hurt yourself.
just my pride. my boss and a couple coworkers got a good view of me just flopping into the floor as documents and paperwork went flying.
label: embarrassed
response: since you did not hurt yourself i think i will have to laugh. it sounds like it was funny.

situation: i know i should not feel like this but i feel so envious when i drive through the rich neighborhoods and i know that i will never be able to live there.
dialogue: i know i should not feel like this but i feel so envious when i drive through the rich neighborhoods and i know that i will never be able to live there.
yea, i feel the same way.  it is worse when you have to pass by them twice a day.
i have to pass twice a day too. oh well, i should just be grateful for what i have now. i just cannot help that feeling from creeping in though. maybe i will buy a lottery ticket,.
label: jealous
response: heck no.  be envious that they were lucky enough to have their parents hand down all their money to them.

situation: my wife and i ordered our first new car last month, delivery time was six weeks. it seems like it is taking forever.
dialogue: last month my wife and i ordered our first new car with a delivery time of six weeks.
oooh, how exciting! what kind of car did you get?
we ordered a new ford superduty pickup. this six weeks is taking forever.
label: anticipating
response: i will bet it is! best of luck with your new truck!

situation: in the 6th grade, a bird pooped on my back during lunchtime. i had to rinse my shirt and wear it for the rest of the day, seeing as i had no spare shirt to wear; i felt so sick.
dialogue: in the 6th grade, a bird pooped on my back during lunchtime.
indoors?
nah we were having a barbecue outdoors.
label: disgusted
response: in the 6th grade? where is this school?

situation: last month a buddy of mine bought a scratch off ticket and won $4500. i never win anything when i buy them.
dialogue: last month, a buddy of mine bought a scratch off ticket and won $4500. i never win anything when i buy them.
wow! that is crazy. i am like that though. i never win anything either
i mean i am happy for him and all, but i would not mind some found money either.
label: jealous
response: haha right! maybe you should buy a few and see what happens. you cannot win if you do not play

situation: our puppy got out of his leash and ran toward the busy road
dialogue: our puppy wiggled out of his leash. he ran toward the busy road and was hit by a car. it was awful
oh god, i am so sorry. is he okay now?
sadly, no. he passed away at the vet a few hours later.
label: devastated
response: i hate to hear that. it is so hard to lose a pet. i hope you are doing okay through this.

situation: i have to take a business trip next week, i 'm not looking forward to flying
dialogue: coincidence, i too i am taking a trip but a business one, i 'm not looking forward to flying
do you not fly often? it is not too bad.
a couple of time, but it truly scares me
label: afraid
response: well if it is a bigger plane it is not as bad. just bring some headphones and listen to some comforting music.

situation: the other day i forgot to take my anti-anxiety medication. it did not affect me too bad until the next morning.
dialogue: the other day i forgot to take my anti-anxiety medication.
you have to be more careful next time, maybe you need a calendar to remind you.
i put an alarm on my phone, i just get so busy some mornings. at least it did not affect me too bad until the next morning.
label: anxious
response: i am so sorry to hear, i am glad that it did not cause a lasting effect.

situation: after my interview for a promotion at work, i am almost positive i have the job. my boss told me i nailed the interview and i have much more experience than the other candidates.
dialogue: i am feeling pretty good after my interview for a promotion at work last week. my boss told me i nailed the interview.
that is a fantastic feeling. i hope you get it.
well i have almost twice the experience as the other two candidates, so i have a really good feeling about it.
label: confident
response: keep riding that confidence. it will get you places. it sounds like you deserve it.

situation: the other night, drunk bicyclists were following me home and laughing on the sidewalk. i was pretty scared, especially since it was night.
dialogue: the other night, drunk bicyclists were following me home and laughing on the sidewalk.
that must have been a bit scary, you should have called the police.
i was not too far from my home so i figured i could tough it out. i was pretty scared however, especially since it was nighttime.
label: terrified
response: you cannot be too careful these days, i am so sorry that happened to you.

situation: nasa released some free space posters a couple of months back. i picked a few that i liked, had them printed for a small fee and now they are up on my wall! i am so happy.
dialogue: nasa released some free space posters a couple of months back.
okay! now that is interested, i would love to see them.
i think they have them up on their website, you should give them a look! i had them printed for a small fee and now they are up on my wall!
label: joyful
response: oh really? i will be checking it out. i would love to have some.

situation: yesterday i found a massive spider in my room. as much as i hate killing insects, i tried killing it and it ran away. i do not know where it went and i am a little scared.
dialogue: yesterday i found a massive spider in my room.
i am afraid of spiders. i would run and scream. what happened afterwards?
it ran off somewhere and i could not find it, even though i moved most of my furniture. i am a little scared.
label: afraid
response: i would move out of that room. maybe you need to spray the area.

situation: there was a chance that it could rain on the day my best friends and i went camping. i am so thankful that it did not, because we made a lot of nice memories during our trip.
dialogue: there was a chance that it could rain on the day my best friends and i went camping.
oh no! did it end up raining? did you take rain gear?
it barely did at night, but for the few days we went camping it was nice weather! i am so thankful that it did not, because we made a lot of nice memories during our trip.
label: grateful
response: that sounds like it was a lot of fun!

situation: when i walk through my house, the rooms are empty. there are no one here but me
dialogue: looks like we have something in common, when i walk through my house, the rooms are empty. there are no one here but me
i am sorry to hear that it can be hard ;/
i know, i am trying to cope but the emptiness is unbearable
label: lonely
response: yeah i would get a pet

situation: i was watching over my girlfriend's cat while she went away on a little trip. the cat wanted barely anything to do with me, and i felt so isolated.
dialogue: i was watching over my girlfriend's cat while she went away on a little trip.
that is so sweet of you. i love cats, you must be a caring spouse.
i like to think so, thanks! unfortunately, the cat wanted barely anything to do with me and i felt so isolated.
label: lonely
response: the cat did not like you, oh dear. i am so sorry that happened. you need to spend more time with the cat.

situation: ever since i started taking medication for anxiety and depression, i have been gaining weight. i have been a skinny boy all my life, and i still am but this extra chub has me feeling down.
dialogue: ever since i started taking medication for anxiety and depression, i have been gaining weight.
i have heard that is a common side effect but you might want to talk to your doctor about it
i have, she said i am okay because i still have a healthy weight. i have been a skinny boy all my life, and i still am but this extra chub has me feeling down.
label: sad
response: well you could always work out and turn it into muscle

situation: no matter who comes to the door, my dog barks. he is such a nuisance, but i love him.
dialogue: no matter who comes to the door, my dog barks.
its a good guard dog then
in a way yes, but not really. as soon as anyone enters the house, he turns into a huge lovable pup and wants them to pet him. he is such a nuisance but i love him.
label: annoyed
response: what kind of dog is he

situation: i was driving down the highway when i saw a car in an accident. it seems they hit a cow! oh my!
dialogue: i was driving down the highway when i saw a car in an accident. it seems they hit a cow! oh my!
animal accidents can be really bad!
i felt so bad for the poor cow. it seems no one was hurt except the cow. the car was pretty damaged though.
label: devastated
response: at least no one else was injured, but it is sad about the cow.

situation: my pet dog is getting older. i know one day she will not be around anymore
dialogue: my pet dog is getting older. i know one day she will not be around anymore
just cherish the moments
i will, but just the thought of it makes me blue
label: sad
response: it will be okay

situation: i put in a lot of effort and energy and i found a new job. it is an online teaching position and i feel so good about myself.
dialogue: i put in a lot of effort and energy and i found a new job!
what kind of job is it
it is an online teaching position and i feel so good about myself.
label: proud
response: that is a nice job i am sure

situation: one night i came home a little drunk from the bar and stole my neighbor's package. i am not even sure why i did it. i felt like an idiot when i had to give it to them the next day.
dialogue: i came home drunk from the bar and stole my neighbor's package that was sitting out.
uh oh! did you get in trouble?
no, but i felt like a jerk when i gave it to them the next day and had to explain what happened.
label: ashamed
response: that is good that you gave it back and were able to admit your mistake. i am sure they appreciate that.

situation: with all the money i have been saving up, i should be able to purchase an oculus rift virtual reality system soon! i am so stoked to try vr!
dialogue: with all the money i have been saving up, i should be able to purchase an oculus rift virtual reality system soon!
awesome, congrats! i am not too familiar with the oculus rift, is there a particular game you are eager to play?
hmm maybe robo recall, a game about fighting robots. otherwise i have to find out what games are available!
label: excited
response: robot games are always fun. i bet you will have a great time!

situation: i went biking on a new bike trail the other day. it was a lot of fun but i did not know the route or the hills, so i was really reluctant to go too fast lest i wipe out on a curve.
dialogue: i went on a new bike trail the other day, it was super fun but also a little scary.
ooh how so? were there a lot of hills and sharp turns?
yep, exactly. i also have a new bike so between the new route and the new bike, i was totally terrified of wiping out. so i took it slow.
label: apprehensive
response: i see. do you think you will be going back on that bike trail?

situation: i made a new friend at a convention i was volunteering at. i was shocked, i have not made any friends in well over a year because i am awful in social situations.
dialogue: i made a new friend at a convention i was volunteering at. i was shocked.
what kind of con was it
otakuthon 2018. it is about anime, japanese culture and videogames. i was volunteering for the msi booth (a pc-gaming company).
label: surprised
response: that is really cool! i like in texas so i cannot go to stuff like that

situation: i participated in a ropes course with my colleagues. it required a high level of faith in others, especially when we did the blind trust fall.
dialogue: i participated in a ropes course with my colleagues, we had to learn how to trust each other.
that sounds amazing!  how did everyone do?
pretty good. the hardest part for most of us was the blind trust fall, but in the end most of us learned to put faith in each other.
label: trusting
response: awesome!  hopefully what you guys learned in the ropes course translates over into the workplace.

situation: i let my little sister go into my wallet and grab my credit card so she can order something online for herself. she told me what it was in advance, i approved it, and i knew she would not steal from me. she is so trustworthy.
dialogue: i let my little sister go into my wallet and grab my credit card so she can order something online for herself.
why did you do tht?
she is very trustworthy and i knew she would not steal from me. it was also something she needed and did not have the money to get it yet.
label: trusting
response: that makes sense, you are a good older sibling!

situation: i once drank 6 pints of beer in a night and ended up getting very sick. i felt so bad about my actions, but it hasn't stopped me from doing it again.
dialogue: i once drank six pints of beer in a night and ended up getting very sick.
i would imagine, that is a lot to drink!
it really is. i felt so bad about my actions, but it hasn't stopped me from doing it at least one other time.
label: ashamed
response: i get that, well i hope you feel betternow!

situation: i never learned how to ride a bike. last summer, my brother had a bike that he wanted me to try, but i was too scared to try riding it in fear of falling.
dialogue: i never learned how to ride a bike.
why is that?
my parents never saw the importance i guess.
label: apprehensive
response: i get that, did your friends know how to ride bikes?

situation: my girlfriend made the cutest and most touching card for my birthday. i practically cried reading it.
dialogue: my girlfriend made the cutest and most touching card for my birthday.
aww that is sweet. did you cry?
i almost did. it was hard holding the tears back.
label: sentimental
response: why hold them back? it okay to cry

situation: i found out my cat has terminal kidney failure. i really do not want to lose her.
dialogue: my cat has terminal kidney failure. there is no cure.
oh, i am so sorry! i used to have a dog we loved so much who had diabetes.we gave him insulin shots twice a day but we lost him. i can relate to how you feel.
it really sucks. it is fairly common in cats and i sort of knew the diagnosis was coming but that does not make it any easier. i am sorry to hear about your dog.
label: devastated
response: our pets are our family..it is not easy to see them suffer.i feel for you. and thank you about our dog.

situation: i received horrific news from a best friend recently. they had tried to commit suicide. it was very hard to hear but thankfully they are getting the help they need.
dialogue: i received horrific news from a best friend recently.
oh no,  what happened?
they had tried to commit suicide. it was very hard to hear but thankfully they are getting the help they need.
label: devastated
response: that is terrible, you must have been devastated,  i hope he find the help he/she needs.

situation: you know at work, one of my coworker is always singing to himself, it bugs me
dialogue: you know at work, one of my coworker is always singing to himself, it bugs me
oh dear, but are you allowed to sing at work? that must be so annoying.
it really is, he thinks he knows how to sing, i would not be so annoying if he knew how to sing
label: annoyed
response: he needs to just sing in the shower. tell him to quit singing.

situation: one time i slipped on a banana peel
dialogue: one time i slipped on a banana peel
haha no way, i thought that only happens in cartoons!
yep, everyone was laughing at me
label: embarrassed
response: i am sorry but i probably would have, too. hopefully you did not get hurt though!

situation: my neighbor recently got a devastating cancer diagnosis. i have been bringing over pre-cooked meals for her and her husband whenever i have a chance so they have one less thing to worry about.
dialogue: my neighbor was recently diagnosed with a pretty bad form of cancer.
that is unfortunate, is he doing any chemotherapy ?
i am not entirely sure of the regimen, i did not want to ask too many questions. but i have been bringing pre-cooked meals over for her and her husband when i get a chance to help them out a little.
label: caring
response: well i hope everything works out for him!

situation: one time i was waiting all day for the mail man to deliver my package
dialogue: one time i was waiting all day for the mail man to deliver my package
what were you waiting for!
i was waiting for my computer monitor!
label: anticipating
response: nice!  the anticipation must have been killing you!

situation: i ran out of laundry soap the other day and grabbed a brand i used many years ago from the store. it was so interesting that the scent of that laundry soap brought me right back to where i was all those years ago, crazy how a familiar smell can do that.
dialogue: i ran out of laundry soap the other day, when i went to the store i grabbed a brand i hadn't used in many years.
how well did it work out for you?

oh it worked fine, but when i pulled my laundry out it surprised me how the smell of that soap reminded me of my life all those years ago when i used it regularly. is not it weird how scents can do that?
label: sentimental
response: wow!  that is such a great feeling!  i love when good memories come back to me!

situation: one time i saw my husband looking at another women
dialogue: one time i saw my husband looking at another women
o no what did you do?
i slapped him and beat up the other women
label: jealous
response: o no i am not sure that was the best response

situation: leaving the bar the other day with my boyfriend, i totally tripped and fell on the step just outside the door and scraped my knee. so humiliating.
dialogue: i was leaving the bar the other day with my boyfriend and tripped on the step just outside the door.
oh no! did you get hurt?
well, physically not so much, just a light scrape on my knee. but man my pride got wounded bad!
label: embarrassed
response: i bet that was a little embarrassing.

situation: i feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker
dialogue: i was a cigarette smoker for nearly an entire decade. in retrospect this is slightly embarrassing.
do not be embarrassed. you know that you had a problem and you are better now for it
right. not much that can be done about it now. i enjoy having more money now though for sure!
label: ashamed
response: that is understandable. i wish you the best in staying smoke free!

situation: i love my daughter. being a parent is actually a lot easier and more wholesome than i expected it to be.
dialogue: being a parent so far has not been anywhere near as difficult as i expected it to be. my daughter is awesome!
that is great to hear that things are going well for you.
thanks that means a lot to me!
label: caring
response: i am sure that things will continue to go smooth since you have a positive attitude about it.

situation: i was waiting to hear about a potential job offer. the waiting was absolutely killing me.
dialogue: i was waiting to hear back about a potential job offer, i really wanted the job.
how long has it been since the interview?
that is the thing, my anxiety and excitement started the moment i first talked to the company, it was driving me crazy. but i ended up getting the job!
label: anticipating
response: oh well congrats and good job!

situation: my friend won $500 in scratch-off lottery tickets. i think the lottery is pretty dumb but i would have loved to be in her shoes!
dialogue: my friend just won $500 in scratch-off lottery tickets!
oh that is awesome for your friend!
oh totally. i am happy for her but part of me was also a little envious, i hate to admit.
label: jealous
response: yeah i can understand that. i would feel the same.

situation: i took on a speed bike course recently that was above my skill level. i was a little scared but i have been practicing quite a bit and feel good about my bike skills these days!
dialogue: i took on a challenging speed bike course recently that was above my skill level.
that was probably not a good idea, how did it go for you?
it actually worked out amazing! i knew going into it that i would practiced a lot and had built up my skills, so i was sure i could do it even if i was a little hesitant.
label: confident
response: well, you never know if you can do something till you try. i am glad you were able to do so well.

situation: when i was interviewing for my job i did all i could to get ready. i doubt i could have done much more to get ready for the interview.
dialogue: when i was interviewing for a promotion at my job. i did all i could to get ready for the interview.
that can be kind of scary. how did it go?
it went great. i having put in all the work ahead of time to get ready, i knew exactly how to answer the questions they had for me.
label: prepared
response: awesome, congratulations! it just goes to show how great things can happen when you are prepared.

situation: at work a coworker of mine tried to take credit for a job i had completed. i went straight to my boss and got it lined out once i found out what had happened.
dialogue: at my job a coworker took credit for a job i had completed. once i found out, i went straight to my boss and got it straightened out.
good job.  your coworker sounds like a shady little b**ch did you let him/her know what is up
i found them and gave them a piece of my mind. what kind of person does something like that.
label: furious
response: for real.  glad you had enough self-respect to handle it, most people dont'

situation: we went camping this summer. my boyfriend made fun of me for packing so much but changed his tune when it turned out he forget the bottle opener and i already had one!
dialogue: we went camping this summer and my boyfriend made fun of me for packing so much stuff.
aww haha how many bags did you bring
it honestly was not *that* much stuff, i packed it well. but the joke's on him, he felt dumb for making fun of me after we needed a bottle opener and i just so happened to pack one.
label: prepared
response: heey there you go..sounds like you are the resourceful one

situation: this couple just moved in next door and have been having loud parties non-stop for weeks. even on weekdays! i am so mad.
dialogue: this couple just moved into my building and have been having loud parties almost every night!
that sounds awful!
yeah, it is really irritating. i do not mind people having fun but come on, every single night? it is really ticking me off.
label: furious
response: have you tried talking to them about it?

situation: an actual ice cream man came through my neighborhood recently, i did not know they still exist! seeing the kids come running out to the truck made me miss being little and excited about the ice cream man.
dialogue: an actual ice cream man came through my neighborhood! i did not think they still exist.
i do not think that i have seen/heard one of those since the 90s. possibly the early 2000's at the earliest! crazy, i did not know that they still exist either!
right? seeing the kids come running out really made me miss when i was little and got all excited about the ice cream man!
label: nostalgic
response: i loved that too!

situation: i am happy with my life.
dialogue: i am content with my life. i have nothing to complain about, luckily!
that is wonderful to hear, good for you. there is way too much craziness in the world making people unhappy. it is nice to hear someone is doing well and happy.
agreed. i have to actively distance myself away from the drama of reality but doing this makes me happier. not sure if this is ideal but that is ok!
label: content
response: distancing yourself from the negative things sounds like a totally healthy way to insulate yourself from that stuff.

situation: going through the attic last week, i came across a box of old photo albums and some of my childhood things. i just sat for hours looking at the old pictures.
dialogue: i was cleaning out the attic last week, and came across a box of old photo albums and some of my childhood things. i sat for hours just looking at old photos.
aw, that must have brought up a lot of nostalgia for you.
it really did. seeing all those old faces i have not seen for years. it was a great experience.
label: nostalgic
response: did you share it with anyone else?

situation: i recently applied for a job at a new company. getting this job would but such a step up for me and my family. it would really be great if i got it.
dialogue: i recently applied for a job with a  new company. it would be such a step up for my family if i got it.
nice, a step up is always such a relief. do you feel confident you will get the job?
some, i did well in the interview. just trying to keep spirits up while they make their decision.
label: hopeful
response: well i hope you get it. good luck!

situation: i am waiting to hear about a lucrative job opportunity, it would pretty much be everything i want. i feel pretty good about my chances.
dialogue: i am waiting to hear about a lucrative job opportunity, it would pretty much be my dream job.
that is great. how long are you going to have to wait?
not sure, hopefully i hear this upcoming week. i feel pretty good about my chances so that is making the waiting a little easier.
label: hopeful
response: i am glad you are so confident about your prospects. i hope you hear something very soon from them.

situation: a lot of my behavior as a teenager was embarrassing in retrospect.
dialogue: most of the decisions that i made as a teenager were kind of embarrassing in retrospect.
i think we have all been there.i have done my fair share of dumbassery
i feel it. most of the bad decisions were fun, at least.
label: embarrassed
response: ha yolooo

situation: i cannot wait until all the trees change colors and the weather starts getting cold. i love autumn!
dialogue: i cannot wait until all the trees change colors and the weather starts getting cold. i love autumn!
i know right! i noticed leaves on the ground the other day and got all excited! is autumn your favorite season, too?
yes! my absolute favorite! it is not too cold and not too hot and there is so much beauty all around! it is soon time to get all the winter clothes out.
label: anticipating
response: i do not mind winter either but you are so right, the temperature is just right during fall.

situation: a project i worked really hard on completely bombed. i was sure it would be awesome and it was a total flop, i was so let down.
dialogue: i worked really hard on this project for work and it totally bombed.
awe, sorry to hear that. i am sure you did better than you think.
well, not really according to analytics. i was really let down by the fact that it was a flop but i am not going to let it drag me down too much.
label: disappointed
response: that is a good attitude. better luck next time!

situation: the house is all cleaned and ready for my guests. wow, i was cleaning all day!
dialogue: the house is all cleaned and ready for my guests. wow, i was cleaning all day!
i was doing the same thing!  hard work but so satisfying when you see the results!  who is coming to stay?

yes, there is no better satisfaction, in my opinion, than a clean house. my sister is visiting with her kids. they are staying for a week here at my house. i am sure the house is going to be trashed in the end.
label: prepared
response: i completely agree.  mine can get trashed in 10 minutes flat from the kids.  ha ha. oh, how fun!  i hope you have a wonderful time!  yeah, you will probably be cleaning all over again by the end of it but its worth it.

situation: my neighbor sits out on his balcony naked sometimes. it is really awkward and i am grossed out by it.
dialogue: my neighbor sits out on his balcony butt naked sometimes.
that sounds pretty disturbing.  have you called the cops?
no but that might be a good idea. it is just an awkward and gross situation.
label: disgusted
response: i bet.  i wonder what he is thinking.

situation: i have fixed up house to the best of my ability. i feel very certain that it will sell very quickly.
dialogue: i have fixed up house to the best of my ability. i feel very certain that it will sell very quickly.
i certainly hope so,  why do you want to move?
i am moving to a smaller house with a big yard where life will be a lot easier. less house to clean and more time outside.
label: confident
response: that sounds great, that is how i like my houses to be too.

situation: i feel confident that eating a fruitarian diet will give me more energy and happiness.
dialogue: i feel confident that eating a fruitarian diet will give me more energy and happiness.
hmm, do not you need fat and protein in your diet also?
i have done a lot of research and so many fruitarians are thriving and feeling the best they ever had in their life. there is fat in avocados and avocados are considered a fruit.
label: hopeful
response: oh i hadn't even thought of avocado. well good luck with the diet, i hope it works for you!

situation: i sent an email to a family member i hadn't spoken to in a long time, i really did not know what they'd say or how they handle it. waiting for a response made me quite nervous.
dialogue: i wrote an email to a family member i have not spoken to in a long time and i was not sure how they'd take everything i said in it.
oh wow! that is a brave thing to do! your letter must have been a little intense if you are worried how they will take it. how did it work out?
yep, it was full of emotion and a lot of things i needed to get off my chest. i was quite nervous waiting for a response but it turns out i had nothing to worry about. she was really glad i spoke up!
label: anxious
response: awe that is great! i am glad there was a happy ending!

situation: i get so mad when the local kids throw eggs at the front doors of houses in my neighborhood. it is so infuriating!
dialogue: i get so mad when the local kids throw eggs at the front doors of houses in my neighborhood. it is so infuriating!
oh man i would be mad too.you should wait outside with a paintball gun
yeah! i wish i had the time for it! i am going to buy one of the web cams and catch them in the act. i am going to teach them a lesson! but i love the paintball idea! that is great!
label: furious
response: yup gotta lay down the law

situation: i moved into a new house and in the middle of the night heard this horrible screeching sound from the basement. it was so scary! turns out it was just the sump pump kicking in.
dialogue: i moved into this new house and was woken up with this horrible screeching noise in the middle of the night.
terrifying! what was it?
it turned out to be the sump pump, i guess it was old. but yes, it scared the daylights out of me!
label: terrified
response: oh good. i bet!  i would not have been able to go back to sleep after that!  do you have to replace the pump?

situation: i made a really inappropriate joke about someone i work with to other coworkers and it got back to them. i feel really bad about it.
dialogue: i made a really inappropriate joke about a coworker to some other people i work with and it got back to him.
oops. i hate when that happens. did they say anything to you?

no, but the person who told him confessed. so i decided to be the bigger person and apologize to my coworker before things got too out of hand. he actually was not that upset and appreciated that i owned up to it, but i still felt bad for it, mostly that i did it behind his back.
label: guilty
response: that was really nice of you to apologize like that. some people would have just ignored it. i know that could have been embarrassing.

situation: i got my work done early on friday so i got to spend the day trying out a new bike trail on my new bike. the weather was amazing. i felt really satisfied with life.
dialogue: i got my work done early on friday so i got to spend the day trying out a new bike trail on my new bike!
that sounds exciting! do you bike a lot?
i have only recently started getting really into it. it sounds kind of corny but getting out there on my bike makes life just really. satisfying. calm.
label: content
response: does not sound corny. we all need a hobby to relieve stress!

situation: i miss being able to take my children to the park.
dialogue: i miss being able to take my children to the park.
how come you cannot take them anymore?
they are all grown up.
label: sentimental
response: awww, well maybe you will have grandchildren that you can take one day!

situation: i studied all night for my final exam
dialogue: i studied all night for my final exam"
that is intense. i hope you did well!
i did! i got an a and i am so proud and happy !
label: confident
response: congratulations! that is great news. well deserved

situation: the neighbor's dog barked all night and kept me up, let's say i am not very happy right now
dialogue: the neighbor's dog barked all night and kept me up, let's say i am not very happy right now
i totally understand. the same thing happened to me last week. i thought i was going to lose it!
i understand the dog is being a dog, but the owner does nothing about it even when i tell him about it
label: angry
response: right, i had to end up calling the homeowners association on them

situation: somehow my cat figured out how to open cabinets and stole an entire bag of treats. i was not even mad, i was astounded by his ingenuity.
dialogue: my cat somehow figured out how to open the cabinet and stole a bag of treats.
wow that is very clever. i would have never thought that could happen.
right? i was not even mad about it, i was astounded by his ingenuity.
label: impressed
response: that is incredible. i wonder what else you can train him to do.

situation: i feel like my husband is the sweetest man in the world.
dialogue: i feel like my husband is the sweetest man in the world
that is great! hopefully he continues to be
i think he will. he puts up with me, and sometimes i can be a pill!
label: faithful
response: lol i am sure you have to put up with him as well so its even

situation: i was so upset when i had to put my dog down last month.
dialogue: i was so upset when i had to put my dog down last month
oh no. that is so sad. was she sick for long?
not really. she was old and we woke up one day and she could not use her back legs. it was very sad.
label: devastated
response: i am sorry. at least she had a good long life.

situation: during my first year in grad school, i had a basement apartment that flooded. all of my possessions were utterly destroyed. it took several months to replace the items that i could, but i cannot help to remember the things that could not be replaced.
dialogue: during my first year in grad school, my basement apartment flooded. everything was destroyed and i had to start over fresh.
that is awful! did you have insurance to cover everything?
thankfully, yes! it took several months to replace everything that i could, but even things, so many things i just simply could not replace.
label: devastated
response: yeah that is horrible. i am sorry that happened to you.

situation: i am in charge of scheduling meeting room use at my job. once, i made a really big mistake and gave a group a room that they should not have gotten. i was mortified because this was one of my main responsibilities and i managed to really mess it up!
dialogue: i am in charge of booking meeting rooms for outside companies at my job. last week, i made a big mistake and accidentally gave a group a room for free when they should've paid $100.
oh no! i hope you did not get into too much trouble by doing so!
thankfully, not too much! i was simply mortified because this was one of my main responsibilities and i managed to mess that one up so badly!
label: ashamed
response: to be fair, everybody makes mistakes and it is bound to happen even to the best of us!

situation: my brother and his friends invited me to a party tonight. they celebrated my birthday and i felt very loved and happy.
dialogue: my brother and his friends invited me to a party tonight.
sounds like that could be fun if you like your brother and if you like parties. do you want to go?
i just came back from it! i am actually still a little intoxicated. i must say it was a lot of fun, we celebrated my birthday and i felt very loved and happy.
label: content
response: happy birthday! i am glad you were able to have fun and be surrounded by those that love you.

situation: i drank a lot and told my girlfriend that i would definitely sleep with her best friend if she was down to do so. i made a huge mistake, and felt very ashamed the next day.
dialogue: i drank a lot and told my girlfriend that i would definitely sleep with her best friend if she was down to do so.
what was her reaction to that
she was a little sad and surprised, but we had been talking about threesomes for a long time now so she understood. regardless, i felt very ashamed the next day.
label: embarrassed
response: i am sure she will forgive you

situation: every evening, once my baby goes to sleep, i sit up with my husband and watch tv. it is the only time we have together in the day that is guaranteed.
dialogue: my husband and i have been watching tv together each night, once the baby is asleep, of course.
that sounds like some nice relaxing quality time
it really is! it is the only time in the day that we are guaranteed to have some time together, just us.
label: content
response: have you ever passed out together watching tv?

situation: my wife and i had found the perfect house to buy, it fit us perfect. someone got a bid in before us and ending up getting the house.
dialogue: my wife and i found the perfect house for sale and we excited to put a bid in on it.
that is exciting! will it be your first house?
well it would have been, but someone got a bid in before us and it ended up being sold. my wife was so sad.
label: disappointed
response: that is no good! hopefully yall will find a better one

situation: i let my friend dogsit for me over the last weekend and he did well.
dialogue: i let my friend watch my dog last weekend.
you must really trust your friend! how did that turn out?
it was good, he (the dog) seemed really happy when i got back. he said that he let my dog out a bunch and even took him to the park!
label: trusting
response: good to hear that it went so well. do you think you will let your friend watch him again?

situation: i once almost ruined my husband's masters thesis presentation. while he was giving his presentation, i had a bad coughing fit. he, and everyone else, stopped to make sure i was okay, and then he could not focus on the rest of his presentation!
dialogue: i once almost ruined my husband's master's thesis presentation, something he needed to pass to get his degree.
oh no, what did you do?
i started coughing, badly. he and everyone else stopped to look at me and make sure i was okay. he was so distracted after that!
label: embarrassed
response: do not worry, from what you said it does not sound like you almost ruined it. it was not something on purpose at least.

situation: i was expecting a surprise birthday party today. my expectations were somewhat true; my brother's friend celebrated not only my birthday party, but two other birthdays today. it was wonderful!
dialogue: i was expecting a surprise birthday party today.
lol that makes a lot of sense?
yeah i had a few hints. my expectations were somewhat true; my brother's friend celebrated not only my birthday party, but two other birthdays today. it was wonderful!
label: anticipating
response: well that sounds fun!

situation: i went out to eat at a restaurant last week and got up to go to the restroom. as i was walking by the kitchen, i watched a cook drop a piece of chicken in the floor and put it right back on a plate. we left right after that.
dialogue: last week while my wife were out for dinner at a restaurant, i got up to use the restroom and walked by the kitchen. i saw a cook pick up a piece of chicken off the floor and put it back on someone's plate.
haha caught red handed!
we proceeded to leave the restaurant, but not after informing the manager, very loudly, about the incident.
label: disgusted
response: yeah, i wonder what their bathrooms are like if that is their service

situation: i am starting school in 2 days.
dialogue: i hope i do well when i start school soon, i cannot help but think it will be too hard.
do not worry about it you will do fine. kindergarten is not too hard. just do not eat the glue.
lmao. it is actually my junior year of mech engineering.
label: apprehensive
response: oh i see. my mistake. i was wondering how you could type and spell so well for a 6 year old. well good luck in college!

situation: my husband has been searching for a job for a long while but cannot seem to find one. he had an interview last thursday and we are eagerly waiting to hear back about whether he got it.
dialogue: my husband's been searching for a professional job but cannot seem to land one after interviewing.
did he try to get another diploma in this profession area?
well, he has a masters degree and graduate certificate already. he is had a fourth interview for a position last thursday, so we are hoping this one will finally be the one!
label: anticipating
response: that is a good news. i hope he get it.

situation: my son had to have surgery to remove his tonsils last month. i know it is a routine procedure, but i could not sit down for the entire time and i was so relieved when they said everything went just fine.
dialogue: last month my son had to have surgery to have his tonsils removed.
surgery on my kids always scares me but i have heard that it is best to have them taken out while they are young
yeah, i was terrified. i just wandering around the waiting room the entire time till they came and told me everything went fine. seemed like it took days.
label: anxious
response: i understand, when it comes to our kids and being worried about them it feels like time stand still

situation: my boyfriend brought me dinner after i had a long stressful day. i had no groceries in the house and i did not feel like driving to get anything.
dialogue: is not it nice when people bring you food, when you've had a long day?
oh for sure. i hate having to cook and do dishes after a long hard day
exactly! my boyfriend brought me dinner the other night. i had no groceries and just did not feel like going out after a long stressful day. i was so thankful.
label: grateful
response: were at work today or doing something else?

situation: my younger sister is constantly going to concert after concert, travelling across the country. it is not that i want to go to so many concerts, i just wish i had all the money she has to be able to afford it!
dialogue: my little sister has been going all across the country this summer, spending lots of time on money on pop concert after pop concert.
interesting. how do you feel about it? do you find it fun and interesting, or wish she were more responsible with her money?
mostly i am a bit frustrated that she is got so much money to blow on these concerts! and to travel all across the country!
label: jealous
response: yeah, i can understand that. sometimes when you are not in a position to enjoy yourself because you are busy being tied down with responsibilities, it is easy to get mad at others. whatever you can do to spin it positively, i would suggest that. being negative about it will only make everyone is lives worse.

situation: during a bad storm this past spring, we had a tornado touch down in my neighbors yard. it sounded like a train was going past my house as we hunkered down in the basement.
dialogue: during this past spring during a bad storm, we had a tornado touch down in my neighbors yard.
oh my gosh!  that had to be super scary!
it sounded like a train going by the house from the basement. thankfully no one was hurt.
label: terrified
response: yeah, thank god you are safe.  i do not know what i would have done if that happened to me.

situation: i heard a friend speaking ill of another friend and refused to participate.
dialogue: i do not like joining it when people talk about someone that is not there, just like what happened yesterday.
yep i thinks its disrespectful and petty. what happened?
he was talking about my other friend who is a bit annoying sometimes. while i may agree i just do not like talking behind someones back.
label: faithful
response: that is good. i am amazed by people who think its okay to do that.

situation: i work at a library cataloging materials and other coworkers often come to me for help. when they do, i feel like i am an expert giving out advice on cataloging, even though i am far from an expert.
dialogue: i work at a library cataloging materials and am often asked to help my coworkers, it makes me feel like an expert, though i am not.
sounds like your co workers respect you then
they seem to. or, at least, they know whom is the right person to go to for those specific kinds of questions!
label: confident
response: or that as well ha

situation: when i was a teenager i stole some comic books from the local grocery store. my mother found out and made me walk them back into the store and give them to the manager. that was a humbling experience.
dialogue: when i was a young kid, i stole some comic books from the local grocery store.
did you ever get caught?
my mother found out and made me walk them back into the store and give them to the manager. that was a humbling experience.
label: guilty
response: was she disappointed?

situation: when i went into labor with my son, it was quite the ordeal. he was coming way too early and we had to rush to get him out. thankfully, i had everything already packed beforehand!
dialogue: when i went into labor with my son, it was quite the ordeal. he came before he was supposed to.
how many month earlier he came?
it was actually only a week, but he was not showing signs of being physically ready was the problem. thankfully, i would already had my bags packed for weeks so we went to the hospital ready!
label: prepared
response: is he healthy?

situation: one time i studied all night for my final exam!
dialogue: one time i studied all night for my final exam!
whatwas the exam for?
it was for organic chemistry
label: prepared
response: tha is really cool what was your grade
